XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD Page_NNP Line_NNP For_IN Read_NNP 111_CD Folio_NNP Heading_NNP D._NNP P._NNP Mukherjee_NNP and_CC P._NNP Bhattacharya_NNP D._NNP D_NNP Shukla_NNP and_CC P._NNP Bhattacharya_NNP 113_CD ERRATA_NNP Indian_NNP Journal_NNP of_IN Veterinary_NNP Science_NNP and_CC Animal_NNP Husbandry_NNP ,_, Vol_NNP ._.

Page_NN Line_NNP For_IN Read_NNP Contents_NNP Under_IN original_JJ arti-_JJ cles_NNS ,_, 3_CD as_IN a_DT Cattle_NNP as_IN a_DT Cattle_NNP Feed_NNP 249_CD Folio_NNP Heading_NNP Thakur_NNP Thakral_NNP 253_CD Table_NNP II_NNP ,_, Col._NNP 4_CD 3.69_CD ±15.24_JJ 369_CD ±15.24_JJ 253_CD Table_NNP II_NNP ,_, Col._NNP 4_CD 38.5±4.42_CD 385±4.42_CD 378_CD 13_CD from_IN bottom_NN 11_CD ,_, T_NNP ,_, Orientis_NNP Walher_NNP 11_CD ,_, T._NNP Orientis_NNP Walker_NNP 301,303,311_CD ,_, Folio_NNP Heading_NNP Burns_NNP Burns_NNP 313,315,317_CD ,_, and_CC 319_CD 303_CD 12_CD from_IN bottom_NN 1040_CD 1940_CD MGIPCORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP DAHI*_NNP I_PRP ._.
INTRODUCTION_NNP AND_NNP HISTORICAL_NNP REVIEW_NNP By_IN H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP AND_NNP K._NNP K._NNP IYA_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 8_CD January_NNP 1951_CD )_) DAHI_NNP (_( Sanskrit_NNP :_: dadhi_NN )_) is_VBZ an_DT important_JJ fermentation_NN product_NN of_IN milk_NN used_VBN in_IN this_DT country_NN since_IN times_NNS immemorial_JJ as_IN an_DT article_NN of_IN diet_JJ ,_, as_IN a_DT refreshing_NN beverage_NN and_CC as_IN an_DT intermediary_NN in_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN desi_NN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ received_VBN great_JJ prominence_NN in_IN Hindu_NNP religious_JJ rites_NNS and_CC numerous_JJ references_NNS to_TO dahi_VB can_MD be_VB found_VBN in_IN the_DT Vedas_NNP and_CC other_JJ ancient_JJ Hindu_NNP scriptures_NNS ._.
It_PRP also_RB finds_VBZ extensive_JJ use_NN in_IN the_DT Ayurvedic_NNP system_NN of_IN medicine_NN [_NNP Dutt_NNP ,_, 1877_CD ]_NN ._.
As_RB early_RB as_IN the_DT second_JJ century_NN A.D._NNP ,_, the_DT sages_NNS Charka_NNP and_CC Sushruta_NNP [_NNP Kaviratna_NNP ,_, 1922_CD ;_: Bhisha-_NNP gratna_NN ,_, 1907_CD ]_NN described_VBD the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN and_CC therapeutic_JJ properties_NNS of_IN dahi_NN ._.
Dahi_NNP is_VBZ prepared_VBN by_IN the_DT lactic_JJ fermentation_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
While_IN the_DT coagulum_NN obtained_VBN by_IN souring_VBG whole_JJ milk_NN is_VBZ generally_RB called_VBN dahi_NN ,_, the_DT term_NN lassi_NN is_VBZ used_VBN to_TO denote_VB either_RB a_DT similar_JJ product_NN made_VBN from_IN skim_JJ milk_NN or_CC the_DT popular_JJ drink_NN prepared_VBN by_IN beating_VBG dahi_NN into_IN a_DT homogenous_JJ liquid_NN ._.
The_DT liquid_NN remaining_VBG after_IN dahi_NN is_VBZ churned_VBN and_CC the_DT butter_NN removed_VBN ,_, is_VBZ often_RB called_VBN lassi_NN ,_, chass_NN or_CC mattha_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ thus_RB different_JJ from_IN butter_NN milk_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT by-product_NN obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT churning_NN of_IN cream_NN in_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN creamery_NN butter_NN ._.
Fermented_VBN milks_NNS Dahi_NNP may_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN the_DT Indian_JJ counterpart_NN of_IN Yoghurt_NNP ,_, Kefir_NNP ,_, and_CC other_JJ fermented_VBN milk_NN preparations_NNS called_VBN by_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN local_JJ names_NNS in_IN different_JJ countries_NNS ._.
Most_JJS of_IN these_DT fermented_VBN milks_NNS are_VBP stated_VBN to_TO have_VB originated_VBN in_IN the_DT south-eastern_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Europe_NNP ,_, the_DT Middle_NNP East_NNP ,_, India_NNP and_CC other_JJ Asiatic_JJ countries_NNS ,_, where_WRB the_DT tropical_JJ or_CC sub-tropical_JJ conditions_NNS necessitated_VBD the_DT preservation_NN of_IN milk_NN from_IN under-_JJ going_VBG rapid_JJ spoilage_NN by_IN proteolytic_JJ and_CC gas_NN producing_VBG organisms_NNS ;_: conversion_NN of_IN milk_NN into_IN a_DT sour_JJ product_NN by_IN lactic_JJ acid_NNS fermentation_NN offered_VBD the_DT best_JJS means_NNS for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ._.
Accordingly_RB ,_, milk_NN obtained_VBN from_IN various_JJ species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ,_, e.g._NN ,_, cow_NN ,_, camel_NN ,_, ewe_NN ,_, mare_NN ,_, buffalo_NN and_CC reindeer_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN utilised_VBN in_IN this_DT form_NN since_IN the_DT earliest_JJS ages_NNS ._.
Various_JJ methods_NNS of_IN providing_VBG favourable_JJ conditions_NNS for_IN the_DT desired_JJ type_NN of_IN fermentation_NN have_VBP been_VBN in_IN vogue_NN ,_, e.g._NN ,_, (_( i_NN )_) addition_NN of_IN previously_RB soured_VBN milk_NN or_CC a_DT small_JJ piece_NN of_IN decaying_VBG vegetable_JJ or_CC animal_JJ matter_NN to_TO establish_VB a_DT pre-_JJ ponderance_NN of_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN organisms_NNS in_IN the_DT milk_NN ,_, (_( ii_NN )_) holding_VBG milk_NN at_IN high_JJ tempera-_JJ tures_NNS to_TO permit_VB natural_JJ souring_NN to_TO take_VB place_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT action_NN of_IN organism_NN *Investigations_NNS carried_VBD out_RP under_IN a_DT Research_NNP Scheme_NNP financed_VBN by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricul-_NNP tural_JJ Research_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP 1_CD 2_CD STUDIES_NNPS ON_NNP DAHI_NNP :_: I_PRP ._.
INTRODUCTION_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP derived_VBD from_IN the_DT utensil_NN or_CC atmosphere_RB ,_, or_CC (_( iii_NN )_) use_NN of_IN containers_NNS like_IN skin_NN bags_NNS ,_, the_DT unclean_JJ surfaces_NNS providing_VBG the_DT requisite_JJ contamination_NN of_IN milk-souring_JJ organisms_NNS ._.
In_IN actual_JJ practice_NN the_DT fermentations_NNS are_VBP brought_VBN about_IN by_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN organisms_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT primitive_JJ methods_NNS followed_VBD in_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN fermented_JJ milks_NNS ._.
The_DT numerous_JJ fermented_JJ milk_NN preparations_NNS of_IN different_JJ countries_NNS can_MD be_VB divided_VBN into_IN two_CD broad_JJ groups_NNS ,_, namely_RB ,_, one_CD in_IN which_WDT acid_JJ production_NN by_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NN is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ feature_NN ,_, with_IN little_JJ or_CC no_DT alcohol_NN formation_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT second_NN in_IN which_WDT alcoholic_JJ fermentation_NN by_IN yeasts_NNS plays_NNS an_DT important_JJ part_NN along_IN with_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN fermentation_NN ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT important_JJ fermented_VBD milks_NNS prepared_VBN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN are_VBP indicated_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Fermented_VBD milks_NNS in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN *_NN Name_NN of_IN fermented_JJ preparation_NN Name_NNP of_IN country_NN where_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ used_VBN Kind_NNP of_IN milk_NN used_VBN Distinctive_NNP characteristics_NNS Principal_NNP organisms_NNS taking_VBG part_NN in_IN the_DT fermentation_NN (_( a_DT )_) Predominantly_RB lactic_JJ acid_NNS fermentation_NN with_IN little_JJ or_CC no_DT alcohol_NN production_NN Yoghurt_NNP (_( Bulgarian_NNP milk_NN )_) Bulgaria_NNP and_CC Turkey_NNP Cow_NNP 's_POS buffalo_NN 's_POS ,_, sheep_NN 's_POS ,_, or_CC goat_NN 's_POS milk_NN (_( pasteurised_JJ or_CC partially_RB evaporated_VBN )_) A_DT thick_NN curdled_VBN milk_NN ;_: highly_RB acidic_IN ;_: con-_JJ tains_NNS little_JJ or_CC no_DT alcohol_NN Mainly_RB lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NNS L._NNP yoghurt_NN ,_, L._NNP bulgaricus_NN and_CC S._NNP thermophilus_CC Mazun_NNP Armenia_NNP Cows_NNP ,_, buffalo_NN 's_POS or_CC goat_NN 's_POS milk_NN ..._: ._. The_DT lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN fermented_JJ milks_NNS can_MD be_VB divided_VBN into_IN three_CD main_JJ groups_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT latest_JJS taxonomical_JJ classification_NN of_IN Bergey_NNP [_NNP Breed_NNP and_CC others_NNS ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ group_NN includes_VBZ the_DT common_JJ milk_NN souring_VBG organism_NN ,_, Streptococcus_NNP lactis_NN ;_: the_DT high_JJ tempera-_JJ ture_NN milk_NN souring_VBG streptococcus_NN ,_, L._NNP thermophilus_CC ;_: and_CC S._NNP cremoris_NN ,_, used_VBN for_IN the_DT ripening_NN of_IN cream_NN ._.
They_PRP produce_VBP mainly_RB lactic_JJ acid_NN by_IN the_DT fermentation_NN of_IN lactose_NN ,_, the_DT final_JJ acidity_NN reached_VBD being_VBG one_CD per_IN cent_NN calculated_VBN as_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN ._.

L._NNP casei_NN and_CC L._NNP plantarum_NN ._.

GENERAL_NNP SURVEY_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP MARKET_NNP DAHI_NNP H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP ,_, V._NNP K._NNP N._NNP NAMBUDRIPAD_NNP ,_, N._NNP V._NNP LAKSHAMI_NNP ,_, S._NNP N._NNP ANANTA-_NNP RAMAIAH_NNP AND_NNP V._NNP SREENIVASAMURTHY_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 8_CD January_NNP 1951_CD )_) THE_DT object_NN of_IN the_DT survey_NN was_VBD to_TO obtain_VB information_NN on_IN the_DT composition_NN ,_, flavour_NN ,_, texture_NN and_CC microbial_JJ content_NN of_IN dahi_NN produced_VBN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN ,_, several_JJ zones_NNS ,_, broadly_RB representing_VBG the_DT different_JJ climatic_JJ and_CC other_JJ natural_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN the_DT country_NN and_CC also_RB including_VBG areas_NNS famous_JJ for_IN quality_NN of_IN dahi_NN ,_, were_VBD marked_VBN out_RP on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN information_NN supplied_VBN by_IN provincial_JJ autho-_JJ rities_NNS and_CC private_JJ sources_NNS ._.
The_DT research_NN workers_NNS visited_VBD important_JJ urban_JJ centres_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN rural_JJ areas_NNS in_IN the_DT different_JJ zones_NNS and_CC collected_VBD representative_JJ samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN and_CC lassi_NN from_IN dairies_NNS ,_, halwais_NN ,_, street_NN vendors_NNS ,_, private_JJ houses_NNS and_CC other_JJ sources_NNS ._.
The_DT programme_NN for_IN the_DT collection_NN of_IN samples_NNS from_IN different_JJ zones_NNS was_VBD so_RB arranged_JJ as_IN to_TO cover_VB all_PDT the_DT seasons_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
Altogether_RB about_IN 1,000_CD samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN and_CC lassi_NN were_VBD secured_VBN for_IN the_DT investigation_NN from_IN the_DT following_JJ centres_NNS (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Geographical_NNP distribution_NN of_IN dahi_NN samples_NNS collected_VBN for_IN the_DT investigation_NN Zone_NNP Centres_NNP Number_NNP of_IN samples_NNS North_NNP Indian_JJ plains_NNS Patna_NNP ,_, Muzaffarpur_NNP ,_, Darbhanga_NNP (_( Tirhut_NNP Valley_NNP )_) ,_, Gorakhpore_$ 60_CD Allahabad_NNP ,_, Banaras_NNP ,_, Lucknow_NNP ,_, Kanpur_NNP ,_, Mathura_NNP ,_, Agra_NNP 159_CD Delhi_NNP ,_, Meerut_NNP ,_, Aligarh_NNP ,_, Khurja_NNP 104_CD Karnal_NNP ,_, Ambala_NNP ,_, Ferozepur_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP 72_CD Lahore_NNP ,_, Lyallpur_NNP 50_CD Nagpur_NNP ,_, Bhusaval_NNP 23_CD Hyderabad_NNP (_( Sind_NNP )_) 19_CD Ahmedabad_NNP ,_, Baroda_NNP 26_CD Cuttack_NNP ,_, Vijayavada_NNP 16_CD Sea_NNP Coast_NNP areas_NNS Bombay_NNP 116_CD Calcutta_NNP 74_CD Karachi_NNP 42_CD Madras_NNP 40_CD Deccan_NNP Plateau_NNP (_( South_NNP India_NNP )_) Poona_NNP 20_CD Hyderabad_NNP (_( Dn_NNP ._. )_)

13_CD 4_CD 14_CD STUDIES_NNPS ON_NNP DAHI_NNP :_: IIMarch_NN ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP et_VBD al_RB 15_CD After_IN the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD vigorously_RB shaken_VBN to_TO break_VB the_DT clumps_NNS of_IN curd_NN ,_, small_JJ quantities_NNS (_( approximately_RB 1_CD gm_NNS ._. )_)
were_VBD weighed_VBN into_IN sterile_JJ flasks_NNS ,_, diluted_VBN suitably_RB in_IN saline_NN and_CC then_RB plated_VBN in_IN duplicate_NN using_VBG milk_NN agar_NN ._.
The_DT plates_NNS were_VBD incubated_VBN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
for_IN 72_CD hours_NNS and_CC the_DT colonies_NNS counted_VBN ._.
The_DT arithmetic_JJ average_NN of_IN duplicate_JJ plate_NN counts_NNS was_VBD employed_VBN for_IN calculation_NN of_IN total_JJ bacterial_JJ counts_NNS per_IN gram_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
Chemical_NNP analysis_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS Upon_IN arrival_NN at_IN Bangalore_NNP ,_, the_DT samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN were_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN fat_NN ,_, ash_NN ,_, and_CC protein_NN by_IN ._.
employing_VBG modifications_NNS of_IN the_DT procedures_NNS described_VBN in_IN A.O.A.C_NNP ._.
[_NN 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
Samples_NNS which_WDT were_VBD received_VBN in_IN an_DT unsatisfactory_JJ condition_NN due_JJ to_TO clumping_VBG of_IN fat_NN ,_, considerable_JJ whey_JJ separation_NN ,_, etc._NN ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT heavy_JJ joltings_NNS during_IN transit_NN ,_, were_VBD not_RB used_VBN for_IN analysis_NN ._.
Lactose_NNP was_VBD determined_VBN only_RB in_IN dahi_NN samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN places_NNS near_IN about_IN Bangalore_NNP and_CC which_WDT had_VBD not_RB been_VBN preserved_VBN with_IN formalin_NN ._.
Fat_NNP ._.
Fifty_NNP grams_NNS of_IN dahi_NN were_VBD mixed_JJ well_RB with_IN 2_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN strong_JJ ammonia_NN and_CC made_VBD up_RB to_TO 100_CD ml_NNS ._.
with_IN distilled_JJ water_NN ._.
Eleven_RB ml_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT solution_NN were_VBD taken_VBN and_CC fat_JJ determined_VBN by_IN the_DT Gerber_NNP method_NN ._.
The_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN dahi_NN was_VBD cal-_JJ culated_VBN by_IN multiplying_VBG the_DT observed_JJ reading_NN by_IN two_CD ._.
Ash_NNP ._.
A_DT 10_CD gm_NN ._.
portion_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN was_VBD used_VBN for_IN determination_NN of_IN the_DT ash_NN by_IN the_DT usual_JJ procedure_NN [_NNP A.O.A.C_NNP ._.
1940_CD ]_NN ._.
Protein_NNP ._.
Total_JJ nitrogen_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN the_DT usual_JJ Kjeldahl_NNP method_NN ,_, using_VBG a_DT 5_CD gm_NN ._.
sample_NN of_IN dahi_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT percentage_NN of_IN protein_NN was_VBD calculated_VBN employing_VBG 6.3_CD as_IN the_DT conversion_NN factor_NN ._.
Lactose_NNP ._.
Lactose_NNP was_VBD determined_VBN (_( according_VBG to_TO Münsen_NNP Walker_NNP 's_POS gravimetric_JJ method_NN )_) only_RB for_IN a_DT few_JJ samples_NNS collected_VBN locally_RB and_CC from_IN places_NNS near_IN about_IN Banga-_NNP lore_NN ._.
Due_JJ to_TO the_DT uncertainty_NN of_IN the_DT age_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT long_JJ interval_NN in_IN transit_NN ,_, extremely_RB low_JJ values_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN for_IN the_DT samples_NNS particularly_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN those_DT obtained_VBN from_IN distant_JJ places_NNS ._.
Since_IN such_JJ values_NNS of_IN lactose_NN were_VBD not_RB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB of_IN practical_JJ significance_NN ,_, the_DT determination_NN of_IN this_DT constituent_NN for_IN subsequent_JJ samples_NNS was_VBD discontinued_VBN ._.
Methods_NNS of_IN manufacture_NN and_CC other_JJ particulars_NNS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS Information_NNP regarding_VBG the_DT history_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS with_IN special_JJ reference_NN to_TO the_DT type_NN of_IN milk_NN used_VBN ,_, process_NN of_IN manufacture_NN ,_, etc._FW ,_, was_VBD recorded_VBN wherever_RB possible_JJ ._.
It_PRP was_VBD generally_RB reported_VBN by_IN those_DT from_IN whom_WP the_DT sample_NN was_VBD collected_VBN that_IN some_DT 12_CD to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS had_VBD elapsed_VBN since_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN the_DT starter_NN to_TO the_DT milk_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN samples_NNS ,_, particularly_RB those_DT obtained_VBN from_IN south_JJ India_NNP ,_, the_DT high_JJ degree_NN of_IN souring_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN yeasty_NN smell_NN shown_VBN by_IN them_PRP indicated_VBD that_IN the_DT informa-_JJ tion_NN regarding_VBG age_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS was_VBD not_RB accurate_JJ and_CC that_IN they_PRP were_VBD mucholder_NN ._.
There_EX were_VBD considerable_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT methods_NNS of_IN manufacture_NN ,_, conditions_NNS of_IN storage_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT methods_NNS of_IN marketing_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
Either_DT cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN ,_, buffalo_NN 's_POS milk_NN ,_, skimmed_VBD milk_NN or_CC mixtures_NNS of_IN these_DT were_VBD employed_VBN ._.
Buffalo_NNP 's_POS milk_NN was_VBD commonly_RB used_VBN where_WRB dahi_NN was_VBD mainly_RB utilised_JJ for_IN ghee_JJ manufacture_NN ._.
In_IN Bengal_NNP ,_, Bihar_NNP and_CC eastern_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ,_, cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN was_VBD almost_RB always_RB used_VBN for_IN dahi_NN making_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN was_VBD usually_RB brought_VBN to_TO a_DT boil_NN and_CC allowed_VBN to_TO cool_VB to_TO 37°_CD 4_CD A_DT 16_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP DAHI_NNP :_: IIMarch_NN ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP et_VBD al_RB 17_CD The_DT sale_NN of_IN dahi_NN in_IN containers_NNS exposed_VBN to_TO atmosphere_VB was_VBD a_DT very_RB common_JJ practice_NN of_IN the_DT halwais_NN in_IN North_NNP India_NNP ._.
Such_JJ shops_NNS were_VBD situated_VBN in_IN crowded_JJ streets_NNS and_CC dahi_NN was_VBD kept_VBN in_IN open_JJ shallow_NN vessels_NNS exposed_VBN to_TO dust_VB ,_, flies_NNS and_CC to_TO splashes_NNS of_IN rain-water_NN in_IN monsoon_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD very_RB little_JJ attention_NN paid_VBN to_TO the_DT cleanliness_NN of_IN the_DT hands_NNS or_CC containers_NNS used_VBN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN selling_VBG either_CC by_IN the_DT vendor_NN or_CC by_IN the_DT buyer_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT south_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD more_RBR common_JJ to_TO find_VB the_DT villagers_NNS bringing_VBG curd_NN into_IN urban_JJ areas_NNS and_CC selling_VBG it_PRP from_IN door_NN to_TO door_VB ._.
Here_RB too_RB ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT complete_JJ absence_NN of_IN hygienic_JJ practices_NNS in_IN the_DT handling_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
RESULTS_VB The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT preliminary_JJ examination_NN of_IN dahi_NN samples_NNS in_IN regard_NN to_TO texture_NN ,_, flavour_NN and_CC microscopic_NN appearance_NN are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.
The_DT percentage_NN dis-_JJ tribution_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT characteristics_NNS shown_VBN by_IN them_PRP is_VBZ given_VBN in_IN the_DT table_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN plate_NN counts_NNS and_CC acidity_NN ,_, which_WDT were_VBD also_RB obtained_VBN during_IN the_DT preliminary_JJ examination_NN of_IN dahi_NN at_IN the_DT sampling_NN centres_NNS ,_, are_VBP presented_VBN along_IN with_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN chemical_JJ analysis_NN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN a_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN collected_VBN in_IN South_NNP India_NNP were_VBD thin_JJ and_CC watery_NN in_IN consistency_NN with_IN lumps_NNS of_IN curd_JJ floating_VBG occasionally_RB in_IN them_PRP ,_, irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN year_NN ._.
They_PRP had_VBD also_RB a_DT pronounced_JJ acid_NN smell_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN a_DT sour_JJ taste_NN ,_, some_DT of_IN the_DT samples_NNS being_VBG extremely_RB sour_JJ ._.
Very_RB few_JJ samples_NNS collected_VBN in_IN summer_NN and_CC not_RB more_JJR than_IN 10_CD to_TO 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN those_DT collected_VBN in_IN winter_NN (_( particularly_RB those_DT obtained_VBN near_IN Madras_NNP or_CC Mysore_NNP )_) possessed_VBD a_DT good_JJ texture_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT typical_JJ dahi_NN flavour_NN ._.
In_IN 15_CD to_TO 25_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ,_, peptonisation_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN ,_, gas_NN formation_NN and_CC disagreeable_JJ flavours_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN while_IN estery_NN or_CC alcoholic_JJ flavours_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN a_DT few_JJ instances_NNS ._.
The_DT samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN collected_VBN from_IN Poona_NNP ,_, Bhusaval_NNP and_CC Nagpur_NNP also_RB contained_VBD a_DT high_JJ proportion_NN of_IN sour_JJ dahi_NN but_CC most_JJS of_IN them_PRP showed_VBD fairly_RB good_JJ texture_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT samples_NNS from_IN Gujarat_NNP were_VBD generally_RB very_RB poor_JJ both_DT in_IN regard_NN to_TO body_NN and_CC in_IN flavour_NN ,_, a_DT few_JJ samples_NNS from_IN Baroda_NNP being_VBG the_DT only_JJ exceptions_NNS ._.
About_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS collected_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP showed_VBD good_JJ physical_JJ texture_NN ,_, sweet_NN or_CC mildly_RB sour_JJ taste_NN ,_, and_CC pleasant_JJ aroma_NN ._.
Some_DT 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN them_PRP were_VBD sour_JJ and_CC the_DT rest_NN were_VBD associated_VBN with_IN various_JJ defects_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD not_RB much_JJ difference_NN between_IN the_DT winter_NN and_CC summer_NN dahi_NN ,_, except_IN that_IN the_DT latter_NN included_VBD a_DT greater_JJR number_NN of_IN samples_NNS (_( mostly_RB collected_VBN during_IN monsoon_NN )_) having_VBG estery_NN or_CC alcoholic_JJ flavours_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN showing_VBG peptonisation_NN and_CC gas_NN forma-_JJ tion_NN ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT Calcutta_NNP samples_NNS ,_, nearly_RB 60_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN those_DT collected_VBN in_IN winter_NN had_VBD very_RB good_JJ texture_NN together_RB with_IN a_DT pleasant_JJ flavour_NN ,_, the_DT rest_NN were_VBD either_RB watery_JJ or_CC associated_VBN with_IN off-flavours_NNS ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT summer_NN samples_NNS had_VBD a_DT poor_JJ texture_NN ._.
Some_DT 30_CD per_IN cent_NN showed_VBD the_DT characteristic_JJ flavour_NN of_IN dahi_NN ,_, 50_CD per_IN cent_NN were_VBD sour_JJ and_CC about_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN were_VBD associated_VBN with_IN estery_NN or_CC alcoholic_JJ flavours_NNS ._.
A_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP samples_NNS were_VBD also_RB sweet_JJ to_TO taste_NN and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS this_DT was_VBD reported_VBN to_TO be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT sugar_NN added_VBD to_TO them_PRP ._.
Almost_RB all_DT samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN areas_NNS in_IN Tirhut_NNP Valley_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ,_, Delhi_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP ,_, and_CC Sind_NNP ,_, irrespective_NN of_IN season_NN ,_, were_VBD characterized_VBN by_IN good_JJ curd_NN formation_NN 18_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP DAHI_NNP :_: IIMarch_NN 1952_CD H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP et_VBD al_RB 19_CD TABLE_NNP III_NNP Bacteriological_NNP and_CC chemical_JJ analysis_NN of_IN dahi_NN samples_NNS (_( figures_NNS in_IN the_DT table_JJ represent_NN the_DT ranges_NNS of_IN variation_NN in_IN the_DT values_NNS )_) area_NN (_( Ref_NNP :_: Table-I_NN )_) Number_NNP of_IN samples_NNS Total_NNP bacterial_JJ count_NN per_IN gm_NN ._.
of_IN dahi_NN (_( millions_NNS )_) Titratable_JJ acidity_NN (_( per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN )_) Fat_NNP (_( per_IN cent_NN )_) Ash_NNP (_( per_IN cent_NN )_) Protein_NNP (_( per_IN cent_NN )_) Lactose_NNP (_( per_IN cent_NN )_) Bausalore_NNP (_( W_NNP )_) 38_CD 8820_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP DAHI_NNP :_: IIH_NNP ._.
LAXMINARAYANA_NNP et_CC al_JJ 21_CD of_IN Microbacterium_NNP )_) which_WDT formed_VBD yellow_JJ rings_NNS on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
Characteristic_JJ colonies_NNS of_IN moulds_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO Oidium_NNP ,_, Cladosporium_NNP ,_, Aspergillus_NNP ,_, and_CC Penicillium_NNP species_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN a_DT few_JJ species_NNS of_IN Actinomyces_NNS were_VBD also_RB found_VBN in_IN old_JJ samples_NNS ._.
These_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD probably_RB dormant_JJ in_IN the_DT freshly_NN made_VBD dahi_NN ._.
The_DT greatest_JJS number_NN of_IN samples_NNS showing_VBG the_DT above_JJ types_NNS of_IN contaminants_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN Gujarat_NNP and_CC a_DT smaller_JJR number_NN in_IN south_JJ India_NNP ._.
The_DT variations_NNS in_IN fat_NN ,_, protein_NN ,_, ash_NN ,_, and_CC lactose_JJ contents_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN total_JJ bacterial_JJ counts_NNS and_CC titratable_JJ acidities_NNS of_IN the_DT dahi_NN samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN different_JJ areas_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
The_DT figures_NNS for_IN lactose_NN are_VBP available_JJ for_IN a_DT few_JJ samples_NNS only_RB ,_, as_IN ._.
its_PRP$ determination_NN was_VBD discontinued_VBN for_IN reasons_NNS explained_VBN earlier_RBR ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT extremely_RB wide_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT values_NNS ,_, averages_NNS have_VBP not_RB been_VBN drawn_VBN but_CC only_RB the_DT ranges_NNS of_IN variation_NN have_VBP been_VBN given_VBN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN (_( Table_JJ III_NNP )_) that_IN the_DT total_JJ bacterial_JJ counts_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN chemical_JJ analyses_NNS are_VBP highly_RB variable_JJ and_CC can_MD not_RB be_VB correlated_VBN with_IN either_DT seasonal_JJ or_CC geographical_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
This_DT may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT highly_RB variable_JJ initial_JJ quality_NN of_IN milk_NN used_VBN ,_, the_DT type_NN of_IN starter_NN added_VBN ,_, temperature_NN of_IN storage_NN ,_, age_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
The_DT total_JJ bacterial_JJ counts_NNS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ranged_VBD from_IN 13_CD to_TO 22_CD millions_NNS per_IN gram_NN of_IN dahi_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN Delhi_NNP and_CC adjacent_JJ centres_NNS during_IN winter_NN while_IN samples_NNS of_IN a_DT similar_JJ quality_NN from_IN Lahore_NNP showed_VBD counts_NNS varying_VBG from_IN 319_CD to_TO 590_CD millions_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, the_DT counts_NNS ranged_VBD between_IN 18_CD and_CC 730_CD millions_NNS per_IN gram_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
Since_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NNS derived_VBN from_IN the_DT starter_JJ constitute_NN the_DT predominant_JJ flora_NN in_IN dahi_NN ,_, the_DT bacterial_JJ counts_NNS are_VBP influenced_VBN mainly_RB by_IN the_DT types_NNS of_IN starter_NN organisms_NNS ,_, temperature_NN of_IN storage_NN and_CC age_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
Due_JJ to_TO uncertainty_NN in_IN regard_NN to_TO these_DT factors_NNS very_RB little_JJ reliance_NN can_MD be_VB placed_VBN on_IN the_DT present_JJ data_NN as_IN an_DT index_NN of_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN dahi_NN or_CC of_IN the_DT sanitary_JJ conditions_NNS during_IN its_PRP$ production_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT relative_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN streptococci_NN and_CC lactobacilli_NN might_MD be_VB of_IN some_DT value_NN in_IN determining_VBG the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT starter_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT conditions_NNS in_IN dahi_NN are_VBP not_RB favourable_JJ for_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN coliform_NN organisms_NNS or_CC spore-forming_JJ bacteria_NNS ,_, their_PRP$ presence_NN in_IN dahi_NN samples_NNS may_MD be_VB expected_VBN to_TO serve_VB as_IN an_DT indication_NN of_IN unsatisfactory_JJ processing_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, use_NN of_IN contaminated_JJ starter_NN or_CC insanitary_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN manufacture_NN and_CC handling_NN ._.
Excessive_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN yeasts_NNS or_CC fungi_NNS may_MD also_RB be_VB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB indications_NNS of_IN poor_JJ quality_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
The_DT values_NNS for_IN titratable_JJ acidity_NN and_CC lactose_NN are_VBP affected_VBN to_TO the_DT greatest_JJS extent_NN by_IN microbial_JJ activity_NN ._.
The_DT initial_JJ acidity_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN is_VBZ also_RB important_JJ in_IN assessing_VBG the_DT significance_NN of_IN titratable_JJ acidity_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
A_DT very_RB large_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS in_IN south_JJ India_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN acidities_NNS exceeding_VBG 1.5_CD per_IN cent_NN (_( expressed_VBN as_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN )_) ,_, which_WDT accounts_VBZ for_IN their_PRP$ highly_RB acidic_JJ taste_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ obviously_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT preponderance_NN of_IN lactobacilli_NN in_IN the_DT starter_NN used_VBN ,_, age_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN and_CC the_DT high_JJ temperatures_NNS to_TO which_WDT the_DT product_NN was_VBD exposed_VBN during_IN handling_NN ._.
The_DT north_JJ Indian_JJ samples_NNS on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, which_WDT were_VBD generally_RB not_RB more_JJR than_IN 24_CD hours_NNS old_JJ at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN sampling_NN and_CC also_RB contained_VBD a_DT preponderance_NN of_IN streptococci_NN ,_, had_VBD acidity_NN values_NNS usually_RB below_IN 1.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS associated_VBN with_IN pleasant_JJ aroma_NN and_CC sweet_JJ taste_NN showed_VBD acidities_NNS ranging_VBG from_IN 1.0_CD to_TO 1.3_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT figures_NNS for_IN lactose_JJ content_NN are_VBP available_JJ only_RB for_IN a_DT limited_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS collected_VBN 5_CD 22_CD [_JJ STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP D_NNP AIH_NNP ._.

29_CD The_DT identification_NN of_IN streptococci_NN also_RB has_VBZ been_VBN somewhat_RB confused_JJ particularly_RB in_IN the_DT distinction_NN between_IN S._NNP lactis_NN and_CC S._NNP cremoris_NN and_CC between_IN S._NNP lactis_NN and_CC S._NNP faecalis_NNS ._.

Bacteriophage_NNP specificity_NN is_VBZ another_DT criterion_NN that_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN for_IN the_DT differentiation_NN of_IN S._NNP lactis_NN ,_, S._NNP cremoris_NN and_CC S._NNP faecalis_VBP [_NNP Shattock_NNP and_CC Mattick_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ;_: Hunter_NNP ,_, 1946_CD ]_NN ,_, but_CC this_DT test_NN would_MD appear_VB to_TO hold_VB promise_NN only_RB for_IN those_DT species_NNS for_IN which_WDT the_DT specific_NN phages_NNS have_VBP been_VBN isolated_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB known_VBN that_IN the_DT bacteriophages_NNS are_VBP highly_RB influenced_VBN by_IN strain_NN variations_NNS and_CC other_JJ factors_NNS ._.

[_JJ Vol_NNP ._.

The_DT former_JJ is_VBZ a_DT non-lactose_JJ fermenting_NN organism_NN occurring_VBG in_IN molasses_NNS and_CC growing_VBG at_IN high_JJ temperatures_NNS while_IN the_DT latter_NN is_VBZ a_DT lactose_JJ fermenting_NN lactobacillus_NN commonly_RB found_VBN in_IN dairy_NN products_NNS and_CC able_JJ to_TO grow_VB only_RB at_IN temperatures_NNS below_IN 45°C_CD ._.
The_DT nutritional_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN an_DT organism_NN can_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, be_VB considered_VBN useful_JJ only_RB in_IN providing_VBG supplementary_JJ evidence_NN regarding_VBG its_PRP$ identity_NN ._.

EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Isolation_NNP of_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_VBD The_DT original_JJ samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN stab_JJ cultures_NNS of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS made_VBN from_IN dahi_NN at_IN various_JJ centres_NNS ,_, secured_VBN in_IN the_DT manner_NN explained_VBD in_IN Part_NNP II_NNP [_NNP Laxmi-_NNP narayana_NN et_NN al._NN ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN of_IN this_DT series_NN ,_, were_VBD used_VBN for_IN the_DT isolation_NN of_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NNS ._.
As_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD received_VBN ,_, a_DT microscopic_NN examination_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_IN to_TO determine_VB the_DT predominant_JJ types_NNS of_IN organisms_JJ present_NN ._.
Small_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN well_RB mixed_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD then_RB transferred_VBN to_TO sterile_VB yeast_RB dextrose_JJ litmus_NNS milk_NN tubes_NNS ._.
One_CD set_NN of_IN tubes_NN was_VBD incubated_VBN at_IN 45°C._CD ,_, one_CD at_IN 37°C._CD ,_, and_CC a_DT third_JJ set_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( 24°_CD to_TO 30°C_CD ._. )_) ._.
When_WRB the_DT inoculated_JJ samples_NNS had_VBD coagulated_VBN or_CC shown_VBN acid_JJ production_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD plated_VBN either_RB immediately_RB or_CC after_IN further_JJ transfers_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO eliminate_VB yeasts_NNS and_CC encourage_VB the_DT growth_NN of_IN specific_JJ types_NNS of_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN organisms_NNS ._.
Immediate_NNP plating_NN gave_VBD only_RB the_DT most_RBS active_JJ types_NNS of_IN rods_NNS or_CC cocci_JJ present_NN in_IN dahi_NN ._.
Repeated_VBN transfers_NNS resulted_VBD in_IN obtaining_VBG pure_JJ cultures_NNS of_IN organisms_NNS having_VBG their_PRP$ optimum_NN near_IN the_DT respective_JJ temperatures_NNS of_IN incubation_NN ._.
Rapid_JJ transfers_NNS of_IN the_DT cultures_NNS soon_RB after_IN curdling_VBG were_VBD helpful_JJ in_IN securing_VBG a_DT pre-_JJ dominance_NN of_IN streptococci_NN over_IN lactobacilli_NN ._.

33_CD When_WRB agar_NN or_CC purple_NN lactose_JJ agar_NN ,_, fortified_VBN with_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN yeast_NN autolysate_NN ,_, was_VBD generally_RB employed_VBN for_IN pouring_VBG plates_NNS ._.
Almost_RB all_DT organisms_NNS grew_VBD well_RB on_IN these_DT media_NNS and_CC formed_VBD clear_JJ colonies_NNS which_WDT were_VBD easy_JJ for_IN picking_VBG ._.
In_IN later_JJ series_NN of_IN samples_NNS ,_, yeast_RB dextrose_JJ agar_NN containing_VBG one_CD per_IN cent_NN sodium_NN citrate_NN was_VBD employed_VBN for_IN encouraging_VBG the_DT growth_NN of_IN heterofermentative_JJ streptococci_NN while_IN tomato_JJ juice_NN agar_NN or_CC wort_NN agar_NN was_VBD used_VBN for_IN cultivating_VBG heterofermentative_JJ types_NNS of_IN lactobacilli_NN ._.
The_DT various_JJ media_NNS were_VBD prepared_JJ according_VBG to_TO standard_JJ methods_NNS [_VBP Levine_NNP and_CC Schoenlein_NNP ,_, 1930_CD and_CC Tanner_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT plates_NNS were_VBD incubated_VBN at_IN 30°C._CD ,_, 37°C._CD ,_, and_CC 45°C._CD ,_, for_IN 3_CD to_TO 4_CD days_NNS or_CC longer_JJR until_IN well_RB developed_JJ colonies_NNS appeared_VBD ._.
Small_NN ,_, discreet_NN colonies_NNS with_IN entire_JJ or_CC irregular_JJ margins_NNS growing_VBG below_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC show-_JJ ing_NN acid_NN production_NN were_VBD recognized_VBN to_TO be_VB lactic_JJ acid_JJ organisms_NNS ._.
Under_IN the_DT low_JJ power_NN (_( x_JJ 40_CD )_) of_IN a_DT compound_NN microscope_NN they_PRP appeared_VBD either_CC as_IN smooth_JJ ,_, rough_JJ or_CC filamentous_JJ colonies_NNS ._.
Well_RB isolated_JJ representative_JJ colonies_NNS from_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT plates_NNS were_VBD picked_VBN into_IN yeast_NN dextrose_JJ litmus_JJ milk_NN tubes_NNS and_CC incubated_VBN at_IN temperatures_NNS at_IN which_WDT the_DT colonies_NNS had_VBD been_VBN cultivated_VBN ._.
After_IN the_DT cultures_NNS showed_VBD evidence_NN of_IN growth_NN they_PRP were_VBD examined_VBN microscopically_RB and_CC purified_VBN by_IN further_JJ plating_NN and_CC repeated_VBD sub-culturing_NN in_IN milk_NN ._.
In_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN for_IN catalase_NN production_NN (_( recognized_VBN by_IN the_DT evolution_NN of_IN gas_NN bubbles_NNS when.1_VBP per_IN cent_NN solution_NN of_IN hydrogen_NN peroxide_NN was_VBD added_VBN on_IN to_TO the_DT agar_NN colonies_NNS )_) in_IN order_NN to_TO eliminate_VB the_DT catalase_NN positive_JJ micrococci_NN and_CC other_JJ contaminants_NNS which_WDT might_MD be_VB mistaken_VBN for_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NNS ._.
Only_RB such_JJ cultures_NNS as_IN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB catalase_JJ negative_JJ and_CC as_RB did_VBD not_RB show_VB appreciable_JJ surface_NN growth_NN on_IN agar_NN slants_NNS were_VBD presumed_VBN to_TO be_VB lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NNS [_VBP Orla_NNP Jensen_NNP ,_, 1942_CD ]_NN and_CC taken_VBN up_RP for_IN further_JJ observations_NNS ._.
A_DT total_NN of_IN 720_CD isolates_NNS ,_, including_VBG 290_CD streptococci_NN and_CC 430_CD lactobacilli_NN ,_, were_VBD obtained_VBN in_IN the_DT above_JJ manner_NN ._.
The_DT isolates_NNS were_VBD maintained_VBN in_IN milk_NN at_IN a_DT low_JJ temperature_NN (_( 10°_CD to_TO 15°C_CD ._. )_)
and_CC transferred_VBD once_RB every_DT ten_NN days_NNS ._.
Classification_NN and_CC identification_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS As_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN isolates_NNS to_TO be_VB examined_VBN was_VBD very_RB large_JJ it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN convenient_NN first_RB to_TO make_VB a_DT preliminary_JJ classification_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS based_VBN on_IN well-recognized_JJ group_NN characteristics_NNS and_CC then_RB select_VB a_DT limited_JJ number_NN of_IN representative_JJ strains_NNS for_IN further_JJ study_NN and_CC identification_NN ._.
Preliminary_JJ grouping_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS All_PDT the_DT isolates_NNS were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT following_JJ tests_NNS for_IN their_PRP$ preliminary_JJ classi-_JJ fication_NN ._.
Microscopic_NNP appearance_NN ._.
Microscopic_NNP appearance_NN and_CC arrangement_NN of_IN the_DT cells_NNS of_IN organisms_NNS in_IN freshly_RB curdled_VBN milk_NN cultures_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN ._.
Action_NN on_IN litmus_JJ milk_NN ._.
The_DT cultures_NNS (_( soon_RB after_IN curdling_VBG )_) were_VBD inoculated_VBN into_IN plain_JJ litmus_JJ milk_NN and_CC incubated_VBN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
Observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN regarding_VBG acid_JJ production_NN ,_, clotting_VBG ,_, reduction_NN of_IN litmus_NN ,_, gas_NN production_NN and_CC proteolysis_NN ._.
Growth_NN at_IN different_JJ temperatures_NNS ._.
Young_NNP cultures_NNS of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD inoculated_VBN into_IN plain_JJ litmus_JJ milk_NN and_CC yeast_NN litmus_NN milk_NN and_CC incubated_VBN at_IN 10°C._CD ,_, 30°C._CD ,_, 37°C._CD ,_, 45°C._CD ,_, and_CC 50°C_CD ._.

RESULTS_NNP AND_CC DISCUSSION_NNP Preliminary_NNP classification_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS Altogether_RB 290_CD streptococci_NN and_CC 430_CD lactobacilli_NNS were_VBD isolated_VBN from_IN over_IN 500_CD samples_NNS of_IN ._.
dahi_NN [_NN Laxminarayana_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
1952_CD ]_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD found_VBN to_TO form_VB small_JJ ,_, discreet_JJ colonies_NNS on_IN lactose_JJ agar_NN plate_NN and_CC under_IN the_DT low_JJ power_NN of_IN the_DT microscope_NN the_DT colonies_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN to_TO be_VB round_VBN or_CC oval_JJ ,_, ranging_VBG from_IN smooth_NN to_TO rough_VB varieties_NNS ._.
Surface_NNP growth_NN on_IN dextrose_NN or_CC lactose_JJ agar_NN slant_NN was_VBD very_RB poor_JJ and_CC the_DT organisms_NN grew_VBD well_RB in_IN agar_NN stabs_NNS indicating_VBG their_PRP$ micro-aerophilic_JJ character_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT evidence_NN of_IN catalase_NN production_NN and_CC all_PDT the_DT isolates_NNS were_VBD Gram_NNP positive_JJ with_IN out_RP showing_VBG any_DT endospore_JJ formation_NN or_CC motility_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN the_DT preliminary_JJ tests_NNS the_DT isolates_NNS could_MD be_VB classified_VBN into_IN the_DT following_JJ distinct_JJ groups_NNS with_IN well_RB defined_VBN characteristics_NNS (_( Table_NNP II_NNP )_) ._.

XXlI_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP The_DT isolates-in_JJ L._NNP casei_NN group_NN (_( Streptobacteria_NNP )_) appeared_VBD as_IN short_JJ and_CC thin_JJ rods_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN pairs_NNS or_CC short_JJ chains_NNS and_CC showing_VBG granules_NNS occasionally_RB ._.
They_PRP showed_VBD growth_NN at_IN 10°C_CD ._.
and_CC a_DT few_JJ isolates_NNS grew_VBD at_IN 45°C_CD ._.
also_RB ._.
Nearly_RB 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN them_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO coagulate_VB milk_NN in_IN 2_CD to_TO 3_CD days_NNS at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
while_IN the_DT rest_NN took_VBD 10_CD to_TO 14_CD days_NNS ._.
Litmus_NNP was_VBD partially_RB reduced_VBN and_CC both_DT maltose_JJ and_CC sucrose_JJ were_VBD generally_RB fermented_VBN ._.
The_DT remaining_VBG lactobacilli_NN ,_, which_WDT were_VBD characteristically_RB slow_JJ acid_NN producers_NNS have_VBP been_VBN included_VBN in_IN L._NNP brevis_NN group_NN ._.
They_PRP generally_RB resembled_VBD the_DT isolates_NNS in_IN L._NNP casei_NN group_NN in_IN their_PRP$ morphology_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN a_DT few_JJ organisms_NNS they_PRP did_VBD not_RB grow_VB at_IN 45°C_CD ._.
but_CC showed_VBD slow_JJ growth_NN at_IN 10°C_CD ._.
All_PDT the_DT organisms_NNS fermented_VBD dextrose_RB ,_, lactose_JJ ,_, sucrose_JJ and_CC maltose_JJ ._.
Half_NN of_IN them_PRP produced_VBD only_RB slight_JJ acid_NNS in_IN milk_NN even_RB after_IN a_DT month_NN but_CC in_IN presence_NN of_IN yeast_JJ extract_JJ milk_NN was_VBD observed_VBN to_TO coagulate_VB in_IN 3_CD to_TO 6_CD days_NNS ._.
Slight_NNP gas_NN production_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN milk_NN cultures_NNS of_IN some_DT of_IN these_DT isolates_NNS ._.
The_DT remaining_VBG 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT isolates_NNS in_IN this_DT group_NN were_VBD able_JJ to_TO coagulate_VB milk_NN in_IN 3_CD to_TO 10_CD days_NNS and_CC also_RB showed_VBD high_JJ aroma_NN and_CC acetoin_JJ formation_NN ._.
The_DT lactobacilli_NN in_IN L._NNP bulgaricus_NN group_NN ,_, particularly_RB those_DT included_VBN in_IN sub-groups_NNS A_NNP and_CC B_NNP of_IN this_DT group_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO occur_VB in_IN dahi_NN produced_VBN in_IN almost_RB all_DT parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN and_CC these_DT also_RB formed_VBD the_DT predominant_JJ flora_NN of_IN south_JJ Indian_JJ dahi_NN samples_NNS ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS in_IN L._NNP casei_NN group_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT predominant_JJ types_NNS of_IN lacto-_JJ bacilli_NN ,_, occurring_VBG in_IN north_JJ Indian_JJ samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT heterofermentative_JJ types_NNS included_VBN in_IN L._NNP brevis_NN group_NN were_VBD found_VBN mostly_RB in_IN good_JJ samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN obtained_VBN from_IN Calcutta_NNP ,_, Darbhanga_NNP (_( Bihar_NNP )_) and_CC Mathura_NNP (_( Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP )_) ._.
Thus_RB ,_, almost_RB all_PDT the_DT types_NNS of_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NN ,_, reported_VBD to_TO be_VB present_JJ in_IN fermented_JJ milks_NNS [_VBP Corminboeuf_NNP ,_, 1933_CD ;_: Tanner_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN were_VBD observed_VBN to_TO occur_VB in_IN dahi_NN ._.
The_DT heterofermentative_JJ streptococci_NN described_VBN under_IN S._NNP dextranicum_NN ,_, group-_JJ IV_NNP ,_, did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT evidence_NN of_IN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO produce_VB gas_NN either_RB in_IN milk_NN or_CC in_IN dextrose_JJ broth_NN cultures_NNS in_IN subsequent_JJ experiments_NNS ._.
They_PRP also_RB became_VBD more_RBR vigo-_JJ rous_JJ acid_NN producers_NNS on_IN repeated_VBN sub-culturing_NN ._.
These_DT astrains_NNS were_VBD accordingly_RB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB heterofermentative_JJ variants_NNS of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS in_IN S._NNP faecalis_NN group_NN ._.
Similarly_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT heterofermentative_JJ types_NNS of_IN lactobacilli_NN included_VBN under_IN L._NNP brevis_NN ,_, group_NN III_NNP only_RB 12_CD isolates_NNS gave_VBD evidence_NN of_IN gas_NN formation_NN ._.
The_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, considered_VBN to_TO be_VB heterofermentative_JJ variants_NNS of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS in_IN Group_NNP II_NNP ._.
Detailed_JJ examination_NN of_IN selected_VBN isolates_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ identification_NN The_DT results_NNS of_IN detailed_JJ taxonomical_JJ studies_NNS on_IN selected_VBN isolates_NNS (_( 32_CD streptococci_NN and_CC 21_CD lactobacilli_NN )_) are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP III_NNP (_( a_DT and_CC b_NN )_) and_CC IV_NNP (_( a_DT and_CC b_NN )_) ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS have_VBP been_VBN grouped_VBN according_VBG to_TO the_DT species_NNS with_IN which_WDT they_PRP have_VBP been_VBN identified_VBN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN their_PRP$ typical_JJ morphological_NN ,_, cultural_JJ and_CC biochemical_JJ characteristics_NNS (_( vide_IN Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.

Lactobacillus_JJ helveticus_NN (_( L._NNP 189_CD )_) ;_: Methylene_NNP blue_IN March_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP et_VBD al_JJ 39_CD and_CC non-spore_RB forming_VBG organising_VBG and_CC their_PRP$ colonies_NNS (_( deep_JJ or_CC sub-surface_NN )_) on_IN agar_NN were_VBD small_JJ ,_, compact_JJ and_CC round_NN ,_, oval_NN or_CC disc_NN shaped_VBN ._.
Under_IN the_DT low_JJ power_NN of_IN a_DT microscope_NN ,_, the_DT colonies_NNS of_IN streptococci_NN generally_RB appeared_VBD smooth_JJ and_CC round_NN or_CC oval_NN shaped_VBN with_IN entire_JJ margins_NNS ,_, while_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN lactobacilli_JJ both_DT smooth_JJ as_RB well_RB as_IN rough_NN and_CC filamentous_JJ types_NNS of_IN colonies_NNS were_VBD encountered_VBN ._.
Growth_NN on_IN agar_NN slants_NNS was_VBD very_RB scanty_JJ while_IN good_JJ growth_NN (_( filiform_NN or_CC beaded_VBN )_) was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN a_DT dextrose_NN or_CC lactose_JJ agar_JJ stab_NN ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO produce_VB catalase_NN ,_, reduce_VB nitrate_NN to_TO nitrite_VB or_CC produce_VB indol_JJ Streptococci_NNP ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN (_( Table_JJ III_NNP a_DT and_CC b_NN )_) that_IN the_DT streptococci_NN have_VBP been_VBN divided_VBN into_IN four_CD distinct_JJ species_NNS viz._VBP ,_, S._NNP thermophilus_CC (_( 10_CD isolates_NNS )_) ;_: S._NNP lactis_NN (_( 6_CD isolates_NNS )_) ;_: S._NNP faecalis_NN (_( 10_CD isolates_NNS )_) ;_: S._NNP liquefaciens_VBZ (_( 3_CD isolates_NNS )_) and_CC heterofermentative_JJ types_NNS tentatively_RB indentified_VBD as_IN S._NNP faecalis_NN (_( 5_CD isolates_NNS )_) ._.
It_PRP was_VBD not_RB possible_JJ to_TO differentiate_VB between_IN the_DT streptococci_NN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN their_PRP$ morphology_NN or_CC colony_NN characteristics_NNS since_IN all_DT of_IN them_PRP generally_RB appeared_VBD as_IN spherical_JJ or_CC oval_JJ cells_NNS (_( 0.6_CD to_TO 1.0µ_CD diameter_NN )_) arranged_VBD in_IN pairs_NNS or_CC short_JJ chains_NNS and_CC formed_VBD smooth_JJ colonies_NNS ._.
Long_JJ chains_NNS of_IN cells_NNS and_CC capsulated_VBD forms_NNS were_VBD conspicuously_RB shown_VBN only_RB by_IN two_CD strains_NNS of_IN S._NNP thermophilus_CC (_( S._NNP 240_CD and_CC S._NNP 197_CD )_) and_CC one_CD of_IN S._NNP lactis_NN (_( S._NNP 10_CD )_) ._.
Significant_JJ differ-_JJ ences_NNS were_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, observed_VBN in_IN respect_NN of_IN growth_NN at_IN different_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, action_NN on_IN litmus_NN milk_NN ,_, production_NN of_IN volatile_JJ acid_NN ,_, acetoin_JJ formation_NN from_IN citrate_NN and_CC production_NN of_IN ammonia_NN from_IN arginine_NN ,_, which_WDT were_VBD of_IN diagnostic_JJ value_NN in_IN the_DT iden-_JJ tification_NN of_IN their_PRP$ species_NNS ._.
With_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN the_DT isolates_NNS included_VBD under_IN S._NNP liquefaciens_NNS and_CC heterofermentative_JJ members_NNS of_IN S._NNP faecalis_NN groups_NNS ,_, there_EX was_VBD no_DT appreciable_JJ production_NN of_IN volatile_JJ acidity_NN in_IN milk_NN ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT streptococci_NN studied_VBD gave_VBD evidence_NN of_IN gas_NN formation_NN either_CC in_IN milk_NN ,_, in_IN sugar_JJ broths_NNS or_CC in_IN semi-solid_JJ glucose_NN agar_JJ media_NNS ._.
All_DT of_IN them_PRP fermented_VBD dextrose_NN (_( except_IN for_IN two_CD isolates_NNS of_IN S._NNP ther-_JJ mophilus_NN )_) and_CC lactose_JJ but_CC in_IN regard_NN to_TO fermentation_NN of_IN other_JJ sugars_NNS considerable_JJ variations_NNS were_VBD encountered_VBN even_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN organisms_NNS included_VBN in_IN the_DT same_JJ species_NNS ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS identified_VBN as_IN S._NNP thermophilus_CC were_VBD all_DT characterised_VBN by_IN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO grow_VB at_IN 50°C._CD ,_, failure_NN to_TO grow_VB at_IN 10°C._CD ,_, resistance_NN to_TO pasteurisation_NN (_( 63°C_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS )_) ,_, rapid_JJ acid_NN production_NN and_CC coagulation_NN of_IN milk_NN without_IN reduction_NN of_IN litmus_NN ,_, inability_NN to_TO produce_VB acetoin_NN from_IN citrate_NN or_CC ammonia_NN from_IN arginine_NN and_CC poor_JJ tolerance_NN to_TO high_JJ pH_NN ,_, NaCl_NNP and_CC methylene_NNP blue_NN ._.
The_DT time_NN of_IN coagulation_NN of_IN plain_NN milk_NN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
ranged_VBN from_IN 6_CD to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS and_CC the_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD able_JJ to_TO curdle_VB yeast_RB dextrose_JJ milk_NN in_IN 4_CD to_TO 6_CD hours_NNS at_IN 45_CD to_TO 47°C_CD ._.
A_DT firm_NN curd_NN with_IN very_RB little_JJ whey_JJ separation_NN and_CC a_DT mildly_RB acidic_JJ flavour_NN was_VBD formed_VBN ._.
The_DT maximum_JJ acidity_NN produced_VBN varied_VBN from_IN 0.8_CD to_TO 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN them_PRP fermented_VBD sucrose_RB but_CC not_RB maltose_JJ and_CC dextrin_NN ._.
Three_CD islolates_NNS (_( S._NNP 240_CD ,_, S._NNP 258_CD and_CC S._NNP 252A_CD )_) may_MD be_VB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB most_JJS typical_JJ of_IN the_DT species_NNS ,_, although_IN S._NNP 252A_CD fermented_VBD maltose_NN ._.
Two_CD of_IN them_PRP (_( S._NNP 240_CD and_CC S._NNP 258_CD )_) fermented_VBD dextrose_JJ very_RB weakly_RB ;_: in_IN course_NN of_IN time_NN they_PRP were_VBD found_VBN to_TO have_VB completely_RB lost_VBN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO ferment_VB this_DT sugar_NN ,_, while_IN their_PRP$ capacity_NN to_TO produce_VB acid_NN from_IN lactose_JJ and_CC sucrose_JJ remained_VBN unaltered_JJ ._.
The_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN isolates_NNS in_IN the_DT S._NNP thermophilus_CC group_NN ,_, showing_VBG a_DT similar_JJ inability_NN to_TO ferment_VB dextrose_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN indicated_VBN in_IN the_DT preliminary_JJ classification_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS ._.

faecalis_NN (_( ?_. )_)
(_( Hetero-_JJ ferment-_JJ ative_NN )_) S._NNP 207_CD ,_, +_NNP +_NNP .._NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP ±_VBD 0_CD +_NNP ±_NNP +_NNP +_NNP S._NNP 209_CD ,_, S._NNP 253_CD S._NNP 212_CD ,_, +_NNP +_NNP .._NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP ±_VBD 0_CD +_NNP ±_NNP +_NNP +_NNP S._NNP 213_CD +_NNP =_NNP Positive_NNP (_( acid_JJ production_NN )_) ;_: ±_CC =_VB variable_JJ or_CC slight_JJ ;_: 0_CD =_NNP Negative_NNP ._.
42_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP DAHI_NNP ._.
III_NNP ._.
TAXONOMY_NN OF_IN THE_NNP LACTIC_NNP ACID_NNP ._.
ETC_NNP ._.
[_JJ Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, strains_NNS of_IN S._NNP thermophilus_CC deserves_VBZ further_JJ investigation_NN ._.
Isolate_NNP S._NNP 8_CD is_VBZ an_DT a_DT typical_JJ strain_NN since_IN it_PRP was_VBD able_JJ to_TO tolerate_VB 4_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP and_CC 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
Six_CD isolates_NNS have_VBP been_VBN identified_VBN as_IN S._NNP lactis_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD distinguished_VBN from_IN S._NNP thermophilus_CC in_IN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO grow_VB at_IN 10°C_CD ._.
and_CC failure_NN to_TO grow_VB at_IN 45°C_CD ._.
or_CC survive_NN (_( 63°C_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS ,_, production_NN of_IN NH3_NNP from_IN arginine_NN (_( except_IN for_IN one_CD isolate_NN ,_, S._NNP 10_CD )_) and_CC tolerance_NN to_TO pH_VB 9.2_CD ,_, 4_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP (_( except_IN S._NNP 10_CD )_) ,_, and_CC 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO coagulate_VB milk_NN in_IN 14_CD to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
and_CC produced_VBD a_DT maximum_JJ acidity_NN ranging_VBG from_IN 0.75_CD to_TO 0.90_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Isolate_NNP S._NNP 157_CD ,_, which_WDT fermented_VBD maltose_NN and_CC dextrin_NN but_CC not_RB sucrose_JJ ,_, may_MD be_VB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB typical_JJ of_IN the_DT species_NNS ._.
Two_CD other_JJ isolates_NNS (_( S._NNP 69_CD and_CC S._NNP 154_CD )_) closely_RB resembled_VBD the_DT typical_JJ strain_NN except_IN for_IN their_PRP$ inability_NN to_TO ferment_VB maltose_NN and_CC the_DT latter_NN 's_POS ability_NN to_TO attack_VB sucrose_JJ strongly_RB ._.
Isolate_NNP S._NNP 10_CD ,_, which_WDT formed_VBD a_DT ropy_NN curd_NN ,_, showed_VBD long_JJ chains_NNS of_IN cells_NNS and_CC capsulated_VBD forms_NNS ._.
It_PRP also_RB failed_VBD to_TO grow_VB in_IN 4_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP ,_, produce_VBP ammonia_NN from_IN arginine_NN or_CC ferment_NN maltose_NN and_CC dextrin_NN ;_: it_PRP thus_RB resembled_VBD S._NNP cremoris_VBD more_RBR closely_RB than_IN S._NNP lactis_NN ._.
This_DT strain_NN is_VBZ probably_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT organisms_NNS described_VBN by_IN Joshi_NNP and_CC Ram_NNP Ayyar_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP and_CC Karnad_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP except_IN that_IN it_PRP showed_VBD ropiness_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, isolate_VBP S._NNP 57_CD showed_VBD some_DT relationship_NN to_TO S._NNP faecalis_NN by_IN its_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO tolerate_VB pH_NN 9.6_CD and_CC 6.5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP ._.
The_DT remaining_VBG streptococci_NN (_( 18_CD isolates_NNS )_) have_VBP been_VBN included_VBN in_IN the_DT Enterococcus_NNP group_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO grow_VB at_IN 10°C_CD ._.
as_RB well_RB as_IN at_IN 45°C_CD ._.
and_CC ,_, with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN 4_CD strains_NNS ,_, showed_VBD growth_NN even_RB at_IN 50°C_CD ._.
All_DT of_IN them_PRP survived_VBD pasteurisation_NN (_( 63°C_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS )_) produced_VBD ammonia_NN from_IN arginine_NN and_CC produced_VBD acid_NNS in_IN milk_NN followed_VBN by_IN reduction_NN of_IN litmus_NN and_CC coagulation_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN two_CD isolates_NNS they_PRP also_RB produced_VBD acetoin_NNS in_IN sugar_NN free_JJ citrate_NN medium_NN and_CC did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT inhibition_NN at_IN pH_JJ 9.6_CD or_CC by_IN 6.5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP and_CC 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
Ten_CD of_IN these_DT have_VBP been_VBN identified_VBN as_IN S._NNP faecalis_NN ._.
They_PRP produced_VBD acid_NN and_CC coagulation_NN of_IN milk_NN rapidly_RB (_( 8H_CD ._.
LAXMINARAYANA_NNP et_CC al_RB 43_CD produced_VBD very_RB high_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN volatile_JJ acidity_NN in_IN milk_NN (_( 25_CD to_TO 33_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN N/10_NNP NaOH_NNP per_IN 250g_CD ._.
of_IN culture_NN )_) and_CC fermented_VBN pentoses_NNS strongly_RB ,_, they_PRP were_VBD originally_RB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB related_VBN to_TO S._NNP paracitrovorous_JJ (_( Leuconostoc_NNP )_) ,_, but_CC their_PRP$ inability_NN to_TO produce_VB gas_NN from_IN glucose_JJ ,_, form_JJ acetoin_NN from_IN citrate_NN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN glucose_NN or_CC other_JJ source_NN of_IN carbohydrate_NN [_NNP Campbell_NNP and_CC Gunsalus_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN and_CC produce_VB amonia_NN from_IN arginine_NN precluded_VBN their_PRP$ being_VBG placed_VBN in_IN this_DT category_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, they_PRP resembled_VBD the_DT Enterococcus_NNP group_NN more_RBR closely_RB (_( particularly_RB S._NNP liquefaciens_NNS )_) in_IN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO grow_VB at_IN high_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, resistance_NN to_TO pasteurisation_NN (_( 63°C_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS )_) and_CC their_PRP$ tolerance_NN to_TO alkaline_VB pH_NN ,_, 6.5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP and_CC 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
S._NNP liquefaciens_VBZ has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN to_TO lose_VB its_PRP$ proteolytic_JJ character_NN and_CC this_DT organism_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN S._NNP faecalis_NNS have_VBP been_VBN reported_VBN to_TO produce_VB volatile_JJ acidity_NN in_IN milk_NN [_NNP Long_NNP and_CC Hammer_NNP ,_, 1936_CD ;_: Davis_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, 1939_CD ]_NN ._.
These_DT isolates_NNS may_MD therefore_RB be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN heterofermentative_JJ variants_NNS of_IN S._NNP faecalis_NN or_CC S._NNP liquefaciens_VBZ or_CC they_PRP may_MD form_VB a_DT distinct_JJ species_NNS in_IN the_DT Enterococcus_NNP group_NN of_IN streptococci_NN ._.
Lactobacilli_NNP ._.
The_DT lactobacilli_NN have_VBP been_VBN classified_VBN (_( Tables_NNP IV_NNP a_DT and_CC 6_CD )_) into_IN six_CD different_JJ species_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, L._NNP bulgaricus_NN (_( 7_CD isolates_NNS )_) ,_, L._NNP lactis_NN (_( 3_CD isolates_NNS )_) ,_, L._NNP helveticus_NN (_( 2_CD isolates_NNS )_) ,_, L._NNP casei_NN (_( 4_CD isolates_NNS )_) ,_, L._NNP plantarum_NN (_( 3_CD isolates_NNS )_) and_CC L._NNP fermenti_NNP (_( 3_CD isolates_NNS )_) ._.
The_DT isolates_NNS included_VBD under_IN the_DT first_JJ three_CD species_NNS (_( Thermobacteria_NNP )_) were_VBD character-_JJ ized_VBN by_IN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO grow_VB at_IN 50°C._CD ,_, failure_NN to_TO grow_VB at_IN 15°C._CD ,_, resistance_NN to_TO pasteuri-_JJ sation_NN (_( 63°C_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS )_) and_CC rapid_JJ acid_NN production_NN and_CC coagulation_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN 13_CD to_TO 40_CD hours_NNS at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
Yeast_NNP dextrose_JJ milk_NN was_VBD curdled_VBN in_IN 6_CD to_TO 10_CD hrs_NN ._.
at_IN 45°C._CD ,_, and_CC ,_, with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN L._NNP bulgaricus_NN strains_NNS ,_, all_PDT the_DT isolates_NNS reduced_VBD litmus_NN ._.
The_DT maximum_JJ acidity_NN ranged_VBD from_IN 1.7_CD to_TO 2.2_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ._.
They_PRP formed_VBD a_DT firm_NN and_CC highly_RB acid_JJ curd_NN with_IN very_RB little_JJ whey_JJ separation_NN or_CC volatile_JJ acid_NN production_NN and_CC did_VBD not_RB produce_VB gas_NN from_IN glucose_NN or_CC show_VB growth_NN in_IN 2_CD per_IN cent_NN lactate_NN media_NNS ._.
Their_PRP$ growth_NN was_VBD not_RB inhibited_VBN by_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP but_CC results_NNS regarding_VBG tolerance_NN to_TO 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP and_CC 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN were_VBD variable_JJ ._.
All_DT of_IN them_PRP fermented_VBD dextrose_NN and_CC lactose_JJ vigorously_RB ._.
Their_PRP$ further_JJ differentiation_NN was_VBD mainly_RB based_VBN on_IN slight_JJ morphological_JJ variations_NNS ,_, their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO reduce_VB litmus_NN ,_, and_CC differences_NNS in_IN the_DT fermentation_NN of_IN sugars_NNS particularly_RB of_IN maltose_NN and_CC sucrose_NN ._.
The_DT strains_NNS of_IN L._NNP bulgaricus_NN appeared_VBD as_IN long_JJ slender_NN rods_NNS (_( 3.0-4.5X0.5-0.7µ_JJ )_) usually_RB occurring_VBG singly_RB and_CC occasionally_RB in_IN long_JJ chains_NNS or_CC filaments_NNS ,_, showing_VBG metachromatic_JJ granules_NNS prominently_RB when_WRB stained_VBN with_IN aqueous_JJ methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
Agar_NNP colonies_NNS of_IN these_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD of_IN the_DT rough_JJ type_NN and_CC were_VBD highly_RB filamentous_JJ ._.
Isolates_NNS L.96_NNP ,_, L.393_NNP and_CC L.409_NNP may_MD be_VB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB typical_JJ of_IN the_DT species_NNS except_IN for_IN their_PRP$ tolerance_NN to_TO 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP and_CC fermentation_NN of_IN arabinose_NN ;_: L.96_NNP had_VBD the_DT ability_NN to_TO ferment_VB maltose_RB slightly_RB ._.
One_CD isolate_NN (_( L.1_NNP )_) fermented_VBD arabinose_JJ and_CC sucrose_JJ strongly_RB and_CC maltose_VB slightly_RB ._.
These_DT organisms_NNS appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB analogous_JJ to_TO the_DT lactobacilli_NN associated_VBN with_IN Yoghourt_NNP ,_, Kefir_NNP and_CC other_JJ fermented_JJ milks_NNS of_IN the_DT Mediterranean_NNP and_CC Middle_NNP East_NNP countries_NNS although_IN the_DT very_RB high_JJ values_NNS of_IN acidity_NN (_( 2.5-4_JJ per_IN cent_NN )_) reported_VBN by_IN previous_JJ workers_NNS [_JJ Hammer_NNP ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN were_VBD not_RB obtained_VBN with_IN them_PRP ._.
They_PRP are_VBP probably_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT organisms_NNS described_VBN by_IN Chatterjee_NNP [_NNP 1910_CD ]_NNP under_IN the_DT name_NN 'Streptothrix_POS dadhi_NN '_'' and_CC later_RB by_IN Ram_NNP Ayyar_NNP [_NNP 1928_CD ]_NNP ._.
Three_CD isolates_NNS (_( L.326_NNP ,_, L.376_NNP and_CC L.395_NNP )_) have_VBP been_VBN identified_VBN as_IN L._NNP lactis_VBZ mainly_RB on_IN account_NN of_IN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO reduce_VB litmus_NN and_CC ferment_NN sucrose_NN ,_, maltose_RB ,_, arbinose_RB and_CC other_JJ sugars_NNS which_WDT are_VBP not_RB attacked_VBN by_IN L._NNP bulgaricus_NN ._.
Morphologically_RB they_PRP 9_CD 44_CD STUDIES_NNPS ON_NNP DAHI_NNP III_NNP ._.

9_CD A_DT 46_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP DAHI_NNP III_NNP ._.

[_JJ VOL_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, PART_NNP I_PRP appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB slightly_RB different_JJ from_IN L._NNP bulgaricus_NN as_IN they_PRP showed_VBD many_JJ curved_VBN and_CC coiled_VBN forms_NNS and_CC occasionally_RB contained_VBD more_RBR numerous_JJ granules_NNS in_IN the_DT cells_NNS ._.
In_IN all_DT other_JJ respects_NNS these_DT organisms_NNS closely_RB resembled_VBD the_DT L._NNP bulgaricus_NN strains_NNS ._.
Isolates_NNS L.12_NNP and_CC L.189_NNP ,_, which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN identified_VBN as_IN L._NNP helveticus_NN differed_VBD from_IN the_DT above_JJ two_CD species_NNS in_IN appearing_VBG as_IN shorter_NN and_CC thinner_NN cells_NNS arranged_VBN in_IN pairs_NNS of_IN palisade_NN formation_NN almost_RB resembling_VBG the_DT cells_NNS of_IN L._NNP casei_NN ._.
The_DT colonies_NNS formed_VBN were_VBD generally_RB of_IN the_DT 'smooth_NNP '_POS type_NN ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD inhibited_VBN by_IN 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP but_CC not_RB by_IN 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
Arabinose_NNP and_CC maltose_VB were_VBD fermented_VBN while_IN sucrose_NN ,_, raffinose_NN and_CC salicin_NN were_VBD not_RB attacked_VBN ._.
The_DT organisms_NN included_VBD under_IN L._NNP casei_NN and_CC L._NNP plantarum_NN species_NNS (_( Streptobac-_NNP teria_NN )_) were_VBD able_JJ to_TO grow_VB at_IN 10°C_CD ._.
and_CC with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN one_CD isolate_NN (_( L.157_NNP )_) ,_, at_IN 45°C_CD ._.
None_NN of_IN them_PRP showed_VBD growth_NN at_IN 50°C_CD ._.
Resistance_NN to_TO pasteurisation_NN (_( 63°C_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD min_NNS ._. )_)
was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, variable_JJ ._.
They_PRP produced_VBD acid_NNS in_IN milk_NN more_RBR slowly_RB than_IN the_DT Thermobacteria_NNP and_CC took_VBD 3_CD to_TO 4_CD days_NNS or_CC longer_JJR to_TO coagulate_VB milk_NN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
Maximum_JJ acidity_NN produced_VBN was_VBD 1.4_CD to_TO 1.6_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN L._NNP casei_NN strains_NNS and_CC less_JJR than_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN others_NNS ._.
They_PRP did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT gas_NN formation_NN from_IN glucose_JJ and_CC with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN two_CD isolates_NNS (_( L.89_NNP and_CC L.73_NNP )_) they_PRP did_VBD not_RB produce_VB any_DT volatile_JJ acidity_NN in_IN milk_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO grow_VB in_IN two_CD per_IN cent_NN lactate_NN and_CC tolerate_VB 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN concentration_NN of_IN NaCl_NNP ._.
All_DT of_IN them_PRP were_VBD inhibited_VBN by_IN 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
In_IN morphology_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD clearly_RB distinguished_VBN from_IN L._NNP bulgaricus_NN and_CC related_JJ strains_NNS by_IN their_PRP$ appearance_NN as_IN very_RB short_JJ and_CC thin_JJ rods_NNS (_( 1.5-2.5X0.2µ_JJ )_) occurring_VBG in_IN pairs_NNS ,_, chains_NNS ,_, palisade_NN formation_NN and_CC occasionally_RB in_IN long_JJ filaments_NNS ._.
Granules_NNS were_VBD not_RB prominent_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN L.157_NNP ,_, two_CD types_NNS of_IN cellsH_NN ._.
LAXMINARAYANA_NNP et_CC al_VBD 47_CD Three_NNP isolates_NNS (_( L.121_NNP ,_, L.124_NNP and_CC L.414_NNP )_) were_VBD found_VBN to_TO possess_VB the_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN Betabacteria_NNP ._.
They_PRP grew_VBD very_RB slowly_RB in_IN milk_NN producing_VBG only_RB acid_RB ,_, and_CC milk_NN was_VBD not_RB coagulated_VBN even_RB when_WRB incubated_VBN for_IN over_IN one_CD month_NN at_IN 30°C_CD ._.
(_( maximum_JJ acidity_NN being_VBG 0.3_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN )_) ._.
Addition_NN of_IN yeast_NN extract_NN stimulated_VBD acid_JJ production_NN and_CC a_DT weak_JJ curd_NN was_VBD formed_VBN after_IN 10_CD to_TO 15_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS produced_VBD gas_NN from_IN glucose_NN and_CC high_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN volatile_JJ acidity_NN in_IN milk_NN ._.
They_PRP grew_VBD in_IN two_CD per_IN cent_NN lactate_NN medium_NN but_CC were_VBD inhibited_VBN by_IN 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN NaCl_NNP and_CC 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN methylene_NN blue_NN ._.
In_IN morphology_NN they_PRP resembled_VBD L._NNP casei_NN strains_NNS except_IN that_DT slightly_RB longer_JJR cells_NNS were_VBD also_RB encountered_VBN ._.
The_DT colonies_NNS formed_VBN were_VBD of_IN the_DT smooth_JJ type_NN ._.
Dextrose_NNP and_CC lactose_VB were_VBD the_DT only_JJ two_CD sugars_NNS which_WDT were_VBD fermented_VBN to_TO any_DT appreciable_JJ extent_NN ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD able_JJ to_TO grow_VB at_IN 45°C_CD ._.
(_( except_IN for_IN isolate_JJ L.414_NNP )_) ,_, but_CC not_RB at_IN 15°C_CD ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN this_DT property_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN their_PRP$ inability_NN to_TO ferment_VB arabinose_RB ,_, the_DT isolates_NNS have_VBP been_VBN identified_VBN as_IN L._NNP fermenti_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Studies_NNPS on_IN the_DT isolation_NN ,_, characterization_NN and_CC classification_NN of_IN 290_CD streptococci_NNS and_CC 430_CD lactobacilli_NN ,_, isolated_VBN from_IN over_IN 500_CD samples_NNS of_IN dahi_NN collected_VBN from_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, are_VBP reported_VBN ._.
On_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN certain_JJ important_JJ characteristics_NNS ,_, the_DT isolates_NNS were_VBD broadly_RB classified_VBN into_IN different_JJ groups_NNS ._.
The_DT streptococci_NN were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN 4_CD groups_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, S._NNP thermophilus_CC (_( 140_CD isolates_NNS )_) ,_, S._NNP lactis_NN (_( 28_CD isolates_NNS )_) S._NNP faecalis_NN (_( 107_CD isolates_NNS )_) and_CC S._NNP dextranicum_NNP (_( 15_CD isolates_NNS )_) ._.
The_DT Lactobacilli_NNP ,_, were_VBD classified_VBN into_IN 3_CD groups_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, L._NNP bulgaricus_NN (_( 310_CD isolates_NNS )_) ,_, L._NNP casei_NN (_( 88_CD isolates_NNS )_) and_CC L._NNP brevis_NNP (_( 32_CD isolates_NNS )_) ._.
Representative_JJ isolates_NNS selected_VBN from_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT above_JJ groups_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN in_IN detail_NN for_IN their_PRP$ species_NNS identification_NN ._.
The_DT species_NNS of_IN streptococci_NN identified_VBN included_VBD S._NNP thermophilus_CC ,_, S._NNP lactis_NN ,_, S._NNP faecalis_NN ,_, and_CC S._NNP liquifaciens_NNS while_IN amongst_VBP the_DT lactobacilli_NN ,_, L._NNP bulgaricus_NNP L._NNP lactis_NN ,_, L._NNP helveticus_NN ,_, L._NNP casei_NN ,_, L._NNP plantarum_NN and_CC L._NNP fermenti_NNS were_VBD encountered_VBN ._.
Some_DT heterofermentative_JJ streptococci_NN and_CC lactobacilli_NN were_VBD identified_VBN as_IN variants_NNS of_IN S._NNP faecalis_NN and_CC L._NNP plantarum_VBP respectively_RB ._.
Amongst_IN the_DT streptococci_NN isolated_VBD from_IN dahi_NN ,_, S._NNP thermophilus_CC and_CC S._NNP faecalis_NNS were_VBD encountered_VBN most_JJS frequently_RB while_IN L._NNP bulgaricus_NN was_VBD the_DT most_RBS commonly_JJ occurring_VBG lactobacillus_NN in_IN this_DT fermented_JJ milk_NN ._.
The_DT heterofermentative_JJ streptococci_NN and_CC lactobacilli_NN were_VBD almost_RB invariably_RB associated_VBN with_IN dahi_NN of_IN good_JJ aroma_NN and_CC other_JJ desirable_JJ qualities_NNS ,_, obtained_VBN from_IN centres_NNS in_IN Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ,_, Bihar_NNP and_CC West_NNP Bengal_NNP ._.

'The_POS Lactic_JJ Acid_NNP Bacteria_NNP '_POS 1st_CD and_CC 2nd_CD Ed_NNP ._.

Bact._NNP ,_, 31_CD ,_, 47_CD REDUCTION_NNP IN_NNP MILK_NNP YIELD_NNP IN_NNP INDIAN_NNP DAIRY_NNP CATTLE_NNP BY_NNP ARTHROPOD_NNP INVASION_NNP AND_NNP ITS_NNP CONTROL_NNP By_IN B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP ,_, C._NNP M._NNP SEN_NNP GUPTA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BALARAMA_NNP MENON_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 16_CD October_NNP 1950_CD )_) IT_NNP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN ectoparasites_VBZ when_WRB present_NN in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS cause_VBP annoyance_NN and_CC irritation_NN to_TO animals_NNS ._.
Sometimes_RB their_PRP$ intensity_NN is_VBZ so_RB great_JJ that_IN the_DT animals_NNS are_VBP worried_JJ day_NN and_CC night_NN ._.
The_DT annoyance_NN caused_VBN by_IN them_PRP is_VBZ manifested_VBN in_IN various_JJ ways_NNS ._.
At_IN times_NNS the_DT cows_NNS are_VBP so_RB frightened_VBN by_IN the_DT attack_NN of_IN Lyperosia_NNP exigua_VBP that_IN while_IN grazing_VBG they_PRP huddle_VBP together_RB so_RB as_IN to_TO give_VB one_CD another_DT as_IN much_JJ protection_NN as_IN possible_JJ ._.
They_PRP scatter_VBP themselves_PRP to_TO prevent_VB the_DT attack_NN from_IN sand-flies_NNS ,_, the_DT animals_NNS keep_VBP constantly_RB walking_VBG and_CC thus_RB keeping_VBG their_PRP$ condition_NN down_RP ._.
Buffalo_NNP flies_NNS cause_VBP sores_NNS about_IN the_DT eyes_NNS ,_, dewlap_NN and_CC body_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS and_CC thus_RB cause_VB constant_JJ worry_NN to_TO them_PRP ._.
Constant_JJ biting_NN of_IN ticks_NNS makes_VBZ them_PRP irritated_JJ and_CC weak_JJ due_JJ to_TO loss_NN of_IN blood_NN ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN insecticidal_NN sprays_NNS to_TO save_VB cows_NNS from_IN the_DT attack_NN of_IN the_DT biting_NN flies_NNS is_VBZ now_RB considered_VBN one_CD of_IN the_DT effective_JJ methods_NNS in_IN all_DT progressive_JJ countries_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT fly_NN trap_NN can_MD be_VB of_IN value_NN only_RB on_IN a_DT small_JJ scale_NN as_IN in_IN a_DT dairy_NN farm_NN where_WRB cattle_NNS are_VBP quiet_JJ and_CC can_MD easily_RB be_VB trained_VBN to_TO go_VB through_IN ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, fly_VBP traps_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB of_IN any_DT use_NN in_IN ridding_VBG the_DT animals_NNS of_IN parasites_NNS like_IN lice_NN ,_, ticks_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
The_DT factors_NNS which_WDT determine_VBP the_DT production_NN of_IN milk_NN are_VBP so_RB numerous_JJ that_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN controlled_JJ observations_NNS are_VBP considered_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO find_VB out_RP an_DT exact_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT invasion_NN of_IN ectoparasites_NNS and_CC the_DT production_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
Various_JJ opinions_NNS have_VBP already_RB been_VBN expressed_VBN on_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN ectoparasites_NNS on_IN milk_NN production_NN and_CC on_IN the_DT fattening_NN of_IN cattle_NNS ._.
Freeborn_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1925_CD ]_NN appear_VB to_TO be_VB the_DT first_JJ whose_WP$ attention_NN was_VBD drawn_VBN to_TO this_DT problem_NN and_CC they_PRP conducted_VBD a_DT large_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS on_IN scientific_JJ lines_NNS to_TO evaluate_VB varying_VBG popular_JJ belief_NN about_IN it_PRP ._.
From_IN their_PRP$ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS it_PRP was_VBD shown_VBN that_IN 9.26_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT loss_NN in_IN milk_NN flow_NN was_VBD caused_VBN by_IN stable_JJ flies_NNS (_( Stomoxys_NNP calcitrans_NNS )_) ,_, 3.33_CD per_IN cent_NN by_IN house_NN flies_NNS (_( Musca_NNP domestica_NN )_) ,_, 1.4_CD per_IN cent_NN by_IN horn_JJ flies_NNS (_( Siphona_NNP irritans_NNS )_) and_CC 4.11_CD per_IN cent_NN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN certain_JJ repellent_NN sprays_NNS ._.
Later_RB on_IN Bishopp_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP recorded_VBD that_IN the_DT farmers_NNS estimated_VBD 40_CD to_TO 60_CD per_IN cent_NN reduction_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN as_IN due_JJ to_TO stable_JJ fly_JJ invasion_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB quite_RB clear_JJ from_IN his_PRP$ report_NN if_IN this_DT estimate_NN was_VBD based_VBN on_IN scientific_JJ data_NNS ._.
Sen_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NNP carried_VBD out_RP experiments_NNS on_IN five_CD Sahiwal_NNP cows_NNS and_CC concluded_VBD that_IN an_DT appreciable_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT yield_NN of_IN milk_NN could_MD be_VB effected_VBN by_IN controlling_VBG Lyperosia_NNP exigua_NN and_CC Musta_NNP crassirostris_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
Belschner_NNP [_JJ 1945_CD ]_NN recorded_VBD a_DT drop_NN of_IN 15_CD to_TO 50_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN and_CC from_IN a_DT few_JJ months_NNS to_TO a_DT few_JJ years_NNS delay_VBP in_IN fattening_NN of_IN cattle_NNS due_JJ to_TO an_DT attack_NN of_IN buffalo_NN flies_NNS ,_, Lyperosia_NNP exigua_VBZ alone_RB ,_, though_IN he_PRP felt_VBD that_IN the_DT statement_NN needed_VBN confirmation_NN by_IN careful_JJ planned_JJ experiments_NNS ._.
Later_RB on_IN ,_, Bruce_NNP and_CC Decker_NNP 51_CD 10_CD 52_CD REDUCTION_NN IN_NNP MILK_NNP YIELD_NNP IN_NNP INDIAN_NNP DAIRY_NNP CATTLE_NNP [_NNP VOL_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, PART_NNP I_PRP [_VBP 1947_CD ]_NN in_IN their_PRP$ well_NN planned_VBN experiments_NNS showed_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT high_JJ degree_NN of_IN inverse_JJ correlation_NN between_IN changes_NNS in_IN milk_NN production_NN and_CC fly_JJ abundance_NN ._.
Thus_RB there_EX is_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN that_IN fly_NN worry_NN does_VBZ result_VB in_IN a_DT drop_NN in_IN milk_NN production_NN and_CC some_DT delay_NN in_IN fattening_NN ._.
Considering_VBG the_DT seriousness_NN of_IN shortage_NN in_IN milk_NN production_NN in_IN India_NNP and_CC the_DT very_RB limited_JJ number_NN of_IN experiments_NNS conducted_VBN on_IN the_DT subject_NN ,_, this_DT problem_NN was_VBD taken_VBN up_RP by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO finally_RB assess_VB the_DT amount_NN of_IN loss_NN in_IN milk_NN production_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN due_JJ to_TO arthropod_VB invasion_NN and_CC to_TO find_VB out_RP a_DT suitable_JJ control_NN measure_NN to_TO combat_VB the_DT arthropods_NNS at_IN a_DT very_RB low_JJ cost_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS so_RB far_RB obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT present_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS are_VBP recorded_VBN below_IN ._.
Further_JJ work_NN on_IN the_DT subject_NN is_VBZ in_IN progress_NN ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_CC METHODS_NNP The_DT insecticidal_NN sprays_NNS used_VBN are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: A_DT High_NNP speed_NN Diesel_NNP oil_NN ..._: ..._: 92_CD parts_NNS Pyrocide_RB 20_CD ..._: ..._: 5_CD parts_NNS Pine_NNP oil_NN ..._: ..._: 3_CD parts_NNS B_NNP Ext_NNP ._.

The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD mostly_RB of_IN Hariana_NNP breed_NN from_IN the_DT farm_NN and_CC had_VBD nearly_RB the_DT same_JJ lactation_NN period_NN ._.
The_DT sprays_NNS were_VBD applied_VBN all_DT over_IN the_DT body_NN excepting_VBG eyes_NNS and_CC udder_NN by_IN a_DT mish_JJ sprayer_NN every_DT day_NN at_IN six_CD O'clock_NNP in_IN the_DT morning_NN ._.
The_DT parts_NNS which_WDT received_VBD more_JJR attention_NN were_VBD the_DT neck_NN and_CC the_DT wither_NN ._.
Approximately_RB 60_CD c.c_NNS ._.
of_IN the_DT mixture_NN was_VBD used_VBN per_IN animal_JJ per_IN day_NN ._.
The_DT operation_NN was_VBD continued_VBN daily_RB for_IN one_CD month_NN and_CC separate_JJ controls_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN for_IN each_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS ._.
Five_CD such_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT milk_NN records_NNS not_RB only_RB for_IN the_DT period_NN during_IN which_WDT the_DT spraying_NN operations_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP but_CC also_RB for_IN one_CD month_NN both_DT preceding_VBG and_CC following_VBG the_DT operation_NN were_VBD kept_VBN ._.
The_DT five_CD series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN during_IN the_DT different_JJ seasons_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, the_DT hot_JJ ,_, the_DT monsoon_NN ,_, the_DT post-monsoon_NN and_CC the_DT cold_JJ months_NNS ._.
January_NNP and_CC February_NNP were_VBD taken_VBN as_IN cold_JJ months_NNS ,_, April_NNP and_CC May_NNP as_IN hot_JJ months_NNS ,_, August_NNP and_CC September_NNP as_IN monsoon_NN period_NN and_CC October_NNP and_CC November_NNP as_IN post-monsoon_JJ months_NNS of_IN Izatnagar_NNP ,_, Bareilly_NNP ._.
Incidentally_RB it_PRP may_MD ._.
be_VB mentioned_VBN that_IN the_DT area_NN has_VBZ extremes_NNS of_IN climate_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN varying_VBG from_IN a_DT maximum_NN of_IN 115°_CD F._NNP in_IN hot_JJ months_NNS to_TO a_DT minimum_NN of_IN 41°_CD F._NNP in_IN cold_JJ months_NNS ._.
The_DT rainfall_NN during_IN monsoon_JJ months_NNS is_VBZ usually_RB 42.15_CD inches_NNS ._.
B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP et_VBD al_RB 53_CD The_DT ectoparasites_NNS commonly_RB recorded_VBN in_IN the_DT area_NN on_IN cattle_NNS are_VBP :_: (_( 1_CD )_) Musca_NNP (_( mostly_RB nebulo_RB Wied_NNP ._. )_)

Nos_NNP ._.

Nos_NNP ._.
1_CD to_TO 4_CD were_VBD found_VBN frequently_RB attacking_VBG the_DT animals_NNS ._.

In_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP to_TO V_VB the_DT milk_NN yield_NN per_IN cow_NN per_IN month_NN preceding_VBG the_DT application_NN of_IN spray_NN was_VBD taken_VBN as_IN the_DT base_NN and_CC in_IN Tables_NNP VI_NNP to_TO IX_VB the_DT figures_NNS for_IN the_DT period_NN when_WRB the_DT spraying_NN was_VBD done_VBN was_VBD taken_VBN as_IN the_DT base_NN ._.
Over_IN these_DT bases_NNS the_DT percentage_NN of_IN milk_NN yield_NN was_VBD calculated_VBN and_CC was_VBD compared_VBN with_IN the_DT controls_NNS to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT apparent_JJ increase_NN or_CC decrease_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN ._.
Experiment_JJ 1_CD Twenty_NNP animals_NNS used_VBD for_IN this_DT experiment_NN were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN four_CD groups_NNS ,_, three_CD groups_NNS receiving_VBG one_CD of_IN the_DT sprays_NNS A_NNP ,_, B_NNP and_CC C_NNP and_CC Group_NNP E_NNP served_VBD as_IN control_NN ._.

SUMMARY_NNP Five_NNP series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN in_IN different_JJ months_NNS of_IN 1948-49_JJ on_IN 95_CD dairy_NN cows_NNS with_IN four_CD insecticidal_NN sprays_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO ascertain_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN ecto-_JJ parasite_NNS control_NN on_IN milk_NN yield_NN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS of_IN each_DT series_NN were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN four_CD groups_NNS and_CC each_DT group_NN was_VBD treated_VBN with_IN a_DT different_JJ insecticidal_JJ mixture_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN one_CD month_NN ._.
About_IN 60_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT mixture_NN was_VBD sprayed_VBN daily_RB on_IN each_DT animal_NN and_CC the_DT cost_NN of_IN this_DT quantity_NN was_VBD calculated_VBN to_TO be_VB slightly_RB less_JJR than_IN an_DT anna_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN record_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN for_IN the_DT period_NN during_IN which_WDT the_DT spraying_NN operation_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP and_CC for_IN one_CD month_NN both_DT preceding_VBG and_CC following_VBG the_DT opera-_JJ tion_NN ._.
Equal_JJ number_NN of_IN control_NN animals_NNS were_VBD also_RB kept_VBN for_IN each_DT series_NN of_IN experiment_NN ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT sprays_NNS not_RB only_RB reduced_VBD the_DT ectoparasites_NNS but_CC was_VBD also_RB found_VBN to_TO result_VB in_IN an_DT appreciable_JJ increase_NN in_IN yield_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT four_CD different_JJ sprays_NNS ,_, A_NNP ,_, B_NNP ,_, C_NNP and_CC D_NNP the_DT spray_NN D_NNP which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT mixture_NN of_IN pyrethrum_NN and_CC DDT_NNP was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR effective_JJ and_CC has_VBZ given_VBN consistently_RB good_JJ results_NNS ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ insecticides_NNS was_VBD studied_VBN in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT various_JJ seasons_NNS also_RB ._.
