CLIMATE_NN AND_CC ANIMAL_NNP HEALTH_NNP I.-SEASONAL_NNP VARIATIONS_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP PULSE_NNP RATE_NNP ,_, RESPIRA-_NNP TION_NNP RATE_NNP ,_, BODY_NNP TEMPERATURE_NNP ,_, BODY_NNP WEIGHT_NNP AND_NNP HAEMOGLOBIN_NNP IN_NNP NORMAL_NNP INDIAN_NNP CATTLE_NNP By_IN D._NNP N._NNP MULLICK_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP D._NNP KEHAR_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 7_CD June_NNP 1950_CD )_) (_( With_IN one_CD text_NN figure_NN )_) PHILLIPS_NNP [_NN 1950_CD ]_NN pointed_VBD out_RP that_IN livestock_NN improvement_NN work_NN is_VBZ fundamental_JJ to_TO the_DT improvement_NN of_IN agriculture_NN in_IN any_DT country_NN ,_, both_DT to_TO ensure_VB proper_JJ balance_NN in_IN the_DT diets_NNS of_IN the_DT people_NNS and_CC to_TO ensure_VB adequate_JJ humus_NN for_IN the_DT soil_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO obtain_VB animals_NNS which_WDT will_MD give_VB optimum_JJ returns_NNS of_IN milk_NN ,_, eggs_NNS ,_, meat_NN and_CC wool_NN or_CC work_NN under_IN different_JJ climatic_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO concentrate_VB not_RB only_RB on_IN the_DT inheritance_NN of_IN high_JJ rates_NNS of_IN production_NN but_CC also_RB the_DT ability_NN to_TO maintain_VB these_DT high_JJ rates_NNS under_IN conditions_NNS prevailing_VBG in_IN different_JJ areas_NNS ._.
Rhoad_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN ,_, Brody_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN ,_, Phillips_NNP [_NNP 1948_CD ,_, 1950_CD ]_NN ,_, Lee_NNP [_NNP 1949_CD ]_NNP and_CC Mullick_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NN have_VBP also_RB stressed_VBN the_DT importance_NN of_IN climatic_JJ factors_NNS for_IN the_DT improvement_NN of_IN livestock_NN ._.
Lee_NNP and_CC Phillips_NNP [_NNP 1949_CD ]_NNP further_RBR emphasised_VBD that_IN among_IN such_JJ conditions_NNS which_WDT tend_VBP to_TO limit_VB the_DT development_NN of_IN innate_NN potentialities_NNS ,_, the_DT most_RBS important_JJ are_VBP high_JJ temperature_NN ,_, parasitic_JJ infection_NN ,_, nutritional_JJ deficiencies_NNS or_CC irregularities_NNS and_CC limited_JJ facilities_NNS for_IN management_NN ._.
Although_IN considerable_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN on_IN the_DT genetical_JJ and_CC nutritional_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN this_DT problem_NN ,_, the_DT studies_NNS on_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN and_CC physiological_JJ reaction_NN have_VBP been_VBN few_JJ and_CC uncorrelated_JJ ._.
A_DT systematic_JJ investigation_NN was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, started_VBD to_TO study_VB the_DT health_NN and_CC general_JJ condition_NN of_IN animals_NNS as_IN affected_VBN by_IN environmental_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, air_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN and_CC moisture_NN and_CC to_TO find_VB out_RP a_DT suitable_JJ physiological_JJ index_NN for_IN heat_NN tolerance_NN which_WDT would_MD be_VB of_IN help_NN in_IN distributing_VBG animals_NNS in_IN different_JJ regions_NNS of_IN the_DT Indian_NNP Union_NNP according_VBG to_TO environmental_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Six_NNP adult_NN steers_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN for_IN these_DT studies_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN the_DT same_JJ maintenance_NN ration_NN for_IN the_DT whole_JJ period_NN of_IN observation_NN ._.
Pulse_NNP rate_NN was_VBD counted_VBN from_IN the_DT coccygeal_NN artery_NN and_CC respiration_NN rate_NN from_IN the_DT flank_NN movements_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN after_IN recording_VBG body_NN weight_NN and_CC rectal_JJ temperature_NN ._.
Drywet_NNP bulbs_NN and_CC maximum-minimum_JJ thermometer_NN readings_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT standard_JJ thermometers_NNS between_IN 2_CD to_TO 3_CD p.m._NN on_IN three_CD consecutive_JJ days_NNS in_IN each_DT month_NN ._.
Blood_NNP hæmoglobin_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN the_DT acid_NN hematin_NN method_NN of_IN Newcomer_NNP [_NNP 1922_CD ]_NNP ,_, by_IN ear_JJ vein_JJ puncture_NN ._.
61_CD 12_CD TABLE_NN I_PRP Observation_VBP on_IN pulse_NN rate_NN ,_, respiration_NN rate_NN ,_, body_NN temperature_NN ,_, body_NN weight_NN and_CC haemoglobin_NN of_IN the_DT steers_NNS Months_NNP Air_NNP temperature_NN °F_NN ._.
Relative_JJ humidity_NN per_IN cent_NN Pulse_NNP rate_NN (_( 2_CD )_) per_IN minute_NN Respiration_NNP (_( 2_CD )_) rate_NN per_IN minute_NN Body_NNP (_( 2_CD )_) temperature_NN March_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP N._NNP MULLICK_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP D._NNP KEHAR_NNP 63_CD TABLE_NNP III_NNP Partial_NNP correlations_NNS of_IN different_JJ physiological_JJ reactions_NNS Variables_NNP RH_NNP held_VBD constant_JJ Variables_NNS AT_NNP held_VBD constant_JJ AT×P_NNP 0.312_CD RHXP_NNP 64_CD CLIMATE_NNP AND_NNP ANIMAL_NNP HEALTH_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, Pulse_NNP ._.
The_DT same_JJ table_NN shows_NNS that_IN the_DT maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ pulse_JJ rates_NNS were_VBD 59_CD in_IN June_NNP and_CC 45_CD in_IN July_NNP ,_, with_IN an_DT annual_JJ average_NN of_IN 52_CD beats_NNS per_IN minute_NN ._.
``_`` With_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ,_, the_DT pulse_NN rate_NN declined_VBN by_IN 15_CD and_CC it_PRP took_VBD some_DT time_NN for_IN the_DT animals_NNS to_TO get_VB used_VBN to_TO the_DT change_NN in_IN weather_NN when_WRB the_DT pulse_NN rate_NN gradually_RB returned_VBN to_TO normal_JJ ._.
The_DT variations_NNS in_IN the_DT rate_NN between_IN months_NNS and_CC animals_NNS were_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ according_VBG to_TO analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN (_( Table_NNP II_NNP )_) ._.
Using_VBG partial_JJ correlation_NN coefficient_NN whereby_NN ,_, the_DT effect_NN of_IN one_CD variable_NN could_MD be_VB held_VBN constant_JJ ,_, the_DT correlation_NN between_IN air_NN temperature_NN and_CC pulse_JJ rate_NN became_VBD not_RB significant_JJ whereas_NNS when_WRB the_DT air_NN temperature_NN was_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ ,_, the_DT relationship_NN between_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN and_CC pulse_JJ rate_NN was_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ with_IN a_DT reverse_NN order_NN (_( Table_NNP III_NNP )_) ._.
A_DT comparison_NN of_IN the_DT multiple_JJ regression_NN co-efficient_NN in_IN the_DT regression_NN equation_NN for_IN the_DT pulse_JJ rate_NN in_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP ,_, appears_VBZ to_TO suggest_VB that_IN one_CD degree_NN rise_NN in_IN air_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN is_VBZ about_IN three_CD times_NNS as_RB important_JJ as_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN decrease_NN in_IN relative_JJ humi-_JJ dity_NN so_RB far_RB as_IN their_PRP$ influence_NN on_IN pulse_NN rate_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ._.
Respiration_NNP Table_NNP I_PRP shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ respiration_NN rates_NNS were_VBD 35_CD in_IN June_NNP and_CC 10_CD in_IN February_NNP ,_, with_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 19.6_CD per_IN minute_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT monsoon_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT decline_NN in_IN rate_NN from_IN 35_CD to_TO 10_CD per_IN minute_NN and_CC it_PRP remained_VBD practically_RB the_DT same_JJ throughout_IN this_DT period_NN ._.
The_DT analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN showed_VBD that_IN the_DT changes_NNS due_JJ to_TO months_NNS and_CC between_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ ._.
The_DT partial_JJ correlation_NN coefficient_NN showed_VBD that_IN both_DT the_DT values_NNS due_JJ to_TO air_VB tem-_JJ perature_NN and_CC relative_JJ humidity_NN were_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ and_CC the_DT latter_NN had_VBD an_DT opposite_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT respiration_NN rate_NN ._.
An_DT examination_NN of_IN the_DT regression_NN coefficient_NN shows_VBZ that_IN every_DT degree_NN increase_NN in_IN air_NN temperature_NN was_VBD responsible_JJ for_IN 8_CD times_NNS as_RB much_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN re-_JJ spiration_NN as_IN was_VBD caused_VBN by_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN increase_NN in_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN ._.
Body_NN temperature_VB The_DT maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ body_NN temperatures_NNS were_VBD 101.6°_CD F._NNP in_IN May_NNP and_CC 100.3°_CD F._NNP in_IN February_NNP with_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 101.0°_CD F._NNP There_EX was_VBD no_DT variation_NN between_IN the_DT months_NNS but_CC within_IN the_DT animals_NNS the_DT changes_NNS were_VBD significant_JJ by_IN the_DT above_JJ method_NN ._.
The_DT value_NN between_IN air_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_NN was_VBD significant_JJ when_WRB humidity_NN was_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ but_CC when_WRB air_NN temperature_NN was_VBD kept_VBN constant_JJ it_PRP was_VBD not_RB significant_JJ though_IN it_PRP had_VBD an_DT opposite_JJ effect_NN (_( Table_NNP II_NNP )_) ._.
Table_JJ III_NNP shows_VBZ that_IN each_DT degree_NN rise_NN in_IN air_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ about_IN four_CD times_NNS as_RB efficient_JJ as_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN decrease_NN in_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN in_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN body_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN ._.
Humidity_NN seems_VBZ to_TO lower_VB the_DT body_NN temperature_NN ._.
Body_NN weight_VBD The_DT maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ body_NN weights_NNS (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) were_VBD 402_CD in_IN April_NNP and_CC 359_CD in_IN July_NNP with_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 380_CD pounds_NNS ._.
There_EX were_VBD significant_JJ variations_NNS both_DT between_IN the_DT months_NNS and_CC the_DT animals_NNS ._.
March_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP N._NNP MULLICK_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP D._NNP KEHAR_NNP 65_CD The_DT correlation_NN coefficients_NNS showed_VBD that_IN a_DT significant_JJ relation_NN exists_VBZ between_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN and_CC live_JJ weight_NN ._.
The_DT same_JJ was_VBD true_JJ in_IN the_DT multiple_JJ regression_NN equation_NN (_( Table_NNP IV_NNP )_) where_WRB humidity_NN was_VBD the_DT dominant_JJ factor_NN for_IN reducing_VBG the_DT body_NN weight_NN ._.
Haemoglobin_NNP The_DT maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ values_NNS were_VBD 12.0_CD in_IN February_NNP and_CC 8.4_CD in_IN August_NNP with_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 10.0_CD gm_NN ._.
hæmoglobin_NN per_IN 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.
The_DT variations_NNS due_JJ to_TO months_NNS and_CC animals_NNS were_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ ._.
The_DT correlation_NN between_IN air_NN temperature_NN and_CC hæmoglobin_NN was_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ and_CC both_DT the_DT temperature_NN and_CC the_DT moisture_NN exercised_VBD an_DT influence_NN in_IN lowering_VBG the_DT values_NNS ._.
The_DT same_JJ was_VBD true_JJ also_RB in_IN multiple_JJ regression_NN equation_NN but_CC the_DT air_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN had_VBD more_JJR influence_NN than_IN moisture_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT above_JJ results_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN air_NN temperature_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB a_DT major_JJ factor_NN for_IN influencing_VBG variations_NNS in_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN ,_, respiration_NN rate_NN ,_, body_NN temperature_NN ,_, body_NN weight_NN and_CC hæmoglobin_NN content_NN in_IN animals_NNS (_( Tables_NNP III_NNP and_CC IV_NNP )_) ._.
From_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN below_IN 80_CD per_IN cent_NN plays_VBZ a_DT minor_JJ role_NN in_IN influencing_VBG variations_NNS in_IN the_DT physiological_JJ reactions_NNS ._.
These_DT observations_NNS are_VBP in_IN agreement_NN with_IN those_DT of_IN Rhoad_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP ,_, Regan_NNP and_CC Gaalaas_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP ,_, Seath_NNP and_CC Miller_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ,_, Richardson_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP ,_, and_CC Reik_NNP and_CC Lee_NNP [_NNP 1948_CD ]_NNP ._.
An_DT examination_NN of_IN Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD reveals_NNS that_WDT changes_NNS in_IN the_DT air_NN temperature_NN and_CC relative_JJ humidity_NN were_VBD closely_RB related_VBN to_TO variations_NNS in_IN the_DT constituents_NNS recorded_VBN ._.
The_DT trends_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN a_DT clear_JJ correlation_NN exists_NNS between_IN air_NN temperature_NN and_CC the_DT physiological_JJ reactions_NNS ._.
Pulse_NNP rate_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_NN changes_VBZ show_VBP that_IN only_RB a_DT small_JJ relationship_NN existed_VBN with_IN air_NN temperature_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ noted_VBN that_IN the_DT most_RBS variable_JJ physiological_JJ reaction_NN with_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT air_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ the_DT respiration_NN rate_NN ._.
In_IN comparatively_RB less_RBR sweating_JJ animals_NNS ,_, like_IN cattle_NNS ,_, one_CD of_IN the_DT physical_JJ mechanisms_NN is_VBZ to_TO compensate_VB for_IN their_PRP$ inability_NN to_TO sweat_VB by_IN the_DT acceleration_NN of_IN the_DT respiration_NN rate_NN ._.
Thus_RB this_DT rate_NN is_VBZ first_RB affected_VBN due_JJ to_TO the_DT changes_NNS in_IN the_DT environmental_JJ conditions_NNS long_RB before_IN the_DT changes_NNS in_IN other_JJ physiological_JJ mechanisms_NNS occur_VBP ._.
The_DT present_JJ investigation_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT respiratory_NN rate_NN reflects_VBZ even_RB the_DT minute_NN changes_NNS in_IN the_DT air_NN temperature_NN ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_DT respiration_NN rate_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS sensitive_JJ index_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN 's_POS feeling_NN of_IN discomfort_NN ._.
In_IN an_DT attempt_NN to_TO express_VB the_DT rather_RB complex_JJ physiological_JJ value_NN in_IN a_DT single_JJ figure_NN ,_, Rhoad_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP has_VBZ devised_VBN a_DT formula_NN for_IN calculating_VBG heat_NN tolerance_NN in_IN cattle_NNS ._.
This_DT formula_NN better_RB known_VBN as_IN 'Iberia_NNS formula_NN '_'' has_VBZ been_VBN widely_RB used_VBN for_IN assaying_VBG the_DT heat_NN tolerance_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN other_JJ countries_NNS ._.
After_IN critical_JJ examination_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN that_IN there_EX are_VBP some_DT limitations_NNS in_IN applying_VBG it_PRP to_TO the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS ._.
The_DT atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN in_IN the_DT shed_JJ (_( 85-95°_JJ F._NNP or_CC higher_JJR )_) may_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB worked_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT adaptability_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS under_IN existing_VBG conditions_NNS ._.
This_DT can_MD be_VB seen_VBN by_IN comparing_VBG the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT studies_NNS undertaken_VBN by_IN Seath_NNP and_CC Miller_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP and_CC the_DT present_JJ authors_NNS ,_, as_IN both_DT have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN under_IN 13_CD CLIMATE_NN AND_NNP ANIMAL_NNP HEALTH_NNP [_NNP VOL_NNP XXII_NNP ,_, PART_NNP I_PRP [_VBP NLS_JJ note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_NNP FIG_NNP ._.

It_PRP appeared_VBD that_IN a_DT relative_JJ humidity_NN above_IN 80_CD per_IN cent_NN had_VBD some_DT influence_NN in_IN causing_VBG the_DT variations_NNS of_IN the_DT reactions_NNS ._.

39_CD ,_, 423-434_CD A_NNP SERIES_NNP of_IN experiments_NNS with_IN oral_JJ feeding_NN of_IN Gammexane_NNP D._NNP 929_CD showed_VBD that_IN dose_NN of_IN 0.5_CD gm./kgm_NN ._.
on_IN two_CD successive_JJ days_NNS proved_VBD rapidly_RB toxic_JJ to_TO bovines_NNS ._.
The_DT main_JJ toxic_NN symptom_NN exhibited_VBN by_IN the_DT animal_NN were_VBD ,_, hypersensitivity_NN of_IN the_DT skin_NN muscular_JJ tremors_NNS ,_, general_JJ paralysis_NN followed_VBN by_IN death_NN ._.
A_DT dose_NN of_IN 0.25_CD gm./kgm_NN ._.
on_IN two_CD successive_JJ days_NNS followed_VBN by_IN 0.125_CD gm./kgm_NNS ._.
on_IN 3rd_CD and_CC 4th_CD days_NNS was_VBD well_RB tolerated_VBN and_CC killed_VBN feeding_NN Glossina_NNP palpalis_NN and_CC ticks_NNS ._.
This_DT dosage_NN protected_VBD the_DT calves_NNS against_IN re-infestation_NN of_IN ticks_NNS for_IN 41_CD days_NNS ._.
Two_CD calves_NNS given_VBN four_CD weekly_JJ doses_NNS of_IN 0.25_CD gm./kgm_NN ._.
and_CC 0.125_CD gm./kgm_NN ._.
were_VBD protected_VBN against_IN re-infestation_NN of_IN ticks_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 20_CD days_NNS and_CC 12_CD days_NNS respectively_RB where_WRB as_IN weekly_JJ doses_NNS of_IN 0.1_CD gm./kgm_NN ._.
have_VB failed_VBN to_TO produce_VB any_DT ticki-_JJ cidal_NN effect_NN ._.
A_DT D_NNP D_NNP T_NNP powder_NN (_( containing_VBG 83_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT para-para_JJ Isomer_NNP )_) ,_, when_WRB fed_VBN to_TO calves_NNS in_IN doses_NNS of_IN 0.5_CD gm./kgm_NN ._.
and_CC 0.25_CD gm./kgm_NN ._.

31_CD ,_, 523-532_CD THE_NNP authors_NNS '_POS investigations_NNS were_VBD to_TO determine_VB the_DT effects_NNS of_IN intermittent_JJ colos-_JJ trum_NN feeding_NN for_IN the_DT duration_NN of_IN milk_NN feeding_VBG period_NN of_IN six_CD months_NNS ._.
The_DT term_NN Colostrum_NNP is_VBZ used_VBN for_IN the_DT first_JJ three_CD days_NNS secretion_VBP immediately_RB following_VBG parturi-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT high_JJ nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN colostrum_NN for_IN the_DT new-born_JJ calf_NN is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN ._.
The_DT vitamin_NN A_NNP content_NN of_IN colostrum_NN is_VBZ many_JJ times_NNS that_IN of_IN normal_JJ milk_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB high_JJ in_IN riboflavin_NN which_WDT is_VBZ also_RB essential_JJ for_IN the_DT calf_NN ._.
Yet_RB with_IN all_PDT these_DT qualities_NNS and_CC knowledge_VB the_DT surplus_NN colostrum_NN is_VBZ not_RB used_VBN for_IN calf_NN raising_VBG in_IN many_JJ dairies_NNS ._.
Seventy-six_JJ calves_NNS born_VBN in_IN the_DT Ohio_NNP State_NNP University_NNP dairy_NN herd_NN during_IN one_CD year_NN period_NN from_IN five_CD different_JJ major_JJ breeds_NNS were_VBD used_VBN for_IN observations_NNS ._.
The_DT calves_NNS of_IN either_DT sex_NN were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN two_CD comparable_JJ groupsABSTRACTS_NNS 71_CD noticed_VBN directly_RB due_JJ to_TO extra_VB colostrum_NN feeding_NN ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN colostrum_NN received_VBN by_IN each_DT calf_NN ,_, the_DT blood_NN plasma_NN vitamin_VBD A_NNP and_CC carotene_JJ level_NN and_CC the_DT gain_NN in_IN body_NN weight_NN are_VBP all_DT tabulated_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN calves_VBZ receiving_VBG more_JJR than_IN 200_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN colostrum_NN maintained_VBD higher_JJR levels_NNS of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP in_IN the_DT blood_NN plasma_NN and_CC made_VBN greater_JJR cumulative_JJ weight_NN gains_NNS than_IN those_DT received_VBN less_JJR than_IN 200_CD lb_NN ._.
During_IN this_DT experiment_NN over_IN 4000_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN surplus_NN colostrum_NN was_VBD used_VBN in_IN feeding_VBG the_DT calves_NNS in_IN group_NN I_PRP and_CC thus_RB same_JJ quantity_NN of_IN marketable_JJ milk_NN was_VBD saved_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ estimated_VBN that_IN even_RB if_IN half_PDT the_DT surplus_JJ colostrum_NN from_IN the_DT 26_CD million_CD dairy_NN cows_NNS in_IN the_DT U.S.A._NNP is_VBZ utilized_VBN in_IN calf_NN raising_VBG it_PRP will_MD save_VB 650_CD million_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN marketable_JJ milk_NN ._.

Breeding_VBG chickens_NNS for_IN resistance_NN to_TO caecal_JJ coccidiosis_NN ._.
PALAFOX_NNP ,_, A._NNP L._NNP ,_, ALICATA_NNP ,_, J._NNP E._NNP and_CC KAXTMAN_NNP ,_, L._NNP (_( 1949_CD )_) ._.

5_CD ,_, 2_CD ,_, 84-87_CD THE_NNP authors_NNS started_VBD breeding_VBG work_NN with_IN the_DT foundation_NN stocks_NNS comprising_VBG White_NNP Leghorn_NNP hens_VBZ having_VBG the_DT highest_JJS rate_NN of_IN survival_NN in_IN progeny_NN against_IN caecal_JJ Coccidiosis_NNP and_CC a_DT susceptible_JJ line_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ breed_NN having_VBG the_DT lowest_JJS rate_NN of_IN survival_NN of_IN progeny_NN ._.
In_IN breeding_NN of_IN these_DT two_CD lines_NNS revealed_VBD that_IN the_DT dams_NNS selected_VBN for_IN high_JJ resistance_NN to_TO Caecal_NNP Coccidiosis_NNP transmitted_VBD high_JJ resistance_NN to_TO their_PRP$ F1_NNP progeny_NN ._.
Similarly_RB dams_NNS selected_VBD for_IN low_JJ resistance_NN transmitted_VBD only_RB low_JJ resis-_JJ tance_NN to_TO their_PRP$ progeny_NN ._.
Resistance_NN or_CC susceptibility_NN in_IN the_DT F1_NNP progeny_NN was_VBD tested_VBN experimentally_RB at_IN four_CD weeks_NNS of_IN age_NN by_IN inoculating_VBG with_IN approximately_RB 120,000_CD sporulated_JJ oocysts_NNS of_IN Eimerla_NNP tenella_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT resistant_JJ line_NN the_DT individual_JJ variation_NN of_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN resistance_NN in_IN the_DT progeny_NN of_IN resistant_JJ dams_NNS mated_VBD to_TO the_DT same_JJ sire_NN was_VBD considerable_JJ indeed_RB ._.
In_IN another_DT attempt_NN reciprocal_JJ matings_NNS between_IN the_DT resistant_NN and_CC susceptible_JJ lines_NNS showed_VBD that_IN neither_DT line_NN was_VBD homozygous_JJ for_IN the_DT character_NN ._.
Further_JJ selection_NN amongst_NN resitant_NN birds_NNS was_VBD therefore_RB indicated_JJ to_TO obtain_VB homozygosity_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT F2_NNP progeny_NN of_IN the_DT resistant_JJ line_NN increased_VBD resistance_NN was_VBD demonstrated_VBN whereas_NNS in_IN the_DT unselected_JJ control_NN lot_NN it_PRP was_VBD intermediate_JJ between_IN the_DT resistant_NN and_CC susceptible_JJ lines_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_DT resitance_NN to_TO Caecal_NNP Coccidiosis_NNP is_VBZ dependent_JJ ,_, at_IN least_JJS in_IN part_NN ,_, on_IN inherited_JJ multiple_JJ factors_NNS ._.
Coccidiosis_NNP amongst_NN rearing_VBG stock_NN in_IN specialised_JJ farms_NNS in_IN India_NNP is_VBZ all_DT too_RB common_JJ ._.
From_IN the_DT foregoing_NN results_NNS it_PRP seems_VBZ breeding_VBG chickens_NNS for_IN natural_JJ resistance_NN to_TO Cocci-_NNP diosis_NN is_VBZ a_DT profitable_JJ line_NN of_IN approach_NN to_TO the_DT problem_NN of_IN solving_VBG poultry_NN mortality_NN ._.

The_DT Galactopoietic_NNP effect_NN of_IN Iodinated_NNP Casein_NNP :_: Dose_NNP Response_NNP Relationships_NNP during_IN Prolonged_NNP Treatment_NNP ._.
LEECH_NNP ,_, F._NNP B_NNP ._.
(_( 1950_CD )_) ._.
J._NNP Endocrinology_NNP ,_, 7_CD ,_, 42-53_JJ FIFTYNINE_NNP cows_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN daily_RB with_IN iodinated_JJ casein_NN in_IN different_JJ dosage_NN levels_NNS of_IN 15_CD ,_, 20_CD ,_, 25_CD g._NN for_IN 28_CD weeks_NNS from_IN 3_CD months_NNS after_IN calving_VBG except_IN in_IN cows_NNS which_WDT become_VBP dry_JJ before_IN time_NN ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN milk_JJ yield_NN lasted_VBD for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 8_CD weeks_NNS after_IN which_WDT the_DT response_NN to_TO the_DT two_CD lower_JJR doses_NNS quickly_RB disappeared_VBD ._.
The_DT response_NN of_IN the_DT group_NN receiving_VBG 25_CD g._NN of_IN iodinated_JJ casein_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN at_IN a_DT 72_CD ABSTBACTS_NNP reduced_VBD level_NN throughout_IN ._.
The_DT treatment_NN did_VBD not_RB effect_NN the_DT proportions_NNS of_IN butter_NN fat_NN and_CC non-fatty_JJ solids_NNS in_IN the_DT milk_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD some_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT heart_NN rate_NN but_CC in_IN general_JJ the_DT cows_NNS showed_VBD no_DT other_JJ symptoms_NNS indicative_JJ of_IN Hyper_NNP thyroidism_NN ._.
Loss_NNP in_IN body_NN weight_NN was_VBD directly_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT dose_NN administered_VBN ._.
This_DT loss_NN in_IN weight_NN gradually_RB disappeared_VBD ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT significant_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT health_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS or_CC on_IN their_PRP$ reproductive_JJ activity_NN ._.
Long_NNP continued_VBD use_NN of_IN thyroactive_JJ materials_NNS is_VBZ not_RB recommended_VBN ._.

10_CD ,_, 22-41_CD THE_NNP present_JJ report_NN on_IN the_DT comparative_JJ nutrition_NN of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS was_VBD under-_JJ taken_VBN by_IN the_DT authors_NNS in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT discrepancies_NNS ,_, pointed_VBD out_RP by_IN Maynard_NNP in_IN the_DT feeding_NN standards_NNS for_IN livestock_NN recommended_VBN by_IN the_DT Committee_NNP on_IN the_DT Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP of_IN the_DT National_NNP Research_NNP Council_NNP ,_, in_IN 1942_CD ._.
The_DT relevant_JJ literature_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT concepts_NNS contributing_VBG to_TO the_DT procedure_NN adopted_VBN by_IN the_DT authors_NNS ,_, have_VBP been_VBN reviewed_VBN ._.
The_DT concept_NN of_IN physiologically_RB equivalent_JJ age_NN has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN to_TO compare_VB the_DT recommended_JJ nutritional_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN different_JJ species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS that_WDT fit_VBP with_IN the_DT physiologically_RB equivalent_JJ age_NN curve_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ feed_NN capacities_NNS of_IN the_DT different_JJ species_NNS are_VBP in_IN general_JJ ,_, proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT fractional_JJ power_NN of_IN bodyweight_NN as_IN the_DT maintenance_NN requirement_NN and_CC the_DT basal_NN heat_NN production_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT fundamental_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT efficiency_NN of_IN feed_NN utilization_NN for_IN growth_NN ,_, that_WDT depends_VBZ on_IN body_NN size_NN as_IN such_JJ ._.
There_EX are_VBP no_DT differences_NNS in_IN the_DT recommended_JJ dietary_JJ allowances_NNS for_IN protein_NN ,_, calcium_NN ,_, phosphorus_NN for_IN different_JJ species_NNS but_CC the_DT ratio_NN of_IN these_DT nutrients_NNS to_TO energy_NN intake_NN changes_NNS with_IN advancing_VBG age_NN ._.
The_DT recommended_JJ requirements_NNS for_IN thiamine_NN ,_, riboflavin_NN ,_, niacin_NN ,_, and_CC pantothenic_JJ acid_NN ,_, indicated_VBD a_DT constant_JJ direct_JJ relation_NN with_IN intake_NN of_IN energy_NN irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ stages_NNS of_IN development_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ consistent_JJ with_IN their_PRP$ function_NN in_IN enzyme_JJ systems_NNS associated_VBN directly_RB or_CC indirectly_RB with_IN the_DT metabolic_JJ rate_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN the_DT vitamin_NN requirements_NNS of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP and_CC carotene_NN are_VBP directly_RB propor-_JJ tional_NN to_TO the_DT bodyweight_NN in_IN mammals_NNS ._.
This_DT applies_VBZ to_TO poultry_VB ,_, as_IN well_RB ,_, but_CC the_DT requirement_NN is_VBZ somewhat_RB higher_JJR than_IN mammals_NNS ._.
The_DT existing_VBG knowledge_NN about_IN the_DT nutritional_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN vitamin_NN D_NNP ,_, would_MD point_VB out_RP to_TO a_DT lack_NN of_IN any_DT relation_NN either_RB with_IN the_DT body_NN weight_VBD or_CC feed_JJ consumption_NN ._.
The_DT generalized_VBN recommended_VBD nutritional_JJ requirements_NNS for_IN farm_NN animals_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS in_IN relation_NN to_TO per_VB cent_NN mature_NN weight_NN ,_, is_VBZ presented_VBN ,_, which_WDT with_IN the_DT existing_VBG knowledge_NN or_CC the_DT results_NNS of_IN future_JJ research_NN is_VBZ capable_JJ of_IN being_VBG translated_VBN into_IN suitable_JJ feeding_NN standards_NNS for_IN practical_JJ use_NN ._.
The_DT authors_NNS suggested_VBD an_DT investigation_NN into_IN the_DT feasibility_NN of_IN expressing_VBG the_DT relationship_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ nutrients_NNS with_IN the_DT metabolizable_JJ energy_NN rather_RB than_IN with_IN the_DT total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO bring_VB the_DT data_NN for_IN ruminants_NNS and_CC non-_JJ ruminants_NNS into_IN closer_NN accord_NN ._.
The_DT field_NN of_IN comparative_JJ nutrition_NN is_VBZ fertile_JJ and_CC there_EX is_VBZ ample_JJ scope_NN for_IN studying_VBG the_DT similarities_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP more_RBR likely_JJ to_TO be_VB more_JJR pro-_JJ nounced_NNS ,_, than_IN differences_NNS ,_, that_IN exist_VBP among_IN the_DT different_JJ species_NNS of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS ._.
[_JJ V._NNP N._NNP M._NNP ]_NNP MGIPCORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP SEASONAL_NNP VARIATIONS_NNP IN_NNP SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP ,_, AND_NNP HAEMOGLOBIN_NNP AND_NNP CELL_NNP VOLUME_NNP CONTENTS_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP BLOOD_NNP IN_NNP BULLS_NNP By_IN D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP and_CC P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 10_CD July_NNP 1951_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP IV74_NNP SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, characteristics_NNS of_IN semen_NNS should_MD be_VB uniform_JJ and_CC controlled_VBD ._.
Unless_IN sexually_RB mature_JJ animals_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ age_NN and_CC breed_NN are_VBP taken_VBN for_IN experimentation_NN and_CC are_VBP kept_VBN under_IN uniform_JJ managerial_NN and_CC dietary_JJ regime_NN during_IN the_DT entire_JJ experimental_JJ period_NN ,_, seasonal_JJ influence_NN ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, on_IN the_DT various_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN semen_NNS may_MD be_VB masked_VBN ,_, minimised_VBD or_CC exaggerated_VBD ._.
Indian_JJ bulls_NNS (_( Bos_NNP indicus_NN )_) belong_NN entirely_RB to_TO a_DT different_JJ species_NNS from_IN the_DT experi-_JJ mental_JJ animals_NNS of_IN the_DT previous_JJ workers_NNS ._.
-_: Climatic_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN this_DT country_NN also_RB are_VBP greatly_RB different_JJ from_IN those_DT in_IN places_NNS where_WRB the_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN ._.
For_IN these_DT reasons_NNS and_CC in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT contradictory_NN results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN the_DT various_JJ workers_NNS it_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN worth_JJ while_IN to_TO study_VB the_DT trend_NN of_IN seasonal_JJ influence_NN on_IN semen_NNS characteristics_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ bulls_NNS ._.
Seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN blood_NN of_IN Indian_JJ dairy_NN cattle_NNS have_VBP been_VBN observed_VBN by_IN Pal_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1945_CD ]_NN ._.
Attempts_NNS have_VBP ,_, therefore_RB ,_, been_VBN made_VBN in_IN this_DT study_NN to_TO determine_VB the_DT relationship_NN ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, of_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT blood_NN with_IN the_DT variations_NNS in_IN the_DT semen_NNS characteristics_NNS ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_CC METHODS_NNP The_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS comprised_VBN of_IN six_CD Kumauni_NNP hill_NN bulls_NNS ._.
All_PDT the_DT bulls_NNS were_VBD of_IN four_CD years_NNS of_IN age_NN excepting_VBG one_CD (_( No_UH ._.
187_CD )_) which_WDT was_VBD seven_CD years_NNS old_JJ at_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT entire_JJ experimental_JJ period_NN the_DT bulls_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN under_IN uniform_JJ managerial_NN and_CC dietary_JJ regime_NN ._.
The_DT ration_NN supplied_VBD to_TO each_DT bull_NN consisted_VBN of_IN a_DT concentrate_JJ mixture_NN containing_VBG crushed_VBN gram_NN 30_CD parts_NNS ,_, crushed_VBD barley_RB 50_CD parts_NNS ,_, wheat_NN bran_VBD 20_CD parts_NNS and_CC common_JJ salt_NN 1_CD oz_NN ._.
Concentrate_NNP mixture_NN was_VBD fed_VBN according_VBG to_TO body-weight_NN ._.
The_DT quantity_NN given_VBN per_IN day_NN to_TO the_DT bulls_NNS was_VBD as_IN follows_VBZ :_: Bull_NNP number_NN Average_NNP body_NN weight_JJ Concentrate_NNP given_VBN .200_VBP 500_CD lb_NN ._.
4_CD 1b_CD ._.
187_CD and_CC 240_CD 450_CD lb_NN ._.
3_CD lb_NN ._.
194,195_CD and_CC 248_CD 400_CD lb_NN ._.
2_CD 1b_CD ._.
In_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT above_JJ concentrate_NN each_DT animal_JJ received_VBN 10-lb_JJ ._.
of_IN roughage_NN and_CC was_VBD allowed_VBN free_JJ grazing_NN for_IN six_CD hours_NNS a_DT day_NN ._.
The_DT bulls_NNS selected_VBN were_VBD in_IN good_JJ health_NN having_VBG good_JJ sex_NN desire_NN and_CC sex_NN ability_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT pre-experimental_JJ period_NN they_PRP were_VBD trained_VBN to_TO mount_VB an_DT anoestrous_JJ hill_NN cow_NN confined_VBN in_IN a_DT service_NN crate_NN and_CC to_TO ejaculate_VB semen_NNS in_IN the_DT artificial_JJ vagina_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO estimate_VB the_DT monthly_JJ variations_NNS in_IN semen_NNS quality_NN and_CC quantity_NN of_IN individual_JJ bulls_NNS ,_, fortnightly_RB collections_NNS of_IN two_CD successive_JJ ejaculates_NNS at_IN an_DT interval_NN June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP &_CC P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 75_CD of_IN 10_CD to_TO 15_CD minutes_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN each_DT bull_NN ._.

M=Thin_NNP milky_NN JUNE_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 77_CD RESULTS_NNP Data_NNP regarding_VBG the_DT average_JJ 'reaction-time_JJ '_'' ,_, semen_NNS and_CC blood_NN attributes_NNS of_IN the_DT bulls_NNS together_RB with_IN the_DT meteorological_JJ data_NNS of_IN each_DT month_NN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
Examination_NN of_IN the_DT data_NN reveals_NNS that_IN there_EX did_VBD not_RB exist_VB any_DT relationship_NN between_IN the_DT 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC the_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS produced_VBN by_IN the_DT bulls_NNS in_IN each_DT month_NN ._.
Average_JJ 'reaction-time_JJ '_'' in_IN 1945-46_CD was_VBD the_DT shortest_JJS in_IN February_NNP and_CC longest_JJS in_IN November_NNP ._.
There_EX was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, no_DT appreciable_JJ difference_NN between_IN these_DT months_NNS in_IN majority_NN of_IN the_DT semen_NNS characteristics_NNS ._.
In_IN 1946-47_CD the_DT 'reaction-time_JJ '_NN was_VBD the_DT lowest_JJS in_IN June_NNP and_CC highest_JJS in_IN April_NNP ._.
The_DT over-all_JJ quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS during_IN these_DT two_CD months_NNS of_IN that_DT year_NN were_VBD diametrically_RB opposite_JJ ;_: semen_NNS samples_NNS of_IN April_NNP were_VBD decidedly_RB superior_JJ to_TO June_NNP samples_NNS ._.
Colour_NN of_IN the_DT semen_NNS samples_NNS produced_VBN by_IN the_DT bulls_NNS during_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN were_VBD either_RB yellow_JJ or_CC milky_JJ white_JJ ._.
Yellow_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD the_DT characteristic_JJ feature_NN of_IN the_DT bull_NN 187_CD ._.
They_PRP were_VBD thin_JJ in_IN consistency_NN and_CC were_VBD of_IN low_JJ sperm_JJ con-_JJ centration_NN ._.
The_DT semen_NNS samples_NNS produced_VBN by_IN the_DT remaining_VBG five_CD bulls_NNS were_VBD generally_RB milky_JJ white_JJ in_IN colour_NN ._.
The_DT consistency_NN was_VBD either_CC very_RB thin_JJ giving_VBG a_DT cloudy_NN appear-_JJ ance_NN or_CC like_IN that_DT of_IN milk_NN ,_, or_CC thick_VB giving_VBG a_DT milky_NN creamy_JJ appearance_NN ._.
Creamy_NNP samples_NNS ,_, of_IN which_WDT there_EX were_VBD a_DT few_JJ ,_, contained_VBN very_RB high_JJ concentration_NN of_IN sperma-_JJ tozoa_NN ._.
Milky_NNP samples_NNS were_VBD of_IN higher_JJR sperm_NN concentration_NN than_IN cloudy_NN or_CC yellow_JJ samples_NNS ._.
In_IN working_VBG out_RP the_DT average_JJ colour_NN and_CC consistency_NN for_IN the_DT month_NN as_IN presented_VBN in_IN the_DT table_NN ,_, the_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS for_IN the_DT month_NN were_VBD only_RB considered_VBN ._.
From_IN the_DT table_NN it_PRP is_VBZ apparent_JJ that_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN of_IN thin_JJ milky_NN samples_NNS ranged_VBD from_IN 456.5_CD to_TO 591.7_CD millions_NNS per_IN c.c_NN ._.
and_CC that_DT of_IN milky_NN samples_NNS from_IN 609.1_CD to_TO 788.3_CD ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT marked_JJ monthly_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT initial_JJ motility_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN and_CC the_DT volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
The_DT latter_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, showed_VBD some_DT de-_JJ crease_NN from_IN October_NNP to_TO December_NNP during_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
No_DT marked_JJ monthly_JJ variation_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN pH_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ pH_JJ value_NN of_IN semen_NNS samples_NNS during_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN was_VBD lower_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN ._.
In_IN 1945-46_CD ,_, sperm_JJR concentration_NN and_CC haematological_JJ constituents_NNS decreased_VBN from_IN May_NNP to_TO September_NNP and_CC in_IN 1946-47_JJ from_IN July_NNP to_TO October_NNP ._.
Meteorological_NNP data_NNS of_IN these_DT periods_NNS show_VBP high_JJ air_NN temperature_NN associated_VBN with_IN high_JJ relative_JJ humi-_JJ dity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ._.
Total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN was_VBD calculated_VBN by_IN multiplying_VBG the_DT total_JJ volume_NN with_IN the_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
Inspection_NN of_IN the_DT data_NNS presented_VBN in_IN the_DT table_NN shows_VBZ that_IN in_IN this_DT characteristic_JJ there_RB existed_VBN variations_NNS from_IN month_NN to_TO month_NN ._.
These_DT variations_NNS were_VBD statistically_RB analysed_VBN ._.
The_DT ,_, implication_NN of_IN the_DT analysis_NN has_VBZ been_VBN discussed_VBN later_RB on_IN ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN ,_, percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN was_VBD minimum_JJ during_IN May_NNP to_TO July_NNP and_CC maximum_JJ during_IN October_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN it_PRP dropped_VBD down_RB to_TO minimum_VB in_IN March_NNP ,_, July_NNP and_CC September_NNP and_CC maximum_NN was_VBD reached_VBN during_IN January_NNP ._.
Average_JJ monthly_JJ variations_NNS in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_'' ,_, in_IN semen_NNS characteristics_NNS and_CC in_IN blood_NN constituents_NNS are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Plate_NNP IV_NNP ,_, and_CC that_IN of_IN air_NN temperature_NN ,_, relative_JJ 78_CD SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XX11_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN in_IN Plate_NNP V._NNP From_NNP Plate_NNP IV_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ apparent_JJ that_IN the_DT curve_NN for_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_'' is_VBZ not_RB uniform_JJ and_CC does_VBZ not_RB show_VB any_DT definite_JJ seasonal_JJ trend_NN ._.
Initial_JJ motility_NN curve_NN shows_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN to_TO follow_VB the_DT curve_NN for_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.

The_DT curve_NN for_IN pH_NN shows_NNS an_DT opposite_JJ trend_NN to-_NN that_IN of_IN sperm_JJ concentra-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT curves_NNS for_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN ,_, haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN run_VB parallel_RB to_TO one_CD another_DT and_CC show_VB definite_JJ seasonal_JJ trends_NNS ._.
From_IN Plate_NNP V_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ evident_JJ that_IN with_IN the_DT rise_NN of_IN air_NN temperature_NN ,_, relative_JJ humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD decrease_NN in_IN the_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS studied_VBD ._.
Low_NNP air_NN temperature_NN associated_VBN with_IN high_JJ humidity_NN as_IN found_VBN in_IN the_DT month_NN of_IN December_NNP of_IN both_CC the_DT years_NNS had_VBD depressing_VBG effect_NN on_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC blood_NN consti-_JJ tuents_NNS ._.
The_DT curve_NN for_IN total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN does_VBZ not_RB uniformly_RB resemble_VB the_DT curve_NN representing_VBG sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.

Volume_NN From_IN the_DT analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN of_IN total_JJ volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN there_EX was_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ variation_NN among_IN bulls_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ total_JJ output_NN of_IN semen_NNS per_IN ejaculate_NN ._.
This_DT character_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, was_VBD not_RB variable_JJ from_IN month_NN to_TO month_NN or_CC from_IN season_NN to_TO season_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ result_NN agrees_VBZ with_IN those_DT reported_VBN by_IN Phillips_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN ,_, Swanson_NNP and_CC Herman_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP ,_, Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP and_CC Anderson_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NN but_CC is_VBZ contrary_JJ to_TO those_DT obtained_VBN by_IN Erb_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN and_CC Mercier_NNP and_CC Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ._.
Total_JJ volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS is_VBZ mainly_RB dependent_JJ on_IN the_DT secretions_NNS of_IN the_DT accessory_JJ reproductive_JJ organs_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ now_RB well-known_JJ that_IN these_DT secretions_NNS are_VBP dependent_JJ upon_IN testosterone_NN liberated_VBN by_IN the_DT interstitial_JJ cells_NNS of_IN the_DT testes_NNS ._.
The_DT measure-_JJ ment_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS ,_, therefore_RB ,_, as_IN pointed_VBN out_RP by_IN Bogart_NNP and_CC Mayer_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP reflects_VBZ the_DT functional_JJ capacity_NN of_IN the_DT interstitial_JJ cells_NNS ._.
Results_NNS obtained_VBD in_IN this_DT experiment_NN show_NN that_IN there_EX was_VBD individual_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT functional_JJ capacity_NN of_IN the_DT interstitial_JJ cells_NNS of_IN the_DT testes_NNS in_IN bulls_NNS but_CC it_PRP was_VBD not_RB influenced_VBN by_IN seasons_NNS ._.
This_DT observation_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, lends_VBZ further_JJ support_NN to_TO the_DT view_NN that_IN proudction_NN of_IN testosterone_NN is_VBZ independent_JJ of_IN the_DT external_JJ factors_NNS studied_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN ._.
June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP AND_NNP P.BHATTACHARYA_NNP 87_CD pH_NN of_IN semen_NNS The_DT hydrogenion-concentration_NN has_VBZ been_VBN recognised_VBN by_IN several_JJ investigators_NNS as_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT many_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN semen_NNS for_IN evaluation_NN of_IN its_PRP$ quality_NN ._.
From_IN analysis_NN of_IN data_NNS for_IN individual_JJ bull_NN ,_, pH_NN of_IN semen_NNS did_VBD not_RB seem_VB to_TO have_VB any_DT special_JJ significance_NN except_IN that_IN it_PRP indicated_VBD in_IN a_DT general_JJ way_NN other_JJ qualities_NNS such_JJ as_IN ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN ,_, initial_JJ motility_NN and_CC total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
The_DT pH_JJ value_NN of_IN semen_NNS was_VBD usually_RB found_VBN to_TO lie_VB between_IN 6.22_CD to_TO 6.34_CD ._.
Higher_JJR pH_NN value_NN was_VBD associated_VBN with_IN low_JJ values_NNS of_IN other_JJ semen_NNS characteristics_NNS and_CC vice_NN versa_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT latter_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT pH_NN value_NN in_IN one_CD bull_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, was_VBD found_VBN not_RB to_TO lie_VB within_IN the_DT range_NN but_CC was_VBD 6.8_CD or_CC above_RB ._.
As_IN mentioned_VBN earlier_RBR this_DT was_VBD due_JJ to_TO an_DT infection_NN in_IN its_PRP$ seminal_JJ vesicles_NNS ._.
Anderson_NNP [_NN 1945_CD ,_, a_DT ]_NN also_RB observed_VBD that_IN in_IN conditions_NNS involving_VBG pathology_NN of_IN genital_JJ organs_NNS the_DT reaction_NN of_IN semen_NNS was_VBD characteristically_RB alkaline_JJ ._.
Results_NNS obtained_VBD in_IN this_DT experiment_NN on_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN season_NN on_IN pH_NNS are_VBP in_IN agree-_JJ ment_NN with_IN those_DT reported_VBN by_IN Erb_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1942_CD ]_NN ,_, but_CC not_RB with_IN those_DT obtained_VBN by_IN Swanson_NNP and_CC Herman_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP ,_, Anderson_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ,_, b_NN ]_NN and_CC Raps_NNP and_CC Cannon_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN here_RB ,_, that_IN there_EX existed_VBD a_DT highly_RB significant_JJ seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN of_IN semen_NNS in_IN individual_JJ bulls_NNS was_VBD negatively_RB correlated_VBN with_IN the_DT pH_NN of_IN semen_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD to_TO be_VB expected_VBN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_IN a_DT seasonal_JJ trend_NN in_IN pH_NN should_MD also_RB exist_VB ._.
The_DT results_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT such_JJ trend_NN ._.
This_DT might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN pH_NN was_VBD determined_VBN in_IN this_DT investiga-_JJ tion_NN with_IN B._NNP D._NNP H._NNP capillators_NNS by_IN colorimetric_JJ method_NN ._.
Admittedly_RB ,_, the_DT values_NNS obtained_VBN with_IN this_DT method_NN would_MD be_VB less_JJR accurate_JJ than_IN what_WP they_PRP would_MD have_VB been_VBN if_IN determined_VBN by_IN glass_NN electrode_NN pH_NN meter_NN ._.
But_CC it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN as_IN pH_NN is_VBZ a_DT general_JJ indication_NN of_IN semen_NNS quality_VBP it_PRP failed_VBD to_TO show_VB any_DT definite_JJ seasonal_JJ trend_NN ._.
Initial_JJ motility_NN Initial_NNP motility_NN as_IN estimated_VBN by_IN direct_JJ microscopical_JJ examination_NN is_VBZ dependent_JJ upon_IN the_DT activity_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
Variations_NNS in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN will_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, reflect_VBP on_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN initial_JJ motility_NN ._.
Analysis_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ data_NNS showed_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ variation_NN among_IN bulls_NNS and_CC between_IN different_JJ years_NNS ,_, and_CC significant_JJ variation_NN among_IN seasons_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS ,_, on_IN the_DT whole_JJ agree_NN with_IN those_DT reported_VBN by_IN Erb_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1948_CD ]_NN ,_, Sawnson_NNP and_CC Herman_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP ,_, Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP and_CC Anderson_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ,_, b_NN ]_NN but_CC differ_NN from_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Phillips_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN and_CC Mercier_NNP and_CC Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NN who_WP reported_VBD no_DT significant_JJ seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT initial_JJ motility.Sperm_JJ concentration_NN Determination_NNP of_IN this_DT characteristic_JJ is_VBZ essential_JJ in_IN order_NN to_TO appraise_VB the_DT fertiliz-_JJ ing_NN capacity_NN of_IN the_DT semen_NNS sample_NN ._.
Result_NN of_IN analysis_NN of_IN data_NNS on_IN sperm_JJ concentra-_JJ tion_NN showed_VBD that_IN it_PRP was_VBD highly_RB variable_JJ among_IN bulls_NNS and_CC among_IN seasons_NNS ._.
This_DT agrees_VBZ with_IN the_DT results_NNS reported_VBN by_IN previous_JJ workers_NNS except_IN Anderson_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP and_CC Swanson_NNP and_CC Herman_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP ._.
4A_CD 88_CD SEASONAL_NNP VARLATION_NNP IN_NNP SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP Estimation_NNP of_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN at_IN regular_JJ intervals_NNS as_IN was_VBD done_VBN in_IN this_DT experi-_JJ ment_NN ,_, provided_VBD a_DT direct_JJ indication_NN of_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN spermatogenesis_NN ._.
Spermatogenesis_NN is_VBZ controlled_VBN by_IN the_DT activity_NN of_IN the_DT follicle_NN stimulating_VBG hormone_NN of_IN the_DT anterior_JJ pituitary_JJ gland_NN ._.
For_IN full_JJ manifestation_NN of_IN its_PRP$ activity_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT secretions_NNS of_IN other_JJ endocrines_NNS are_VBP also_RB necessary_JJ ._.
Very_RB recently_RB it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN demonstrated_VBN that_IN in_IN some_DT farm_NN animals_VBZ the_DT seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN fertility_NN and_CC semen_NNS characteristics_NNS correspond_NN with_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT thyroid_JJ gland_NN and_CC that_IN this_DT seasonal_JJ effect_NN can_MD be_VB controverted_VBN by_IN artificially_RB administering_VBG thyroid_NN hormone_NN in_IN summer_NN and_CC one_CD of_IN the_DT depressant_JJ thiouracil_NN drugs_NNS in_IN winter_NN [_NN Berliner_NNP and_CC Warbritton_NNP (_( 1937_CD )_) Bogart_NNP and_CC Mayer_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_DT decrease_NN in_IN sperm_JJ con-_JJ centration_NN in_IN summer_NN and_CC autumn_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO mild_VB hypothyroidism_NN produced_VBN due_JJ to_TO the_DT prevailing_NN high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN and_CC relative_JJ humidity_NN ._.
Total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ Sperm_NNP concentration_NN is_VBZ indicative_JJ of_IN spermatogenetic_JJ activity_NN but_CC does_VBZ not_RB give_VB a_DT true_JJ evaluation_NN unless_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ per_IN ejaculate_NN is_VBZ also_RB con-_JJ sidered_VBD ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ per_IN ejaculate_NN when_WRB calculated_VBN from_IN data_NNS of_IN two_CD successive_JJ ejaculates_NNS from_IN an_DT individual_JJ animal_NN gives_VBZ rather_RB an_DT accurate_JJ picture_NN of_IN semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN for_IN the_DT particular_JJ period_NN when_WRB the_DT semen_NN was_VBD collected_VBN ._.
Analysis_NN of_IN data_NNS for_IN total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN in_IN different_JJ bulls_NNS showed_VBD no_DT seasonal_JJ influence_NN on_IN this_DT character_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ result_NN is_VBZ in_IN disagree-_JJ ment_NN with_IN those_DT reported_VBN by_IN Erb_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1942_CD ]_NN and_CC Phillips_NNP et_VBP al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN but_CC is_VBZ in_IN agreement_NN with_IN that_DT reported_VBN by_IN Mercier_NNP and_CC Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT latter_JJ authors_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, expressed_VBD doubts_NNS about_IN their_PRP$ results_NNS because_IN the_DT frequency_NN of_IN semen_NNS collection_NN in_IN their_PRP$ study_NN was_VBD not_RB rigorously_RB controlled_VBN ._.
Consequently_RB ,_, they_PRP believed_VBD that_IN the_DT variation_NN due_JJ to_TO seasons_NNS in_IN this_DT respect_NN might_MD have_VB been_VBN obscured_VBN ._.
They_PRP have_VBP ,_, therefore_RB ,_, suggested_VBD that_IN '_'' before_IN the_DT question_NN is_VBZ satisfactorily_RB answered_VBN it_PRP will_MD be_VB necessary_JJ to_TO establish_VB a_DT rigorous_JJ schedule_NN for_IN semen_NNS collection_NN throughout_IN a_DT year_NN '_POS ._.
In_IN this_DT investigation_NN ,_, a_DT definite_NN schedule_NN throughout_IN the_DT two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS was_VBD followed_VBN in_IN collecting_VBG semen_NNS samples_NNS ,_, and_CC yet_RB no_DT significant_JJ variation_NN among_IN seasons_NNS or_CC among_IN months_NNS within_IN seasons_NNS was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
Abnormal_NNP spermatozoa_VBD The_DT result_NN obtained_VBN in_IN this_DT respect_NN show_NN that_WDT bulls_VBZ did_VBD not_RB differ_VB significantly_RB in_IN production_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
Regarding_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN seasons_NNS it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN summer_NN differed_VBN from_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT seasons_NNS in_IN producing_VBG low_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormality_NN ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN of_IN bulls_NNS have_VBP also_RB been_VBN reported_VBN by_IN Erb_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1942_CD ]_NN ,_, Phillips_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN ,_, Swanson_NNP and_CC Herman_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP and_CC Mercier_NNP and_CC Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ._.
During_IN winter_NN and_CC spring_NN more_RBR bent_JJ and_CC coiled_JJ tail_NN sperms_NNS were_VBD produced_VBN ,_, whereas_NNS in_IN summer_NN and_CC autumn_NN more_JJR tailless_JJ ones_NNS ._.
Phillips_NNS and_CC his_PRP$ collaborators_NNS while_IN working_VBG with_IN bulls_NNS and_CC rams_NNS [_VBP 1943_CD ,_, a_DT ;_: and_CC 1943_CD ,_, b_NN ]_NN reported_VBD a_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormality_NN in_IN tails_NNS during_IN winter_NN ._.
But_CC they_PRP did_VBD not_RB mention_VB the_DT types_NNS of_IN the_DT tail_NN abnormalities_NNS observed_VBD ._.
They_PRP considered_VBD that_IN cold_JJ weather_NN might_MD have_VB adversely_RB effected_VBN the_DT tails_NNS after_IN the_DT collections_NNS were_VBD made_VBN ._.
To_TO test_VB the_DT validity_NN of_IN this_DT view_NN a_DT few_JJ fresh_JJ samples_NNS June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 89_CD of_IN bull_NN semen_NNS in_IN small_JJ test-tubes_NNS were_VBD put_VBN into_IN chipped_JJ ice_NN for_IN about_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN immediately_RB after_IN collection_NN and_CC later_RB on_IN examined_VBN for_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN '_POS bent_JJ tail_NN '_POS sperms_NNS ._.
Samples_NNS thus_RB treated_VBD did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT appearance_NN of_IN bent_NN tails_NNS or_CC coiled_VBN tails_NNS ._.
Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1949_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN these_DT are_VBP not_RB true_JJ abnormalities_NNS but_CC are_VBP immature_JJ forms_NNS of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_IN during_IN winter_NN and_CC spring_NN when_WRB the_DT rate_NN of_IN spermatogenesis_NN is_VBZ high_JJ ,_, a_DT considerable_JJ number_NN of_IN immature_NN spermatozoa_NN are_VBP carried_VBN along_IN with_IN the_DT normal_JJ spermatozoa_NN in_IN the_DT male_JJ reproductive_JJ tract_NN before_IN they_PRP come_VBP to_TO ampullae_VB for_IN final_JJ ejectment_NN ._.
Blood_NN constituents_NNS From_IN Plates_NNP IV_NNP and_CC V_NNP ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN the_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, haemo-_JJ globin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN were_VBD inversely_RB related_VBN to_TO the_DT changes_NNS in_IN air_NN temperature_NN ._.
Higher_JJR the_DT temperature_NN the_DT lesser_NN was_VBD the_DT haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN contents_NNS in_IN blood_NN ._.
Manersa_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1940_CD ]_NN also_RB found_VBD that_IN haemoglobin_JJ index_NN was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN winter_NN and_CC lower_JJR in_IN summer_NN in_IN Philippine_NNP cattle_NNS ._.
For_IN both_DT haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN the_DT result_NN reported_VBD herein_JJ agrees_NNS with_IN that_DT reported_VBN by_IN Pal_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1945_CD ]_NN in_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS in_IN India_NNP ._.
During_IN summer_NN air_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ high_JJ as_IN compared_VBN with_IN body_NN temperature_NN ._.
As_RB soon_RB as_IN high_JJ air_NN temperature_NN comes_VBZ in_IN contact_NN with_IN skin_NN ,_, some_DT heat_NN is_VBZ absorbed_VBN by_IN peripheral_JJ blood_NN which_WDT subsequently_RB passes_VBZ through_IN the_DT heat_NN regulating_VBG centre_NN ._.
On_IN coming_VBG in_IN contact_NN with_IN blood_NN of_IN higher_JJR temperature_NN this_DT centre_NN operates_VBZ to_TO dis-_VB pose_VB off_RP the_DT extra_JJ heat_NN and_CC as_IN a_DT result_NN the_DT red_JJ and_CC white_JJ blood_NN corpuscles_NNS and_CC plate-_JJ lets_NNS go_VBP to_TO their_PRP$ reserve_NN places_NNS ,_, i.e._FW ,_, spleen_JJ and_CC liver_NN ._.
The_DT increased_VBN blood_NN plasma_NN in_IN the_DT dialated_JJ capillaries_NNS evaporates_VBZ off_IN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN perspiration_NN and_CC keep_VB the_DT body_NN cool_NN ._.
Secretions_NNS of_IN thyroid_NN and_CC adrenal_NN are_VBP also_RB inhibited_VBN [_NNP Kuno_NNP ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN ._.
During_IN autumn_NN ,_, high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN with_IN high_JJ humidity_NN perhaps_RB prevent_VBD the_DT dissipation_NN of_IN the_DT exrta_NN body_NN heat_NN by_IN retarding_VBG body_NN evaporation_NN and_CC thus_RB the_DT physiological_JJ adjustment_NN is_VBZ to_TO a_DT large_JJ extent_NN upset_NN ._.
In_IN consequence_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT general_JJ derangement_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN functions_NNS including_VBG the_DT spermatogenesis_NN of_IN the_DT testes_NNS and_CC hence_RB the_DT low_JJ concentration_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN during_IN autumn_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Seasonal_NNP variation_NN in_IN '_POS reaction-time_NN '_'' ,_, semen_NNS characteristics_NNS ,_, haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN contents_NNS in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN six_CD Kumauni_NNP hill_NN bulls_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN during_IN two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ variation_NN was_VBD observed_VBN among_IN bulls_NNS in_IN average_JJ '_POS reaction-_JJ time_NN '_'' ,_, all_DT attributes_NNS of_IN semen_NNS studied_VBN except_IN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN and_CC the_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS ._.
Reaction-time_NNP '_POS did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT definite_JJ seasonal_JJ trend_NN and_CC bore_VBD no_DT relation-_JJ ship_NN with_IN sperm_JJ production_NN ._.
Colour_NNP and_CC consistency_NN of_IN semen_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB thin_JJ milky_NN in_IN autumn_NN and_CC milky_NN in_IN the_DT other_JJ three_CD seasons_NNS ._.
90_CD SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, No_NNP significant_JJ seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN average_JJ semen_JJ volume_NN and_CC total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ variation_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT average_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN between_IN years_NNS ;_: the_DT first_JJ year_NN being_VBG superior_JJ to_TO the_DT second_JJ year_NN ._.
It_PRP also_RB varied_VBD significantly_RB among_IN seasons_NNS ;_: summer_NN showing_VBG significantly_RB lower_JJR motility_NN than_IN winter_NN ._.
The_DT pH_NN of_IN semen_NNS showed_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ variation_NN between_IN years_NNS and_CC between_IN months_NNS within_IN seasons_NNS ._.
pH_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN was_VBD lower_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT second_JJ ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN was_VBD observed_VBN among_IN seasons_NNS ;_: autumn_NN showing_VBG significantly_RB lower_JJR concentration_NN than_IN winter_NN and_CC spring_NN ._.
Among_IN seasons_NNS highly_RB significant_JJ variation_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
In_IN summer_NN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ sperma-_JJ tozoa_NN was_VBD less_JJR than_IN in_IN other_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
Some_DT forms_NNS of_IN tail_NN abnormalities_NNS such_JJ as_IN ,_, bent_JJ tail_NN and_CC coiled_VBD tail_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR preponderant_JJ in_IN winter_NN and_CC spring_NN ._.
In_IN autumn_NN and_CC summer_NN ,_, tailless_NN forms_NNS were_VBD slightly_RB more_RBR in_IN comparison_NN with_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD seasons_NNS ._.
Haemoglobin_NNP and_CC cell_NN volume_NN contents_NNS of_IN blood_NN were_VBD highly_RB variable_JJ among_IN bulls_NNS ,_, between_IN years_NNS ,_, among_IN seasons_NNS and_CC among_IN months_NNS within_IN seasons_NNS ._.
The_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS were_VBD higher_JJR in_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ._.
Among_IN seasons_NNS ,_, spring_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT best_JJS and_CC autumn_VB the_DT worst_JJS for_IN these_DT characteristics_NNS ._.
The_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS and_CC the_DT blood_NN of_IN the_DT bulls_NNS were_VBD significantly_RB superior_JJ in_IN spring_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, February_NNP to_TO April_NNP and_CC significantly_RB inferior_JJ in_IN autumn_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, August_NNP to_TO October_NNP ._.
Spring_NN was_VBD marked_VBN with_IN moderate_JJ air_NN temperature_NN ,_, lowest_JJS humidity_NN and_CC scanty_NN rainfall_NN ._.
Whereas_NNP ,_, autumn_RB recorded_VBN as_RB high_JJ an_DT air_NN temperature_NN as_IN in_IN summer_NN associated_VBN with_IN high_JJ humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ._.

33_CD ,_, 224_CD EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP MUSCULAR_NNP EXERCISE_NNP ON_NNP SEMEN_NNP PRODUCTION_NNP By_IN S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP GUHA_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, s_JJ Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 12_CD June_NNP 1951_CD )_) THE_DT importance_NN of_IN regular_JJ exercise_NN for_IN breeding_VBG bulls_NNS is_VBZ mentioned_VBN in_IN all_DT standard_JJ books_NNS on_IN animal_NN husbandry_NN ._.
Bartlett_NNP and_CC Perry_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD that_IN daily_JJ exercise_NN lasting_NN for_IN one_CD hour_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 2½_CD miles_NNS per_IN hour_NN increased_VBD semen_NNS output_NN by_IN 51_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Kelly_RB [_JJ 1940_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS exercise_VBP at_IN 2½_CD miles_NNS per_IN hour_NN greatly_RB increased_VBD the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT semen_NNS ._.
He_PRP found_VBD that_IN motility_NN rose_VBD from_IN 5_CD to_TO 45_CD per_IN cent_NN before_IN exercise_NN to_TO 60_CD to_TO 100_CD per_IN cent_NN after_IN exercise_NN ._.
With-_JJ out_RP exercise_NN motility_NN ceased_VBD at_IN 3_CD to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, while_IN with_IN exercise_NN it_PRP was_VBD maintained_VBN up_RP to_TO 22_CD to_TO 39_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT report_NN of_IN Hamilton_NNP and_CC Symington_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN daily_JJ exercising_VBG increased_VBD the_DT volume_NN of_IN ejaculate_NN ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC motility_NN ,_, while_IN Dunlop_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP laid_VBD great_JJ stress_NN on_IN plenty_NN of_IN exercise_NN for_IN producing_VBG larger_JJR ejaculates_NNS containing_VBG more_JJR sperm_NNS of_IN higher_JJR activity_NN ._.
In_IN recent_JJ years_NNS ,_, increased_JJ attention_NN is_VBZ being_VBG paid_VBN to_TO the_DT environment_NN as_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT major_JJ factors_NNS conditioning_VBG the_DT physiological_JJ reaction_NN of_IN animals_NNS ._.
The_DT breed_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN also_RB is_VBZ known_VBN to_TO play_VB an_DT equally_RB important_JJ part_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT higher_JJR air_NN temperature_NN and_CC humidity_NN ranges_VBZ prevailing_VBG in_IN this_DT country_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD thought_VBN worthwhile_RB to_TO investigate_VB whether_IN the_DT conclusions_NNS on_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN exercise_NN on_IN semen_NNS production_NN arrived_VBN at_IN by_IN the_DT foreign_JJ workers_NNS held_VBD good_JJ in_IN 'toto_NNP '_POS ,_, or_CC at_IN least_JJS in_IN part_NN ,_, under_IN the_DT environmental_JJ 'stresses_NNS '_POS met_NN here_RB ._.
The_DT immediate_JJ object_NN of_IN undertaking_VBG these_DT studies_NNS was_VBD to_TO arrive_VB at_IN some_DT tested_JJ standards_NNS for_IN exercising_VBG the_DT bulls_NNS kept_VBD for_IN routine_JJ use_NN at_IN artificial_JJ insemination_NN centres_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ paper_NN are_VBP reported_VBN the_DT results_NNS of_IN three_CD series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS conducted_VBN on_IN a_DT lot_NN of_IN 8_CD Kumauni-hill_NNP bulls_NNS ._.
Experimental_JJ procedure_NN Eight_NNP Kumauni-hill_NNP bulls_VBZ receiving_VBG a_DT uniform_NN and_CC standard_JJ diet_NN were_VBD divided_VBN at_IN random_NN into_IN 2_CD groups_NNS ._.
The_DT treatments_NNS were_VBD alloted_VBN to_TO the_DT 2_CD groups_NNS at_IN random_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN a_DT certain_JJ period_NN which_WDT varied_VBD with_IN the_DT experimental_JJ series94_JJ EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP MUSCULAR_NNP EXERCISE_NNP ON_NNP SEMEN_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, collections_NNS ,_, thus_RB group_NN 1_CD which_WDT received_VBD exercise_NN before_IN collection_NN on_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN ,_, received_VBD no_DT exercise_NN at_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN of_IN collection_NN and_CC exercise_NN again_RB on_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN of_IN collection_NN and_CC so_RB on_IN ._.

Normally_RB ,_, only_RB two_CD collections_NNS in_IN a_DT week_NN are_VBP made_VBN from_IN routine_JJ artificial_JJ insemination_NN bulls_NNS ._.
The_DT decision_NN to_TO have_VB more_JJR collections_NNS in_IN a_DT week_NN and_CC confine_VB the_DT experiment_NN to_TO only_RB two_CD weeks_NNS was_VBD taken_VBN in_IN order_NN to_TO eliminate_VB effect_NN of_IN season_NN on_IN semen_NNS production_NN ._.

The_DT experiment_NN lasted_VBD for_IN four_CD months_NNS ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, (_( vi_NN )_) Total_JJ sperm_NN in_IN an_DT ejaculate_NN ._.
As_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT initial_JJ motility_NN ,_, the_DT total_JJ sperm_NN was_VBD higher_JJR for_IN the_DT non-exercised_JJ group_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT exercised_JJ group_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ejaculate_NN and_CC vice_NN versa_NN in_IN the_DT second_JJ ejaculate_NN ._.
The_DT overall_JJ means_VBZ for_IN the_DT two_CD treatments_NNS were_VBD :_: Exercise=1181_NNP millions_NNS and_CC Non-exercise_JJ 1246_CD millions_NNS ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
The_DT between_IN ejaculate_NN difference_NN however_RB ,_, was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB significant_JJ at_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN ._.
(_( vii_NN )_) Initial_NNP pH_NN ._.
The_DT mean_JJ pH_NN was_VBD lower_JJR in_IN the_DT non-exercised_JJ lot_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT exercise_NN lot_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ejaculate_NN ,_, while_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT second_JJ ejaculate_NN ._.
The_DT overall_JJ means_VBZ for_IN the_DT exercised_JJ and_CC non-exercised_JJ bulls_NNS were_VBD 6.02_CD and_CC 5.98_CD respectively_RB ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD statistically_RB significant_JJ at_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT foregoing_NN ,_, it_PRP would_MD appear_VB that_IN the_DT attributes_NNS most_RBS likely_JJ to_TO be_VB affected_VBN due_JJ to_TO lack_VB of_IN regular_JJ exercise_NN are_VBP initial_JJ pH_NN ,_, per_IN cent_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ sperms_NNS ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC motility_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD attributes_NNS ,_, the_DT differences_NNS are_VBP statistically_RB significant_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN the_DT rest_NN ,_, they_PRP approach_VBP the_DT 5_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN of_IN signi-_JJ ficance_NN ._.
Experiment_JJ III_NNP ._.
The_DT data_NNS are_VBP summarised_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VI_NNP ._.
The_DT figures_NNS in_IN the_DT table_NN are_VBP averages_NNS of_IN all_DT observations_NNS within_IN a_DT period_NN ._.
Using_VBG the_DT averages_NNS of_IN all_DT observations_NNS within_IN a_DT period_NN ,_, analysis_NN appropriate_JJ to_TO 'switch-back_JJ '_'' design_NN was_VBD under-_JJ taken_VBN separately_RB for_IN the_DT first_JJ and_CC second_JJ ejaculates_NNS ,_, for_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT attributes_NNS under_IN study_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT error_NN mean_NN squares_NNS (_( carrying_VBG 6_CD d.f_JJ each_DT )_) in_IN the_DT two_CD ejaculates_NNS turned_VBD out_RP to_TO be_VB homogenous_JJ (_( as_IN determined_VBN by_IN F._NNP test_NN )_) in_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, a_DT pooled_JJ analysis_NN over_IN both_DT ejaculates_NNS was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VII_NNP ._.
Examination_NN of_IN Tables_NNP VI_NNP and_CC VII_NNP shows_NNS :_: (_( i_NN )_) Volume_NN ._.
In_IN both_DT ejaculates_NNS on_IN an_DT average_JJ one_CD hour_NN exercised_VBN animals_NNS gave_VBD slightly_RB larger_JJR ejaculates_NNS than_IN the_DT two_CD hour_NN exercised_VBD ones_NNS ,_, the_DT respective_JJ overall_JJ means_VBZ being_VBG 1.79_CD c.c_NN ._.
and_CC 1.58_CD c.c_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) Initial_NNP motility_NN ._.
The_DT mean_JJ motility_NN rating_NN was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN both_DT ejaculates_NNS ,_, for_IN the_DT two_CD hour_NN exercised_VBN animals_NNS ._.
The_DT overall_JJ means_VBZ for_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN and_CC two_CD hour_NN exercised_VBD groups_NNS were_VBD 3.41_CD and_CC 3.53_CD respectively_RB ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD not_RB statis-_JJ tically_RB significant_JJ ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) Sperm_NNP concentration_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ ejaculate_NN ,_, the_DT average_JJ sperm_JJ concentration_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN the_DT 'one_CD hour_NN exercise_NN '_POS group_NN was_VBD lower_JJR and_CC in_IN the_DT second_JJ ejaculate_NN higher_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT 'two_FW hour_NN exercise_NN '_POS lot_NN ._.
The_DT actual_JJ overall_JJ means_NNS were_VBD 990_CD M/C_NNP for_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN and_CC 903_CD M/C_NNP for_IN the_DT two_CD hour_NN groups_NNS respectively_RB ._.
The_DT differ-_JJ ence_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
(_( iv_NN )_) Per_NNP cent_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ sperm_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ sperms_NNS was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT two_CD hour_NN group_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ ejaculate_NN and_CC vice_NN versa_NN in_IN the_DT second_JJ ejaculate_NN ._.
The_DT overall_JJ means_NNS of_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN and_CC two_CD hour_NN exercised_VBD groups_NNS were_VBD 6.36_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 16.23_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, respectively_RB ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
(_( v_NN )_) Reaction_NN time_NN ._.
In_IN both_DT ejaculates_NNS bulls_NNS in_IN 'one_CD hour_NN exercise_NN '_POS group_NN on_IN an_DT average_JJ took_VBD longer_JJR time_NN than_IN those_DT in_IN the_DT 'two_FW hour_NN exercise_NN '_POS group_NN ._.
The_DT overall_JJ respective_NN means_NNS are_VBP 97_CD and_CC 79_CD seconds_NNS ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB signi-_JJ ficant_NN ._.
June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP GUHA_NNP 107_CD (_( vi_NN )_) Total_JJ sperm_NN in_IN an_DT ejaculate_NN ._.
In_IN both_DT the_DT caculates_NNS ,_, bulls_NNS in_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN exercise_NN group_NN gave_VBD larger_JJR number_NN of_IN sperm_JJ than_IN those_DT in_IN the_DT two_CD hour_NN group_NN ,_, the_DT respective_JJ overall_JJ means_VBZ being_VBG 1598_CD and_CC 1448_CD millions_NNS respectively_RB ._.
The_DT difference_NN did_VBD not_RB approach_VB the_DT 5_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN of_IN significance_NN ._.
(_( vii_NN )_) Initial_NNP pH_NN ._.
In_IN both_DT ejaculates_NNS ,_, there_EX was_VBD hardly_RB any_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT values_NNS of_IN pH_NN of_IN the_DT semen_NNS of_IN bulls_NNS in_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, no_DT significant_JJ differences_NNS in_IN the_DT various_JJ attributes_NNS of_IN semen_NNS quality_NN and_CC reaction_NN time_NN were_VBD found_VBN between_IN the_DT animals_NNS subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT two_CD levels_NNS of_IN excercise_NN ,_, showing_VBG clearly_RB that_IN no_DT material_JJ advantage_NN was_VBD gained_VBN by_IN increasing_VBG the_DT rate_NN of_IN exercise_NN from_IN one_CD to_TO two_CD hours_NNS daily_RB ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
Experiments_NNS were_VBD undertaken_VBN on_IN Kumauni_NNP hill_NN bulls_NNS to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN immediate_NN ,_, long_JJ term_NN (_( one_CD month_NN )_) and_CC two_CD levels_NNS of_IN exercise_NN (_( one_CD hour_NN and_CC two_CD hours_NNS on_IN semen_NNS production_NN ._.
The_DT exercise_NN (_( when_WRB otherwise_RB stated_VBN )_) consisted_VBN in_IN leading_VBG the_DT bulls_NNS on_IN a_DT marked_JJ pathway_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 3_CD miles_NNS an_DT hour_NN for_IN approximately_RB an_DT hour_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
With_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN semen_NNS volume_NN ,_, on_IN significant_JJ difference_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT semen_NNS characteristics_NNS and_CC reaction_NN time_NN of_IN bulls_NNS receiving_VBG and_CC not_RB receiving_VBG exercise_NN just_RB prior_RB to_TO collection_NN ._.
Bulls_NNP receiving_VBG no_DT exercise_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN one_CD month_NN showed_VBD significant_JJ changes_NNS in_IN intial_JJ pH_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ sperms_NNS while_IN changes_NNS in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC motility_NN rating_NN approached_VBD 5_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN of_IN significance_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS and_CC reaction_NN times_NNS of_IN bulls_NNS receiving_VBG one_CD hour_NN and_CC two_CD hour_NN daily_JJ exercise_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN concluded_VBN that_IN while_IN lack_NN of_IN exercise_NN for_IN long_JJ periods_NNS is_VBZ detrimental_JJ to_TO sperm_VB production_NN ,_, increase_NN in_IN the_DT daily_JJ level_NN of_IN exercise_NN from_IN one_CD to_TO two_CD hours_NNS is_VBZ not_RB likely_JJ to_TO materially_RB improve_VB semen_NNS production_NN and_CC reaction_NN time_NN ._.

The_DT Lowa_NNP State_NNP College_NNP Press_NNP ,_, Ames_NNP ,_, Lowa_NNP SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP 'REACTION-TIME_POS '_POS AND_CC SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP SHEEP_NNP BY_NNP D._NNP D._NNP SHUKLA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 30_CD July_NNP 1951_CD )_) (_( With_IN one_CD text-figure_NN )_) THERE_NNP is_VBZ a_DT distinct_JJ breeding_NN season_NN when_WRB the_DT testes_NNS show_VBP maximum_JJ reproductive_JJ activity_NN in_IN the_DT males_NNS of_IN wild_JJ forms_NNS of_IN domesticated_JJ animals_NNS [_VBP Marshal_NNP ,_, 1922_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT domesticated_JJ animals_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, probably_RB as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN changed_VBN environmental_JJ conditions_NNS attending_VBG the_DT process_NN of_IN domestication_NN ,_, the_DT males_NNS have_VBP become_VBN conti-_JJ nuous_JJ breeders_NNS ._.
Radulescu_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD spermatogenesis_NN in_IN rams_NNS during_IN all_DT months_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN and_CC found_VBD continuous_JJ spermatogenesis_NN ._.
Roux_NNP and_CC Hoffman_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD that_IN rams_NNS do_VBP not_RB become_VB impotent_JJ during_IN any_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
Though_NNP spermatogenic_JJ activity_NN goes_VBZ on_IN throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, its_PRP$ extent_NN and_CC rate_NN have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN to_TO depend_VB on_IN environmental_JJ temperature_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, McKenzie_NNP and_CC Berliner_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NN at_IN Missouri_NNP found_VBD that_IN in_IN Shropshire_NNP and_CC Hampshire_NNP rams_VBP high_JJ summer_NN temperature_NN induced_VBD a_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT numbers_NNS of_IN normal_JJ and_CC an_DT increase_NN in_IN that_DT of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
Green_JJ [_NN 1940_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD low_JJ sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC rise_NN in_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN from_IN June_NNP to_TO August_NNP in_IN Shrop-_NNP shire_NN rams_NN at_IN Minnesota_NNP ._.
From_IN January_NNP to_TO May_NNP the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN was_VBD best_RBS in_IN these_DT rams_NNS ._.
Gunn_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1942_CD ]_NN observed_VBD marked_JJ seasonal_JJ degeneration_NN in_IN rams_NNS in_IN Australia_NNP during_IN hot_JJ weather_NN and_CC a_DT gradual_JJ recovery_NN in_IN cooler_NN season_NN ._.
Phillips_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ,_, b_NN ]_NN have_VBP made_VBN similar_JJ observations_NNS in_IN Hampshire_NNP ,_, Karakul_NNP ,_, Shropshire_NNP and_CC South_NNP down_RB rams_VBZ at_IN Maryland_NNP ._.

One_CD singular_NN fact_NN which_WDT emerges_VBZ out_IN of_IN the_DT review_NN of_IN the_DT literature_NN is_VBZ that_IN climatic_JJ conditions_NNS influence_VBP very_RB greatly_RB the_DT spermatogenic_JJ activity_NN of_IN rams_NNS and_CC that_DT high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN dec-_JJ reases_VBZ the_DT spermatogenesis_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ study_NN an_DT attempt_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN to_TO determine_VB the_DT seasonal_JJ varia-_JJ tions_NNS of_IN semen_NNS characteristics_NNS of_IN indigenous_JJ rams_NNS ._.

I_PRP ._.
From_IN the_DT figure_NN it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT curve_NN for_IN 'reaction-_JJ time_NN '_'' did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT definite_JJ monthly_JJ variation_NN ._.

There_EX is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, an_DT indication_NN that_IN the_DT average_JJ pH_NN was_VBD high_JJ during_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN than_IN during_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN ._.
The_DT curves_NNS for_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NNS are_VBP more_RBR or_CC less_JJR of_IN the_DT same_JJ type_NN ,_, showing_VBG a_DT definite_JJ monthly_JJ variation_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT gradual_JJ decrease_NN in_IN both_DT of_IN these_DT characteristics_NNS from_IN April_NNP to_TO September_NNP after_IN which_WDT there_EX was_VBD a_DT progressive_JJ increase_NN ._.

The_DT curve_NN for_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN has_VBZ two_CD peak_NN points_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN ,_, one_CD in_IN January_NNP and_CC the_DT other_JJ in_IN August_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN ,_, one_CD in_IN September_NNP and_CC the_DT other_JJ in_IN December_NNP ._.
The_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ sperma-_JJ tozoa_NN in_IN August_NNP and_CC September_NNP was_VBD due_JJ to_TO preponderance_NN of_IN tailless_NN spermatozoa_NN ,_, whereas_RB in_IN December_NNP and_CC January_NNP it_PRP was_VBD due_JJ to_TO bent_VB tail_NN ones_NNS ._.

This_DT was_VBD because_RB in_IN autumn_NN and_CC winter_NN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN tailless_NN and_CC bent-tail_JJ sperma-_JJ tozoa_NN respectively_RB were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT ejaculates_NNS ._.
Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NN who_WP studied_VBD the_DT seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN semen_NNS and_CC blood_NN qualities_NNS of_IN bulls_NNS during_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN ,_, when_WRB this_DT experiment_NN was_VBD conducted_VBN ,_, found_VBD that_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN were_VBD highest_JJS in_IN autumn_NN and_CC lowest_JJS in_IN spring_NN ._.
Average_JJ air_NN temperature_NN in_IN autumn_NN was_VBD almost_RB as_RB high_JJ as_IN in_IN summer_NN ._.
Air_NNP temperature_NN in_IN spring_NN was_VBD moderate_JJ ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_IN when_WRB air_NN temperature_NN was_VBD moderate_JJ with_IN scanty_JJ rainfall_NN and_CC lowest_JJS humidity_NN as_IN in_IN spring_NN the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN rams_NNS improved_VBN ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP Reaction-time_NNP ._.
The_DT study_NN of_IN 'reaction-time_NNP '_POS was_VBD undertaken_VBN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO determine_VB if_IN there_EX was_VBD any_DT correlation_NN between_IN sex_NN vigour_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN and_CC its_PRP$ fertility_NN ._.
Result_NN obtained_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN showed_VBD that_IN sex_NN vigour_NN and_CC sperm_JJ production_NN were_VBD quite_RB independent_JJ of_IN each_DT other_JJ ._.
From_IN the_DT records_NNS of_IN individual_JJ rams_NN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN rams_VBZ with_IN high_JJ sex_NN vigour_NNS were_VBD not_RB necessarily_RB good_JJ semen_NNS producers_NNS ._.

These_DT results_NNS agree_VBP with_IN those_DT of_IN McKenzie_NNP and_CC Berliner_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NN with_IN rams_NNS ,_, Anderson_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP and_CC Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NN with_IN bulls_NNS ._.
Volume_NN ._.
Volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB variable_JJ among_IN rams_NNS and_CC during_IN the_DT seasons_NNS ._.

This_DT observation_NN is_VBZ in_IN agreement_NN with_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ experiment_NN ._.
Under_IN the_DT same_JJ climatic_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN which_WDT experiment_NN was_VBD performed_VBN ,_, Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD no_DT such_JJ seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN volume_NN of_IN bull_JJ semen_NNS ._.

Motility_NN ._.
Motility_NN rating_NN was_VBD determined_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN by_IN direct_JJ micro-_JJ scopical_JJ examination_NN ._.
-_: Obviously_RB this_DT method_NN of_IN estimation_NN not_RB only_RB depends_VBZ on_IN motility_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN but_CC on_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN as_RB well_RB ._.
This_DT might_MD be_VB the_DT reason_NN why_WRB in_IN autumn_NN when_WRB the_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN was_VBD lower_JJR than_IN in_IN spring_NN the_DT initial_JJ motility_NN was_VBD also_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB lower_JJR ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT direct_JJ proportional_JJ increase_NN in_IN initial_JJ motility_NN with_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN during_IN the_DT different_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
Had_VBD it_PRP been_VBN so_RB ,_, in_IN winter_NN and_CC autumn_NN when_WRB there_EX was_VBD no_DT significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN initial_JJ motility_NN there_RB should_MD have_VB been_VBN no_DT variation_NN in_IN sperm_JJ concentra-_JJ tion_NN as_IN well_RB ._.
But_CC the_DT result_NN indicated_VBD that_IN in_IN autumn_JJ sperm_JJ concentration_NN was_VBD significantly_RB lower_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT seasons_NNS ._.
Again_NN in_IN summer_NN initial_JJ motility_NN was_VBD significantly_RB higher_JJR than_IN in_IN spring_NN but_CC sperm_JJ concentration_NN showed_VBD just_RB the_DT reverse_JJ trend_NN ._.
Initial_JJ motility_NN rating_NN as_IN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS emperical_JJ method_NN of_IN evaluating_VBG semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
At_IN best_RBS it_PRP can_MD indicate_VB a_DT good_JJ sample_NN from_IN a_DT bad_JJ sample_NN ._.

Determination_NN of_IN pH_NN in_IN semen_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN recognised_VBN by_IN various_JJ workers_NNS on_IN semenology_NN as_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT methods_NNS of_IN evaluating_VBG semen_NNS quality_NN as_IN it_PRP indirectly_RB gives_VBZ an_DT indication_NN of_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN in_IN semen_NNS ._.

Sperm_NNP concentration_NN ._.
Result_NN of_IN analysis_NN of_IN data_NNS on_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN showed_VBD that_IN it_PRP was_VBD highly_RB variable_JJ among_IN rams_NNS between_IN years_NNS and_CC among_IN seasons_NNS ._.

[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
