McKenzie_NNP and_CC Berliner_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD a_DT low_JJ level_NN of_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN in_IN the_DT Shorpshire_NNP during_IN August_NNP and_CC September_NNP and_CC a_DT sudden_JJ increase_NN in_IN October_NNP ,_, which_WDT lasted_VBD till_IN December_NNP ._.
In_IN this_DT experiment_JJ highest_JJS sperm_JJ concentration_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN spring_NN and_CC lowest_JJS in_IN autumn_NN ._.
This_DT result_NN is_VBZ in_IN '_'' complete_JJ agreement_NN with_IN that_DT obtained_VBN in_IN bulls_NNS by_IN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
Berliner_NNP and_CC Werbritton_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP made_VBD histological_JJ studies_NNS of_IN the_DT organs_NNS June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 121_CD and_CC Berliner_NNP a_DT distinct_JJ increase_NN in_IN total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN was_VBD observed_VBN from_IN October_NNP to_TO January_NNP in_IN Shorpshire_NNP and_CC August_NNP to_TO November_NNP in_IN Hampshire_NNP ._.
According_VBG to_TO Phillips_NNP and_CC his_PRP$ associates_NNS ,_, total_JJ spermatozoa_NN was_VBD highest_JJS in_IN winter_NN and_CC lowest_JJS in_IN fall_NN ._.
Both_DT the_DT above_JJ groups_NNS of_IN workers_NNS found_VBD spring_NN to_TO be_VB the_DT second_JJ best_RBS season_NN ._.
Abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
The_DT result_NN obtained_VBN in_IN this_DT respect_NN show_NN that_IN ram_VBZ 3_CD varied_JJ significantly_RB from_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT rams_NNS ._.
Regarding_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN seasons_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN in_IN autumn_NN and_CC spring_NN the_DT average_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ sper-_JJ matozoa_NN was_VBD significantly_RB more_JJR than_IN in_IN spring_NN and_CC summer_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN stated_VBN before_IN that_DT in_IN autumn_NN the_DT tailless_NN spermatozoa_NN and_CC in_IN winter_NN the_DT bent-tail_JJ ones_NNS were_VBD more_JJR than_IN in_IN other_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
Autumn_NNP was_VBD marked_VBN for_IN its_PRP$ high_JJ temperature_NN ,_, humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ._.
During_IN this_DT season_NN the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN was_VBD also_RB poorer_JJR than_IN in_IN other_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
Phillips_NNS and_CC McKenzie_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT marked_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN following_VBG heat_NN treatment_NN of_IN rams_NNS and_CC within_IN three_CD weeks_NNS practically_RB no_DT spermatozoa_NN were_VBD present_JJ ._.
McKenzie_NNP and_CC Berliner_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP also_RB found_VBD that_IN heat_NN applied_VBN to_TO scrotum_VB either_DT experimentally_RB or_CC by_IN local_JJ inflammation_NN decreased_VBN spermatogenesis_NN and_CC increased_VBD abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
The_DT predominance_NN of_IN tailless_NN spermatozoa_NN in_IN autumn_NN as_IN found_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN tail_NN abnormalities_NNS in_IN winter_NN as_IN observed_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN was_VBD also_RB reported_VBN in_IN bulls_NNS and_CC rams_NNS by_IN Phillips_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ,_, a_DT and_CC 1943_CD b_NN ]_NN ._.
But_CC they_PRP did_VBD not_RB mention_VB the_DT types_NNS of_IN the_DT tail_NN abnormalities_NNS ._.
This_DT experiment_NN showed_VBD that_IN the_DT predominant_JJ tail_NN abnormality_NN in_IN winter_NN was_VBD the_DT bent-tail_JJ one_NN ._.
Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP also_RB observed_VBD the_DT increase_NN in_IN bent-tail_JJ spermatozoa_NN in_IN the_DT ejaculates_NNS of_IN bulls_NNS in_IN winter_NN ._.
They_PRP have_VBP further_JJ shown_VBN that_IN the_DT bent-tail_JJ spermatozoa_NN in_IN the_DT ejaculates_NNS of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS are_VBP really_RB immature_JJ ones_NNS and_CC have_VBP suggested_VBN that_IN in_IN winter_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT rate_NN of_IN spermatogenesis_NN was_VBD comparatively_RB higher_JJR than_IN in_IN autumn_NN ,_, more_JJR of_IN immature_NN spermatozoa_NNS like_IN bent-tail_JJ ones_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN along_IN with_IN normal_JJ spermatozoa_NN in_IN the_DT male_JJ reproductive_JJ tract_NN before_IN they_PRP came_VBD to_TO ampullae_VB for_IN final_JJ ejectment_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Seasonal_NNP variation_NN in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC semen_NNS characteristics_NNS of_IN nine_CD rams_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN for_IN two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ variation_NN was_VBD observed_VBN among_IN rams_NNS in_IN average_JJ 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC all_DT attributes_NNS of_IN semen_NNS studied_VBN except_IN in_IN the_DT initial_JJ motility_NN ._.
'Reaction-time_JJ '_'' did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT definite_JJ seasonal_JJ trend_NN and_CC bore_RB no_DT relationship_NN with_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS produced_VBN ._.
Between_NNP years_NNS highly_RB significant_JJ variations_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS ;_: pH_NNS of_IN semen_NNS ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
Between_JJ seasons_NNS highly_RB significant_JJ variations_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN all_DT characterisitcs_NN of_IN semen_NNS except_IN in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS ._.
The_DT semen_NNS quality_NN in_IN autumn_NN was_VBD poorer_JJR than_IN in_IN other_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
Spring_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT best_JJS season_NN for_IN semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
Between_JJ months_NNS within_IN seasons_NNS highly_RB sigificant_JJ variation_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN intial_JJ motility_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN ,_, total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, TABLE_NNP IIIJune_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN N._NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP ,_, C._NNP S._NNP DHARMARAJAN_NNP AND_NNP R._NNP V._NNP RAO_NNP 133_CD SUMMARTY_NNP Two_CD hundred_CD and_CC two_CD samples_NNS of_IN cow_NN and_CC thirty-seven_JJ samples_NNS of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN collected_VBN from_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN were_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN freezing_VBG point_NN ,_, lactose_JJ and_CC chlorine_NN ._.

Nearly_RB 97_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS gave_VBD a_DT freezing_JJ point_NN depression_NN higher_JJR than_IN 0_CD 530ºC_CD ._.
The_DT average_JJ lactose_JJ and_CC chlorine_JJ contents_NNS were_VBD respectively_RB 5.28_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 0.072_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN cow_NN milk_NN ,_, and_CC 5.27_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 0.061_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN buffalo_JJ milk_NN ._.

Sci._NNP ,_, 20_CD ,_, 263_CD GEOGRAPHICAL_NNP DISTRIBUTION_NNP AND_NNP SEASONAL_NNP INCIDENCE_NNP OF_NNP MAIN_NNP CONTAGIOUS_NNP DISEASES_NNP AMONG_NNP BOVINES_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP PUNJAB_NNP FROM_NNP 1944-45_CD TO_NNP 1949-50_CD By_IN TULSA_NNP RAM_NNP ,_, L.V.P._NNP ,_, M.Sc._NNP ,_, Ph.D._NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 16_CD July_NNP 1951_CD )_) (_( With_IN three_CD text-figures_NNS )_) THE_DT information_NN regarding_VBG the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN main_JJ contagious_JJ diseases_NNS among_IN cattle_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP was_VBD published_VBN in_IN Indian_JJ Farming_NNP ,_, Volume_NN 3_CD ,_, March_NNP ,_, 1946_CD ._.
This_DT ,_, however_RB ,_, related_VBN to_TO the_DT Joint_NNP Punjab_NNP and_CC for_IN the_DT period_NN from_IN 1932-33_JJ to_TO 1934-44_CD ._.
The_DT data_NNS ,_, now_RB presented_VBN in_IN this_DT article_NN ,_, relate_NN to_TO the_DT Punjab_NNP (_( India_NNP )_) and_CC for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN six_CD years_NNS from_IN 1944-45_JJ to_TO 1949-50_JJ ._.
The_DT Punjab_NNP State_NNP now_RB comprises_VBZ of_IN thirteen_JJ districts_NNS divided_VBN into_IN two_CD revenue_NN divisions_NNS of_IN Jullundur_NNP and_CC Ambala_NNP ._.
The_DT data_NNS have_VBP been_VBN collected_VBN from_IN the_DT reports_NNS of_IN outbreaks_NNS received_VBN from_IN the_DT field_NN staff_NN through_IN their_PRP$ respective_JJ Divisional_NNP Superintendents_NNP ,_, TABLE_NNP I_PRP Incidence_NNP of_IN the_DT main_JJ contagious_JJ diseases_NNS in_IN bovines_NNS year-wise_RB Name_NNP of_IN disease_NN Number_NNP of_IN outbreaks_JJ 1944-45_JJ 1945-46_JJ 1946-47_JJ 1947-48_JJ 1948-49_JJ 1949-50_JJ Rinderpest_NNP 581_CD 725_CD 759_CD 1,573_CD 777_CD 127_CD Haemorrhagic_NNP septicaemia_VBD 1,111_CD 1,026_CD 807_CD 114_CD 705_CD 472_CD Foot_NN and_CC mouth_NN 147_CD 517_CD 718_CD 88_CD 296_CD 1,067_CD Black_NNP quarter_NN 115_CD 59_CD 36_CD 5_CD 23_CD 11_CD From_IN Table_JJ I_PRP presenting_VBG data_NNS for_IN 6_CD years_NNS and_CC Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD showing_VBG yearly_JJ distribution_NN of_IN contagious_JJ diseases_NNS since_IN 1932-33_CD ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN that_IN rinderpest_JJS occurs_NNS in_IN cycles_NNS ._.
The_DT first_JJ peak_NN occurred_VBD in_IN 1932-33_CD and_CC 1933-34_JJ ;_: second_JJ peak_NN occurred_VBD after_IN three_CD years_NNS ,_, i.e_NN ._.
in_IN 1937-38_JJ and_CC 1938-39_JJ and_CC the_DT third_JJ peak_NN began_VBD in_IN 1944-45_CD ,_, which_WDT lasted_VBD upto_JJ 1947-48_JJ and_CC since_IN then_RB it_PRP is_VBZ on_IN the_DT decline_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT trend_NN the_DT next_JJ peak_JJ cycle_NN can_MD be_VB predicted_VBN with_IN some_DT accuracy_NN and_CC thus_RB mass_NN prophylactic_JJ vaceination_NN against_IN rinderpest_NN could_MD be_VB carried_VBN out_RP a_DT year_NN earlier_RBR to_TO prevent_VB its_PRP$ causing_VBG heavy_JJ losses_NNS ._.
135_CD 13_CD 136_CD MAIN_NNP CONTAGIOUS_NNP DISEASES_NNP AMONG_NNP BOVINES_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.

1_CD ._.
Yearly_JJ distribution_NN of_IN contagious_JJ diseases_NNS ._.
June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN TULSA_NNP RAM_NNP 137_CD The_DT year_NN 1947-48_CD was_VBD unprecedented_VBN in_IN the_DT history_NN of_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP in_IN which_WDT movement_NN of_IN livestock_NN along_IN with_IN human_JJ population_NN took_VBD place_NN on_IN mass_NN scale_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT partition_NN of_IN the_DT Province_NNP resulting_NN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN also_RB on_IN mass_NN scale_NN throughout_IN the_DT State_NNP ._.
The_DT incidence_NN of_IN other_JJ contagious_JJ diseases_NNS ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, was_VBD lowest_JJS in_IN the_DT same_JJ year_NN ,_, most_RBS probably_RB ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT break_NN down_IN of_IN communication_NN and_CC transport_NN systems_NNS and_CC preoccupation_NN of_IN the_DT people_NNS in_IN domestic_JJ worries_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT upheavel_NN ._.
Great_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN reports_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN all_DT other_JJ infectious_JJ diseases_NNS was_VBD observed_VBN from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ,_, depending_VBG upon_IN movement_NN of_IN livestock_NN ,_, rainfall_NN and_CC other_JJ environmental_JJ factors_NNS ._.
Lall_NNP [_NN 1946_CD ]_NN reported_VBD that_IN rinderpest_NN was_VBD on_IN the_DT decline_NN in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP since_IN 1932-33_CD ._.
However_RB ,_, observations_NNS recorded_VBN above_RB do_VBP not_RB agree_VB with_IN his_PRP$ findings_NNS ._.
In_IN so_RB far_RB as_IN other_JJ diseases_NNS of_IN bovine_NN are_VBP concerned_VBN ,_, the_DT above_JJ observations_NNS are_VBP in_IN conformity_NN with_IN those_DT recorded_VBN by_IN him_PRP ._.
Seasonal_JJ incidence_NN The_DT number_NN of_IN outbreak_JJ reports_NNS of_IN each_DT disease_NN received_VBD each_DT month_NN for_IN all_PDT the_DT years_NNS from_IN 1944-45_JJ to_TO 1949-50_JJ were_VBD pooled_VBN together_RB to_TO determine_VB the_DT seasonal_JJ incidence_NN ._.
Table_JJ II_NNP below_NN shows_VBZ the_DT result_NN ._.
TABLE_NNP II_NNP Number_NNP of_IN outbreaks_NNS of_IN main_JJ contagious_JJ diseases_NNS in_IN bovines_NNS month-wise_JJ Name_NN of_IN disease_NN January_NNP February_NNP March_NNP April_NNP May_NNP June_NNP July_NNP August_NNP September_NNP October_NNP November_NNP December_NNP Rinderpest_NNP 914_CD 277_CD 206_CD 269_CD 164_CD 257_CD 236_CD 244_CD 288_CD 338_CD 654_CD 695_CD Haemorrhagic_NNP septicaemia_VBD 246_CD 156_CD 129_CD 91_CD 79_CD 73_CD 235_CD 1258_CD 1178_CD 400_CD 183_CD 207_CD Foot_NN and_CC mouth_NN 43_CD 26_CD 78_CD 401_CD 826_CD 819_CD 218_CD 90_CD 121_CD 102_CD 63_CD 47_CD Black_NNP quarter_NN 8_CD 11_CD 10_CD 30_CD 17_CD 25_CD 20_CD 49_CD 33_CD 22_CD 12_CD 12_CD Table_JJ II_NNP and_CC Fig_NNP ._.

Special_JJ Pathology_NNP and_CC Therapeutic_NNP of_IN the_DT Diseases_NNP of_IN Domestic_NNP Animals_NNP I_PRP ,_, 396-397_JJ STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP MANGE_NNP MITES_NNP OF_NNP LIVESTOCK_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP ,_, P._NNP BALARAMA_NNP MENON_NNP and_CC C._NNP M._NNP SEN_NNP GUPTA_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD August_NNP 1951_CD )_) SKIN_NNP diseases_VBZ originate_VBP from_IN various_JJ causes_NNS ._.
In_IN livestock_NN in_IN India_NNP the_DT most_RBS im-_JJ portant_NN of_IN them_PRP is_VBZ the_DT infestation_NN with_IN various_JJ types_NNS of_IN mites_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ a_DT serious_JJ problem_NN for_IN the_DT veterinarian_JJ as_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN livestock_NN is_VBZ infested_VBN with_IN none_NN or_CC more_JJR species_NNS of_IN mites_NNS and_CC effective_JJ treatment_NN entails_VBZ considerable_JJ inconvenience_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN is_VBZ known_VBN under_IN various_JJ names_NNS viz._RB ,_, itch_NN ,_, scab_NN ,_, mange_NN ,_, scabies_NNS and_CC a_DT number_NN of_IN local_JJ names_NNS ._.
About_RB two_CD dozen_NN species_NNS or_CC varieties_NNS of_IN species_NNS are_VBP known_VBN to_TO infest_VB domestic_JJ animals_NNS and_CC among_IN them_PRP are_VBP some_DT of_IN the_DT most_RBS serious_JJ pests_NNS of_IN livestock_NN ._.
Pillers_NNS [_VBP 1921_CD ]_NNP estimated_VBD a_DT loss_NN of_IN 102,616_CD per_IN annum_NN due_JJ to_TO mange_VB in_IN horses_NNS in_IN the_DT United_NNP Kingdom_NNP ._.
To_TO prevent_VB this_DT loss_NN the_DT United_NNP Kingdom_NNP and_CC Canada_NNP have_VBP enforced_VBN legislation_NN compelling_VBG livestock_NN owners_NNS to_TO report_VB cases_NNS of_IN mange_NN in_IN horses_NNS and_CC sheep_NN to_TO the_DT authorities_NNS for_IN remedy_NN ._.
Previous_JJ literature_NN Owing_VBG to_TO the_DT inaccessibility_NN of_IN literature_NN an_DT annotated_JJ review_NN of_IN the_DT works_NNS of_IN twenty-four_JJ authors_NNS on_IN the_DT subject_NN is_VBZ given_VBN ._.
Literature_NN on_IN mange_NN reveals_NNS that_WDT life_NN history_NN of_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT burrowing_NN mites_VBZ causing_VBG scabies_NNS in_IN man_NN and_CC animal_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN thoroughly_RB worked_VBN out_RP [_JJ Gordon_NNP et_NN al_NN 1943_CD ]_NN ;_: that_WDT work_VBP on_IN treatment_NN of_IN various_JJ acariasis_NN infection_NN is_VBZ very_RB meagre_JJ and_CC the_DT stage_NN in_IN their_PRP$ life_NN history_NN when_WRB they_PRP are_VBP infective_JJ to_TO healthy_JJ hosts_NNS is_VBZ not_RB yet_RB known_VBN ._.
The_DT only_JJ available_JJ account_NN is_VBZ by_IN Gordon_NNP et_CC al_JJ [_JJ loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
who_WP made_VBD limited_JJ observations_NNS on_IN the_DT life_NN histories_NNS of_IN Notoedres_NNS in_IN white_JJ rats_NNS and_CC Sarcoptes_NNP scabei_VBP in_IN man_NN and_CC found_VBD that_IN they_PRP are_VBP identical_JJ ._.
They_PRP further_RB suggested_VBD ._.
that_IN the_DT larval_NN and_CC nymphal_JJ stages_NNS are_VBP infective_JJ to_TO healthy_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Recently_RB ,_, Palimpsestov_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NN did_VBD valuable_JJ work_NN on_IN the_DT subject_NN and_CC observed_VBD that_IN sarcoptids_NNS of_IN both_DT sexes_NNS pass_VBP through_IN four_CD active_JJ and_CC four_CD passive_JJ stages_NNS ._.
Mellanby_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1942_CD ]_NN in_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN controlled_JJ experiments_NNS proved_VBD that_IN temperature_NN had_VBD definite_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT adult_NN of_IN Sarcoptes_NNP scabei_NN ._.
He_PRP re-_NN corded_VBD the_DT thermal_JJ death_NN point_NN for_IN these_DT mites_NNS and_CC showed_VBD that_IN atmospheric_JJ humi-_JJ dity_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN it_PRP ._.
But_CC Troitzkii_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN air_NN humidity_NN had_VBD a_DT great_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN mange_NN in_IN sheep_JJ though_IN air_NN temperature_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN it_PRP ._.
Gillain_NNP [_JJ 1942_CD ]_NN recorded_VBD that_IN Sarcoptes_NNP scabei_VBD infection_NN of_IN pig_NN could_MD be_VB experimentally_RB transmitted_VBN to_TO man_NN and_CC also_RB recorded_VBD its_PRP$ spontaneous_JJ cure_NN ._.
Unsworth_IN [_JJ 1946_CD ]_NN isolated_VBD demodectic_JJ mange_NN parasite_NN from_IN ten_JJ per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT apparently_RB healthy_JJ dogs_NNS ._.
He_PRP failed_VBD to_TO transmit_VB demodectic_JJ mange_NN infection_NN by_IN direct_JJ contact_NN ._.
Varenne_NNP [_NN 1946_CD ]_NN reported_VBD successful_JJ transmission_NN of_IN sarcoptic_JJ mange_NN from_IN cattle_NNS to_TO man_NN ._.
Imperial_NNP Chemical_NNP Industries_NNP (_( Veterinary_NNP Bulletin_NNP ,_, 1950_CD )_) record_NN easy_JJ transmission_NN of_IN goat_NN mange_NN to_TO man_NN during_IN cold_JJ months_NNS in_IN Baluchistan_NNP ._.
143_CD 14_CD 144_CD STUDIES_NNPS ON_NNP MANGE_NNP MITES_NNP OF_NNP LIVESTOCK_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, Sen_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP gave_VBD a_DT review_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ methods_NNS of_IN treatment_NN of_IN follicular_JJ mange_NN in_IN dogs_NNS ._.
Basu_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NNP gave_VBD a_DT general_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ types_NNS of_IN mange_NN mites_NNS in_IN India_NNP along_IN with_IN their_PRP$ standard_JJ treatment_NN ._.
Roy_NNP and_CC Ghosh_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN oil_NN of_IN turpentine_NN had_VBD properties_NNS lethal_VBN to_TO Saccoptes_NNP scabei_NN ._.
Turpentine_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO reach_VB and_CC kill_VB mites_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ burrows_NNS without_IN preliminary_JJ cleaning_NN of_IN the_DT skin_NN ._.
Taylor_NNP [_NN 1945_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN solution_NN of_IN Benzene_NNP hexachloride_NN in_IN olive_JJ oil_NN or_CC liquid_NN paraffin_NN was_VBD more_RBR effective_JJ than_IN benzyl_JJ benzoate_NN or_CC tetraethyl_JJ thiurium_NN mono-sulphide_NN and_CC DDT_NNP in_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN Notoedres_NNP acariasis_NN ._.
Psoroptes_NNS mange_VBP in_IN cattle_NNS and_CC horses_NNS were_VBD successfully_RB treated_VBN with_IN a_DT sulphur_NN lime_NN dust_NN by_IN Gladenko_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP and_CC Fortushnuif_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
Tretyakova_NNP [_NN 1947_CD ]_NN reported_VBD effective_JJ treatment_NN of_IN Psoroptes_NNP mange_NN in_IN horses_NNS with_IN a_DT powder_NN made_VBN from_IN a_DT fused_JJ mixture_NN of_IN sulphur_NN and_CC naphthalene_NN ._.
Braun_NNP and_CC Schuermann_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD poor_JJ effect_NN of_IN Gesarol_NNP (_( DDT_NNP )_) on_IN Acarus_NNP scabei_NN and_CC on_IN scabies_NNS ._.
The_DT curative_JJ effect_NN was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, not_RB superior_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN benzyl_NN benzoate_NN emulsion_NN ._.
Benzene_NNP hexachloride_NN and_CC Gammazene_NNP were_VBD found_VBN efficient_NN in_IN curing_VBG sheep_JJ scab_NN [_NNP Kemper_NNP ,_, 1948_CD and_CC Dowhing_NNP ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN ,_, scaly_JJ legs_FW [_JJ Griffiths_NNP and_CC O'Rourke_NNP ,_, 1949_CD ]_NN ,_, sarcoptic_JJ mange_NN in_IN camels_NNS [_NNP Draz_NNP ,_, 1947_CD ]_NN and_CC cattle_JJ mange_NN (_( Brander_NNP )_) ._.
Phenothiazine_NNP ointment_NN was_VBD found_VBN useful_JJ in_IN treatment_NN of_IN demodectic_JJ mange_NN [_NNP McCay_NNP and_CC Udall_NNP ,_, 1949_CD ]_NN ._.
Penicillin_NNP was_VBD successfully_RB employed_VBN in_IN treating_VBG demodectic_JJ mange_NN [_NNP Floric_NNP and_CC Gratecos_NNP ,_, 1947_CD ]_NN ._.
Distribution_NN and_CC seasonal_JJ incidence_NN From_IN the_DT record_NN of_IN clinical_JJ material_NN received_VBN from_IN the_DT various_JJ States_NNS and_CC the_DT reports_NNS of_IN State_NNP Governments_NNP and_CC of_IN the_DT Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN mange_NN infestation_NN is_VBZ more_RBR or_CC less_RBR common_JJ in_IN livestock_NN throughout_IN India_NNP ._.
Regarding_VBG seasonal_JJ incidence_NN of_IN various_JJ species_NNS of_IN parasitic_JJ acariasis_NN causing_VBG skin_JJ diseases_NNS of_IN livestock_NN some_DT preliminary_JJ observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP in_IN 1947_CD and_CC 1948_CD and_CC it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN mange_NN infestation_NN was_VBD definitely_RB seasonal_JJ and_CC restric-_JJ ted_VBN to_TO a_DT few_JJ months_NNS in_IN the_DT year_NN viz._NN ,_, October_NNP to_TO March_NNP ._.
Sarcoptes_NNS scabei_VBP var_NN ._.
caprae_NN ,_, the_DT mite_NN responsible_JJ for_IN sarcoptic_JJ acariasis_NN in_IN goats_NNS was_VBD widely_RB prevalent_JJ in_IN our_PRP$ area_NN (_( Izatnagar_NNP )_) and_CC its_PRP$ incidence_NN was_VBD very_RB high_JJ during_IN the_DT winter_JJ months_NNS ._.
Generally_RB all_DT types_NNS of_IN mange_NN infestation_NN in_IN livestock_NN are_VBP worst_VBN in_IN cold_JJ weather_NN ._.
The_DT head_NN and_CC the_DT ears_NNS are_VBP usually_RB the_DT initial_JJ points_NNS of_IN infection_NN ._.
Later_RB on_IN ,_, the_DT disease_NN extends_VBZ backwards_NNS over_IN the_DT body_NN and_CC limbs_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT period_NN October_NNP 1947_CD to_TO February_NNP 1948_CD the_DT incidence_NN of_IN mange_NN observed_VBN in_IN goats_NNS varied_VBD from_IN 33_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 77_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, the_DT peak_NN being_VBG in_IN December_NNP ._.
During_IN this_DT period_NN out_IN of_IN 79_CD goats_NNS ex-_JJ amined_VBD for_IN mange_NN 59_CD animals_NNS showed_VBD mange_JJ infestation_NN ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT follicular_JJ mange_NN infestation_NN in_IN dogs_NNS ,_, 3_CD out_IN of_IN 16_CD dogs_NNS examined_VBD showed_VBD follicular_JJ mange_NN infesta-_JJ tion_NN in_IN 1948_CD in_IN the_DT month_NN of_IN November_NNP within_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP premises_VBZ ._.
In_IN all_PDT the_DT three_CD cases_NNS ,_, the_DT area_NN affected_VBD was_VBD found_VBN hairless_NN and_CC the_DT skin_NN appeared_VBD deadened_JJ and_CC grayish_JJ ._.
Some_DT critical_JJ observations_NNS on_IN various_JJ species_NNS of_IN mange_NN mites_NNS were_VBD made_VBN during_IN the_DT period_NN November_NNP 1949_CD to_TO March_NNP 1950_CD and_CC their_PRP$ incidence_NN in_IN various_JJ species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS is_VBZ reported_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I._NNP June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP ,_, P._NNP B._NNP MENON_NNP AND_NNP C._NNP M._NNP SEN_NNP GUPTA_NNP 145_CD TABLE_NNP I_PRP Incidence_NNP of_IN mange_NN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP during_IN November_NNP 1949_CD to_TO March_NNP 1950_CD Species_NNP November_NNP 1949_CD December_NNP 1949_CD January_NNP 1950_CD February_NNP 1950_CD March_NNP 1950_CD No_NNP ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, Experiment_NNP 1_CD DDT.June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP ,_, P._NNP B._NNP MENON_NNP AND_NNP C._NNP M._NNP SEN_NNP GUPTA_NNP 147_CD During_IN the_DT experiment_NN the_DT experimental_JJ goats_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN separate_JJ sheds_NNS away_RB from_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS to_TO prevent_VB extraneous_JJ contamination_NN and_CC reinfestation_NN ._.
Four_CD of_IN these_DT received_VBN eight_CD injections_NNS on_IN alternate_JJ days_NNS of_IN approximately_RB 40_CD c.c_NNS ._.
per_IN hundred_CD pounds_NNS body_JJ weight_NN of_IN sterile_JJ sea_NN water_NN which_WDT was_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT sea_NN at_IN Madras_NNP ._.
The_DT goats_NNS were_VBD weighed_VBN before_IN and_CC after_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN sea_NN water_NN administered_VBD varied_JJ according_VBG to_TO the_DT body_NN weight_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
Likewise_RB ,_, another_DT group_NN of_IN four_CD mange_NN goats_NNS in_IN two_CD batches_NNS received_VBD a_DT series_NN of_IN seven_CD and_CC six_CD injections_NNS of_IN a_DT 2.3_CD per_IN cent_NN solution_NN of_IN sodium_NN chloride_NN in_IN distilled_JJ water_NN ,_, i.e._NN ,_, the_DT strength_NN in_IN which_WDT sodium_NN chloride_NN was_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT sea_NN water_NN used_VBN ._.
In_IN both_DT the_DT groups_NNS ,_, half_PDT the_DT number_NN of_IN animals_NNS received_VBD the_DT inoculum_NN intravenously_RB and_CC the_DT other_JJ half_NN intraperitoneally_RB ._.
No_DT improvement_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS treated_VBD ._.
All_DT of_IN them_PRP died_VBD later_RB on_IN due_JJ to_TO continued_VB ill_JJ health_NN and_CC resulting_VBG weakness_NN ._.
The_DT result_NN of_IN this_DT experiment_NN is_VBZ tabulated_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.

40_CD 40_CD 148_CD STUDIES_NNPS ON_NNP MANGE_NNP MITES_NNP OF_NNP LIVESTOCK_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, Tobacco_NNP leaves_VBZ and_CC lime_NN were_VBD soaked_VBN in_IN water_NN for_IN 48_CD hours_NNS and_CC the_DT infusion_NN wrung_NN through_IN a_DT piece_NN of_IN coarse_JJ muslin_NN ._.
Nicotine_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT tobacco_NN leaves_VBZ was_VBD es-_JJ timated_VBN at_IN 2.3_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT tobacco-lime_JJ infusion_NN at_IN 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN strength_NN did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT effect_NN on_IN mange_NN mites_NNS or_CC sheep_JJ ked_NNS but_CC proved_VBD effective_JJ against_IN biting_VBG lice_NN ._.
No_DT harmful_JJ effect_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT sheep_NN dressed_VBN with_IN this_DT infusion_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Studies_NNPS on_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ incidence_NN and_CC treatment_NN of_IN mange_NN in_IN various_JJ domestic_JJ animals_NNS have_VBP been_VBN conducted_VBN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP and_CC the_DT following_JJ observations_NNS are_VBP recorded_VBN :_: Mange_NNP infestation_NN is_VBZ definitely_RB seasonal_JJ and_CC is_VBZ almost_RB restricted_VBN to_TO a_DT few_JJ months_NNS in_IN the_DT year_NN viz._NN ,_, October_NNP to_TO March_NNP ,_, as_IN observed_VBN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP ._.
During_IN the_DT period_NN November_NNP 1949_CD to_TO March_NNP 1950_CD ,_, out_IN of_IN a_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN 130_CD goats_NNS ,_, 52_CD sheep_NN ,_, 165_CD cows_NNS ,_, 138_CD buffaloes_NNS ,_, 32_CD horses_NNS ,_, 53_CD dogs_NNS and_CC 7_CD cats_NNS examined_VBD for_IN mange_NN ,_, 22_CD goats_NNS 2_CD buffaloes_NNS and_CC 4_CD dogs_NNS were_VBD found_VBN positive_JJ ._.
Sarcoptes_NNS scabei_NNS and_CC Demodex_NNP folliculorum_NN were_VBD the_DT common_JJ species_NNS of_IN mites_NNS responsible_JJ for_IN mange_NN in_IN domestic_JJ animals_NNS at_IN Izatnagar_NNP ._.
Different_JJ strengths_NNS of_IN DDT_NNP ,_, Gammexane_NNP ,_, Derris_NNP root_NN powder_NN and_CC tobacco-lime_JJ infusion_NN were_VBD tried_VBN on_IN Sarcoptic_JJ mange_NN in_IN goats_NNS and_CC psoroptic_JJ mange_NN in_IN sheep_NN ._.
DDT_NNP had_VBD no_DT action_NN against_IN sarcoptic_JJ mange_NN mites_NNS but_CC a_DT 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN suspension_NN was_VBD found_VBN effective_JJ against_IN psoroptic_JJ mange_NN ._.
A_DT derris_JJ wash_NN was_VBD practically_RB ineffective_JJ against_IN Sarcoptis_NNP mites_NNS but_CC was_VBD found_VBN successful_JJ in_IN Psoroptes_NNP (_( one_CD out_IN of_IN two_CD tried_NNS )_) The_DT wash_NN in_IN 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 0.2_CD per_IN cent_NN strengths_NNS proved_VBD effective_JJ against_IN biting_VBG lice_NN and_CC sheep_NN ked_VBD respectively_RB ._.
A_DT ._.
2_CD per_IN cent_NN solution_NN of_IN Gammexane_NNP (_( D.025_NNP )_) proved_VBD to_TO be_VB an_DT effective_JJ cure_NN for_IN sarcoptic_JJ mange_NN in_IN goats_NNS ._.
Tobacco-lime_JJ infusion_NN at_IN 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
strength_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN mange_NN mites_NNS or_CC sheep_JJ ked_NNS but_CC was_VBD effective_JJ against_IN biting_VBG lice_NN ._.
Intravenous_JJ and_CC intraperitoneal_JJ injections_NNS of_IN sea_NN water_NN and_CC sodium_NN chloride_NN (_( 2.3_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) had_VBD no_DT beneficial_JJ effect_NN on_IN sarcoptic_JJ (_( 8_CD cases_NNS tried_VBN )_) or_CC demodectic_JJ mange_NN (_( one_CD case_NN tried_VBD )_) ._.
Mange_NNP infestation_NN is_VBZ more_RBR or_CC less_RBR common_JJ in_IN livestock_NN throughout_IN India_NNP ._.

Progress_NNP report_NN of_IN Benzene_NNP hexachloride_NN for_IN the_DT destruction_NN of_IN sheep_JJ scab_NN mitesTHE_NN PHARMACOLOGY_NNP OF_NNP GIGANTIN*_NNP By_IN V._NNP RATHNASABAPATHY_NNP ,_, B.V.SC._NNP ,_, and_CC V._NNP ISWARIAH_NNP ,_, B.A._NNP ,_, M.B.B.S._NNP ,_, M.R.C.P_NNP ._.
(_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 17_CD April_NNP 1951_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP VI152_NNP THE_NNP PHARMACOLOGY_NNP OF_NNP GIGANTIN_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, Perfusion_NNP of_IN mammalian_JJ hearts_NNS and_CC experiments_NNS with_IN isolated_JJ bits_NNS of_IN plain_NN muscles_NNS as_IN uterus_NN and_CC sheep_NN 's_POS carotid_JJ artery_NN were_VBD done_VBN in_IN an_DT improved_JJ type_NN of_IN apparatus_NN ,_, invented_VBN by_IN Vareed_NNP and_CC Venkatachalam_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP which_WDT are_VBP in_IN use_NN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN for_IN over_IN ten_JJ years_NNS giving_VBG very_RB satisfactory_JJ results_NNS ._.
The_DT heart_NN perfusion_NN apparatus_NN consists_VBZ of_IN a_DT double_JJ walled_JJ flask_NN of_IN two_CD litres_NNS capacity_NN and_CC a_DT double_JJ sur-_NN faced_VBD condenser_NN about_IN 90_CD centi-meters_NNS long_RB ._.
The_DT heart_NN cannula_NN is_VBZ fixed_VBN to_TO the_DT lower_JJR end_NN of_IN the_DT condenser_NN ._.
Water_NN at_IN constant_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ carried_VBN through_IN the_DT double_JJ surfaced_VBN condenser_NN and_CC the_DT double_JJ walled_JJ flask_NN ._.
A_DT thermometer_NN inserted_VBN into_IN the_DT heart_NN cannula_NN registers_VBZ the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT perfusion_NN fluid_NN ._.
Injections_NNS of_IN drugs_NNS are_VBP usually_RB made_VBN into_IN the_DT bulb_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN cannula_NN which_WDT has_VBZ got_VBD a_DT capacity_NN of_IN about_IN 10_CD c.c_NN ._.
Drugs_NNS injected_VBN into_IN the_DT heart_NN cannula_NN are_VBP thus_RB diluted_VBN ten_JJ times_NNS in_IN the_DT bulb_NN ._.
The_DT apparatus_NN for_IN perfusing_VBG isolated_JJ uterus_NN ,_, intestines_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, consists_VBZ of_IN a_DT jacketed_JJ cylindrical_JJ bath_NN of_IN 100_CD c.c_NN ._.
capacity_NN with_IN three-way_JJ stop_NN cock_NN at_IN the_DT bottom_NN and_CC a_DT jacketed_JJ two_CD litres_NNS flask_VBP ,_, connected_VBN together_RB ._.
Water_NN at_IN constant_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ run_VBN through_IN the_DT outer_JJ jackets_NNS ._.
Drugs_NNS when_WRB added_VBN into_IN the_DT bath_NN are_VBP diluted_VBN 100_CD times_NNS ._.
Perfusion_NN of_IN kidney_NN was_VBD done_VBN in_IN the_DT Dixtion_NNP 's_POS apparatus_NN ._.
Experimental_NNP data_NNS Toxicity_NNP ._.
A_DT precised_JJ L.D_NNP ._.
50_CD was_VBD not_RB worked_VBN out_RP ._.
But_CC it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN a_DT intravenous_JJ dose_NN of_IN 0.3_CD mg._NNS per_IN kg_NN ._.
was_VBD invariably_RB fatal_JJ to_TO majority_NN of_IN the_DT dogs_NNS in_IN 15_CD to_TO 30_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT toxic_NN symptoms_NNS may_MD be_VB divided_VBN for_IN convenience_NN into_IN three_CD groups_NNS ._.
In_IN lethal_JJ doses_NNS there_EX was_VBD frequent_JJ emesis_NN of_IN biletinged_VBN frothy_JJ fluid_NN ,_, distressed_JJ look_NN ,_, great_JJ exhaustion_NN and_CC death_NN in_IN about_RB 15_CD to_TO 20_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT heart_NN beat_NN was_VBD highly_RB accelerated_VBN with_IN indistinct_JJ sounds_NNS resulting_VBG in_IN fibrillation_NN and_CC cardiac_JJ failure_NN ._.
Pulse_NNP and_CC respiration_NN were_VBD accelerated_VBN throughout_IN but_CC respiration_NN was_VBD dyspnoeic_JJ and_CC oral_JJ ._.
On_IN post_NN mortem_NN the_DT liver_NN was_VBD highly_RB congested_VBN ,_, enlarged_VBN and_CC friable_JJ ._.
The_DT cortex_NN of_IN the_DT kidney_NN was_VBD slightly_RB congested_VBN ._.
There_EX was_VBD nothing_NN abnormal_NN in_IN other_JJ organs_NNS ._.
All_PDT the_DT tissues_NNS were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO histopathological_JJ examination_NN ._.
Except_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC kidneys_NNS ,_, all_PDT the_DT other_JJ tissues_NNS were_VBD normal_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT liver_NN there_RB was_VBD widening_VBG sinusoidal_JJ spaces_NNS ,_, the_DT branches_NNS of_IN the_DT portal_JJ veins_NNS were_VBD engorged_VBN ._.
But_CC there_EX was_VBD no_DT definite_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT liver_NN parenchyma_NN ._.
The_DT blood_NN vessels_NNS in_IN the_DT cortex_NN of_IN the_DT kidney_NN were_VBD engorged_VBN and_CC the_DT glomerular_JJ tufts_NNS were_VBD congested_VBN ._.
Tubu-_JJ lar_NN epethelia_NN showed_VBD clowdy_JJ degeneration_NN ._.
In_IN doses_NNS that_WDT are_VBP toxic_JJ ,_, but_CC not_RB lethal_JJ ,_, there_EX was_VBD frequent_JJ emesis_NN of_IN bile-tinged_JJ frothy_JJ fluid_NN ,_, dyspnoea_NN ,_, distressed_JJ look_NN ,_, brady-cardia_NN ,_, weak_JJ pulse_NN and_CC accelerated_JJ respiration_NN ._.
But_CC gradual_JJ recovery_NN took_VBD place_NN in_IN an_DT hour_NN ._.
In_IN physiological_JJ doses_NNS ,_, i.e._NN ,_, 0.05_CD mg._NN per_IN kg._NN ,_, there_EX were_VBD no_DT apparent_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN and_CC heart_NN beat_NN ;_: but_CC the_DT beats_NNS were_VBD more_RBR powerful_JJ ,_, pulse_JJ full_JJ and_CC strong_JJ ._.

Note_VB the_DT persistent_JJ rise_NN in_IN the_DT B._NNP P._NNP and_CC the_DT correspond-_JJ ing_NN decrease_NN in_IN the_DT spleen_JJ volume_NN ,_, after_IN an_DT injection_NN of_IN 0.25_CD mg._NN of_IN gigantin_NN ._.

Vol_NNP XXII_NNP ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ]_NNP [_NNP NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_FW A_DT record_NN of_IN the_DT ventricular_JJ movements_NNS of_IN a_DT perfused_JJ kitten_NN 's_POS heart_NN ,_, with_IN 1_CD :_: 2,00,000_CD concentration_NN of_IN gigantin_NN in_IN the_DT perfusion_NN fluid_NN ._.
(_( TimeJune_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN V._NNP RATHNASABAPHATY_NNP AND_NNP V._NNP ISWARI_NNP 155_CD minute_NN ._.
The_DT auricles_NNS and_CC the_DT ventricles_NNS were_VBD beating_VBG in_IN unision_NN so_RB far_RB ._.
After_IN this_DT the_DT ventricles_NNS were_VBD reduced_VBN in_IN rate_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT auricles_NNS were_VBD maintaining_VBG their_PRP$ normal_JJ rate_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT single_JJ ventricular_NN response_NN for_IN every_DT two_CD or_CC more_JJR auricular_JJ beats_NNS ._.
After_IN some_DT time_NN ,_, complete_JJ block_NN developed_VBD resulting_VBG in_IN the_DT ventricles_NNS having_VBG their_PRP$ own_JJ rhythm_NN and_CC final_JJ arrest_NN in_IN diastole_NN (_( Plate_NNP X_NNP )_) ._.
The_DT drug_NN 1_CD :_: 2,00,000_CD concentration_NN caused_VBD an_DT initial_JJ increase_NN ,_, then_RB a_DT slowing_NN of_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN ._.
By_IN perfusion_NN with_IN normal_JJ Locke_NNP 's_POS solution_NN at_IN this_DT stage_NN ,_, apparently_RB the_DT normal_JJ rhythm_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN was_VBD restored_VBN ._.
But_CC on_IN repeating_VBG the_DT dose_NN ,_, heart_NN block_NN was_VBD produced_VBN in_IN three_CD minutes_NNS ,_, the_DT ventricles_NNS responding_VBG for_IN every_DT two_CD or_CC more_JJR auricular_JJ beats_NNS only_RB ._.
The_DT ventricles_NNS become_VBP irregular_JJ and_CC were_VBD arrested_VBN ._.
Similar_JJ changes_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN even_RB in_IN the_DT auricles_NNS with_IN regular_JJ or_CC irregular_JJ intermissions_NNS ._.
Finally_RB ,_, they_PRP were_VBD also_RB arrested_VBN some_DT time_NN later_RB than_IN the_DT ventricular_JJ stand-still_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT chambers_NNS responded_VBD to_TO mechanical_JJ stimuli_NNS as_IN a_DT pin_NN prick_NN or_CC pinching_VBG with_IN fine_JJ forceps_NNS showing_VBG that_IN the_DT heart_NN muscle_NN was_VBD not_RB dead_JJ and_CC if_IN only_RB adequate_JJ stimuli_NNS reach_VBP them_PRP ,_, from_IN the_DT pace_NN maker_NN they_PRP would_MD continue_VB to_TO beat_VB ._.
Contractility_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT physiological_JJ dose_NN of_IN gigantin_NN ,_, the_DT heart_NN was_VBD initially_RB acce-_JJ lerated_VBN but_CC the_DT amplitude_NN was_VBD diminished_VBN ._.
This_DT phase_NN was_VBD only_RB transient_JJ ._.
Soon_RB the_DT rate_NN was_VBD slowed_VBN while_IN the_DT amplitude_NN was_VBD increased_VBN ._.
The_DT systolic_JJ contractions_NNS were_VBD quicker_JJR and_CC steeper_JJR whereas_IN the_DT relaxations_NNS were_VBD slower_JJR than_IN normal_JJ ._.
The_DT slowing_NN was_VBD due_JJ mainly_RB to_TO a_DT long_JJ rest_NN in_IN the_DT normal_JJ pause_NN ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN ampli-_JJ tude_NN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO systole_VB ,_, the_DT diastole_JJ being_VBG normal_JJ ._.
These_DT changes_NNS in_IN the_DT con-_JJ tractility_NN were_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT auricles_NNS also_RB but_CC not_RB to_TO a_DT marked_JJ degree_NN as_IN seen_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT ventricle_NN (_( Plate_NNP IX_NNP ,_, Fig_NNP ._.
c_NN )_) ._.
Cardiae_NNP out-put_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT physiological_JJ dose_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN ,_, the_DT rate_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN was_VBD slowed_VBN but_CC the_DT amplitude_NN and_CC force_NN of_IN contraction_NN were_VBD increased_VBN ._.
The_DT systolic_JJ contraction_NN was_VBD marked_VBN with_IN no_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT diastole_NN ._.
The_DT long_JJ pause_NN in_IN diastole_NN facilitated_VBD complete_JJ filling_NN of_IN the_DT ventricle_NN and_CC the_DT powerful_JJ systolic_JJ contractions_NNS emptied_VBD the_DT heart_NN perfectly_RB ._.
Thus_RB the_DT out-put_JJ per_IN beat_NN may_MD be_VB said_VBD to_TO be_VB increased_VBN ._.
The_DT slowing_NN of_IN the_DT rate_NN was_VBD thus_RB compensated_VBN for_IN by_IN the_DT increased_JJ pulse_NN volume_NN and_CC the_DT out-put_JJ per_IN minute_NN might_MD not_RB be_VB altered_VBN considerably_RB by_IN the_DT drug_NN ._.
Fixation_NN and_CC Cumulative_JJ effect_NN ._.
A_DT dose_NN of_IN 0.05_CD mg._NN of_IN gigantin_NN given_VBN in_IN the_DT bulb_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN cannula_NN slowed_VBD the_DT heart_NN and_CC increased_VBD the_DT force_NN and_CC contractions_NNS ._.
After_IN about_RB 30_CD minutes_NNS the_DT heart_NN was_VBD apparently_RB normal_JJ ,_, when_WRB a_DT dose_NN of_IN 0.025_CD mg._NN was_VBD injected_VBN again_RB into_IN the_DT heart_NN cannula_NN ._.
This_DT repetition_NN produced_VBD not_RB only_RB a_DT slowing_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN but_CC also_RB caused_VBD auriculo-ventricular_JJ heart_NN block_NN in_IN about_IN three_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT ventricles_NNS responded_VBD once_RB for_IN every_DT 2_CD or_CC more_JJR auricular_JJ systole_NN ._.
Finally_RB due_JJ to_TO complete_VB block_NN they_PRP developed_VBD ectopic_NN beats_NNS and_CC were_VBD arrested_VBN ._.
Thus_RB a_DT return_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN to_TO apparent_JJ normality_NN was_VBD not_RB an_DT indication_NN of_IN the_DT com-_JJ plete_JJ elimination_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN ,_, but_CC showed_VBD that_IN some_DT drug_NN has_VBZ been_VBN left_VBN behind_IN and_CC were_VBD eliminated_VBN very_RB slowly_RB ._.

per_IN stroke_NN ._.

given_VBN intravenously_RB did_VBD not_RB produce_VB any_DT appreciable_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT normal_JJ intestinal_JJ movements_NNS (_( Plate_NNP VIII_NNP )_) ._.

The_DT record_NN of_IN the_DT movements_NNS of_IN an_DT isolated_JJ uterus_NN of_IN rabbit_NN in_IN the_DT constant_JJ temperature_NN bath_NN showed_VBD a_DT good_JJ contraction_NN both_DT before_IN and_CC after_IN sympa-_JJ tholysis_NN with_IN ergotoxine_NN ,_, when_WRB 0.5_CD mg._NN of_IN gigantin_NN was_VBD added_VBN to_TO the_DT bath_NN ._.
Diuresis_NN ._.
Diuresis_NN in_IN an_DT anaesthetised_JJ dog_NN was_VBD measured_VBN both_DT before_IN and_CC after_IN gigantin_NN ._.
A_DT volume_NN 250_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN a_DT 10_CD per_IN cent_NN solution_NN of_IN cane_NN sugar_NN was_VBD given_VBN early_RB in_IN the_DT morning_NN by_IN stomach_NN tube_NN and_CC the_DT animal_NN allowed_VBD plenty_NN of_IN water_NN to_TO drink_VB ._.
It_PRP was_VBD anaesthetised_VBN by_IN paraldehyde_NN ,_, the_DT abdomen_NNS opened_VBD and_CC the_DT ureter_NN of_IN one_CD kidney_NN was_VBD cannulated_VBN and_CC the_DT urine_NN made_VBD to_TO drop_VB on_IN an_DT Inchley_NNP 's_POS drop_NN re-_NN corder_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD connected_VBN to_TO a_DT Mary_NNP tambour_NN ._.
Every_DT drop_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN on_IN the_DT drum_NN and_CC the_DT time_NN record_NN was_VBD also_RB made_VBN simultaneously_RB ._.
When_WRB the_DT drops_NNS per_IN minute_NN were_VBD uniform_JJ a_DT dose_NN of_IN gigantin_NN was_VBD given_VBN intravenously_RB and_CC the_DT number_NN of_IN drops_NNS per_IN minute_NN was_VBD counted_VBN after_IN the_DT drug_NN ._.
Rate:158_VB THE_NNP PHARMACOLOGY_NNP OF_NNP GIGANTIN_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT transient_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN drops_NNS recorded_VBN after_IN a_DT dose_NN of_IN 0.25_CD mg._NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN given_VBN intravenously_RB ._.
This_DT however_RB was_VBD not_RB sustained_VBN ._.
Action_NN on_IN respiration_NN Respiratory_NNP records_NNS taken_VBN by_IN tracheal_JJ cannulation_NN showed_VBD that_IN the_DT drug_NN did_VBD not_RB produce_VB any_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT normal_JJ respiration_NN ;_: but_CC where_WRB it_PRP was_VBD already_RB depressed_VBN a_DT stimulation_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP Gigantin_NNP given_VBN intravenously_RB to_TO anaesthetised_JJ dogs_NNS produced_VBD a_DT persistent_JJ rise_NN of_IN blood_NN pressure_NN which_WDT is_VBZ not_RB abolished_VBN by_IN ergotoxine_NN or_CC decerebration_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT above_JJ experimental_NN data_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ thought_VBN that_IN the_DT rise_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN both_DT on_IN the_DT heart_NN and_CC the_DT splanchnic_JJ vessels_NNS ._.
The_DT action_NN on_IN the_DT heart_NN is_VBZ direct_JJ on_IN the_DT musculature_NN and_CC independant_NN of_IN the_DT central_JJ or_CC peripheral_JJ nervous_JJ mechanism_NN as_IN the_DT same_JJ is_VBZ produced_VBN in_IN isolated_JJ and_CC atropinised_JJ hearts_NNS ._.
Both_DT hearts_NNS in_IN situ_NN and_CC isolated_JJ behave_VBP similarly_RB to_TO gigantin_VB ._.
In_IN all_DT doses_VBZ the_DT rate_NN is_VBZ accelerated_VBN in_IN the_DT beginning_NN ,_, later_RB slowed_VBN ._.
The_DT amplitude_NN is_VBZ normal_JJ in_IN the_DT early_JJ part_NN but_CC later_RB increased_VBD ._.
The_DT increase_NN is_VBZ due_JJ mainly_RB to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT systolic_JJ level_NN ,_, the_DT diastole_NN being_VBG either_CC normal_JJ or_CC slightly_RB deficient_JJ ._.
The_DT initial_JJ increase_NN followed_VBN by_IN as_IN showing_NN of_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN under_IN gigantin_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO some_DT changes_NNS effected_VBN in_IN the_DT pace_NN maker_NN ,_, for_IN ,_, the_DT whole_JJ heart_NN muscle_NN is_VBZ involved_VBN in_IN this_DT action_NN ._.
The_DT irregularities_NNS of_IN the_DT rhythm_NN in_IN the_DT toxic_JJ phase_NN is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT heart_NN block_NN ,_, for_IN the_DT ventricles_NNS beat_VBP once_RB for_IN every_DT two_CD or_CC more_JJR auricular_JJ beats_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ followed_VBN after_IN a_DT time_NN by_IN a_DT complete_JJ block_NN when_WRB the_DT ventri-_JJ cles_NNS develop_VB their_PRP$ own_JJ rhythm_NN ,_, become_VB irregular_JJ and_CC get_VB arrested_VBN ._.
The_DT final_JJ stand-_NN still_RB of_IN the_DT ventricles_NNS is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT failure_NN of_IN effective_JJ stimuli_NNS reaching_VBG them_PRP and_CC not_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT death_NN of_IN the_DT muscle_NN ,_, since_IN the_DT muscle_NN responds_VBZ to_TO mechanical_JJ stimuli_NNS even_RB after_IN the_DT ventricular_JJ arrest_NN ._.
The_DT conduction_NN thus_RB is_VBZ first_JJ impaired_VBN in_IN the_DT auriculoventricular_JJ bundle_NN and_CC at_IN a_DT later_JJ stage_NN in_IN the_DT auricular_JJ fibres_NNS ._.
The_DT impulses_NNS started_VBN by_IN the_DT pace_NN maker_NN thus_RB fail_NN to_TO arouse_VB the_DT auricle_NN ,_, as_IN at_IN a_DT previous_JJ stage_NN impulses_NNS which_WDT reach_VBP the_DT auricles_NNS fail_VBP to_TO reach_VB the_DT ventricles_NNS ._.
The_DT auricles_NNS and_CC ventricles_NNS in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN impulses_NNS to_TO contract_NN develop_VB ectopic_NN rhythm_NN and_CC when_WRB a_DT number_NN of_IN successive_JJ impulses_NNS fail_VBP ,_, prolonged_JJ and_CC final_JJ stand_NN still_RB results_NNS ._.
Finally_RB the_DT pace_NN maker_NN may_MD be_VB slowed_VBN and_CC arrested_VBN ._.
The_DT two_CD factors_NNS which_WDT comprise_VBP the_DT action_NN of_IN gigantin_NN are_VBP slowing_VBG and_CC increased_JJ contractility_NN ._.
The_DT slowing_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB due_JJ to_TO a_DT long_JJ rest_NN in_IN the_DT normal_JJ pause_NN ._.
The_DT increased_VBN contractility_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN by_IN the_DT increased_VBN systolic_JJ level_NN ,_, the_DT diastole_JJ being_VBG normal_JJ or_CC very_RB slightly_RB deficient_NN ._.
Further_RB the_DT systolic_JJ contractions_NNS were_VBD also_RB power-_JJ ful_JJ and_CC complete_JJ for_IN in_IN the_DT individual_JJ beats_NNS after_IN gigantin_NN ,_, the_DT systolic_JJ excursion_NN of_IN the_DT liver_NN is_VBZ quicker_JJR ,_, steeper_JJR and_CC higher_JJR than_IN normal_JJ ._.
When_WRB the_DT diastole_NN is_VBZ normal_JJ ,_, while_IN the_DT contraction_NN is_VBZ greater_JJR the_DT extent_NN of_IN movement_NN and_CC the_DT volume_NN of_IN blood_NN expelled_VBN are_VBP of_IN course_NN greater_JJR ._.
June_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN V._NNP RATHNASABAPHATY_NNP AND_NNP V._NNP ISWARI_NNP 159_CD In_IN a_DT physiological_JJ dose_NN the_DT work_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN is_VBZ greatly_RB improved_VBN ._.
Work_NN done_VBN in_IN a_DT unit_NN of_IN time_NN is_VBZ the_DT product_NN of_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN beat_NN and_CC pulse_JJ volume_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT rate_NN is_VBZ slowed_VBN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN ,_, the_DT out-put_JJ per_IN beat_NN (_( pulse_JJ volume_NN )_) is_VBZ the_DT chief_JJ point_NN at_IN issue_NN and_CC this_DT depends_VBZ upon_IN the_DT relative_JJ development_NN of_IN systolic_JJ contractions_NNS and_CC diastolic_JJ relaxations_NNS ._.
If_IN the_DT contractions_NNS become_VBP more_JJR complete_JJ and_CC relaxations_NNS unchanged_JJ the_DT pulse_JJ volume_NN is_VBZ naturally_RB greater_JJR ._.
Though_IN the_DT out-put_NN was_VBD not_RB measured_VBN in_IN these_DT experiments_NNS ,_, but_CC only_RB the_DT muscular_JJ contractions_NNS it_PRP may_MD be_VB inferred_VBN that_IN the_DT pulse_NN volume_NN is_VBZ increased_VBN correspondingly_RB ._.
But_CC the_DT work_NN done_VBN per_IN minute_NN might_MD not_RB be_VB increased_VBN as_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN pulse_JJ volume_NN is_VBZ compensated_VBN for_IN by_IN the_DT slowing_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT diseased_JJ or_CC irregular_JJ heart_NN where_WRB more_JJR rest_NN is_VBZ ensured_VBN without_IN affecting_VBG the_DT minute_NN volume_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB said_VBD that_IN the_DT drug_NN increases_VBZ the_DT efficiency_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN ._.
In_IN toxic_JJ doses_NNS ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT question_NN of_IN efficiency_NN for_IN when_WRB heart_NN block_NN develops_VBZ it_PRP is_VBZ obvious_JJ that_IN the_DT out-put_JJ per_IN minute_NN is_VBZ definitely_RB less_RBR ._.
Gigantin_NNP seems_VBZ to_TO posses_VB cumulative_JJ properties_NNS for_IN the_DT same_JJ physiological_JJ dose_NN repeated_VBD when_WRB the_DT heart_NN apparently_RB returns_VBZ to_TO normal_JJ produces_NNS toxic_NN symptoms_NNS ._.
The_DT apparent_JJ return_NN of_IN normality_NN is_VBZ therefore_RB not_RB an_DT indication_NN that_IN the_DT whole_JJ drug_NN has_VBZ been_VBN eleminated_VBN but_CC something_NN is_VBZ left_VBN behind_IN which_WDT in_IN conjunction_NN with_IN a_DT subsequent_JJ physiological_NN dose_NN ,_, makes_VBZ up_RP a_DT toxic_NN dose_NN ._.
In_IN addition_NN the_DT drug_NN gets_VBZ fixed_VBN in_IN the_DT heart_NN muscle_NN as_IN seen_VBN by_IN the_DT persistence_NN of_IN the_DT action_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN on_IN isolated_JJ perfused_JJ heart_NN ,_, even_RB by_IN subsequent_JJ perfusion_NN with_IN normal_JJ Locke_NNP 's_POS solution_NN for_IN a_DT prolonged_JJ time_NN ._.
As_IN seen_VBN from_IN the_DT experimental_JJ data_NN the_DT rise_NN of_IN blood_NN pressure_NN may_MD be_VB ascribed_VBN partly_RB due_JJ to_TO constriction_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN vessels_NNS of_IN the_DT splanchnic_JJ area_NN ._.
The_DT volume_NN of_IN spleen_JJ and_CC kidney_NN showed_VBD a_DT marked_JJ decrease_NN ._.
Perfusion_NN of_IN isolated_JJ organs_NNS ,_, liver_NN and_CC kidney_NN indicate_VBP a_DT constriction_NN of_IN the_DT vessels_NNS leading_VBG to_TO a_DT diminished_JJ out-_JJ flow_NN of_IN the_DT perfusion_NN fluid_NN from_IN the_DT veins_NNS ._.
The_DT action_NN on_IN the_DT kidney_NN vessels_NNS were_VBD however_RB slight_JJ ._.
The_DT coronary_JJ vessels_NNS were_VBD neither_RB dilated_VBN nor_CC constricted_VBN ._.
The_DT action_NN on_IN the_DT vessels_NNS is_VBZ direct_JJ on_IN the_DT muscular_JJ tissue_NN of_IN the_DT arteries_NNS and_CC not_RB nervous_JJ in_IN action_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT same_JJ is_VBZ produced_VBN in_IN isolated_JJ bits_NNS of_IN arterial_JJ muscles_NNS even_RB after_IN sym-_JJ patholysis_NN by_IN ergotoxine_NN ._.
To_TO find_VB out_RP if_IN it_PRP has_VBZ got_VBN uniform_JJ action_NN on_IN all_DT plain_NN muscles_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD tried_VBN on_IN the_DT uterine_NN and_CC the_DT intestinal_JJ muscles_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN it_PRP has_VBZ direct_JJ action_NN on_IN the_DT uterine_JJ musculature_NN only_RB and_CC has_VBZ no_DT action_NN on_IN intestinal_JJ musculature_NN ._.
The_DT transient_JJ increase_NN in_IN diuresis_NN produced_VBN by_IN the_DT drug_NN is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT concomittant_JJ rise_NN of_IN the_DT general_JJ blood_NN pressure_NN and_CC increased_VBD flow_NN of_IN blood_NN through_IN the_DT kidneys_NNS which_WDT is_VBZ not_RB of_IN great_JJ therapuetic_JJ value_NN ._.
Gigantin_NNP has_VBZ no_DT action_NN on_IN normal_JJ respiration_NN ._.
But_CC it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN that_IN it_PRP stimulates_VBZ the_DT respiration_NN both_DT in_IN rate_NN and_CC depth_NN where_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ already_RB depressed_VBN ._.
The_DT slowing_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN ,_, increased_VBD contractility_NN ,_, cumulation_NN are_VBP all_DT charac-_JJ teristics_NNS of_IN the_DT digitalis_JJ series_NN of_IN drugs_NNS and_CC in_IN these_DT gigantin_NNS resembles_VBZ them_PRP ._.

Further_RB ,_, there_EX was_VBD no_DT apparent_JJ decrease_NN in_IN fertility_NN with_IN age_NN of_IN semen_NNS up_IN to-_JJ 76_CD hours_NNS at_IN Montgomery_NNP and_CC Patna_NNP centres_NNS ._.
At_IN Calcutta_NNP Centre_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, there_EX is_VBZ an_DT indication_NN of_IN lowered_JJ fertility_NN with_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN aged_JJ semen_NNS ._.
The_DT latter_JJ results_NNS confirm_VBP the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Milovanov_NNP and_CC Kulesova_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP ,_, who_WP found_VBD a_DT reduction_NN of_IN 15_CD to_TO 20_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN pregnancies_NNS after_IN 48_CD to_TO 96_CD hours_NNS of_IN storage_NN at_IN 5°_CD to_TO 8°C_CD ,_, and_CC Underbjerg_NNP ,_, Davis_NNP and_CC Spangler_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NN who_WP ,_, using_VBG both_DT diluted_VBN and_CC neat_JJ semen_NNS ,_, found_VBD a_DT marked_JJ increase_NN in_IN service_NN rates_NNS with_IN semen_NNS stored_VBN for_IN more_JJR than_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
As_IN opposed_VBN to_TO this_DT ,_, and_CC in_IN line_NN with_IN the_DT findings_NNS at_IN Montgomery_NNP and_CC Patna_NNP Centres_NNP ,_, Willett_NNP ,_, Fuller_NNP and_CC Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD no_DT important_JJ deviation_NN upto_JJ 96_CD hours_NNS ,_, with_IN semen_NNS stored_VBN in_IN yolk-_JJ phosphate_NN diluent_NN ._.
Their_PRP$ data_NNS covered_VBD 1,500_CD inseminations_NNS and_CC as_IN in_IN our_PRP$ studies_NNS ,_, only_RB sperm_VBZ not_RB less_JJR than_IN +++_JJ motility_NN rating_NN were_VBD used_VBN ._.
Salisbury_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ,_, 1943_CD ,_, and_CC 1944_CD ]_NN reported_VBD a_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN conception_NN with_IN semen_NNS stored_VBN in_IN yolk-_JJ citrate_NN and_CC yolk-phosphate_JJ diluents_NNS for_IN as_RB long_RB as_IN 5_CD days_NNS ;_: further_RB ,_, using_VBG different_JJ rates_NNS of_IN dilution_NN no_DT detectable_JJ effect_NN on_IN fertility_NN level_NN with_IN dilution_NN rate_NN as_RB high_JJ as_IN 1_CD :_: 100_CD (_( without_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN sulpha_NN drugs_NNS )_) was_VBD observed_VBN by_IN Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ;_: Salisbury_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_JJ 1943_CD ;_: 1945_CD ]_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN sulpha_NN drugs_NNS ,_, the_DT dilution_NN rate_NN could_MD be_VB further_RB increased_VBN [_JJ Salisbury_NNP and_CC Bratton_NNP ;_: 1948_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN our_PRP$ data_NNS are_VBP incomplete_JJ in_IN many_JJ respects_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT number_NN of_IN inseminations_NNS performed_VBN using_VBG stored_JJ semen_NNS is_VBZ comparatively_RB small_JJ ,_, no_DT conclusions_NNS are_VBP drawn_VBN at_IN present_NN on_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN age_NN of_IN stored_JJ semen_NNS on_IN fertility_NN ._.
September_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP 175_CD TABLE_NNP VI_NNP ._.

Report_NN on_IN the_DT Development_NNP of_IN the_DT Cattle_NNP and_CC Dairy_NNP Industries_NNP of_IN India_NNP ._.
Published_VBN by_IN Manager_NNP of_IN Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP Publications_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP 'REACTION-TIME_POS '_POS AND_CC SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP GOATS_NNP By_IN D._NNP D._NNP SHUKLA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 16_CD January_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN one_CD text-figure_NN )_) IN_NNP recent_JJ years_NNS several_JJ investigations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP into_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN seasons_NNS on_IN the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN by_IN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP and_CC Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP working_VBG with_IN Indian_JJ bulls_NNS and_CC rams_NNS respectively_RB that_IN the_DT semen_JJ qualities_NNS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS vary_VBP in_IN different_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
They_PRP have_VBP found_VBN that_IN high_JJ air_NN temperature_NN associated_VBN with_IN high_JJ relative_JJ humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN as_RB found_VBN in_IN autumn_NN (_( i.e._FW ,_, from_IN August_NNP to_TO October_NNP )_) has_VBZ an_DT adverse_JJ effect_NN on_IN semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN these_DT two_CD species_NNS of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS ._.
Little_JJ information_NN is_VBZ available_JJ regarding_VBG the_DT seasonal_JJ influence_NN on_IN semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN goats_NNS ._.
Phillips_NNP et_CC al._NN ,_, [_JJ 1943_CD ]_NN studied_VBD the_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN bucks_NNS of_IN Saanen_NNP and_CC Toggenburg_NNP breeds_NNS at_IN Maryland_NNP (_( U._NNP S_NNP ._.
A_DT ._. )_) ._.
Their_PRP$ observations_NNS were_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, limited_VBD to_TO only_RB two_CD bucks_NNS ,_, one_CD of_IN each_DT breed_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT scanty_NN information_NN available_JJ in_IN respect_NN of_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ goat_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN desirable_JJ to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN different_JJ seasons_NNS on_IN its_PRP$ semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP ._.
Experimental_JJ animals_NNS consisted_VBD of_IN eight_CD goats_NNS purchased_VBN from_IN the_DT local_JJ market_NN They_PRP were_VBD all_DT mature_NN bucks_NNS between_IN two_CD to_TO three_CD years_NNS of_IN age_NN at_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
Before_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN they_PRP were_VBD trained_VBN to_TO mount_VB an_DT anoestrous_JJ doe_NN and_CC ejaculate_JJ semen_NNS in_IN artificial_JJ vagina_NN ._.
Throughout_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN under_IN the_DT same_JJ managerial_JJ and_CC dietary_JJ conditions_NNS as_IN reported_VBN for_IN rams_NNS by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
Two_CD collections_NNS of_IN semen_NNS at_IN an_DT interval_NN of_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN each_DT animal_NN every_DT fortnight_NN for_IN two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ,_, and_CC under_IN the_DT same_JJ climatological_JJ conditions_NNS under_IN which_WDT Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP and_CC Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP respectively_RB observed_VBD seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN bulls_NNS and_CC rams_NNS ._.
Each_DT semen_NNS sample_NN was_VBD examined_VBN for_IN the_DT following_JJ characteristics_NNS :_: (_( 1_CD )_) Colour_NNPS and_CC consistency_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Initial_NNP motility_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) pH_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
(_( 5_CD )_) Sperm_NNP concentration_NN per_IN ml_NN ._.
of_IN semen_NNS ._.
(_( 6_CD )_) Total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN and_CC (_( 7_CD )_) Percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
179_CD 4_CD 180_CD SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP GOATS_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, Besides_IN the_DT above_NN mentioned_VBD physical_JJ characteristics_NNS ,_, '_'' reaction-time_JJ '_NNS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS was_VBD also_RB noted_VBN as_IN in_IN rams_NN [_NNP Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP ]_NNP ._.
Colour_NNP and_CC consistency_NN were_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT visual_JJ appearance_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
Volume_NN was_VBD measured_VBN upto_JJ 1/100_CD of_IN ml_NN ._.
Initial_JJ motility_NN was_VBD scored_VBN according_VBG to_TO the_DT criteria_NNS of_IN Erb_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, [_JJ 1942_CD ]_NN ._.
Hydrogenion_NNP concentration_NN of_IN semen_NNS was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN B._NNP D._NNP H._NNP capillator_NN ._.
Sperm_NNP cencentration_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT usual_JJ haemacyto-_JJ meter_NN method_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT determination_NN of_IN percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN the_DT method_NN as_IN adopted_VBN by_IN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP was_VBD followed_VBN ._.
For_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN seasons_NNS on_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC semen_NNS quality_NN ,_, the_DT local_JJ seasons_NNS were_VBD distinguished_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: September_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP D._NNP SHUKLA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 181_CD [_NNP NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_$ 182_CD [_JJ September_NNP ,_, 1952_CD 182_CD SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP GOATS_NNP [_NNP September_NNP ,_, 1952_CD TABLE_NN I_PRP Average_VBP monthly_JJ variation_NN in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC semen_NNS characteristics_NNS of_IN goats_NNS 1945-46_JJ 1946-47_JJ J_NNP F_NNP M_NNP A_NNP M_NNP J_NNP J_NNP A_NNP S_NNP O_NNP N_NNP D_NNP J_NNP F_NNP M_NNP A_NNP M_NNP J_NNP J_NNP A_NNP S_NNP O_NNP N_NNP D_NNP Reaction.time_NNP (_( in_IN seconds_NNS )_) 98_CD 68_CD 44_CD 66_CD 30_CD 43_CD 45_CD 66_CD 58_CD 62_CD 59_CD 45_CD 56_CD 49_CD 47_CD 50_CD 38_CD 45_CD 22_CD 48_CD 46_CD 42_CD 43_CD 40_CD Colour_NNPS and_CC consistency_NN of_IN semen_NNS Th.C_NNP ._.

The_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN of_IN this_DT goat_NN was_VBD inferior_JJ to_TO goat_VB 3_CD and_CC 164_CD which_WDT had_VBD the_DT highest_JJS sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
The_DT low_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN of_IN goat_NN 160_CD in_IN spite_NN of_IN high_JJ sperm_NNS concentration_NN might_MD be_VB due_JJ amongst_IN other_JJ causes_NNS to_TO the_DT highest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN found_VBN in_IN this_DT animal_NN ._.
Initial_JJ motility_NN of_IN goat_NN 164_CD did_VBD not_RB significantly_RB differ_VBP from_IN that_DT of_IN 168_CD ,_, but_CC it_PRP was_VBD significantly_RB lower_JJR than_IN the_DT rest_NN ,_, except_IN goat_NN ._.
160_CD ._.
The_DT low_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN of_IN this_DT goat_NN inspite_NN of_IN the_DT highest_JJS sperm_NN concentration_NN than_IN of_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS might_MD also_RB be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN which_WDT are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO be_VB less_JJR motile_NN than_IN the_DT normal_JJ ones_NNS ._.
Goats_NNS 2_CD ,_, 3_CD and_CC 1_CD had_VBD high_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN which_WDT might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN goats_VBZ 2_CD and_CC 1_CD had_VBD high_JJ sperm_JJ concentration_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN low_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
The_DT reason_NN for_IN goat_NN 3_CD showing_VBG high_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN inspite_NN of_IN high_JJ abnormality_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN might_MD be_VB its_PRP$ high_JJ sperm_JJ con-_JJ centration_NN ._.
The_DT higher_JJR initial_JJ motility_NN of_IN goats_NNS 137_CD and_CC 169_CD in_IN comparison_NN with_IN 160_CD and_CC 164_CD might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO their_PRP$ lower_JJR percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN in_IN spite_NN of_IN their_PRP$ lower_JJR sperm_NN concentration_NN than_IN of_IN the_DT latter_JJ goats_NNS ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN initial_JJ motility_NN rating_NN ,_, as_IN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN by_IN direct_JJ microscopical_JJ examina-_JJ tion_NN ,_, depends_VBZ not_RB only_RB on_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN but_CC also_RB on_IN the_DT abnormality_NN of_IN sper-_JJ matozoa_NN ._.
Abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN are_VBP comparatively_RB less_RBR motile_JJ than_IN the_DT normal_JJ ones_NNS and_CC an_DT increase_NN or_CC decrease_NN in_IN their_PRP$ numbers_NNS might_MD also_RB affect_VB the_DT motility_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
September_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP D._NNP SHUKLA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 187_CD Average_NNP pH_NN of_IN semen_NNS of_IN goats_NNS 3_CD and_CC 164_CD was_VBD significantly_RB lower_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN others_NNS ._.
Associated_VBN with_IN low_JJ pH_NN ,_, high_JJ sperm_NN concentration_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN them_PRP ._.
Again_RB ,_, goats_NNS 137_CD and_CC 169_CD having_VBG higher_JJR pH_NN than_IN others_NNS showed_VBD the_DT lowest_JJS sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_DT high_JJ pH_NN was_VBD associated_VBN with_IN lower_JJR sperm_NN concentration_NN in_IN goats_NNS ._.
Total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN has_VBZ been_VBN calculated_VBN by_IN multiplying_VBG sperm_JJ concen-_JJ tration_NN per_IN ml_NN ._.
of_IN semen_NNS and_CC the_DT total_JJ volume_NN of_IN the_DT ejaculate_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD expected_VBN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_IN the_DT goat_NN having_VBG the_DT smallest_JJS semen_JJ volume_NN but_CC higher_JJR sperm_JJ concen-_JJ tration_NN would_MD show_VB the_DT lower_JJR total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
This_DT has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB true_JJ in_IN case_NN of_IN goat_NN 164_CD ._.
Goat_NNP 169_CD had_VBD the_DT highest_JJS volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS and_CC inspite_NN of_IN its_PRP$ low_JJ sperm_JJ concentration_NN it_PRP had_VBD the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ signi-_JJ ficantly_RB higher_JJR than_IN all_DT except_IN goat_NN 3_CD ._.
Goats_NNS 160_CD ,_, 168_CD and_CC 1_CD did_VBD not_RB vary_VB in_IN their_PRP$ total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN as_IN there_EX was_VBD neither_DT significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN their_PRP$ total_JJ volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS nor_CC in_IN their_PRP$ sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
Between_NNP goats_NNS 2_CD and_CC 3_CD there_EX was_VBD no_DT significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN probably_RB because_IN the_DT difference_NN in_IN their_PRP$ volume_NN was_VBD very_RB little_JJ and_CC non-significant_JJ (_( 'although_IN there_EX was_VBD significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN their_PRP$ sperm_JJ concentration_NN '_POS )_) ._.
Critical_JJ difference_NN at_IN five_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN of_IN variable_JJ factors_NNS between_IN years_NNS is_VBZ presented_VBN in_IN Table_JJ V._NNP From_IN the_DT table_NN it_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN that_IN during_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN the_DT goats_NNS took_VBD significantly_RB lesser_JJR time_NN to_TO mount_VB an_DT anoestrous_JJ female_NN and_CC ejaculate_JJ semen_NNS in_IN artificial_JJ vagina_NN ._.
This_DT observation_NN is_VBZ in_IN complete_JJ agreement_NN with_IN that_DT in_IN rams_NNS by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT semen_NNS samples_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN had_VBD lower_JJR pH_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN in_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN was_VBD significantly_RB more_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN ._.
Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhatta-_NNP charya_NN [_NN 1947_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN in_IN rams_JJ semen_NNS quality_NN deteriorated_VBN in_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN as_IN indicated_VBN by_IN higher_JJR pH_NN ,_, lower_JJR sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, no_DT such_JJ clear_JJ indication_NN in_IN this_DT experi-_JJ ment_NN ._.
Critical_JJ difference_NN at_IN five_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN of_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC semen_NNS character-_JJ istics_NNS between_IN seasons_NNS is_VBZ presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VI_NNP ._.
From_IN the_DT table_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ evident_JJ that_IN in_IN summer_NN ,_, the_DT 'reaction-time_JJ '_NN was_VBD the_DT least_JJS of_IN all_DT the_DT seasons_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, no_DT relationship_NN between_IN the_DT 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC the_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS produced_VBN by_IN goats_NNS in_IN differenet_NN seasons_NNS ._.
Volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS in_IN winter_NN was_VBD significantly_RB lower_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT other_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
Semen_NNS samples_NNS as_IN judged_VBN by_IN initial_JJ motility_NN ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ,_, were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT best_JJS in_IN spring_NN and_CC worst_JJS in_IN autumn_NN ._.
DISCUSSGIN_NNP Reaction-time_NNP ._.
The_DT average_JJ 'reaction-time_JJ '_'' in_IN goats_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB higher_JJR than_IN that_DT observed_VBD in_IN rams_NNS by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
This_DT variation_NN in_IN 'reaction-time_NNP '_POS might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT difference_NN in_IN species_NNS between_IN goats_NNS and_CC rams_NNS ._.
As_IN found_VBN in_IN rams_NN ,_, there_EX did_VBD not_RB seem_VB to_TO exist_VB any_DT correlation_NN between_IN the_DT sex-drive_JJ and_CC sperm_JJ production_NN ._.
Summer_NNP which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT period_NN of_IN decline_NN in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN shows_NNS lower_JJR average_JJ 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC in_IN winter_NN which_WDT is_VBZ next_JJ best_JJS season_NN for_IN average_JJ sperm_JJ concentration_NN records_NNS the_DT highest_JJS 'reaction-time_JJ ._. '_''
188_CD SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP GOATS_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, Volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
No_DT work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN on_IN seasonal_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS in_IN goats_NNS ,_, excepting_VBG that_IN of_IN Phillips_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, [_JJ 1943_CD ]_NN who_WP used_VBD only_RB two_CD bucks_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ experiment_NN ._.
The_DT data_NN ,_, therefore_NN ,_, could_MD not_RB indicate_VB clearly_RB the_DT seasonal_JJ trend_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD in_IN this_DT study_NN are_VBP not_RB in_IN agreement_NN with_IN the_DT observations_NNS of_IN Phillips_NNP and_CC his_PRP$ co-workers_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO them_PRP highest_JJS average_JJ volume_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN in_IN fall_NN but_CC in_IN this_DT experiment_JJ highest_JJS average_JJ volume_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN summer_NN ._.
Spring_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT worst_JJS period_NN by_IN Phillips_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, for_IN semen_JJ volume_NN whereas_NNS in_IN this_DT experiment_NN the_DT lowest_JJS semen_JJ volume_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN winter_NN ._.
Initial_JJ motility_NN ._.
Results_NNS obatined_VBD in_IN the_DT present_JJ experiment_NN on_IN seasonal_JJ influence_NN on_IN motility_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN is_VBZ in_IN general_JJ agreement_NN with_IN those_DT found_VBN in_IN rams_NNS by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
But_CC they_PRP differ_VBP from_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Phillips_NNP and_CC his_PRP$ co-workers_NNS [_NN 1943_CD ]_NN in_IN goats_NNS who_WP obtained_VBD highest_JJS average_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN in_IN fall_NN and_CC lowest_JJS in_IN winter_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT experiment_NN spring_NN which_WDT showed_VBD highest_JJS initial_JJ motility_NN was_VBD also_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT best_JJS season_NN for_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
Autumn_NNP was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT worst_JJS season_NN for_IN initial_JJ motility_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN for_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
Initial_NNP motility_NN which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN estimated_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN by_IN direct_JJ microscopical_JJ examination_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS empirical_JJ method_NN of_IN determining_VBG motility_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ dependent_JJ not_RB only_RB on_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN but_CC also_RB on_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN as_IN found_VBN in_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT individual_JJ goats_NNS ._.
Further_RB more_RBR ,_, cold_JJ air_NN tempe-_JJ rature_NN as_IN obtained_VBN in_IN winter_NN decreases_VBZ the_DT initial_JJ motility_NN ._.
As_IN between_IN winter_NN and_CC summer_NN there_EX was_VBD no_DT significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ,_, the_DT low_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN in_IN winter_NN might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO cold_VB environmental_JJ temperature_NN ._.
HydrogenSeptember_NNP 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP D._NNP SHUKLA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 189_CD Total_NNP number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
The_DT result_NN of_IN analysis_NN of_IN data_NNS on_IN total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN showed_VBD that_IN it_PRP was_VBD lowest_VBN in_IN autumn_NN and_CC highest_JJS in_IN spring_NN ._.
This_DT result_NN agrees_VBZ with_IN that_DT obtained_VBN in_IN rams_NNS by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NN but_CC is_VBZ contrary_JJ to_TO the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Phillips_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, [_JJ 1943_CD ]_NN who_WP obtained_VBD highest_JJS average_JJ total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN in_IN summer_NN and_CC lowest_JJS in_IN spring_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN in_IN our_PRP$ result_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN Phillips_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO difference_NN in_IN climate_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD places_NNS or_CC due_JJ to_TO limited_JJ number_NN of_IN data_NNS on_IN which_WDT the_DT results_NNS of_IN Phillips_NNP and_CC his_PRP$ collaborators_NNS were_VBD based_VBN ._.
Percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
Results_NNS obtained_VBD on_IN seasonal_JJ variation_NN of_IN the_DT occurrences_NNS of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NNS are_VBP similar_JJ to_TO those_DT reported_VBN in_IN rams_NNS by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN summer_NN and_CC autumn_VB the_DT tailless_NN spermatozoa_NN and_CC in_IN winter_NN the_DT bent_NN tail_NN spermatozoa_NN were_VBD more_RBR in_IN the_DT ejaculates_NNS ._.
The_DT bent_NN tails_NNS have_VBP been_VBN indentified_VBN by_IN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1949_CD ]_NNP as_IN immature_NN forms_NNS of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
So_IN it_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN in_IN winter_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT rate_NN of_IN spermatogenesis_NN was_VBD higher_JJR than_IN in_IN autumn_NN and_CC summer_NN ,_, more_JJR of_IN these_DT immature_NN spermatozoa_NN were_VBD carried_VBN into_IN the_DT male_JJ reproductive_JJ tract_NN before_IN they_PRP came_VBD to_TO ampullae_VB for_IN ejectment_NN ._.
During_IN autumn_NN and_CC summer_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB poorer_JJR ,_, the_DT tailless_NN spermatozoa_NN were_VBD found_VBN more_RBR in_IN number_NN and_CC this_DT might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Seasonal_NNP variation_NN in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC semen_NNS characteristics_NNS of_IN eight_CD goats_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN for_IN two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ variations_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN among_IN goats_NNS in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS and_CC in_IN all_PDT the_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN semen_NNS studied_VBN except_IN its_PRP$ pH_NN which_WDT varied_VBD only_RB signi-_JJ ficantly_RB ._.
'Reaction-time_JJ '_'' in_IN summer_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB significantly_RB less_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT other_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
'Reaction-time_JJ '_'' was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB independent_JJ of_IN sperm_JJ production_NN ._.
Between_NNP years_NNS highly_RB significant_JJ variations_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_POS pH_NN '_POS ._.
of_IN semen_NNS and_CC total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
Between_JJ seasons_NNS highly_RB significant_JJ variations_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN initial_JJ motility_NN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN and_CC significant_JJ variations_NNS in_IN 'reaction-time_JJ '_'' ,_, volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS and_CC percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
The_DT semen_NNS quality_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB poorer_VBN in_IN autumn_NN and_CC richer_NN in_IN spring_NN ._.
Between_JJ months_NNS within_IN season_NN highly_RB significant_JJ variations_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN and_CC significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN initial_JJ motility_NN ._.

VOLUME_NNP CONTENTS_NNP IN_NNP RAMS_NNP AND_NNP GOATS_NNP By_IN D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP and_CC P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 5_CD January_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN two_CD text.figures_NNS )_) MUKHERJEE_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN there_EX exists_VBZ a_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN semen_JJ qualities_NNS and_CC haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN contents_NNS of_IN blood_NN in_IN bulls_NNS ._.
Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD and_CC 1948_CD ]_NN have_VBP also_RB observed_VBN seasonal_JJ trend_NN in_IN the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN rams_NNS and_CC goats_NNS ._.
The_DT present_JJ study_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO determine_VB if_IN the_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN ,_, in_IN sheep_JJ and_CC goat_NN follow_VBP a_DT seasonal_JJ trend_NN as_IN in_IN bulls_NNS ,_, and_CC if_IN so_RB ,_, how_WRB far_RB this_DT trend_NN follows_VBZ the_DT seasonal_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT semen_NNS of_IN these_DT species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS as_IN reported_VBN by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP Blood_NNP samples_NNS were_VBD drawn_VBN from_IN the_DT jugular_JJ vein_NN once_RB a_DT fortnight_NN from_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT 9_CD rams_NNS and_CC 8_CD male_NN goats_NNS for_IN determining_VBG the_DT haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN contents_NNS ._.
Haemoglobin_NNP was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN New_NNP Comer_NNP [_NN 1923_CD ]_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN by_IN that_DT of_IN Napier_NNP and_CC Das_NNP Gupta_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP ._.
During_IN the_DT entire_JJ experi-_JJ mental_NN period_NN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN under_IN uniform_JJ nutritional_JJ and_CC managerial_JJ conditions_NNS as_IN have_VBP already_RB been_VBN reported_VBN by_IN Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.

during_IN this_DT month_NN ,_, the_DT relative_JJ humidity_NN was_VBD almost_RB the_DT lowest_JJS and_CC rainfall_DT negligible_JJ ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN from_IN the_DT table_NN that_IN the_DT blood_NN samples_NNS were_VBD poorest_JJ with_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT two_CD charac-_JJ teristics_NNS in_IN autumn_NN ._.
In_IN spring_NN ,_, the_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS of_IN goats_NNS and_CC haemoglobin_NN contents_NNS in_IN rams_NNS were_VBD highest_JJS ._.
Although_IN ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN cell_NN volume_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN rams_NN was_VBD highest_JJS in_IN winter_NN it_PRP did_VBD not_RB differ_VB significantly_RB from_IN that_DT in_IN spring_NN ._.
Table_JJ V_NNP shows_VBZ variation_NN in_IN average_JJ air_NN temperature_NN ,_, humidity_NN in_IN different_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
