of_IN semen_NNS Total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ Autumn_NNP 1919_CD 1221_CD 1950_CD 1456_CD Winter_NN 2752_CD 1696_CD 2968_CD 1713_CD Spring_NN 2814_CD 1850_CD 3525_CD 2234_CD Summer_NN 2362_CD 1627_CD 2615_CD 1878_CD *Data_NN obtained_VBN through_IN the_DT courtesy_NN of_IN Mr._NNP D._NNP D._NNP Shukla_NNP and_CC Dr._NNP P._NNP Bhattacharya_NNP The_DT results_NNS presented_VBD above_IN show_NN that_IN the_DT trend_NN of_IN variation_NN in_IN the_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS and_CC semen_NNS characteristics_NNS during_IN different_JJ seasons_NNS in_IN rams_NNS and_CC goats_NNS were_VBD parallel_RB ._.
Furthermore_RB ,_, the_DT trend_NN of_IN seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT two_CD blood_NN constituents_NNS were_VBD the_DT same_JJ as_IN that_DT reported_VBD in_IN bulls_NNS by_IN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
Thus_RB ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN season_NN upon_IN the_DT blood_NN and_CC semen_NNS quality_NN was_VBD similar_JJ in_IN bulls_NNS ,_, rams_NNS ,_, and_CC goats_NNS ._.
In_IN these_DT species_NNS of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS ,_, high_JJ air_NN temperature_NN associated_VBN with_IN high_JJ humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN as_RB found_VBN in_IN autumn_NN brought_VBN about_IN a_DT deterioration_NN in_IN the_DT semen_NNS and_CC blood_NN characteristics_NNS studied_VBD ._.
In_IN spring_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN was_VBD moderate_JJ with_IN low_JJ humidity_NN and_CC scanty_NN rainfall_NN ,_, the_DT semen_NNS qualities_NNS improved_VBN and_CC the_DT blood_NN also_RB became_VBD richer_RB in_IN haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_IN the_DT mechanisms_NNS by_IN which_WDT air_NN tempera-_JJ ture_NN ,_, humidity_NN ,_, and_CC rainfall_VB affect_JJ reproductive_JJ function_NN and_CC blood_NN constituents_NNS in_IN bulls_NNS ,_, also_RB come_VBN into_IN play_NN in_IN rams_NNS and_CC goats_NNS ._.
September_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 197_CD SUMMARY_NNP Seasonal_NNP variation_NN in_IN haemoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN contents_NNS of_IN blood_NN from_IN 9_CD rams_NNS and_CC 8_CD male_NN goats_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN for_IN one_CD year_NN ._.
Haemoglobin_NNP and_CC cell_NN volume_NN contents_NNS of_IN blood_NN were_VBD highly_RB variable_JJ among_IN animals_NNS and_CC among_IN seasons_NNS ._.
In_IN both_DT rams_NNS and_CC goats_NNS haemoglobin_VBP content_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB highly_RB variable_JJ between_IN months_NNS within_IN seasons_NNS ._.
Cell_NNP volume_NN of_IN blood_NN in_IN goats_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO vary_VB significantly_RB between_IN months_NNS within_IN season_NN but_CC it_PRP was_VBD not_RB so_RB in_IN case_NN of_IN rams_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN in_IN these_DT animals_NNS ,_, the_DT seasonal_JJ trends_NNS in_IN semen_NNS attributes_NNS and_CC blood_NN constituents_NNS were_VBD similar_JJ ._.
The_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS and_CC blood_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB superior_JJ in_IN spring_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, from_IN February_NNP to_TO April_NNP and_CC inferior_JJ in_IN Autumn_NNP ,_, i.e._FW ,_, from_IN August_NNP to_TO October_NNP ._.

In_IN press_NN AVIAN_NNP SALMONELLOSIS_NNP STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP SALMONELLA_NNP GALLINARUM_NNP By_IN S._NNP B._NNP V._NNP RAO_NNP ,_, S._NNP NARAYAN_NNP ,_, D._NNP R._NNP RAMNANI_NNP and_CC J._NNP DAS_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD September_NNP 1951_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP XI_NNP to_TO XVI_VB )_) THE_NNP first_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN Salmonellosis_NNP due_JJ to_TO a_DT motile_JJ organism_NN in_IN a_DT commercial_JJ flock_NN of_IN fowls_NN in_IN India_NNP was_VBD recorded_VBN in_IN 1949_CD by_IN Iyer_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1950_CD ]_NN ._.
Prior_RB to_TO this_DT only_JJ once_RB S.gallinarum_NNP was_VBD recovered_VBN from_IN a_DT single_JJ hen_NN [_NNP Cooper_NNP and_CC Naik_NNP ,_, 1931_CD ]_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, duck_JJ Salmonellosis_NN was_VBD reported_VBN in_IN the_DT Army_NNP Development_NNP Farms_NNP by_IN Rao_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ._.
Hitherto_NNP India_NNP had_VBD been_VBN free_JJ from_IN S._NNP pullorum/gallinarum_NN infection_NN in_IN chickens_NNS though_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ prevalent_JJ all_RB over_IN the_DT world_NN ._.
An_DT extensive_JJ survey_NN initiated_VBN by_IN this_DT Section_NN in_IN 1945_CD revealed_VBD little_JJ evidence_NN of_IN its_PRP$ presence_NN in_IN most_JJS part_NN of_IN India_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT year_NN 1950_CD ,_, three_CD outbreaks_NNS of_IN Salmonellosis_NNP occurred_VBD in_IN widely_RB separated_VBN areas_NNS in_IN India_NNP ._.
Two_CD of_IN these_DT were_VBD due_JJ to_TO paratyphoid_VB organisms_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT third_JJ one_NN was_VBD caused_VBN by_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN ,_, the_DT fowl_NN typhoid_JJ organism_NN ._.
Fowl_NNP typhoid_NN is_VBZ a_DT disease_NN of_IN young_JJ adults_NNS rather_RB than_IN of_IN old_JJ birds_NNS and_CC much_RB less_JJR of_IN baby_NN chicks_NNS ._.
Brookes_NNS and_CC Rhodes_NNP [_NNP 1923_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN certain_JJ strains_NNS of_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN produced_VBN in_IN young_JJ chicks_NNS lesions_NNS indistinguishable_JJ from_IN those_DT of_IN S._NNP pullorum_JJ infection_NN ._.
In_IN North-Central_NNP U._NNP S._NNP A._NN the_DT disease_NN mainly_RB affects_VBZ young_JJ adults_NNS and_CC rarely_RB chicks_NNS [_VBP Bushnell_NNP ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN England_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ most_RBS common_JJ in_IN adults_NNS but_CC has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN recorded_VBN in_IN baby_NN chicks_NNS [_JJ Menzies_NNS ,_, 1947_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN South_NNP Africa_NNP the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ erratic_JJ ,_, attacking_VBG exclusively_RB one_CD breed_NN on_IN a_DT farm_NN or_CC only_RB chicks_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN others_NNS adults_NNS [_JJ Coles_NNP ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN Hawaii_NNP ,_, sporadic_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN acute_JJ form_NN in_IN chicks_NNS and_CC chronic_JJ form_NN in_IN adults_NNS are_VBP reported_VBN [_JJ Fitzgerald_NNP ,_, 1947_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN Australia_NNP adult_NN mortality_NN due_JJ to_TO S._NNP gallinarum_NN is_VBZ unknown_JJ [_NNP Leynen_NNP ,_, 1939_CD ]_NN ._.
Beudette_NNP [_NNP 1925_CD ]_NNP ,_, and_CC Komarov_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP isolated_VBD S._NNP gallinarum_NN from_IN the_DT yolks_NNS of_IN chicks_NNS and_CC ovaries_NNS of_IN the_DT adult_NN hens_NNS ._.
This_DT made_VBD them_PRP believe_VBP that_IN contact_NN infection_NN might_MD result_VB between_IN mature_NN birds_NNS and_CC carriers_NNS ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT infection_NN might_MD be_VB passed_VBN through_IN the_DT eggs_NNS ._.
Beach_NNP and_CC Davis_NNP [_NNP 1927_CD ]_NNP concluded_VBD that_IN trans-_JJ mission_NN through_IN the_DT egg_NN was_VBD possible_JJ in_IN the_DT light_NN of_IN their_PRP$ studies_NNS on_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN in_IN baby_NN chicks_NNS and_CC the_DT ovarian_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN adults_NNS ,_, the_DT latter_JJ being_VBG indistinguishable_JJ from_IN those_DT caused_VBN by_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN ._.
Egg_NN transmission_NN studies_NNS were_VBD made_VBN by_IN Simms_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP ,_, the_DT organism_NN being_VBG isolated_VBN from_IN yolks_NNS of_IN fertile_NN eggs_NNS ,_, dead_JJ embryos_NN ,_, ailing_VBG baby_NN chicks_NNS and_CC from_IN the_DT ovaries_NNS of_IN reactor_NN hens_NNS ._.
S._NNP gallinarum_NN closely_RB resembles_VBZ S._NNP pullorum_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO differentiate_VB them_PRP ._.
Van_NNP Heelsbergen_NNP [_NNP 1929_CD ]_NNP ,_, Manninger_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP ,_, Miessner_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP ,_, Haupt_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP ,_, Wagner_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP and_CC other_JJ European_JJ workers_NNS have_VBP considered_VBN the_DT two_CD organisms_JJ identical_JJ ._.
Smith_NNP [_NN 1915_CD ]_NN and_CC Smith_NNP and_CC Ten_NNP Brock_NNP [_NNP 1915_CD ]_NNP worked_VBD exhaustively_RB on_IN 199_CD 7_CD 200_CD STUDIES_NNPS ON_NNP SALMONELLA_NNP GALLINARUM_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, the_DT two_CD organisms_NNS and_CC ,_, while_IN recognising_VBG their_PRP$ similarity_NN as_IN regards_NNS their_PRP$ antigenic_JJ structure_NN ,_, noted_VBD the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT carbohydrate_NN fermentation_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN gas_NN produc-_JJ tion_NN by_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN and_CC fermentation_NN of_IN maltose_NN by_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN ._.
Hadley_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1917_CD ]_NN reported_VBD infection_NN in_IN adult_NN fowl_NN due_JJ to_TO non-gas_JJ producing_VBG type_NN of_IN pullorum_NN ._.
The_DT gas_NN producing_VBG type_NN has_VBZ come_VBN to_TO be_VB known_VBN as_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN '_'' A_NNP '_POS and_CC non-gas_JJ producing_VBG type_NN as_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN '_'' B_NNP '_POS Muslow_NNP [_NN 1919_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN certain_JJ strains_NNS of_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN fermented_VBD maltose_JJ and_CC hence_RB suggested_VBD dulcitol_NN as_IN a_DT better_JJR differen-_NN tiating_NN sugar_NN ._.
Hendrickson_NNP [_NN 1927_CD ]_NN concurred_VBN with_IN Muslow_NNP in_IN using_VBG serum_JJ water_NN as_IN a_DT basic_JJ medium_NN for_IN sugars_NNS ._.
He_PRP attributed_VBD Maltose_NNP fermentation_NN by_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN to_TO the_DT materials_NNS and_CC methods_NNS employed_VBN for_IN the_DT cultivation_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN and_CC suggested_VBD peptone_NN water_NN instead_RB ._.
He_PRP considered_VBD S._NNP gallinarum_NN as_IN maltose_NN ,_, dulcite_NN and_CC dextrain_NN positive_JJ ._.
Van_NNP Roekel_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP isolated_VBD strains_NNS of_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN which_WDT fermented_VBD maltose_NN within_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS ._.
Hinshaw_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN showed_VBN by_IN fermentation_NN of_IN carbohydrates_NNS that_IN there_EX were_VBD several_JJ sub-species_NNS in_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN and_CC S._NNP gallinarum_NN groups_NNS ,_, like_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN intermediate_NN ,_, type_NN '_'' A_NNP '_POS ,_, which_WDT produced_VBD acid_NNS and_CC gas_NN in_IN maltose_NN ,_, dulcite_NN and_CC arabinose_NN ,_, and_CC S._NNP pullorum_VBP intermediate_NN '_'' B_NNP '_POS which_WDT produced_VBD acid_IN only_RB in_IN maltose_NN ,_, dulcite_NN and_CC arabinose_JJ ,_, but_CC none_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD fermented_VBD xylose_NN in_IN addition_NN ,_, like_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN ._.
Experimental_JJ work_NN Epidemiology_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN 1950_CD an_DT acute_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN fowl_NN typhoid_NN occurred_VBD in_IN a_DT large_JJ poultry_NN farm_NN ._.
First_RB the_DT adults_NNS and_CC later_RB the_DT baby_NN chicks_NNS were_VBD affected_JJ perhaps_RB in_IN consequence_NN of_IN hatching_VBG from_IN the_DT carriers_NNS ._.
This_DT made_VBD a_DT study_NN of_IN its_PRP$ various_JJ aspects_NNS possible_JJ for_IN the_DT first_JJ time_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
The_DT disease_NN spread_NN rapidly_RB into_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT breeding_NN pens_NNS ._.
The_DT birds_NNS in_IN full_JJ lay_NN were_VBD found_VBN droopy_RB ruffle_JJ feathered_VBN ,_, off_RB feed_NN and_CC reluctant_NN to_TO move_VB ._.
Some_DT had_VBD matted_VBN fluff_NNS due_JJ to_TO greenish_VB diarrhoea_NN which_WDT developed_VBD in_IN birds_NNS that_WDT lingered_VBD on_IN for_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS ._.
The_DT temperature_NN was_VBD 1°_CD to_TO 3°_CD F._NNP above_IN normal_JJ ,_, comb_NN and_CC wattles_NNS became_VBD cyanotic_JJ and_CC death_NN supervened_VBN after_IN a_DT couple_NN of_IN days_NNS of_IN ailment_NN (_( Plate_NNP XI_NNP ._.
fig_NN ._.
1_CD ._. )_)
The_DT early_JJ cases_NNS were_VBD peracute_NN for_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD weeks_NNS and_CC later_RB the_DT rate_NN of_IN mortality_NN decreased_VBN and_CC the_DT coarse_NN also_RB became_VBD protracted_JJ ,_, the_DT symptoms_NNS being-_JJ pallor_NN of_IN the_DT comb_NN and_CC wattels_NNS and_CC profuse_NN green_JJ diarrhoea_NN ._.
Pending_VBG diagnosis_NN ,_, the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD checked_VBN by_IN depopulation_NN of_IN the_DT visibly_NN affected_VBD birds_NNS and_CC sanitation_NN ._.
The_DT probability_NN of_IN food_NN poisoning_NN was_VBD eliminated_VBN by_IN biological_JJ and_CC cultural_JJ tests_NNS ._.
Post-mortem_JJ findings_NNS ._.
Over_IN a_DT hundred_JJ birds_NNS were_VBD autopsied_VBN ._.
No_DT special_JJ lesions_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN peracute_NN cases_NNS and_CC the_DT blood_NN was_VBD negative_JJ under_IN the_DT micros-_JJ cope_NN for_IN organisms_NNS ._.
In_IN cases_NNS of_IN delayed_JJ mortality_NN a_DT common_JJ though_IN not_RB constant_JJ lesions_NNS was_VBD a_DT linear_JJ band_NN of_IN haemorrhage_NN varying_VBG from_IN 2_CD to_TO 3_CD m.m_NNS ._.
in_IN width_JJ n_IN the_DT sub-mucosa_NN of_IN the_DT proventriculus_NN near_IN the_DT gizzard-end_NN ._.
Occasionally_RB there_EX were_VBD necrotic_JJ ulcers_NNS in_IN the_DT horny_JJ epithelium_NN of_IN the_DT gizzard_NN ._.
Liver_NNP was_VBD enlarged_VBN and_CC friable_JJ containing_VBG numerous_JJ yellow_JJ or_CC grey_JJ necrotic_JJ foci_NN ,_, almost_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT lesion_NN seen_VBN in_IN diffuse_NN lymphomatosis_NN ._.
Pericardium_NN showed_VBD serofibrinous_JJ adhesion_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT heart_NN wall_NN large_JJ necrotic_JJ foci_NN as_RB big_JJ as_IN the_DT seeds_NNS of_IN garden_NN peas_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN ._.

S._NNP B._NNP V._NNP RAO_NNP ,_, S._NNP NARAYANAN_NNP ,_, D._NNP R._NNP RAMANI_NNP AND_NNP J._NNP DAS_NNP 201_CD ulcers_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT affected_JJ portions_NNS particularly_RB near_IN the_DT terminal_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT intestines_NNS ._.

After_IN the_DT cessation_NN of_IN mortality_NN ,_, cases_NNS of_IN ruptured_VBN liver_NN and_CC yolk_NN peritonitis_NN were_VBD often_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT post-mortems_NNS for_IN over_IN six_CD months_NNS as_IN a_DT sequel_NN to_TO the_DT disease_NN ,_, Such_JJ livers_NNS presented_VBD a_DT mass_NN of_IN cicatrices_NNS of_IN healed_JJ lesions_NNS with_IN chalky_NN deposits_NNS ._.
After_IN a_DT removal_NN of_IN the_DT reactors_NNS ,_, from_IN survivors_NNS of_IN the_DT flock_NN ,_, cases_NNS of_IN yolk_NN peritonitis_NN decreased_VBN ,_, but_CC those_DT of_IN ruptured_JJ livers_NNS persisted_VBD ._.
The_DT liver_NN cultures_NNS were_VBD however_RB negative_JJ for_IN Salmonella_NNP ._.
Histopathology_NNP ._.
The_DT average_JJ blood_NN picture_NN of_IN adults_NNS in_IN peracute_NN cases_NNS showed_VBD the_DT following_JJ counts_NNS ,_, Erythrocytes_VBZ 2,300,000_CD per_IN c.mm_NN ._.
Leucocytes_VBZ 138,000_CD 202_CD STUDIES_NNPS ON_NNP SALMONELLA_NNP GALLINARUM_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, were_VBD no_DT characteristic_JJ symptoms_NNS or_CC lesions_NNS ,_, though_IN the_DT organism_NN could_MD be_VB regularly_RB recovered_VBN from_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC heart_NN blood_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT course_NN was_VBD prolonged_VBN ,_, the_DT chicks_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO huddle_VB around_IN the_DT hover_NN ,_, while_IN a_DT few_JJ isolated_JJ themselves_PRP showing_VBG marked_JJ dyspnoea_NN and_CC droopiness_NN ._.
Diarrhoea_NNP was_VBD not_RB always_RB present_JJ in_IN chicks_NNS less_JJR than_IN a_DT week_NN old_JJ ,_, but_CC older_JJR ones_NNS had_VBD greyish_JJ fluid_NN evacuations_NNS and_CC pasting_NN of_IN the_DT vent_NN ._.
In_IN acute_JJ cases_NNS no_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN ,_, but_CC in_IN more_RBR protracted_JJ ones_NNS the_DT liver_NN showed_VBD multiple_JJ pin-point_JJ haemorrhages_NNS ,_, green_JJ and_CC yellow_JJ stripes_NNS of_IN discolouration_NN ,_, or_CC miliary_JJ necrotic_JJ foci_NN in_IN varying_VBG degree_NN ._.
Unabsorbed_VBN yolk_NN with_IN a_DT greenish_JJ sheen_NN ,_, lesions_NNS of_IN greyish_JJ white_JJ necrotic_JJ nodules_NNS on_IN heart_NN wall_NN and_CC distortion_NN of_IN its_PRP$ shape_NN were_VBD also_RB observed_VBN ._.
In_IN some_DT ,_, stripes_NNS of_IN petichiae_NN in_IN the_DT proventriculus_NN at_IN the_DT gizzard-end_NN ,_, lung_NN lesions_NNS ranging_VBG from_IN a_DT slight_JJ congestion_NN to_TO pneumonia_VB and_CC rare_JJ lesions_NNS of_IN irregular_JJ necrosis_NN ,_, or_CC scattered_VBD white_JJ nodules_NNS were_VBD found_VBN ._.
Experimental_JJ infection_NN assumed_VBD a_DT peracute_JJ form_NN and_CC hence_NN lesions_NNS were_VBD not_RB observed_VBN ._.

Experiments_NNS with_IN chronic_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN Salmonella_NNP gallinarum_NN Twenty_NNP eight_CD reactors_NNS were_VBD reared_VBN in_IN isolation_NN for_IN four_CD months_NNS for_IN experimental_JJ observation_NN ._.
When_WRB autopsied_VBN there_EX were_VBD four_CD 'no_POS lesion_NN '_'' cases_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD negative_JJ for_IN cultural_JJ tests_NNS as_RB well_RB ._.
Among_IN the_DT rest_NN there_EX were_VBD six_CD (_( one_CD cock_NN and_CC five_CD hens_NNS )_) whose_WP$ end_JJ titres_NNS ranged_VBD from_IN 1_CD to_TO 20_CD to_TO 1_CD to_TO 80_CD ._.
The_DT remaining_VBG birds_NNS were_VBD all_DT showing_VBG high_JJ titres_NNS up_IN to_TO 5,180_CD and_CC were_VBD culturally_RB positive_JJ ._.
The_DT cock_NN bird_NN showed_VBD healed_JJ heart_NN and_CC liver_NN lesions_NNS ,_, but_CC was_VBD culturally_RB negative_JJ ._.

6_CD and_CC 7_CD )_) were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT last_JJ group_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT low_JJ reacting_NN hens_NNS showed_VBD but_CC one_CD or_CC two_CD aberrated_JJ ova_NNS with_IN abnormal_JJ yolk_NN contents_NNS ._.
Organism_NN were_VBD however_RB regularly_RB recovered_VBN from_IN them_PRP ._.
Summary_NNP of_IN lesions_NNS in_IN chronic_JJ carriers_NNS ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS which_WDT [_VBP were_VBD sequel_VBN to_TO ovarian_JJ dysfunction_NN were_VBD typical_JJ of_IN Salpingitis_NNP ,_, as_IN described_VBN by_IN Bunyea_NNP [_NNP 1926_CD ]_NNP caused_VBN by_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN ,_, and_CC were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN fowl_JJ typhoid_NN as_RB well_RB ._.
Egg_NN production_NN of_IN Reactors_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ egg_NN production_NN of_IN the_DT farm_NN flock_NN was_VBD over_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN during_IN February_NNP ,_, March_NNP ,_, April_NNP and_CC May_NNP ,_, but_CC for_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN the_DT reactors_NNS averaged_VBD 19.5_CD per_IN cent_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ month_NN but_CC later_RB the_DT production_NN dwindled_VBD down_RB to_TO zero_CD in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN a_DT further_JJ three_CD months_NNS ,_, when_WRB they_PRP were_VBD des-_JJ troyed_NN for_IN examination_NN ._.
Incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN hatches_NNS from_IN carrier_NN eggs_NNS ._.
A_DT pen_NN of_IN 24_CD reactor_NN hens_NNS were_VBD mated_VBN to_TO a_DT reactor_NN cock_NN and_CC 48_CD eggs_NNS from_IN this_DT pen_NN were_VBD collected_VBN ._.

BACTERIOLOGY_NNP Isolation_NNP of_IN the_DT organism_NN from_IN the_DT heart_NN blood_NN and_CC liver_NN ._.
The_DT organism_NN was_VBD isolated_VBN from_IN acute_JJ cases_NNS from_IN the_DT heart_NN blood_NN and_CC livers_NNS ,_, of_IN chicks_NNS and_CC adults_NNS dying_VBG after_IN a_DT brief_JJ period_NN of_IN illness_NN ._.
The_DT colonies_NNS ,_, on_IN plain_NN agar_NN appeared_VBD as_IN fine_JJ granular_JJ pin-point_NN in_IN 24_CD hours_NNS and_CC developed_VBD into_IN smooth_JJ glistening_VBG translucent_JJ hemispheres_NNS in_IN 48_CD hours_NNS of_IN incubation_NN ,_, and_CC later_RB they_PRP varied_VBD from_IN round_NN to_TO angular_VB ._.
The_DT heart_NN blood_NN usually_RB yielded_VBD a_DT pure_JJ culture_NN ,_, while_IN liver_JJ cultures_NNS sometimes_RB required_VBD sieving_VBG through_IN brilliant_JJ green_JJ broth_NN and_CC plating_VBG on_IN to_TO Macconkey_NNP media_NNS ._.
Isolation_NN from_IN the_DT ovaries_NNS of_IN the_DT reactors_NNS ._.
In_IN cases_NNS of_IN abnormal_JJ ovum_NN ,_, culture_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN by_IN searing_VBG the_DT ovisac_NN puncturing_NN and_CC pipetting_VBG out_RP the_DT whole_JJ con-_JJ tents_NNS into_IN brilliant_JJ green_JJ broth_NN ,_, about_RB 200_CD c.c_NN ._.
per_IN ovum_NN ,_, and_CC incubating_VBG for_IN 48_CD hours_NNS and_CC then_RB plating_VBG on_IN to_TO Macconkey_NNP for_IN recovery_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN ._.
Where_WRB lesions_NNS were_VBD not_RB well_RB marked_VBN and_CC the_DT ovary_NN was_VBD found_VBN arrested_VBN in_IN its_PRP$ growth_NN ,_, the_DT bunch_NN of_IN the_DT immature_NN ova_NN was_VBD tritutated_VBN and_CC transferred_VBN to_TO a_DT large_JJ quantity_NN of_IN tetrathionate_JJ broth_NN from_IN 200_CD to_TO 500_CD c.c_NN ._.
depending_NN ,_, upon_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN the_DT bunch_NN and_CC incubated_VBN for_IN 24_CD to_TO 48_CD hours_NNS before_IN recovery_NN by_IN plating_VBG on_IN to_TO Macconkey_NNP ._.
By_IN these_DT two_CD methods_NNS 19_CD out_IN of_IN 24_CD ovaries_NNS of_IN reactors_NNS yielded_VBN positive_JJ cultures_NNS ._.
Isolation_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN from_IN eggs_NNS of_IN the_DT Reactors_NNPS ._.
Thirty-six_NNP eggs_NNS from_IN a_DT pen_JJ exculsively_RB of_IN carriers_NNS were_VBD cultured_VBN in_IN five_CD batches_NNS ._.
The_DT eggs_NNS were_VBD opened_VBN after_IN washing_VBG in_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN dettol_NN ,_, dipping_VBG in_IN alcohol_NN ,_, flaming_VBG lightly_RB ,_, and_CC opening_VBG into_IN a_DT sterile_JJ petri_NN dish_NN ._.
The_DT whole_JJ yolk_NN was_VBD spooned_VBN out_RP into_IN 200_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN broth_NN ,_, and_CC incubated_VBD for_IN 48_CD hours_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT white_JJ was_VBD discarded_VBN ._.
The_DT organism_NN was_VBD recovered_VBN on_IN Macconkey_NNP plate_NN ._.
13_CD out_IN of_IN the_DT 36_CD eggs_NNS thus_RB cultured_VBD gave_VBD positive_JJ results_NNS which_WDT proves_VBZ that_IN over_IN 36_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT eggs_NNS laid_VBN by_IN carriers_NNS might_MD be_VB infected_VBN ._.
Isolation_NN from_IN the_DT intestines_NNS of_IN baby_NN chicks_NNS and_CC adults_NNS ._.
Materials_NNS from_IN the_DT duode-_JJ num_NN of_IN baby_NN chicks_NNS with_IN white_JJ diarrhoea_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN adults_NNS showing_VBG enteritis_NN were_VBD incubated_VBN in_IN separate_JJ isolation_NN experiments_NNS in_IN terathionate_JJ broth_NN to_TO which_WDT brilliant_JJ green_NN in_IN 1_CD to_TO 50,000_CD proportion_NN had_VBD been_VBN added_VBN ._.
After_IN 48_CD hours_NNS of_IN incubation_NN the_DT organism_NN was_VBD recovered_VBN on_IN Macconkey_NNP media_NNS in_IN the_DT usual_JJ way_NN ,_, but_CC several_JJ sievings_NNS were_VBD continued_VBN through_IN the_DT special_JJ media_NNS before_IN pure_JJ culture_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
Indentification_NN of_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN ._.
In_IN all_DT cases_NNS of_IN isolation_NN on_IN Macconkey_NNP plates_NNS fine_JJ white_JJ colonies_NNS were_VBD picked_VBN up_RP and_CC ._.
sown_VBN on_IN agar_NN slants_NNS serially_RB ._.
Those_DT colonies_NNS which_WDT yielded_VBD non-motile_JJ gram_NN negative_JJ slender_NN rods_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ antigenic_JJ specificity_NN by_IN the_DT rapid_JJ serum_NN method_NN of_IN Stafseth_NNP and_CC Carbutt_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NN before_IN sub-_JJ mitting_NN to_TO principal_VB sugar_NN tests_NNS for_IN confirmation_NN ._.
Pathogenicity_NN ._.
Rabbits_NNS and_CC guinea_NN pigs_NNS were_VBD killed_VBN in_IN 48_CD hours_NNS by_IN the_DT sub-_JJ cutaneous_JJ route_NN ,_, evincing_VBG septicaemic_JJ lesions_NNS of_IN an_DT acute_JJ haemorrhagic_NN type_NN on_IN heart_NN ,_, stomach_NN ,_, and_CC intestines_NNS (_( Plate_NNP XIII_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
4_CD )_) ._.
It_PRP proved_VBD fatal_JJ to_TO pigeons_NNS after_IN five_CD days_NNS by_IN the_DT intramuscular_JJ route_NN ._.
The_DT pigeon_NN went_VBD down_RB on_IN both_DT legs_NNS and_CC was_VBD supporting_VBG itself_PRP on_IN its_PRP$ out-spread_JJ wings_NNS on_IN the_DT fourth_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT post-mortem_JJ findings_NNS were_VBD ,_, large_JJ areas_NNS of_IN necrosis_NN in_IN the_DT pectoral_JJ muscles_NNS at_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN inoculation_NN 204_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP SALMONELLA_NNP GALLINARUM_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, and_CC acute_JJ arthritis_NN of_IN wing_NN and_CC limb_NN joints_NNS ._.
Both_DT white_JJ and_CC black_JJ rats_NNS were_VBD resis-_JJ tant_NN ._.
A_DT mortality_NN of_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN adult_NN fowls_NN when_WRB infected_VBN by_IN intra-muscular_JJ route_NN ,_, birds_NNS succumbing_VBG from_IN 7_CD to_TO 11_CD days_NNS ._.
Three_CD healthy_JJ bird_NN kept_VBD successively_RB in_IN the_DT same_JJ cage_NN where_WRB previously_RB sick_JJ birds_NNS had_VBD been_VBN confined_VBN became_VBD sero-positive_JJ in_IN 11_CD to_TO 15_CD days_NNS but_CC the_DT infection_NN was_VBD sub-clinical_JJ ._.
18_CD hour_NN broth_JJ culture_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN in_IN dilution_NN corresponding_VBG to_TO Brown_NNP 's_POS standard_JJ opacity_NN tube_NN 1_CD ,_, in_IN 0.1_CD c.c_NN ._.
dose_RB subcutaneously_RB ,_, proved_VBD cent_JJ per_IN cent_NN fatal_NN in_IN 3_CD to_TO 5_CD days_NNS ,_, to_TO six_CD one_CD day_NN old_JJ baby_NN chicks_NNS ._.
Oral_JJ dosing_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN suspension_NN in_IN 0.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
dose_NN was_VBD equally_RB fatal_JJ in_IN 5_CD to_TO 8_CD days_NNS ,_, in_IN a_DT day-old_JJ chick_NN ,_, with_IN two_CD survivors_NNS among_IN the_DT ten_NN birds_NNS infected_VBN ,_, which_WDT also_RB became_VBD sero-positive_JJ after_IN eleven_JJ days_NNS ._.
Three_CD incontact_JJ chicks_NNS with_IN the_DT above_NN lot_NN died_VBD of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN 7_CD to_TO 10_CD days_NNS ,_, organisms_NNS being_VBG recovered_VBN from-them_NN ._.
Oral_JJ dosing_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN suspension_NN described_VBN above_IN ,_, along_IN with_IN a_DT 16_CD per_IN cent_NN sodium_NN solution_NN of_IN sulphamezathine_NN in_IN drinking_NN water_NN at_IN 0.2_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN of_IN the_DT active_JJ drug_NN for_IN one_CD week_NN in_IN a_DT lot_NN of_IN 20_CD day-old_JJ chicks_NNS failed_VBD to_TO prevent_VB mortality_NN ._.
16_CD died_VBD within_IN a_DT week_NN and_CC two_CD of_IN the_DT rest_NN were_VBD sero-positive_JJ ._.
Organism_NN was_VBD re-_JJ covered_VBN from_IN all_PDT the_DT dead_JJ chicks_NNS ._.
Morphology_NNP ._.
The_DT strain_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT adults_NNS produced_VBD typical_JJ disease_NN in_IN chicks_NNS and_CC vice-verse_NN ._.
The_DT two_CD strains_NNS were_VBD identical_JJ as_IN regards_NNS their_PRP$ behaviour_NN on_IN routine_JJ laboratory_NN media_NNS ._.
They_PRP exhibited_VBD the_DT following_JJ characters_NNS :_: September_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP S._NNP B._NNP V._NNP RAO_NNP ,_, S._NNP NARAYANAN_NNP ,_, D._NNP R._NNP RAMANI_NNP AND_NNP J._NNP DAS_NNP 205_CD Tube_NNP test_NN using_VBG the_DT antigen_NN S.p.l7A_NNP (_( a_DT standard_NN Hull_NNP Que_NNP strain_NN of_IN Salmonella_NNP pullorum_NN received_VBD through_IN the_DT courtesy_NN of_IN the_DT Dominion_NNP Animal_NNP Pathologist_NNP ,_, Canada_NNP )_) was_VBD positive_JJ to_TO complete_VB titre_NN with_IN the_DT natural_JJ serum_NN from_IN the_DT reacting_VBG bird_NN ,_, similarly_RB both_DT chick_JJ no_DT ._.
586_CD and_CC adult_NN no_DT ._.
399_CD antigens_NNS reacted_VBD to_TO complete_VB titre_NN with_IN the_DT immune_JJ serum_NN prepared_VBD from_IN stock_NN culture_NN S.p_NNP ._.
17A_CD ._.
The_DT same_JJ serum_NN S.p.l7A_NNP absorbed_VBD with_IN chick_NN and_CC adult_NN antigens_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB completely_RB free_JJ of_IN the_DT homologous_JJ agglutinins_NNS ,_, conversely_RB the_DT adult_NN no_DT ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT course_NN and_CC Post-mortem_NNP lesions.206_NN STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP SALMONELLA_NNP GALLINARUM_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, Both_NNP strains_VBZ differ_VBP from_IN the_DT intermediate_JJ type_NN '_'' B_NNP '_POS of_IN pullorum_NN by_IN the_DT fermen-_JJ tation_NN of_IN xylose_JJ and_CC dextrin_JJ and_CC from_IN intermediate_JJ type_NN '_'' A_NNP '_POS by_IN the_DT non-production_NN of_IN gas_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN fermentation_NN of_IN xylose_JJ and_CC dextrin_NN ._.
Therefore_RB the_DT chick_NN and_CC adult_NN strains_NNS are_VBP identical_JJ and_CC belong_JJ to_TO the_DT same_JJ species_NNS S._NNP gallinarum_NN ._.

AN_DT IMPROVED_NNP SALMONELLA_NNP ANTIGEN_NNP FOR_IN THE_NNP RAPID_NNP WHOLE_NNP BLOOD_NNP AGGLUTINATION_NNP TEST_NNP By_IN S._NNP B._NNP V._NNP Rao_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD September_NNP 1951_CD )_) THE_DT occurrence_NN of_IN Salmonella_NNP pullorum/gallinarum_NN ,_, S._NNP aertrycke_NN ,_, and_CC certain_JJ members_NNS of_IN other_JJ paratyphoid_JJ groups_NNS in_IN commercial_JJ poultry_NN flocks_NNS in_IN widely_RB separated_VBN areas_NNS since_IN 1949_CD for_IN the_DT first_JJ time_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN ,_, has_VBZ created_VBN a_DT serious_JJ hazard_NN to_TO the_DT growing_VBG poultry_NN industry_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT potential_JJ menace_NN to_TO public_JJ health_NN ,_, and_CC has_VBZ made_VBN the_DT study_NN [_NNP Rao_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, 1950_CD ]_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN possible_JJ and_CC its_PRP$ control_NN imperative_NN ._.

[_NN Mitchell_NNP ,_, Garlock_NNP and_CC Brokkahn_NNP ,_, 1946_CD and_CC Judefind_NNP ,_, 1947_CD ._. ]_VB

the_DT slow_JJ tube_NN ,_, the_DT rapid_JJ serum_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT whole_JJ blood_NN agglutination_NN test_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT contrary_JJ ,_, paratyphoid_JJ (_( motile_NN )_) organism_NN ,_, usually_RB not_RB being_VBG yolk_PRP borne_JJ ,_, does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO create_VB such_JJ a_DT serious_JJ 'carrier_JJR '_POS problem_NN as_IN its_PRP$ spread_NN is_VBZ by_IN shell_NN contamination_NN or_CC by_IN penetration_NN of_IN the_DT shell_NN during_IN incubation_NN [_NNP Schalm_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ,_, and_CC Wilson_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.

The_DT disease_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, is_VBZ controlled_VBN for_IN all_DT practical_JJ purposes_NNS by_IN incubator_NN fumigation_NN and_CC farm_NN sanitation_NN [_NNP Buxton_NNP ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN ._.

62_CD ..._: CALOTROPIS-STANDARDISATION_NN AND_NNP BIOLOGICAL_NNP ASSAY_NNP By_IN V._NNP RATHNASABAPATHY_NNP ,_, B.V.Sc._NNP ,_, and_CC V._NNP ISWARIAH_NNP ,_, B.A._NNP ,_, M.B.B.S._NNP ,_, M.R.C.P_NNP ._.
(_( Published_VBN from_IN the_DT Research_NNP Unit_NNP Indigenous_NNP Drugs_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Pharmacology_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP Medical_NNP College_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP )_) (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 19_CD January_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP XVII_NNP to_TO XX_NNP )_) CALOTROPIS_NNP GIGANTEA_NNP ,_, commonly_RB known_VBN by_IN the_DT following_JJ names_NNS in_IN various_JJ Indian_JJ languages_NNS ,_, arka_NN (_( Sanskrit_NNP )_) ;_: madar_NN (_( Hindi_NNP )_) ;_: akand_NN (_( Bengali_NNP )_) ;_: erukku_CC (_( Tamil_NNP )_) ;_: and_CC jelledu_NN (_( Telugu_NNP )_) ;_: has_VBZ been_VBN dealt_VBN with_IN in_IN detail_NN in_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ medical_JJ literature_NN and_CC is_VBZ highly_RB spoken_JJ of_IN as_IN a_DT very_RB good_JJ alterative_NN and_CC tonic_NN ,_, [_NNP Watt_NNP ,_, 1893_CD and_CC Chopra_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP ._.
A_DT preliminary_JJ study_NN made_VBN by_IN the_DT senior_JJ author_NN and_CC his_PRP$ colleagues_NNS on_IN the_DT various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT plant_NN namely_RB ,_, the_DT leaves_NNS ,_, the_DT flowers_NNS and_CC the_DT root_NN bark_NN ,_, revealed_VBD that_IN the_DT leaf_NN powder_NN in_IN small_JJ repeated_JJ doses_NNS exerted_VBD a_DT tonic_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT ruminants_NNS ._.
Active_JJ principles_NNS were_VBD isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT leaves_NNS and_CC the_DT milky_NN juice_NN (_( madar_JJ juice_NN )_) and_CC they_PRP were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB identical_JJ in_IN their_PRP$ physiological_JJ activities_NNS ,_, except_IN that_IN the_DT one_CD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT latter_NN was_VBD more_RBR potent_JJ ._.
Both_DT of_IN them_PRP produced_VBD a_DT sustained_JJ rise_NN of_IN blood_NN pressure_NN when_WRB given_VBN intravenously_RB to_TO anaesthetised_JJ dogs_NNS [_MD Rathnasabapathy_NNP ,_, Lakshman_NNP ,_, Krishnaswamy_NNP and_CC David_NNP ,_, 1949_CD ]_NN ._.
Pitchandi_NN in_IN 1948_CD ,_, isolated_VBD the_DT active_JJ principle_NN of_IN the_DT madar_NN juice_NN in_IN a_DT pure_JJ crystalline_NN form_NN and_CC proposed_VBD the_DT formula_NN C24_NNP H36_NNP 09_CD provisionally_RB and_CC suggested_VBD the_DT name_NN 'Gigantin_NNP '_POS to_TO the_DT substance_NN thus_RB obtained_VBN ._.
The_DT pharmacology_NN of_IN gigantin_NN has_VBZ been_VBN thoroughly_RB investigated_VBN by_IN the_DT authors_NNS both_DT on_IN the_DT amphibians_NNS and_CC the_DT mammals_NNS and_CC its_PRP$ action_NN on_IN all_PDT the_DT organs_NNS with_IN special_JJ reference_NN to_TO the_DT cardio-vascular_JJ system_NN has_VBZ been_VBN worked_VBN out_RP in_IN detail_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD shown_VBN that_IN the_DT drug_NN ,_, by_IN a_DT direct_JJ action_NN on_IN the_DT musculature_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN and_CC blood_NN vessels_NNS produces_VBZ a_DT persistent_JJ rise_NN of_IN blood_NN pressure_NN ;_: the_DT efficiency_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN is_VBZ increased_VBN in_IN physiological_JJ doses_NNS and_CC that_IN the_DT action_NN on_IN the_DT heart_NN is_VBZ similar_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN digitalis_NN [_NNP Rathnasabapathy_NNP ,_, David_NNP and_CC Iswariah_NNP 1951_CD ]_NNP ._.
With_IN all_PDT these_DT beneficial_JJ actions_NNS of_IN a_DT good_JJ drug_NN ,_, gigantin_NN has_VBZ its_PRP$ disadvantages_NNS as_IN a_DT good_JJ pharmaceutical_JJ preparation_NN ._.
As_IN it_PRP is_VBZ insoluble_JJ in_IN water_NN it_PRP is_VBZ unsuitable_JJ for_IN easy_JJ parenteral_JJ administration_NN and_CC as_IN the_DT quantity_NN obtained_VBN is_VBZ not_RB commensurate_JJ with_IN the_DT labour_NN and_CC cost_NN involved_VBN in_IN its_PRP$ preparation_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ uneconomical_JJ for_IN manufac-_JJ ture_NN on_IN a_DT large_JJ scale_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB considered_VBN profitable_JJ to_TO utilise_VB the_DT leaves_NNS of_IN Calotropis_NNP gigantea_NN ,_, which_WDT have_VBP got_VBN active_JJ principles_NNS having_VBG the_DT same_JJ physio-_JJ logical_JJ activity_NN as_IN gigantin_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN tincture_NN after_IN standardisation_NN ._.
The_DT close_JJ resemblance_NN of_IN calotropis_NN and_CC digitalis_NN in_IN their_PRP$ biological_JJ activities_NNS ,_, suggested_VBD that_IN tincture_NN calotropis_NN can_MD be_VB assaved_VBN in_IN the_DT same_JJ manner_NN as_IN tincture_NN digitalis_NN ._.
225_CD 226_CD CALOTROPIS-STANDARDISATION_NN AND_NNP BIOLOGICAL_NNP ASSAY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, METHODS_NNP Standardi_NNP ation_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ standard_NN prepared_VBN by_IN the_DT authors_NNS consists_VBZ of_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN ten_JJ different_JJ samples_NNS of_IN the_DT leaves_NNS of_IN Calotropis_NNP gigantea_NN ,_, collected_VBN from_IN the_DT city_NN of_IN Madras_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ neighbourhood_NN ,_, dried_VBN at_IN the_DT room_NN temperature_NN of_IN about_IN 28°C_CD ._.
for_IN about_RB ten_JJ days_NNS ,_, powdered_VBD to_TO pass_VB through_IN a_DT No_NNP ._.
60_CD sieve_NN ,_, dried_VBN in_IN an_DT electric_JJ hot_JJ air_NN oven_RB between_IN 55°C_CD ._.
and_CC 60°C_CD ._.
for_IN six_CD hours_NNS ,_, ampouled_VBN in_IN sterile_JJ containers_NNS and_CC stored_VBN in_IN the_DT frigidaire_NN ._.
The_DT moisture_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT standard_JJ powder_NN was_VBD determined_VBN and_CC found_VBN to_TO be_VB 2.45_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Unit_NN ._.
The_DT unit_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ standard_NN was_VBD defined_VBN as_IN the_DT acitvity_NN contained_VBN in_IN 0.1_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT standard_JJ calotropis_NN leaf_NN powder_NN prepared_VBD and_CC kept_VBD in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN ,_, (_( The_DT Department_NNP of_IN Physiology_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP ._. )_)
Biological_JJ Assay_NNP ._.
The_DT standard_NN is_VBZ now_RB available_JJ for_IN any_DT one_CD to_TO compare_VB an_DT unknown_JJ sample_NN of_IN leaf_NN to_TO see_VB how_WRB far_RB this_DT sample_NN differed_VBD in_IN acitvity_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT standard_NN ._.

(_( 1951_CD )_) 10_CD ,_, 4_CD ,_, 961-968_CD TWO_NNP comparable_JJ groups_NNS of_IN 16_CD lactating_NN cows_NNS (_( 8_CD Holsteins_NNP and_CC 8_CD Jerseys_NNS each_DT were_VBD used_VBN in_IN a_DT double-reversal_JJ experiment_NN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN cooling_NN by_IN sprinkling_VBG on_IN respiration_NN rates_NNS ,_, body_NN temperatures_NNS and_CC grazing_VBG performances_NNS ._.
Although_IN both_DT breeds_NNS used_VBD the_DT shower_NN more_RBR as_IN the_DT temperature_NN increased_VBD ,_, the_DT Holsteins_NNP remained_VBD under_IN the_DT shower_JJR an_DT average_NN of_IN about_IN 9_CD per_IN cent_NN more_JJR than_IN Jerseys_NNP ._.
The_DT average_JJ amount_NN of_IN time_NN spent_VBN under_IN the_DT shower_NN for_IN both_DT breeds_NNS was_VBD 2_CD and_CC 3_CD times_NNS as_IN great_JJ at_IN a_DT temperature_NN range_NN of_IN 85°_CD to_TO 90°F_CD ._.
and_CC 92°_CD to_TO 97°F_CD ._.
res-_NN pectively_RB ,_, as_IN at_IN a_DT temperature_NN range_NN of_IN 80°_CD to_TO 85°F_CD ._.
Respiration_NN rates_NNS were_VBD slightly_RB higher_JJR for_IN Jerseys_NNP than_IN Holsteins_NNP ,_, while_IN the_DT reverse_NN was_VBD noted_VBN for_IN body_NN temperature_NN ._.
The_DT respiration_NN rate_NN of_IN Holsteins_NNP and_CC Jerseys_NNP having_VBG access_NN to_TO shower_VB were_VBD 18_CD and_CC 13_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
lower_JJR ,_, respectively_RB than_IN for_IN those_DT with_IN only_RB shade_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, the_DT respiration_NN rates_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS were_VBD very_RB nearly_RB the_DT same_JJ after_IN a_DT walk_NN of_IN one-fourth_NN of_IN a_DT mile_NN to_TO the_DT byres_NNS ._.
Sprinkling_VBG was_VBD effective_JJ in_IN producing_VBG a_DT lower_JJR body_NN temperature_NN for_IN both_DT breeds_NNS ._.
Holsteins_NNS and_CC Jerseys_NNP being_VBG sprinkled_VBN had_VBD body_NN temperatures_NNS of_IN 0.7°F_CD ._.
and_CC 0.4°F_CD ._.
lower_RBR respectively_RB than_IN did_VBD those_DT with_IN only_RB shade_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD an_DT increase_NN of_IN 0.5°F_CD ._.
for_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT breeds_NNS ,_, after_IN a_DT walk_NN of_IN one_CD mile_NN to_TO the_DT byres_NNS ,_, irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT treatment_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT temperature_NN range_NN of_IN 80°-85°F._JJ ,_, both_DT breeds_NNS spent_VBD 63_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN their_PRP$ time_NN grazing_NN and_CC the_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT shower_NN appeared_VBD to_TO have_VB no_DT significant_JJ effect_NN on_IN grazing_VBG rate_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT grazing_NN rate_NN decreased_VBN as_IN the_DT temperature_NN increased_VBD and_CC at_IN a_DT temperature_NN range_NN of_IN 92°F_CD ._.
to_TO 97°F_CD ._.
the_DT Holsteins_NNP and_CC Jerseys_NNP grazed_VBD 69_CD and_CC 68_CD per_IN cent_NN less_RBR respectively_RB ,_, than_IN they_PRP did_VBD at_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN 80°_CD to_TO 85°F_CD ._.
Although_IN sprinkling_NN was_VBD effective_JJ in_IN cooling_VBG the_DT cows_NNS as_IN borne_NN by_IN the_DT decreas-_JJ ing_NN respiration_NN rates_NNS and_CC body_NN temperature_NN and_CC increasing_VBG grazing_NN rates_NNS ,_, there_EX appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB no_DT relationship_NN between_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN milk_NN produced_VBN and_CC treatment_NN ._.

P._NNP MAHADEVAN_NNP Effect_NNP of_IN Environment_NNP and_CC Heredity_NNP on_IN Lactation_NNP (_( 1951_CD )_) ,_, J._NNP agric_NN ._.
Sci_NNP ._.
Vol_NNP ._.
41_CD ,_, 80_CD VARIOUS_NNP environmental_JJ factors_NNS render_VBP it_PRP difficult_JJ to_TO evaluate_VB the_DT potential_JJ breeding_NN worth_NN of_IN animals_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN dairy_NN cattle_NNS this_DT involves_VBZ the_DT statistical_JJ analysis_NN of_IN production_NN figures_NNS of_IN cows_NNS in_IN relation_NN to_TO known_VB environmental_JJ factors_NNS and_CC the_DT subsequent_JJ standardisation_NN of_IN these_DT production_NN figures_NNS with_IN a_DT view_NN 231_CD 13_CD 232_CD ABSTRACTS_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP III_NNP ,_, to_TO eliminating_VBG as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ the_DT effects_NNS of_IN the_DT environmental_JJ influences_NNS ._.
The_DT records_NNS of_IN twelve_NN pedigree_JJ herds_NNS of_IN Ayreshire_NNP cattle_NNS numbering_VBG about_IN 5,000_CD were_VBD standardized_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN and_CC employed_VBN to_TO obtain_VB the_DT estimates_NNS of_IN heritability_NN and_CC to_TO study_VB the_DT rate_NN of_IN genetic_JJ gain_NN due_JJ to_TO selection_NN ._.
The_DT unit_NN of_IN measurement_NN of_IN production_NN employed_VBN was_VBD the_DT yield_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ 180_CD days_NNS of_IN the_DT lactation_NN period_NN ,_, thus_RB eliminating_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT variation_NN in_IN length_NN of_IN current_JJ calving_VBG interval_NN on_IN milk_NN yield_NN ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT month_NN of_IN calving_VBG on_IN milk_NN yield_NN varied_VBD significantly_RB between_IN herds_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD shown_VBN that_IN correction_NN factors_NNS for_IN month_NN of_IN calving_VBG should_MD be_VB cal-_JJ culated_VBN on_IN a_DT within_IN herd_JJ basis_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ difference_NN in_IN 180_CD day_NN yield_NN between_IN summer_NN and_CC winter_NN calvers_NNS of_IN all_DT herds_NNS was_VBD about_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN favour_NN of_IN winter_NN calvers_NNS ._.
The_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN the_DT cow_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB influenced_VBN both_DT by_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN her_PRP$ previous_JJ lactations_NNS and_CC also_RB by_IN her_PRP$ age_NN at_IN calving_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN that_IN precentage_NN of_IN correction_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS satisfactory_JJ among_IN the_DT types_NNS of_IN corrections_NNS employed_VBN by_IN previous_JJ investigators_NNS for_IN age_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT positive_JJ correlation_NN between_IN milk_NN yield_NN and_CC length_NN of_IN preceding_VBG calving_VBG interval_NN ._.
From_IN an_DT economic_JJ point_NN of_IN view_NN ,_, the_DT optimum_JJ length_NN of_IN calving_VBG interval_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB 400_CD days_NNS for_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN and_CC one_CD year_NN for_IN the_DT sub-_JJ sequent_NN ones_NNS ._.
Corrections_NNS for_IN the_DT preceding_VBG calving_VBG interval_NN like_IN those_DT for_IN age_NN were_VBD most_RBS satisfactory_JJ when_WRB they_PRP were_VBD proportionate_NN and_CC not_RB additive_JJ ._.
No_DT significant_JJ differences_NNS were_VBD found_VBN among_IN the_DT first_JJ three_CD records_NNS of_IN a_DT cow_NN in_IN their_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO indicate_VB her_PRP$ actual_JJ production_NN capacity_NN ._.

NOTE_NN ._.
XVORIGINAL_NN ARTICLES_NNP THE_NNP NUTRITIVE_NNP VALUE_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP INDIGENOUS_NNP GRASSES_NNP OF_NNP ASSAM_NNP VI_NNP ._.
THE_DT GRASS_NNP JOY-JOHA_NNP (_( ISCHAEMUM_NNP RUGOSUM_NNP SALISB_NNP )_) AS_IN A_DT CATTLE_NNP FEED_NNP By_IN B._NNP K._NNP DAS_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP C._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Research_NNP Scheme_NNP ,_, Gauhati_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 27_CD December_NNP 1951_CD )_) IN_VBZ a_DT series_NN of_IN papers_NNS ,_, recently_RB Talapatra_NNP [_NN 1949_CD and_CC 1950_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN although_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ grasses_NNS are_VBP deficient_VBN in_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT indispensable_JJ mineral_JJ elements_NNS like_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN yet_RB they_PRP could_MD profitably_RB be_VB introduced_VBN in_IN the_DT dietary_NN of_IN cattle_NNS in_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ;_: in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT aquatic_JJ grasses_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, he_PRP and_CC his_PRP$ associate_JJ [_NNP Talapatra_NNP et_FW al_NN ,_, 1949_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN green_JJ feeding_VBG led_VBN to_TO considerable_JJ worm_NN troubles_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT mature_NN hay_NN from_IN these_DT grasses_NNS could_MD be_VB fed_VBN to_TO any_DT type_NN of_IN cattle_NNS without_IN the_DT least_JJS fear_NN of_IN helminthic_JJ infection_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT investigations_NNS so_RB far_RB reported_VBN from_IN this_DT laboratory_NN seem_VBP to_TO indicate_VB that_IN the_DT animals_NNS thriving_VBG on_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ grasses_NNS suffer_VBP from_IN a_DT sort_NN of_IN chronic_JJ calcium_NN deficiency_NN ,_, because_IN of_IN the_DT very_RB low_JJ content_NN of_IN this_DT mineral_NN in_IN the_DT herbage_NN ._.
Recently_RB we_PRP have_VBP come_VBN across_IN a_DT kind_NN of_IN semi-aquatic_JJ grass_NN which_WDT appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB fairly_RB rich_JJ in_IN ._.
both_DT calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_VB even_RB at_IN the_DT flowering_NN stage_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ commonly_RB known_VBN as_IN Joy-Joha_NNP (_( Ischaemum_NNP rugosum_VBP Salisb_NNP )_) ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ an_DT annual_JJ grass_NN ,_, tall_NN ,_, erect_NN or_CC ascending_VBG in_IN robust_JJ tufts_NNS and_CC branching_VBG at_IN the_DT base_NN ._.
The_DT branches_NNS are_VBP often_RB 2-nate_JJ ,_, compressed_JJ ,_, very_RB glabrous_JJ and_CC swollen_VBN at_IN the_DT top_NN ._.
Leaf-blades_NNS are_VBP soft_JJ ,_, flat_JJ ,_, linear_JJ or_CC almost_RB lanceolate_NN ._.
The_DT culms_NNS are_VBP 6_CD to_TO 39_CD inches_NNS tall_JJ ._.
It_PRP looks_VBZ more_RBR or_CC less_RBR like_IN 'Bao_NNP '_POS (_( spring_NN )_) paddy_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ available_JJ from_IN June_NNP to_TO November_NNP and_CC flowers_NNS during_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN October_NNP ,_, when_WRB the_DT other_JJ grasses_NNS in_IN this_DT part_NN turn_VB woody_NN and_CC fibrous_JJ ._.

XX_NN ,_, IV_NNP THE_NNP UTILISATION_NNP OF_NNP MANGO-SEED_NNP KERNEL_NNP AND_NNP JAMAN_NNP SEED_NNP MEAL_NNP IN_NNP A_NNP SIMPLIFIED_NNP POULTRY_NNP RATION_NNP FOR_NNP GROWING_NNP CHICKEN_NNP By_IN S._NNP BOSE_NNP ,_, B._NNP M._NNP THAKRAL_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP NARAYANAN_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 1_CD February_NNP 1952_CD )_) IN_NNP view_NN of_IN the_DT acute_NN food_NN shortage_NN in_IN the_DT country_NN ,_, investigations_NNS into_IN the_DT proper_JJ utilisation_NN of_IN the_DT waste_NN materials_NNS in_IN the_DT poultry_NN ration_NN are_VBP of_IN great_JJ importance_NN for_IN the_DT poultry_NN industry_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
In_IN a_DT previous_JJ investigation_NN Bose_NNP ,_, Thakral_NNP and_CC Narayanan_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NNP concluded_VBD that_IN mango-seed_JJ kernel_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ generally_RB thrown_VBN away_RB as_IN a_DT waste_NN material_NN ,_, could_MD be_VB utilised_VBN by_IN replacing_VBG as_RB much_RB as_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN in_IN the_DT laying_JJ ration_NN with_IN beneficial_JJ results_NNS ._.
The_DT inclu-_JJ sion_NN of_IN Jaman_NNP seed_NN meal_NN ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, had_VBD great_JJ depressing_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT egg_NN production_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ investigation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN undertaken_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effects_NNS of_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN mango-seed-kernel_NN and_CC jaman_NN seed_NN meal_NN to_TO a_DT simplified_JJ poultry_NN ration_NN for_IN growing_VBG chickens_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_VB A_NNP total_NN of_IN 45_CD Rhode_NNP Island_NNP Red_NNP chicks_NNS hatched_VBN in_IN May_NNP ,_, 1950_CD ,_, were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN three_CD comparable_JJ groups_NNS and_CC fed_VBN on_IN the_DT experimental_JJ diets_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN eight_CD weeks_NNS ._.
The_DT birds_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN on_IN all-mash_JJ rations_NNS in_IN a_DT wet_NN crumbly_RB state_NN according_VBG to_TO appetite_NN in_IN the_DT morning_NN ,_, noon_NN and_CC afternoon_NN ._.
Broken_NNP limestone_NN ,_, succulent_NN green_JJ food_NN and_CC fresh_JJ clean_JJ water_NN were_VBD supplied_VBN ad_NN lib_NN ._.
during_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN ._.
Group_NNP I_PRP was_VBD fed_VBN on_IN the_DT basal_NN ration_NN consisting_VBG of_IN yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN 55_CD parts_NNS ,_, wheat_NN bran_VBD 25_CD parts_NNS ,_, groundnut_NNS cake_VBP meal_JJ 19_CD parts_NNS and_CC common_JJ salt_NN 1_CD part_NN ._.
Group_NNP II_NNP received_VBD all-mash_JJ ration_NN in_IN which_WDT 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN of_IN the_DT basal_NN ration_NN was_VBD replaced_VBN by_IN mango-seed-kernel_NNS ._.
Group_NNP III_NNP was_VBD fed_VBN on_IN all-mash_JJ ration_NN in_IN which_WDT 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN of_IN the_DT basal_NN ration_NN was_VBD replaced_VBN by_IN jaman_NN seed_NN meal_NN ._.
Cooked_JJ meat_NN offal_NN was_VBD mixed_JJ with_IN the_DT mash_NN and_CC fed_NN to_TO the_DT birds_NNS in_IN all_PDT the_DT three_CD groups_NNS as_IN protein_JJ supplement_NN at_IN the_DT rates_NNS of_IN 1_CD part_NN of_IN meat_NN offal_NN for_IN every_DT 2_CD parts_NNS of_IN the_DT mash_NN ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN meat_NN offal_NN required_VBN every_DT day_NN was_VBD cooked_VBN for_IN about_IN an_DT hour_NN in_IN a_DT small_JJ quantity_NN of_IN water_NN and_CC run_VB through_IN a_DT mincing_NN machine_NN prior_RB to_TO mixing_VBG with_IN the_DT mash_NN ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP DISCUSSION_NNP At_IN eight_CD weeks_NNS the_DT average_JJ weights_NNS in_IN ounces_NNS of_IN the_DT males_NNS in_IN Groups_NNP I_PRP ,_, II_NNP and_CC III_NNP were_VBD 15.1_CD ,_, 14.1_CD and_CC 15.2_CD respectively_RB ._.
The_DT corresponding_JJ figures_NNS for_IN females_NNS were_VBD 13.3_CD ,_, 13.7_CD and_CC 13.4_CD ._.
Although_IN the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT monsoon_NN season_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ not_RB very_RB suitable_JJ for_IN growing_VBG chickens_NNS in_IN the_DT Northern_NNP India_NNP ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ remarkable_JJ that_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN of_IN the_DT chickens_NNS compared_VBN very_RB favourably_RB with_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN usually_RB obtained_VBN during_IN the_DT winter_JJ months_NNS ._.
At_IN no_DT stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN there_EX was_VBD any_DT significant_JJ difference_NN between_IN the_DT average_JJ weights_NNS of_IN Group_NNP I_PRP ,_, II_NNP and_CC III_NNP ._.
Both_DT mango-seed-kernel_NNS and_CC Jaman_NNP seed_NN meal_NN can_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, replace_VB 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN in_IN growing_VBG ration_NN without_IN any_DT detri-_JJ mental_JJ effect_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ rather_RB interesting_JJ because_IN similar_JJ experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP on_IN laying_VBG hens_NNS [_NNP Bose_NNP ,_, Thakral_NNP and_CC Narayanan_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
revealed_VBD that_IN jaman_NN seed_NN meal_NN had_VBD great_JJ depressing_JJ effect_NN on_IN egg_NN production_NN ._.
The_DT factor_NN present_NN in_IN jaman_NN seed_NN meal_NN ,_, which_WDT adversely_RB affected_VBD egg_NN production_NN ,_, had_VBD therefore_RB no_DT detrimental_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN chickens_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ food_NN consumptions_NNS were_VBD satisfactory_JJ and_CC very_RB similar_JJ for_IN all_PDT the_DT three_CD groups_NNS ._.
The_DT utilisation_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ rations_NNS in_IN ounces_NNS per_IN ounce_NN live_JJ weight_NN gain_NN did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT significant_JJ difference_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT inclusion_NN of_IN mango-seed-kernel_NNS and_CC jaman_NN seed_NN meal_NN by_IN replacing_VBG 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN separately_RB in_IN a_DT normal_JJ growing_VBG ration_NN showed_VBD no_DT detri-_JJ mental_JJ effect_NN ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN ,_, food_NN consumption_NN and_CC food_NN utilisation_NN were_VBD similar_JJ in_IN all_PDT the_DT three_CD groups_NNS ._.

PHYSIOLOGICAL_NNP STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP BLOOD_NNP OF_NNP DOMES-_NNP TIC_NNP ANIMALS_NNP III_NNP ._.
THE_DT NORMAL_NNP BLOOD_NNP PICTURE_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP KUMAONI_NNP BULLOCK*_NNP By_IN V._NNP N._NNP MURTY_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP D._NNP KEHAR_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Division_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ._.
(_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 30_CD January_NNP 1952_CD )_) THE_DT importance_NN of_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT normal_JJ blood_NN composition_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN nutritional_JJ and_CC physiological_JJ research_NN has_VBZ been_VBN emphasized_VBN by_IN Sen_NNP and_CC Roy_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP ,_, Kehar_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP and_CC Kehar_NNP et_VBP al_NN ._.
[_NN 1940_CD ,_, 1945_CD ,_, 1951a_CD ,_, 1951b_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT factors_NNS likely_JJ to_TO cause_VB variations_NNS in_IN blood_NN from_IN the_DT normal_JJ range_NN may_MD be_VB of_IN food_NN ,_, breed_NN or_CC climate_NN ._.
Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD variations_NNS in_IN the_DT blood_NN composition_NN of_IN Hariana_NNP and_CC Dhanni_NNP breeds_NNS ._.
Since_IN extensive_JJ nutritional_JJ investigations_NNS are_VBP carried_VBN out_IN on_IN Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP commonly_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT lower_JJR Himalayan_NNP ranges_NNS and_CC are_VBP very_RB economical_JJ and_CC docile_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN desirable_JJ to_TO study_VB in_IN detail_NN their_PRP$ normal_JJ blood_NN components_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Twenty_NNP four_CD healthy_JJ adult_NN Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN for_IN analysing_VBG the_DT morphological_JJ ,_, organic_JJ and_CC inorganic_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN blood_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD main-_JJ tained_VBN on_IN the_DT Institute_NNP basal_NN ration_NN consisting_VBG of_IN rape_NN cake_NN and_CC wheat_NN bhoosa_NN throughout_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN ._.
The_DT observations_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN during_IN the_DT TABLE_NNP I_PRP Showing_VBG the_DT morphological_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN Kumaoni_NNP bullock_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO Hariana_NNP and_CC Dhanni_NNP bullocks_VBZ Constituents_NNP KUMAONI_NNP BULLOCK_NNP HARIANA_NNP BULLOCK_NNP DHANNI_NNP BULLOCK_NNP Maximum_NNP Minimum_NNP Mean_NNP with_IN standard_JJ error_NN Mean_NNP [_NNP Kehar_NNP and_CC Murty_NNP ,_, 1945_CD ]_NN Mean_NNP [_NNP Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN Mean_NNP [_NNP Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NNP Haemoglobin_NNP gms/100_NN ml_NN ._.
blood_NN 9.2_CD 6.2_CD 7.4±0.18_CD 11.0_CD 10.8_CD 12.5_CD Red_NNP blood_NN corpuscles252_VBD THE_NNP BLOOD_NNP OF_NNP DOMESTIC_NNP ANIMALS_NNP ,_, III_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP summer_NN months_NNS ._.
Blood_NN was_VBD drawn_VBN from_IN the_DT jugular_JJ vein_NN before_IN the_DT morning_NN feed_NN was_VBD given_VBN ._.
The_DT morphological_JJ constituents_NNS and_CC blood_NN sugar_NN (_( total_JJ reducing_VBG sub-_JJ stances_NNS )_) were_VBD estimated_VBN in_IN the_DT whole_JJ blood_NN ._.
Neutral_JJ potassium_NN oxalate_NN was_VBD used_VBN as_IN the_DT anticoagulant_NN and_CC the_DT necessary_JJ correction_NN made_VBN in_IN calculating_VBG the_DT cell_NN volume_NN ._.
The_DT inorganic_JJ constituents_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, calcium_NN ,_, inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN ,_, magne-_JJ sium_NN ,_, sodium_NN ,_, potassium_NN and_CC chlorides_NNS ,_, and_CC proteins_NNS were_VBD estimated_VBN in_IN blood_NN serum_NN ._.
RESULTS_NNP AND_CC DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT morphological_JJ constituents_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT methods_NNS described_VBN by_IN Napier_NNP and_CC Das_NNP Gupta_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT range_NN and_CC the_DT average_NN with_IN standard_JJ error_NN of_IN these_DT constituents_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN and_CC compared_VBN with_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT other_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ evident_JJ from_IN the_DT Table_NN I_PRP that_IN the_DT Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS ,_, as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT Hariana_NNP and_CC Dhanni_NNP bullocks_NNS ,_, recorded_VBN significantly_RB lower_JJR values_NNS for_IN all_PDT the_DT haematological_JJ constituents_NNS studied_VBN except_IN the_DT white_JJ blood_NN corpuscles_NNS ._.
Haemoglobin_NNP ._.
The_DT method_NN of_IN Newcomer_NNP as_IN described_VBN by_IN Hawk_NNP ,_, Osler_NNP and_CC Summerson_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP was_VBD used_VBN in_IN estimating_VBG the_DT haemoglobin_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.

per_IN 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN ._.
This_DT figure_NN is_VBZ definitely_RB lower_JJR than_IN the_DT one_NN reported_VBN by_IN Kehar_NNP and_CC Murty_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP and_CC Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP for_IN Hariana_NNP and_CC Dhanni_NNP bullocks_NNS respectively_RB ._.

Corpuscular_JJ values_NNS (_( calculated_VBN )_) ._.

The_DT maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ values_NNS were_VBD 16.5_CD and_CC 11.5_CD mg._NN with_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 14.0±0.28_CD mg._NNS per_IN 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN serum_NN ._.
Chlorides_NNS ._.
The_DT serum_NN chlorides_NNS were_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN Whitehorn_NNP [_NNP 1920-21_JJ ]_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ chloride_JJ content_NN was_VBD 385±4.42_CD within_IN the_DT range_NN of_IN 344_CD to_TO 412_CD mg._NNS per_IN 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN serum_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT foregoing_NN data_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN that_IN the_DT blood_NN composition_NN of_IN Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS ,_, which_WDT showed_VBD lower_JJR haematological_JJ values_NNS as_IN compared_VBN to_TO those_DT of_IN pure_NN bred_VBN cattle_NNS ,_, compare_NN favourably_RB with_IN the_DT blood_NN picture_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS reported_VBN by_IN Kehar_NNP and_CC Murty_NNP [_NNP 1951_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT breed_NN differences_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT haemoglobin_NN concentration_NN and_CC the_DT red_JJ cell_NN count_NN ,_, observed_VBN by_IN Manresa_NNP and_CC Reyes_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP and_CC Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP ,_, the_DT low_JJ values_NNS recorded_VBN ,_, for_IN these_DT constituents_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT present_JJ study_NN ,_, seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB characteristic_JJ of_IN the_DT breed_NN ._.
The_DT mean_JJ corpuscular_JJ volume_NN and_CC the_DT mean_JJ corpuscular_JJ haemoglobin_NN of_IN goat_NN blood_NN [_NNP Murty_NNP and_CC Kehar_NNP 1951_CD ]_NN are_VBP lower_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS ._.
The_DT serum_NN calcium_NN and_CC magnesium_NN contents_NNS of_IN Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS are_VBP almost_RB the_DT same_JJ as_IN observed_VBN in_IN buffalo_NN [_NNP Kehar_NNP and_CC Murty_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._.
]_NN ,_, goat_NN [_NNP Murty_NNP and_CC Kehar_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
and_CC pure_NN bred_VBD cattle_NNS [_JJ Kehar_NNP and_CC Murty_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit._NN ,_, Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN ._.
The_DT serum_NN calcium_NN content_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR and_CC the_DT chlorides_NNS lower_JJR in_IN equine_JJ blood_NN [_NNP Kehar_NNP et_FW al_NN ,_, 1940_CD ]_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO that_DT of_IN Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN that_IN the_DT Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS recorded_VBD higher_JJR amounts_NNS of_IN serum_NN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN and_CC blood_NN sugar_NN but_CC lower_JJR serum_NN proteins_NNS ,_, than_IN the_DT pure_NN bred_VBD cattle_NNS ,_, but_CC they_PRP compare_VBP favourably_RB with_IN buffalo_JJ [_NNP Kehar_NNP and_CC Murty_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
and_CC goat_NN [_NNP Murty_NNP and_CC Kehar_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN ._.
The_DT sodium_NN and_CC chloride_JJ contents_NNS of_IN goat_NN serum_NN [_NNP Kehar_NNP and_CC Murty_NNP ,_, loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
are_VBP lower_JJR and_CC the_DT potassium_NN content_NN similar_JJ to_TO Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS ._.
The_DT above_JJ findings_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN not_RB only_RB the_DT blood_NN constituents_NNS of_IN different_JJ species_NNS of_IN domestic_JJ animals_NNS differ_VBP ,_, but_CC variations_NNS are_VBP also_RB found_VBN in_IN different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ species_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Previous_NNP investigations_NNS carried_VBD out_RP in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN had_VBD indicated_VBN that_IN there_EX may_MD be_VB a_DT possibility_NN of_IN variations_NNS in_IN the_DT amounts_NNS of_IN the_DT constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT blood_NN in_IN December_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN V._NNP N._NNP MURTY_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP D._NNP KEHAR_NNP 256_CD different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS ._.
Since_IN Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS are_VBP extensively_RB used_VBN for_IN meta-_JJ bolic_NN and_CC physiological_JJ experiments_NNS ,_, attempts_NNS were_VBD made_VBN to_TO establish_VB the_DT physio-_JJ logical_JJ standards_NNS for_IN the_DT blood_NN constituents_NNS of_IN this_DT breed_NN of_IN cattle_NNS ._.
These_DT observa-_JJ tions_NNS included_VBD the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT morphological_JJ ,_, organic_JJ and_CC inorganic_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ blood_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ values_NNS with_IN standard_JJ error_NN are_VBP given_VBN below_IN :_: Haemoglobin_NN :_: 7.40±0.18_CD gms_NN ._.
per_IN 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN ;_: Red_NNP blood_NN cell_NN count_NN 6.50±0.24_CD millions_NNS and_CC white_JJ cell_NN count_NN 8.40±0.33_CD thousands_NNS per_IN cubic_JJ millimeter_NN of_IN blood_NN ;_: cell_NN volumeTHE_IN BUFFALO258_NNP THE_NNP BUFFALODecember_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP E._NNP S._NNP E._NNP HAFEZ_NNP 259_CD in_IN the_DT milk-yield_JJ [_NNP Sinha_NNP and_CC Minett_NNP ,_, 1947_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT calf_NN can_MD be_VB delivered_VBN without_IN much_JJ difficulty_NN ._.
The_DT buffalo_NN calf_NN may_MD then_RB be_VB hand_NN reared_VBN (_( pail_JJ suckling_NN )_) with_IN good_JJ attention_NN ._.
Buffalo_NNP meat_NN is_VBZ thought_VBN to_TO be_VB coarse_JJ ,_, but_CC this_DT is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN old_JJ animals_NNS are_VBP usually_RB slaughtered_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT meat_NN of_IN an_DT animal_NN ,_, four_CD to_TO six_CD weeks_NNS old_JJ and_CC properly_JJ fed_NN ,_, in_IN no_DT way_NN differs_NNS from_IN veal_NN ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT relative_JJ nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN buffalo_NN beef_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN ox-beef_JJ and_CC veal_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ stated_VBN that_IN the_DT former_JJ is_VBZ dis-_JJ tinctly_RB superior_JJ in_IN several_JJ respects_NNS ._.
Buffalo_NNP beef_NN differs_NNS markedly_RB in_IN structure_NN from_IN ox-beef_NN ,_, the_DT muscle_NN fibres_VBZ being_VBG thicker_NN and_CC the_DT nuclei_NN more_RBR abundant_JJ ._.
In_IN trans-_JJ verse_NN sections_NNS ,_, the_DT fibres_NNS are_VBP polygonal_JJ instead_RB of_IN irregularly_JJ shaped_VBN ,_, the_DT component_NN fibrallae_NN are_VBP larger_JJR and_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT greater_JJR amount_NN of_IN sarcoplasm_NN ._.
Differences_NNS also_RB occur_VBP in_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT subcutaneous_JJ fat_NN ,_, connective_JJ tissue_NN and_CC elastic_JJ tissue_NN ._.
The_DT buffalo_JJ bull_NN can_MD not_RB stand_VB cold_NN or_CC heat_NN ,_, yet_CC he_PRP well_RB adapts_VBZ himself_PRP to_TO hard_JJ work_NN ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, the_DT buffalo_NN is_VBZ generally_RB more_RBR susceptible_JJ than_IN cattle_NNS to_TO Foot-and-_NNP Mouth_NNP disease_NN and_CC Anthrax_NNP and_CC the_DT incidence_NN of_IN Anthrax_NNP is_VBZ almost_RB the_DT same_JJ when_WRB compared_VBN to_TO cattle_NNS ._.
Although_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT breeds_NNS of_IN domestic_JJ buffalo_NNS have_VBP been_VBN introduced_VBN in_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN places_NNS ,_, their_PRP$ introduction_NN in_IN some_DT sub-tropical_JJ countries_NNS is_VBZ still_RB limited_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT British_JJ colonies_NNS (_( tropical_JJ Africa_NNP )_) and_CC in_IN most_JJS parts_NNS of_IN China_NNP there_EX are_VBP large_JJ areas_NNS of_IN swampy_NN land_NN which_WDT can_MD not_RB be_VB drained_VBN and_CC which_WDT supply_NN abundant_JJ grass_NN on_IN which_WDT the_DT buffalo_NN would_MD no_DT doubt_NN be_VB rendered_VBN productive_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS ,_, the_DT swamps_NNS and_CC marshes_NNS of_IN Florida_NNP ,_, Louisiana_NNP and_CC Mississippi_NNP should_MD be_VB especially_RB suitable_JJ for_IN buffalo_JJ production_NN ._.
Selection_NN must_MD be_VB made_VBN to_TO ensure_VB high_JJ milk_NN yields_NNS from_IN the_DT dairy_NN herds_NNS ._.
More_JJR angular_JJ form_NN ,_, better_JJR development_NN of_IN the_DT udder_NN and_CC milk_NN veins_NNS may_MD be_VB attained_VBN by_IN careful_JJ selection_NN ._.
The_DT selection_NN of_IN the_DT breeding_NN animals_NNS may_MD be_VB based_VBN on_IN the_DT progeny_JJ testing_NN of_IN each_DT individual_JJ buffalo-bull_NN ._.
Cross-breeding_JJ amongst_VBZ the_DT different_JJ breeds_NNS and_CC races_NNS of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ buffalo_NN might_MD give_VB desirable_JJ results_NNS ,_, and_CC artificial_JJ insemination_NN could_MD be_VB applied_VBN on_IN a_DT ,_, larger_JJR scale_NN ._.
Further_RB careful_JJ studies_NNS should_MD be_VB made_VBN before_IN an_DT attempt_NN to_TO spread_VB the_DT areas_NNS of_IN buffalo_NN raising_NN ._.

7_CD ,_, 303_CD )_) *Fouad_NN I_PRP University_NNP Thesis_NNP for_IN Ph.D._NNP degree_NN ,_, Faculty_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, Cairo_NNP ,_, Egypt_NNP CAUSES_NNP OF_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP BIRTH_NNP WEIGHT_NNP OF_IN EGYP-_NNP TIAN_NNP CATTLE_NNP AND_NNP BUFFALOES_NNP A_NNP ._.
A._NN ASKER_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP T._NNP RAGAB_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Breeding_NNP Department_NNP ,_, Faculty_NNP of_IN Agri-_NNP culture_NN ,_, Fouad_NNP First_NNP University_NNP ,_, Cairo_NNP ,_, Egypt_NNP ._.
(_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 18_CD March_NNP ,_, 1952_CD )_) THE_DT weight_NN of_IN an_DT animal_NN at_IN any_DT stage_NN of_IN life_NN is_VBZ a_DT phenotypic_JJ expression_NN of_IN its_PRP$ genetype_NN ._.
The_DT wider_NN the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD expressions_NNS ,_, the_DT less_JJR impor-_JJ tant_NN is_VBZ the_DT phenotype_NN as_IN an_DT aid_NN to_TO selection_NN ._.
The_DT part_NN played_VBN by_IN environment_NN in_IN the_DT determination_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB of_IN special_JJ importance_NN ._.
Birth_NNP weight_NN is_VBZ the_DT first_JJ measure_NN of_IN the_DT prospective_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN 's_POS weight_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR economical_JJ to_TO cull_VB the_DT surplus_NN males_NNS in_IN the_DT herd_NN as_RB early_RB as_IN possible_JJ ._.
In_IN consider-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT birth_NN weight_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN breeding_VBG plans_NNS ,_, a_DT full_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT importance_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ factors_NNS causing_VBG variation_NN should_MD be_VB known_VBN ._.
This_DT investigation_NN aims_VBZ at_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN how_WRB birth_JJ weight_NN in_IN Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS ,_, Pure-bred_NNP Shorthorn_NNP ,_, Shorthorn_NNP grades_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS is_VBZ affected_VBN by_IN genetical_JJ and_CC non-genetical_JJ factors_NNS ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN sex_NN ,_, sequence_NN of_IN calving_NN ,_, month_NN of_IN calving_NN and_CC the_DT sire_NN of_IN the_DT calf_NN were_VBD studied_VBN ._.
Also_RB the_DT repeatability_NN and_CC heritability_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN were_VBD determined_VBN ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP OF_NNP ANALYSIS_NNP Birth_NNP weights_NNS of_IN calves_NNS from_IN cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS were_VBD available_JJ on_IN 133_CD males_NNS and_CC 153_CD females_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS and_CC 140_CD males_NNS and_CC 130_CD females_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS ,_, besides_IN 133_CD calves_NNS of_IN pure_NN and_CC graded_VBD Shorthorn_NNP of_IN both_DT sexes_NNS ._.
All_PDT those_DT calves_NNS were_VBD born_VBN as_IN singles_NNS ._.
The_DT calves_NNS were_VBD born_VBN from_IN 1930_CD to_TO 1950_CD on_IN the_DT farm_NN of_IN the_DT Faculty_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, Giza_NNP ,_, Egypt_NNP ._.
They_PRP were_VBD dropped_VBN mainly_RB during_IN Autumn_NNP ,_, Winter_NNP and_CC Spring_NNP ;_: and_CC few_JJ cases_NNS happened_VBD to_TO be_VB born_VBN in_IN Summer_NNP ._.
The_DT buffalo_NN calves_NNS were_VBD sired_VBN by_IN seven_CD bulls_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT cattle_JJ calves_NNS had_VBD six_CD sires_NNS ._.
Each_DT bull_NN had_VBD seven_CD or_CC more_JJR calves_NNS ._.
Calves_NNS were_VBD usually_RB weighed_VBN within_IN 24_CD hours_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ birth_NN and_CC their_PRP$ weights_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN in_IN kilogrammes_NNS ._.
The_DT analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN for_IN sex_NN and_CC sequence_NN of_IN calving_NN was_VBD worked_VBN out_RP using_VBG the_DT method_NN suggested_VBN by_IN Snedecor_NNP and_CC Cox_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN estimating_VBG the_DT heritability_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN ,_, the_DT parental_JJ half-sibs_JJ method_NN suggested_VBN by_IN Lush_NNP [_NN 1948_CD ]_NN was_VBD used_VBN ,_, RESULTS_NNP AND_NNP DISCUSSION_NNP Effect_NNP of_IN sex_NN and_CC sequence_NN of_IN calving266_JJ BIRTH_NNP WEIGHT_NNP OF_NNP EGYPTIAN_NNP CATTLE_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP buffaloes_VBZ in_IN the_DT same_JJ order_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS show_VBP that_IN females_NNS are_VBP lighter_JJR than_IN male_JJ calves_NNS at_IN birth_NN in_IN both_DT cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ._.
The_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD sexes_NNS is_VBZ highly_RB significant_JJ in_IN both_DT cases_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ in_IN accordance_NN with_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Knapp_NNP et_FW al_NN [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN and_CC Tyler_NNP et_VBP al_NN [_NN 1947_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ birth_JJ weight_NN of_IN buffalo_NN calves_NNS was_VBD 38.50_CD and_CC 36.41_CD kilos_NN for_IN males_NNS and_CC females_NNS respectively_RB ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS the_DT averages_NNS were_VBD 25.77_CD and_CC 23.93_CD kilos_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ order_NN ._.
Buffaloes_NNS in_IN both_DT sexes_NNS exceeded_VBD cattle_NNS in_IN birth_NN weight_NN by_IN 12.73_CD and_CC 12.83_CD kilos_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN males_NNS and_CC females_NNS ._.
Such_JJ differences_NNS are_VBP expected_VBN since_IN we_PRP are_VBP deal-_JJ ing_VBG with_IN different_JJ species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Numbers_NNPS and_CC means_NNS of_IN birth_NN weight_NN in_IN kilos_NN according_VBG to_TO sex_NN of_IN the_DT calf_NN and_CC calving_NN ,_, sequence_NN of_IN dam_NN for_IN Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS ._.

A._NN ASKER_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP T._NNP RAGAB_NNP 267_CD When_WRB dams_NNS get_VBP older_JJR ,_, the_DT average_JJ birth_JJ weight_NN of_IN their_PRP$ calves_NNS tends_VBZ to_TO in-_JJ crease_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR pronounced_JJ in_IN the_DT early_JJ parturitions_NNS ,_, i.e._NN ,_, 1st_CD ,_, 2nd_CD and_CC 3rd_CD ones_NNS in_IN both_DT cases_NNS ,_, than_IN it_PRP is_VBZ in_IN the_DT later_JJ ones_NNS (_( Tables_NNPS I_PRP and_CC II_NNP )_) ._.
This_DT may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT dams_NN '_POS weights_NNS as_IN they_PRP advance_VBP in_IN age_NN and_CC approach_NN maturity_NN ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, the_DT analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN set_VBN out_RP in_IN Tables_NNP III_NNP and_CC IV_NNP ,_, showed_VBD that_IN the_DT mean_JJ square_NN for_IN sequence_NN of_IN calving_VBG is_VBZ highly_RB significant_JJ ._.

This_DT result_NN does_VBZ not_RB fully_RB agree_VBP with_IN other_JJ investigations_NNS carried_VBD out_RP in_IN this_DT respect_NN ._.
Knapp_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1941_CD ]_NN stated_VBD that_IN the_DT first_JJ calves_NNS were_VBD lighter_JJR than_IN their_PRP$ subsequents_NNS in_IN birth_NN weight_NN ,_, but_CC beyond_IN that_DT parturition_NN no_DT consistent_JJ trend_NN was_VBD evident_JJ ._.

Knapp_NNP and_CC Nordskog_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP and_CC Dawson_NNP et_VBP al_NN [_NN 1947_CD ]_NN used_VBN sire-offspring_JJ regression_NN and_CC parental_JJ half-sibs_JJ methods_NNS for_IN estima-_JJ ting_VBG the_DT heritability_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN in_IN beef_NN cattle_NNS ._.
Their_PRP$ estimates_NNS ranged_VBD between_IN 11_CD and_CC 42_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
This_DT analysis_NN shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT heritability_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN of_IN Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS are_VBP higher_JJR than_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT previously_RB mentioned_VBN results_NNS ._.
Such_JJ results_NNS are_VBP expected_VBN since_IN cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS in_IN Egypt_NNP are_VBP mixed_JJ populations_NNS and_CC consequently_RB the_DT genetic_JJ variability_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN should_MD be_VB higher_JJR than_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT established_VBN European_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO such_JJ high_JJ estimates_NNS of_IN heritability_NN for_IN birth_NN weight_NN in_IN both_DT Egyp-_NNP tian_JJ cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ,_, it_PRP could_MD be_VB concluded_VBN that_IN phenotypic_NN selection_NN could_MD be_VB used_VBN for_IN improving_VBG birth_JJ weights_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ._.

However_RB ,_, Kadi_NNP [_NNP 1952_CD ]_NNP working_VBG on_IN two_CD breeds_NNS of_IN Egyptian_JJ sheep_NN ,_, found_VBD that_IN the_DT genetic_JJ correlation_NN between_IN the_DT birth_NN weight_NN and_CC weaning_VBG weight_NN on_IN the_DT one_CD hand_NN ,_, and_CC birth_NN weight_NN and_CC marketing_NN weight_NN on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, were_VBD all_DT near_JJ unity_NN ._.
If_IN the_DT case_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS and_CC cattle_NNS is_VBZ proved_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT same_JJ ,_, selection_NN based_VBN on_IN birth_NN weight_NN will_MD not_RB lead_VB to_TO any_DT loss_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN genes_NNS controlling_VBG mature_NN weights_NNS ._.

A._NN ASKER_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP T._NNP RAGAB_NNP 271_CD The_DT herds_NNS of_IN the_DT Faculty_NNP were_VBD under_IN a_DT stable_JJ system_NN of_IN feeding_VBG for_IN the_DT whole_JJ period_NN of_IN study_NN ._.

During_IN Winter_NNP they_PRP were_VBD fed_VBN only_RB on_IN clover_NN if_IN it_PRP could_MD suffice_VB their_PRP$ needs_NNS ,_, otherwise_RB they_PRP were_VBD given_VBN a_DT supplementary_JJ ration_NN of_IN concentrates_NNS ._.
This_DT system_NN has_VBZ been_VBN followed_VBN all_DT through_IN the_DT long_JJ time_NN of_IN investigation_NN without_IN much_JJ change_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, one_CD could_MD not_RB expect_VB that_IN month_NN of_IN calving_VBG to_TO be_VB a_DT source_NN of_IN variation_NN in_IN birth_NN weight_NN of_IN calves_NNS under_IN such_JJ stable_JJ system_NN of_IN feeding_VBG and_CC manage-_JJ ment_NN ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP SUMMARY_NNP A_NNP study_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN the_DT sex_NN of_IN the_DT calf_NN ,_, calving_VBG sequence_NN ,_, month_NN of_IN calving_VBG and_CC sire_NN of_IN the_DT calf_NN on_IN birth_NN weight_NN of_IN Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ._.
The_DT heritability_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT repeatability_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN in_IN both_DT species_NNS were_VBD estimated_VBN ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN grading_VBG Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS with_IN pure-bred_JJ Shorthorn_NNP on_IN birth_NN weight_NN of_IN calves_NNS was_VBD determined_VBN ._.
The_DT study_NN covered_VBD a_DT period_NN of_IN twenty_JJ years_NNS (_( 1930-1950_JJ )_) and_CC included_VBD 286_CD ,_, 270_CD and_CC 133_CD calves_NNS of_IN both_DT sexes_NNS from_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, native_JJ cattle_NNS and_CC pure-bred_JJ Shorthorn_NNP and_CC grades_NNS respectively_RB ._.
The_DT average_JJ birth_JJ weight_NN of_IN male_JJ calves_NNS was_VBD 38.50_CD kilos_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT mean_JJ birth_NN weight_NN of_IN females_NNS was_VBD 36.41_CD kilos_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS ,_, the_DT mean_JJ birth_NN weights_NNS were_VBD 25.77_CD and_CC 23.93_CD kilos_NN for_IN males_NNS and_CC females_NNS res-_VBP pectively_RB ._.
The_DT differences_NNS between_IN sexes_NNS in_IN cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS were_VBD significant_JJ ._.
Sequence_NN of_IN calving_NN was_VBD responsible_JJ for_IN bringing_VBG about_RB significant_JJ differences_NNS between_IN birth_JJ weights_NNS of_IN calves_NNS in_IN cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ._.
Month_NNP of_IN calving_VBG appeared_VBN to_TO have_VB no_DT effect_NN on_IN birth_NN weight_NN of_IN calves_NNS ._.
The_DT heritability_NN estimate_NN for_IN birth_NN weight_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS was_VBD 0.561_CD compared_VBN to_TO 0.417_CD for_IN cattle_NNS ._.
The_DT repeatability_NN of_IN birth_NN weight_NN was_VBD .548_JJ and_CC 0.048_CD for_IN buffaloes_NNS and_CC cattle_NNS respectively_RB ._.
Grading_VBG Egyptian_JJ cattle_NNS with_IN purebred_JJ Shorthorns_NNP caused_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT birth_NN weight_NN of_IN calves_NNS ._.
The_DT difference_NN between_IN grades_NNS was_VBD not_RB significant_JJ ,_, also_RB grade_VBN Shorthorns_NNP were_VBD 6.6_CD kilos_NNS heavier_RBR in_IN their_PRP$ birth_NN weight_NN than_IN Egyptian_JJ calves_NNS ._.
