Sci._NNP ,_, 30_CD ,_, 483-498_JJ REGIONAL_NNP DISTRIBUTION_NNP OF_NNP TABANUS_NNP FLIES_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP AND_NNP ITS_NNP RELATIONSHIP_NNP TO_NNP THE_NNP INCIDENCE_NNP OF_NNP SURRA_NNP BY_NNP B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP ._.
P._NNP BALARAMA_NNP MENON_NNP ,_, AND_NNP C._NNP M._NNP SEN_NNP GUPTA_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN Publication_NNP on_IN 14_CD April_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP XX-XXI_NNP )_) THE_NNP flies_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT genus_NN Tabanus_NNP ,_, commonly_RB known_VBN as_IN horse-flies_NNS or_CC gnats_NNS ,_, are_VBP widely_RB prevalent_JJ in_IN India_NNP ,_, having_VBG been_VBN recorded_VBN from_IN tropical_JJ ,_, sub_JJ »_NNP tropical_NN ,_, and_CC temperate_JJ regions_NNS ._.
The_DT adults_NNS are_VBP strong_JJ fliers_NNS and_CC occur_VBP abundantly_RB in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN water_NN both_DT on_IN the_DT plains_NNS and_CC hills_NNS ._.
All_PDT the_DT common_JJ species_NNS are_VBP blood_JJ suckers_NNS and_CC attack_NN warm_NN blooded_VBD animals_NNS including_VBG man_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT diseases_NNS '_POS transmitted_VBN by_IN these_DT flies_NNS ,_, surra_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS important_JJ ,_, affecting_JJ horses_NNS ,_, mules_NNS ,_, camels_NNS ,_, cattle_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
These_DT flies_NNS lay_VBP their_PRP$ eggs_NNS generally_RB on_IN leaves_NNS over-hanging_JJ water_NN ._.
After_IN hatching_VBG the_DT larvae_NN fall_NN into_IN the_DT water_NN and_CC develop_NN ._.
When_WRB mature_NN ,_, they_PRP crawl_VBP to_TO dry_VB soil_NN ,_, pupate_NN and_CC after_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS emerge_VBP as_IN adult_NN flies_NNS ._.
The_DT available_JJ meagre_NN ,_, scattered_VBN data_NNS on_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN Tabanus_NNP in_IN India_NNP comprise_VBP the_DT catalogue_NN by_IN Senior-White_NNP [_NN 1927_CD ]_NN and_CC the_DT records_NNS based_VBN on_IN the_DT speci-_JJ mens_NNS received_VBN from_IN field_NN workers_NNS for_IN identification_NN at_IN this_DT Institute_NNP ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO provide_VB an_DT up-to-date_JJ ready_JJ reference_NN to_TO the_DT distribution_NN of_IN species_NNS of_IN Tabanus_NNP in_IN India_NNP ,_, their_PRP$ occurrence_NN ,_, compiled_VBN from_IN various_JJ sources_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN recorded_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN ._.
The_DT study_NN on_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN these_DT flies_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN extended_VBN as_RB far_RB as_IN pos-_JJ sible_JJ to_TO Pakistan_NNP and_CC other_JJ surrounding_VBG countries_NNS as_IN a_DT knowledge_NN of_IN their_PRP$ occurrence_NN in_IN the_DT neighbouring_JJ countries_NNS will_MD be_VB useful_JJ in_IN devising_VBG control_NN measures_NNS ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN the_DT division_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN into_IN five_CD regions_NNS on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN topography_NN ,_, climate_NN ,_, rainfall_NN and_CC vegetation_NN ,_, etc._NN ,_, as_IN recommended_VBN by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP for_IN the_DT orientation_NN of_IN agricultural_JJ research_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN adopted_VBN ._.
Their_PRP$ incidence_NN has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN discussed_VBN according_VBG to_TO four_CD natural_JJ physical_JJ regions_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, montane_NN ,_, submontane_NN ,_, pastural_JJ ,_, and_CC coastal_NN ._.
Region_NN 1274_CD REGIONAL_NNP DISTRIBUTION_NNP OF_NNP TABANUS_NNP FLIES_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP This_DT region_NN contains_VBZ also_RB the_DT submontane_NN zone_NN ,_, i.e._NN ,_, the_DT foot_NN hills_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT very_RB heavy_JJ rainfall_NN ,_, up_RB to_TO 220_CD inches_NNS ,_, mostly_RB distributed_VBN between_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN June_NNP and_CC September_NNP ._.
The_DT land_NN has_VBZ a_DT slope_NN and_CC the_DT soil_NN is_VBZ generally_RB porous_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ traversed_VBN by_IN numerous_JJ rivers_NNS ,_, streams_NNS and_CC seepages_NNS of_IN varying_VBG sizes_NNS particularly_RB during_IN the_DT rains_NNS ._.
The_DT local_JJ rainfall_NN has_VBZ very_RB little_JJ effect_NN on_IN them_PRP for_IN unless_IN the_DT sub-soil_JJ water_NN on_IN the_DT hills_NNS is_VBZ high_JJ the_DT streams_NNS do_VBP not_RB have_VB water_NN for_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT day_NN even_RB if_IN there_EX has_VBZ been_VBN heavy_JJ downpour_NN locally_RB ._.
The_DT places_NNS described_VBN above_IN are_VBP ideal_JJ for_IN the_DT breeding_NN of_IN Tabanus_NNP flies_NNS as_IN is_VBZ evident_JJ from_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN nineteen_JJ species_NNS have_VBP been_VBN recorded_VBN from_IN this_DT region_NN ._.

Region_NN 3December_CD ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP ,_, P._NNP BALARAMA_NNP MENON_NNP ,_, AND_NNP C._NNP M._NNP SEN_NNP GUPTA_NNP 279_CD area_NN has_VBZ an_DT average_JJ rainfall_NN of_IN twenty-five_JJ to_TO fifty_VB inches_NNS and_CC is_VBZ largely_RB millet_JJ growing_VBG ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ a_DT roughly_RB triangular_JJ undulating_JJ land_NN of_IN moderate_JJ elevation_NN interespersed_VBN with_IN tracts_NNS of_IN somewhat_RB higher_JJR forest-covered_JJ hills_NNS and_CC plateaus_NN ._.

The_DT central_JJ plateau_NN as_IN a_DT whole_JJ slopes_NN to_TO the_DT east_NN and_CC almost_RB all_PDT the_DT rivers_NNS flow_VBP from_IN west_NN to_TO east_VB ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP In_IN this_DT paper_NN efforts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO rearrange_VB the_DT incidence_NN of_IN surra_NN on_IN regional_JJ basis_NN as_IN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN in_IN case_NN of_IN tabanid_NN flies_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN in_IN Region_NNP 1_CD the_DT incidence_NN is_VBZ varied_VBN ._.
In_IN Kashmir_NNP the_DT incidence_NN is_VBZ reported_VBN to_TO be_VB moderately_RB low_JJ ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB high_JJ in_IN portions_NNS of_IN East_NNP Punjab_NNP and_CC Himachal_NNP Pradesh_NNP and_CC moderately_RB high_JJ in_IN certain_JJ portions_NNS of_IN Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP and_CC low_JJ in_IN portions_NNS of_IN Bihar_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP and_CC Assam_NNP ._.
No_DT record_NN of_IN surra_NN was_VBD available_JJ from_IN Nepal_NNP ,_, Sikkim_NNP and_CC Bhutan_NNP ._.
In_IN Region_NNP 2_CD the_DT range_NN of_IN variation_NN of_IN incidence_NN varies_NNS from_IN moderately_RB heavy_JJ to_TO very_RB low_JJ ._.
No_DT record_NN was_VBD available_JJ from_IN Vindhya_NNP Pradesh_NNP ._.
In_IN Region_NNP 3_CD heaviest_JJS in-_JJ cidence_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN in_IN the_DT portion_NN of_IN Punjab_NNP and_CC moderately_RB heavy_JJ infestation_NN in_IN Sind_NNP and_CC part_NN of_IN Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ._.
The_DT comparatively_RB less_RBR infested_JJ areas_NNS of_IN Kashmir_NNP ,_, North_NNP West_NNP Frontier_NNP Province_NNP and_CC Madhya_NNP Pradesh_NNP are_VBP also_RB included_VBN in_IN this_DT region_NN ._.
No_DT information_NN was_VBD available_JJ from_IN Greater_NNP Rajasthan_NNP ,_, a_DT camel_NN raising_VBG area_NN ,_, and_CC Baluchistan_NNP ._.
In_IN Region_NNP 4_CD the_DT incidence_NN of_IN surra_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC Madras_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN to_TO be_VB moderately_RB high_JJ and_CC Mysore_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN to_TO be_VB free_JJ from_IN it_PRP ._.
No_DT report_NN of_IN surra_NN was_VBD available_JJ from_IN Saurashtra_NNP ,_, Kutch_NNP ,_, and_CC Madhya_NNP Bharat_NNP ._.
Incidence_NN of_IN surra_NN in_IN Region_NNP 5_CD has_VBZ been_VBN recorded_VBN very_RB low_JJ ._.
However_RB ,_, with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO establish_VB more_JJR clearly_RB the_DT direct_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT disease_NN and_CC the_DT transmitting_NN vector_NN ,_, more_JJR detailed_JJ information_NN will_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB collected_VBN to_TO rearrange_VB the_DT distribution_NN map_NN of_IN surra_NN on_IN regional_JJ basis_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP To_TO provide_VB a_DT ready_JJ ,_, uptodate_JJ reference_NN to_TO the_DT distribution_NN of_IN Tabanus_NNP flics_NNS in_IN India_NNP ,_, their_PRP$ incidence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN plotted_VBN in_IN a_DT map_NN of_IN India_NNP ._.

Temperate_NNP Himalayan_NNP Region.December_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP B._NNP C._NNP BASU_NNP ,_, P._NNP BALARAMA_NNP MENON_NNP AND_NNP C._NNP M._NNP S._NNP GUPTA_NNP 287_CD Out_NNP of_IN the_DT seventy-five_JJ species_NNS of_IN Tabanus_NNP recorded_VBD from_IN India_NNP and_CC the_DT surround-_JJ ing_NN countries_NNS ,_, the_DT following_VBG seven_CD has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN to_TO be_VB capable_JJ of_IN transmitting_VBG surra_NN :_: Tabanus_NNP ditaeniatus_NN Mac._NNP ,_, Tabanus_NNP macer_NN Bigot_NNP ,_, Tabanus_NNP nemocallosus_NN Ricard._NNP ,_, Tabanus_NNP rubidus_NN Wied._NNP ,_, Tabanus_NNP striatus_NN Fabr._NNP ,_, Tabanus_NNP tropicus_NN Panzer_NNP and_CC Tabanus_NNP virgo_NNP Wied_NNP ._.
The_DT incidence_NN of_IN surra_NN has_VBZ been_VBN recorded_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT heaviest_JJS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP followed_VBN by_IN Sind_NNP and_CC Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP in_IN its_PRP$ intensity_NN ._.

The_DT average_JJ production_NN of_IN wool_NN per_IN sheep_NN is_VBZ reported_VBN as_IN 1.9_CD lbs_NN ._.
a_DT year_NN [_RB 3_CD ]_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ probably_RB lower_JJR than_IN that_DT for_IN any_DT other_JJ sheep-raising_JJ country_NN ;_: the_DT entire_JJ yearly_JJ production_NN of_IN 54.33_CD million_CD lbs_NN ._.
[_RB 5_CD ]_NN from_IN a_DT quality_NN standpoint_NN is_VBZ classed_VBN as_IN a_DT coarse_JJ carpet_NN wool_NN ,_, suitable_JJ only_RB for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN carpets_NNS and_CC rough_JJ blankets_NNS ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN producing_VBG surplus_JJ wool_NN ,_, with_IN an_DT export_JJ figure_NN of_IN about_IN 41.14_CD million_CD lbs_NN ._.
[_RB 5_CD ]_NNS every_DT year_NN ,_, the_DT country_NN has_VBZ to_TO import_VB 19.24_CD million_CD lbs_NN ._.
of_IN apparel_NN wools_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO meet_VB its_PRP$ needs_NNS for_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN clothing_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ export_NN goes_VBZ into_IN the_DT international_JJ trade_NN as_IN carpet_NN wool_NN ._.
Besides_IN the_DT need_NN for_IN increasing_VBG the_DT quantity_NN of_IN wool_NN per_IN sheep_NN ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN improvement_NN of_IN quality_NN ,_, both_DT for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN apparel_JJ wool_NN to_TO meet_VB the_DT domestic_JJ consumption_NN and_CC for_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN ideal_JJ carpet_NN wool_NN for_IN export_NN ,_, would_MD be_VB a_DT befitting_NN plan_NN for_IN any_DT pro-_JJ gressive_JJ program_NN ,_, with_IN due_JJ regard_NN to_TO environmental_JJ and_CC feeding_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
From_IN a_DT preliminary_JJ survey_NN by_IN the_DT Marketing_NNP Department_NNP of_IN India_NNP [_NNP 3_CD ]_NN ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN although_IN the_DT foundation_NN stock_NN is_VBZ inferior_JJ ,_, potentialities_NNS for_IN improve-_JJ ment_NN in_IN certain_JJ breeds_NNS are_VBP not_RB entirely_RB lacking_VBG ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT promising_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN ,_, of_IN country-wide_JJ importance_NN ,_, is_VBZ the_DT Bikaner_NNP ,_, native_JJ to_TO the_DT northwestern_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP in_IN the_DT Rajasthan_NNP Union_NNP ._.
It_PRP derives_VBZ its_PRP$ name_NN from_IN its_PRP$ homeland_NN ,_, the_DT Bikaner_NNP State_NNP ._.
The_DT breed_NN is_VBZ reported_VBN to_TO produce_VB one_CD of_IN the_DT finest_JJS carpet_NN wools_NNS in_IN the_DT world_NN [_VBZ 16_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT average_JJ fleece_JJ weight_NN is_VBZ reported_VBN to_TO be_VB as_RB high_JJ as_IN 6.5_CD lbs_NN ._.
[_RB 23_CD ]_NNS ._.
Due_JJ to_TO the_DT superior_JJ quality_NN of_IN the_DT sheep_NN and_CC its_PRP$ wool_NN ,_, the_DT breed_NN has_VBZ found_VBN favour_RB in_IN many_JJ other_JJ states_NNS of_IN the_DT country294_NN BIKANER_NNP WOOL_NNP AND_NNP ITS_NNP IMPROVEMENT_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP spite_NN of_IN varied_JJ climates_NNS ,_, which_WDT in_IN many_JJ cases_NNS are_VBP too_RB humid_JJ ,_, with_IN high_JJ rainfalls_NNS ,_, as_IN compared_VBN with_IN its_PRP$ ,_, arid_JJ home-region_NN ,_, the_DT breed_NN is_VBZ reported_VBN flourishing_VBG in_IN Assam_NNP [_NNP 15_CD ]_NNP ,_, Orissa_NNP [_VBZ 27_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC Madras_NNP [_NNP 6_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT breed_NN already_RB yields_VBZ an_DT enormous_JJ influence_NN in_IN Rajputana_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP ,_, and_CC United_NNP Provinces_NNP ,_, and_CC ,_, with_IN the_DT growing_VBG interest_NN to_TO introduce_VB the_DT breed_NN in_IN southern_JJ and_CC central_JJ India_NNP ,_, Bikaner_NNP sheep_NN and_CC wool_NN have_VBP become_VBN important_JJ in_IN all_DT regions_NNS of_IN India_NNP ._.
With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO explore_VB the_DT possibilities_NNS and_CC the_DT potentialities_NNS for_IN improvement_NN of_IN this_DT sheep_NN and_CC wool_NN ,_, 8_CD representative_JJ commercial_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD analyzed_VBN in_IN the_DT Wool_NNP Department_NNP ,_, University_NNP of_IN Wyo-_NNP ming_NN ,_, Laramie_NNP ,_, Wyoming_NNP ._.
POSITION_NN OF_NNP BIKANER_NNP WOOL_NNP Bikaner_NNP wool_NN is_VBZ unique_JJ for_IN its_PRP$ length_NN ,_, color_NN ,_, quality_NN ,_, and_CC loftiness_RB as_IN a_DT product_NN best_RB suited_VBN for_IN carpets_NNS ._.
It_PRP always_RB commands_VBZ the_DT highest_JJS prices_NNS in_IN the_DT local_JJ markets_NNS as_IN compared_VBN with_IN other_JJ wools_NNS ,_, which_WDT usually_RB are_VBP double_JJ in_IN amount_NN by_IN weight_NN [_$ 4_CD ]_NN ._.
Because_IN of_IN its_PRP$ superior_JJ quality_NN ,_, the_DT wool_NN is_VBZ mixed_VBN by_IN the_DT traders_NNS with_IN inferior_JJ wools_NNS from_IN adjoining_VBG areas_NNS and_CC exported_VBD to_TO foreign_JJ countries_NNS under_IN the_DT trade_NN name_NN of_IN Vicanere_NNP wool_VBP [_$ 4_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN recent_JJ years_NNS ,_, wool_NN from_IN certain_JJ localities_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN so_RB highly_RB appreciated_VBN for_IN its_PRP$ fineness_NN and_CC quality_NN that_WDT certain_JJ authorities_NNS have_VBP been_VBN inclined_VBN to_TO believe_VB that_IN the_DT wool_NN is_VBZ more_RBR suitable_JJ for_IN clothing_NN purposes_NNS than_IN for_IN carpet_NN manufacture_NN ._.
A_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT wool_NN produced_VBN is_VBZ utilized_VBN by_IN farmers_NNS in_IN hand_NN spinning_NN and_CC weav-_JJ ing_NN for_IN making_VBG articles_NNS of_IN native_JJ dress_NN and_CC blankets_NNS ,_, while_IN a_DT certain_JJ percentage_NN goes_VBZ into_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN carpets_NNS and_CC rugs_NNS ._.
A_DT major_JJ portion_NN is_VBZ exported_VBN from_IN the_DT home-region_NN to_TO markets_NNS in_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP for_IN use_NN in_IN the_DT mills_NNS and_CC for_IN foreign_JJ trade_NN ._.
The_DT 3_CD types_NNS of_IN woolDecember_NN ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP G._NNP S._NNP MAHAL_NNP ,_, A._NNP JOHNSTON_NNP AND_NNP R._NNP H._NNP BURNS_NNP 295_CD Before_IN analysis_NN the_DT representative_NN samples_NNS were_VBD scoured_VBN in_IN order_NN to_TO remove_VB extraneous_JJ matter_NN ._.

Burns_NNP '_POS improved_VBN technique_NN [_$ 13_CD ]_NN was_VBD used_VBN for_IN the_DT measurements_NNS ._.

Only_RB 100_CD readings_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN to_TO measure_VB the_DT fiber_NN types_NNS ._.
The_DT contour_NN ratio_NN ,_, which_WDT expresses_VBZ the_DT ellipticity_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN cross_NN section_NN ,_, was_VBD measured_VBN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT major_JJ to_TO the_DT minor_JJ axis_NN [_VBD 31_CD ]_NN ._.
Barker_NNP [_VBD 8_CD ]_NN has_VBZ proved_VBN that_IN in_IN two_CD wools_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ fineness_NN ,_, the_DT more_JJR circular_JJ wool_NN spins_NNS better_RBR ._.
Hardy_NNP 's_POS technique_NN [_VBD 19_CD ]_NN was_VBD used_VBN in_IN making_VBG the_DT cross_NN sections_NNS ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP The_DT amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN and_CC the_DT thickness_NN measurements_NNS of_IN different_JJ samples_NNS apparently_RB show_VBP a_DT direct_JJ relation_NN to_TO one_CD another_DT ._.

length_NN is_VBZ 1,900_CD ,_, with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN from_IN 1,700_CD to_TO 2,300_CD ;_: and_CC on_IN heterotypical_JJ and_CC hair_JJ fibers_NNS is_VBZ 2,788_CD ,_, with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN from_IN 1,800_CD to_TO 3,400_CD ._.
When_WRB calculated_VBN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN 100µ_CD width_NN and_CC the_DT same_JJ length_NN ,_, the_DT average_JJ number_NN is_VBZ 10,797_CD ,_, with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN from_IN 9,000_CD to_TO 13,571_CD ,_, in_IN the_DT former_JJ case_NN ;_: and_CC 5,332_CD ,_, with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN from_IN 3,214_CD to_TO 7,750_CD ,_, in_IN the_DT latter_NN ._.

The_DT average_NN for_IN the_DT true_JJ wool_NN fibers_NNS was_VBD 6.4_CD ,_, with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN from_IN 5½_CD to_TO 8_CD ;_: that_WDT for_IN the_DT heterotype_NN and_CC hair_NN fibers_NNS was_VBD 5_CD ,_, with_IN a_DT range_NN of_IN from_IN 4_CD to_TO 7_CD ._.

XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP The_DT shape_NN of_IN the_DT scales_NNS on_IN the_DT true_JJ wool_NN fibers_NNS was_VBD of_IN annular_JJ or_CC coronal_JJ form_NN (_( single_JJ scale_NN along_IN the_DT width_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN )_) ,_, as_IN described_VBN by_IN Blyth_NNP [_NNP 10_CD ]_NNP ,_, and_CC resembled_VBD the_DT segments_NNS of_IN a_DT young_JJ bamboo_NN cane_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN heterotypical_JJ and_CC hair_JJ fibers_NNS ,_, the_DT shape_NN of_IN the_DT scales_NNS was_VBD polygonal_JJ or_CC flattened_VBN ._.
Various_JJ forms_NNS of_IN pentagonal_JJ and_CC hexagonal_JJ shapes_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD apparent_JJ that_IN with_IN a_DT smaller_JJR thickness_NN the_DT shape_NN of_IN the_DT scales_NNS was_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_JJR of_IN a_DT columnar_NN type_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP inclined_VBD to_TO become_VB rectangular_JJ and_CC flattened_VBN with_IN increase_NN in_IN the_DT thickness_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Eight_NNP samples_NNS illustrating_VBG average_NN and_CC extreme_JJ types_NNS of_IN Bikaner_NNP wool_WDT were_VBD selected_VBN from_IN 28_CD samples_NNS received_VBN from_IN the_DT Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP at_IN Hissar_NNP ,_, India_NNP ._.
These_DT 8_CD samples_NNS were_VBD analyzed_VBN for_IN fiber_NN types_NNS ,_, dividing_VBG them_PRP into_IN true_JJ wool_NN ,_, hair_NN ,_, heterotype_NN ,_, and_CC kemp_NN fibers_NNS ._.
Both_DT the_DT benzol_NN test_NN and_CC microscopic_NN cross-_JJ sectional_JJ images_NNS were_VBD used_VBN in_IN the_DT classification_NN ._.
Fiber_NNP thickness_NN ,_, stretched_VBD fiber_NN length_NN ,_, and_CC contour_NNS ratio_NN were_VBD determined_VBN for_IN the_DT 8_CD samples_NNS along_IN with_IN the_DT surface_NN scale_NN measurements_NNS for_IN the_DT different_JJ fiber_NN types_NNS ._.
CONCLUSIONS_NNP The_DT following_JJ conclusions_NNS are_VBP evident_JJ from_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD from_IN this_DT study_NN :_: 1_CD ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT count_NN analysis_NN of_IN fiber_NN types_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ dimensional_JJ characteristics_NNS in_IN the_DT 8_CD samples_NNS as_IN a_DT whole_JJ show_NN that_IN the_DT wool_NN is_VBZ very_RB near_RB to_TO the_DT carpet_NN wool_NN standards_NNS as_IN worked_VBN out_RP by_IN Burns_NNP ,_, Johnston_NNP ,_, and_CC Chen_NNP [_NNP 14_CD ]_NN and_CC the_DT Southwestern_NNP Sheep_NNP Breeding_NNP Laboratory_NNP at_IN Fort_NNP Wingate_NNP ,_, New_NNP Mexico_NNP ,_, from_IN their_PRP$ work_NN on_IN Navajo_NNP Sheep_NNP [_VBD 2_CD ]_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN the_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT length_NN and_CC fineness_NN of_IN fiber_NN types_NNS is_VBZ slightly_RB largerDecember_VBN ,_, 1952_CD ]_NNP G._NNP S._NNP MAHAL_NNP ,_, A._NNP JOHNSTON_NNP AND_NNP R._NNP H._NNP BURUS_NNP 303_CD 4_CD ._.
The_DT analysis_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN the_DT individual_JJ samples_NNS indicates_VBZ that_IN there_EX are_VBP great_JJ possibilities_NNS for_IN improving_VBG the_DT wool_NN for_IN apparel_NN fabrics_NNS ,_, the_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT fiber_NN thickness_NN being_VBG rather_RB large_JJ to_TO require_VB particular_JJ attention_NN ._.
Even_RB the_DT finest_JJS samples_NNS ,_, with_IN average_JJ thicknesses_NNS of_IN 26.55µ_CD and_CC 26.77µ_CD ,_, show_VBP variations_NNS of_IN 34.2_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 49.2_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
For_IN any_DT program_NN of_IN improvement_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, the_DT greatest_JJS emphasis_NN should_MD be_VB to_TO attain_VB the_DT uniformity_NN of_IN fibers_NNS ._.
The_DT uniformity_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN true_JJ wool_NN fibers_NNS is_VBZ fairly_RB satisfactory_JJ ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT stretched_JJ fiber_NN length_NN of_IN different_JJ types_NNS of_IN fibers_NNS in_IN the_DT individual_NN samples_NNS do_VBP not_RB show_VB any_DT marked_JJ elongation_NN of_IN the_DT outer_NN coat_NN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT inner_JJ coat_NN as_IN seen_VBN in_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT poor_JJ carpet_NN wools_NNS ._.
This_DT characteristic_JJ is_VBZ highly_RB desirable_JJ for_IN the_DT spinning_VBG value_NN of_IN carpet_NN wools_NNS ._.
6_CD ._.
There_EX appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB a_DT relationship_NN between_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN and_CC the_DT thickness_NN of_IN the_DT entire_JJ sample_NN ,_, the_DT diameter_NN increasing_VBG with_IN increased_VBN medulla-_JJ tion_NN in_IN the_DT sample_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, hair_NN fibers_NNS with_IN a_DT diameter_NN of_IN 30µ_CD and_CC wool_JJ fibers_NNS with_IN a_DT diameter_NN of_IN 50µ_CD show_NN that_IN the_DT diameter_NN alone_RB does_VBZ not_RB control_VB medullation_NN in_IN wool_NN ,_, and_CC some_DT other_JJ factor_NN ,_, probably_RB genetic_JJ ,_, is_VBZ partly_RB ,_, if_IN not_RB entirely_RB ,_, responsible_JJ ._.
7_CD ._.
The_DT average_JJ contour_JJ ratio_NN of_IN the_DT 8_CD samples_NNS is_VBZ 1.284_CD ,_, designating_VBG a_DT fair_JJ spinn-_JJ ability_NN according_VBG to_TO the_DT trade_NN opinion_NN ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT samples_NNS showed_VBD a_DT very_RB good_JJ spinnability_NN ,_, with_IN a_DT contour_NN of_IN 1.179_CD ,_, and_CC one_CD showed_VBD a_DT medium_NN spinnability_NN ._.
This_DT again_RB reflects_VBZ possibilities_NNS for_IN improvement_NN ._.
Higher_JJR contour_NN ratio_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB related_VBN to_TO higher_JJR amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN the_DT individual_JJ samples_NNS ._.
8_CD ._.
The_DT average_JJ number_NN of_IN scales_NNS on_IN true_JJ wool_NN fibers_NNS with_IN an_DT average_JJ thickness_NN of_IN 17.2µ_CD is_VBZ 1,900_CD along_IN one_CD surface_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ very_RB close_RB to_TO that_DT for_IN the_DT fine_JJ wool_NN Merino_NNP ._.
When_WRB compared_VBN on_IN the_DT equal_JJ basis_NN of_IN unit_NN length_NN and_CC 100µ_CD width_NN ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN scales_NNS on_IN the_DT true_JJ wool_NN fibers_NNS was_VBD double_JJ that_IN found_VBD on_IN the_DT heterotypical_JJ or_CC hair_JJ fibers_NNS ._.
The_DT outline_NN of_IN the_DT scales_NNS is_VBZ uniform_JJ ,_, regular_JJ ,_, and_CC annular_NN on_IN the_DT true_JJ wool_NN fiber_NN ,_, but_CC is_VBZ irregular_JJ ,_, with_IN pentagonal_JJ ,_, hexagonal_JJ and_CC rectangular_JJ forms_NNS ,_, on_IN the_DT hair_NN and_CC heterotypical_JJ fibers_NNS ._.
9_CD ._.
For_IN a_DT mass_NN improvement_NN of_IN Bikaner_NNP sheep_VBP it_PRP seems_VBZ necessary_JJ that_IN only_RB tested_VBD rams_NNS be_VB used_VBN for_IN breeding_VBG which_WDT show_VBP a_DT desirable_JJ amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN the_DT fleece_NN and_CC possess_NN maximum_JJ uniformity_NN in_IN fiber_NN thickness_NN ._.

The_DT visible_JJ scale_NN height_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB an_DT important_JJ characteristic_NN for_IN differentiation_NN between_IN wool_NN and_CC related_JJ hair_NN fibers_NNS such_JJ as_IN mohair_NN and_CC camel_NN 's_POS hair_NN ._.
A_DT special_JJ study_NN of_IN the_DT epidermal_JJ structure_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB necessary_JJ in_IN blends_NNS of_IN wool_NN and_CC related_JJ fibers_NNS which_WDT can_MD only_RB be_VB distinguished_VBN by_IN the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT scale_NN formation_NN ._.
Apart_RB from_IN ascertaining_VBG the_DT number_NN of_IN scales_NNS per_IN unit_NN length_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN and_CC their_PRP$ shape_NN in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT felting_VBG properties_NNS of_IN wool_NN ,_, some_DT workers_NNS have_VBP tried_VBN to_TO relate_VB these_DT characteristics_NNS to_TO the_DT different_JJ species_NNS or_CC breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN ._.
A_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN scales306_JJ TYPES_NNP OF_NNP DOMESTIC_NNP SHEEP_NNP AND_NNP WILD_NNP LIFE_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP and_CC are_VBP either_DT convexly_NN curved_VBD or_CC their_PRP$ free_JJ edges_NNS trace_VBP out_RP a_DT wave-shaped_JJ line_NN around_IN the_DT fiber_NN shaft_NN ._.
The_DT reticulate_NN or_CC hair_NN type_NN of_IN scale_NN structure_NN has_VBZ the_DT appearance_NN of_IN a_DT rather_RB taunt_JJ net_JJ stretched_VBN across_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN ._.
The_DT scales_NNS ,_, although_IN slightly_RB curved_VBN ,_, appear_VBP rather_RB straight_JJ and_CC smooth-sided_JJ in_IN comparison_NN with_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT wool_NN type_NN ._.
More_JJR than_IN two_CD scales_NNS meet_VBP at_IN a_DT point_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP are_VBP often_RB irregular_JJ in_IN size_NN and_CC shape_NN ._.
Hausman_NNP [_VBZ 8_CD ]_NN ,_, from_IN his_PRP$ study_NN of_IN mammalian_JJ hair_NN fibers_NNS ,_, formulated_VBD his_PRP$ well-_JJ known_VBN classification_NN dividing_VBG the_DT scale_NN structure_NN into_IN coronal_JJ and_CC imbricate_JJ forms_NNS ._.
The_DT coronal_JJ scales_NNS completely_RB encircle_VBP the_DT corticle_NN cylinder_NN of_IN the_DT hair_NN shaft_NN ,_, their_PRP$ free_JJ ectal_NN edges_NNS sculptured_VBN in_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ._.
The_DT imbricate_NN scales_NNS do_VBP not_RB indivi-_VB dually_RB encircle_VB the_DT corticle_NN cylinder_NN ,_, but_CC are_VBP arranged_VBN like_IN the_DT scales_NNS of_IN a_DT fish_NN ,_, with_IN their_PRP$ free_JJ distal_NN edges_NNS etched_VBN into_IN different_JJ shapes_NNS ._.
The_DT two_CD groups_NNS of_IN scales_NNS are_VBP further_RB classified_JJ according_VBG to_TO their_PRP$ apparent_JJ structure_NN ._.
The_DT coronal_JJ scales_NNS may_MD be_VB simple_JJ ,_, serrate_JJ ,_, and_CC dentate_NN ;_: imbricate_JJ scales_NNS may_MD be_VB ovate_JJ ,_, acuminate_JJ ,_, elongate_JJ ,_, crenate_NN ,_, and_CC flattened_VBD ._.
Although_IN the_DT author_NN did_VBD not_RB include_VB wool_NN in_IN his_PRP$ studies_NNS ,_, the_DT crenate_NN and_CC flattened_VBN types_NNS are_VBP often_RB encountered_VBN on_IN wool_NN fibers_NNS ._.
REVIEW_NNP OF_NNP LITERATURE_NNP Although_IN scale_NN structure_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN studied_VBN extensively_RB in_IN the_DT field_NN of_IN wool_NN technology_NN ,_, various_JJ workers_NNS have_VBP been_VBN interested_JJ in_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN scale_JJ struc-_JJ ture_NN ._.
Their_PRP$ methods_NNS may_MD be_VB classified_VBN under_IN three_CD main_JJ headingsDecember_NN ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN G.S_NNP ._.
MAHAL_NNP ,_, A._NNP JOHNSTON_NNP AND_NNP R._NNP H._NNP BURNS_NNP 307_CD Hausman_NNP [_VBD 6_CD ]_NNS ,_, while_IN classifying_VBG the_DT scale_NN forms_NNS [_VBP 8_CD ]_NN from_IN his_PRP$ drawings_NNS of_IN the_DT hairs_NNS of_IN 166_CD fur-bearing_JJ animals_NNS [_VBP 7_CD ]_NN ,_, was_VBD able_JJ to_TO find_VB an_DT interesting_JJ and_CC surprising_JJ relationship_NN in_IN the_DT scales_NNS of_IN infrahominid_NN mammals308_NN TYPES_NNP OF_NNP DOMESTIC_NNP SHEEP_NNP AND_NNP WILD_NNP LIFE_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP Skinkle_NNP stated_VBD further_RBR that_IN no_DT cases_NNS had_VBD arisen_VBN in_IN his_PRP$ experience_NN which_WDT did_VBD not_RB fall_VB into_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT above_JJ classes_NNS ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN some_DT wools_NNS may_MD have_VB values_NNS of_IN S_NNP slightly_RB above_IN 18µ_CD but_CC values_NNS of_IN S3/D_NNP of_IN 140_CD or_CC less_JJR ._.
Mirzoeva_NNP [_VBD 17_CD ]_NNS made_VBN microscopic_JJ investigations_NNS '_POS of_IN the_DT form_NN and_CC development_NN of_IN the_DT scales_NNS of_IN the_DT wool_NN of_IN purebred_JJ Merino_NNP ,_, Turkmenian_JJ fat-rumped_JJ ,_, lomud_JJ ,_, and_CC Erek_NNP sheep_NN ,_, and_CC concluded_VBD that_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN scales_NNS for_IN a_DT given_VBN length_NN of_IN wool_NN (_( 256µ_CD )_) and_CC the_DT form_NN and_CC area_NN (_( in_IN µ2_NN )_) are_VBP specific_JJ to_TO the_DT individual_JJ breeds_NNS studied_VBN and_CC must_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN genetically_RB controlled_VBN ._.
He_PRP stated_VBD further_RBR that_IN ,_, contrary_JJ to_TO the_DT findings_NNS of_IN D._NNP Udolskii_NNP (_( whose_WP$ methods_NNS were_VBD used_VBN in_IN his_PRP$ study_NN )_) ,_, no_DT definite_JJ influence_NN of_IN breed_NN on_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN rows_NNS of_IN scales_NNS on_IN a_DT hair_NN could_MD be_VB ascertained_VBN ._.
Mathews_NNP [_VBZ 15_CD ]_NN stated_VBD that_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN scales_NNS necessary_JJ to_TO cover_VB the_DT circum-_JJ ference_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN varies_VBZ considerably_RB ,_, depending_VBG upon_IN the_DT diameter_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ height_NN of_IN the_DT scales_NNS is_VBZ approximately_RB 28µ_CD and_CC the_DT average_JJ width_JJ approxi-_JJ mately_RB 36µ_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT finest_JJS wools_NNS each_DT one_CD of_IN the_DT scales_NNS is_VBZ large_JJ enough_RB to_TO encircle_VB the_DT shaft_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN ,_, but_CC with_IN increased_JJ fiber_NN diameter_NN the_DT number_NN of_IN scales_NNS necessary_JJ to_TO cover_VB the_DT circumference_NN increases_VBZ proportionately_RB ._.
Mathews_NNP further_RB asserted_VBD that_IN the_DT visible_JJ scale_NN height_NN in_IN fine_JJ wools_NNS is_VBZ from_IN 8µ_CD to_TO 10µ_CD and_CC in_IN coarse_NN wools_NNS it_PRP may_MD increase_VB to_TO 18µ_CD ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN scales_NNS along_IN the_DT edge_NN of_IN the_DT fiber_NN per_IN 100µ_CD length_NN averages_NNS 10_CD or_CC 12_CD ,_, but_CC may_MD range_VB from_IN 6_CD to_TO 14_CD ._.

15_CD THIS_NNP book_NN ,_, published_VBN under_IN the_DT auspices_NNS of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP ,_, is_VBZ the_DT second_JJ of_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN manuals_NNS relating_VBG to_TO animal_VB husbandry_JJ subjects_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ divided_VBN into_IN 15_CD chapters_NNS ._.

Chapter_NN VII_NNP is_VBZ confined_VBN to_TO dairy_VB engineering_NN problems_NNS connected_VBN with_IN the_DT management_NN and_CC maintenance_NN of_IN a_DT dairy_NN herd_NN and_CC the_DT operations_NNS of_IN a_DT dairy_NN or_CC creamery_NN ._.

ORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP THE_NNP EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP FEEDING_NNP THYROPROTEIN_NNP ON_NNP SEMEN_NNP QUALITY_NNP AND_NNP ON_NNP SOME_NNP PHYSIOLOGICAL_NNP CONDITIONS_NNP OF_IN GOATS_NNP I_PRP ._.
EFFECT_NN ON_NNP REACTION_NNP TIME_NNP AND_NNP SEMEN_NNP CHARACTERISTICS_NNP By_IN D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, A._NNP ROY_NNP and_CC P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 1_CD April_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN Text-figures_NNP )_) ALTHOUGH_NNP spermatozoa_NN are_VBP produced_VBN throughout_IN the_DT year_NN in_IN farm_NN animals_NNS ,_, the_DT rate_NN of_IN spermatogenesis_NN and_CC the_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS are_VBP greatly_RB influenced_VBN by_IN climatic_JJ changes_NNS ._.
Experiments_NNS on_IN different_JJ species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT climatic_JJ conditions_NNS prevailing_VBG in_IN certain_JJ seasons_NNS are_VBP conducive_JJ to_TO the_DT production_NN of_IN good_JJ quality_NN semen_NNS ,_, but_CC that_IN the_DT quality_NN deteriorates_VBZ very_RB much_JJ during_IN other_JJ seasons_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, high_JJ air_NN temperature_NN associated_VBN with_IN high_JJ relative_JJ humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN has_VBZ an_DT adverse_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN both_DT semen_NNS and_CC blood_NN [_NN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP ,_, 1947_CD a_DT and_CC b_NN ;_: Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP ,_, 1947_CD a_DT and_CC b_NN ]_NN ._.
Attempts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN in_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS of_IN America_NNP to_TO improve_VB the_DT semen_NNS quality_NN in_IN rams_NN during_IN an_DT unfavourable_JJ season_NN by_IN administration_NN of_IN thyro-_JJ xine_NN or_CC thyroactive_JJ materials_NNS ._.
Berliner_NNP and_CC Warbritton_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD that_IN the_DT administration_NN of_IN thyroxine_NN to_TO rams_VB during_IN the_DT summer_NN improved_VBD the_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
This_DT observation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN supported_VBN by_IN Bogart_NNP and_CC Mayer_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ,_, Warwick_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1948_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN rams_NN which_WDT tolerated_VBD the_DT dosage_NN of_IN thyroactive_JJ protein_NN administered_VBD to_TO them_PRP produced_VBN in_IN the_DT summer_NN semen_NNS which_WDT was_VBD either_DT equal_JJ to_TO or_CC slightly_RB better_RBR in_IN quality_NN than_IN that_DT produced_VBN by_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT treatment_NN of_IN rams_NNS with_IN thyroactive_JJ protein_NN during_IN spring_NN had_VBD a_DT deleterious_JJ effect_NN on_IN semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
Eaton_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1948_CD ]_NN reported_VBD that_IN thyroprotein_NN (_( 1_CD and_CC 2_CD gm_NN ._. )_)
given_VBN to_TO rams_VB daily_RB from_IN May_NNP to_TO September_NNP did_VBD not_RB improve_VB their_PRP$ semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT conflicting_NN results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN the_DT above_NN mentioned_VBD workers_NNS and_CC especially_RB because_IN in_IN India_NNP there_EX is_VBZ a_DT very_RB long_JJ period_NN of_IN high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN ,_, the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT administration_NN of_IN thyroactive_JJ protein_NN on_IN semen_NNS quality_NN and_CC '_POS reaction_NN time_NN '_'' of_IN goats_NNS during_IN the_DT summer_NN ,_, the_DT most_RBS unfavourable_JJ period_NN for_IN semen_JJ production_NN ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP Experimental_NNP animals_NNS comprised_VBD 14_CD male_NN goats_NNS between_IN 1_CD to_TO 2½_CD years_NNS of_IN age_NN ._.
Before_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN they_PRP were_VBD trained_VBN to_TO mount_VB on_IN anoes-_JJ trous_JJ female_NN and_CC ejaculate_JJ semen_NNS in_IN the_DT artificial_JJ vagina_NN ._.
After_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD properly_RB trained_VBN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN two_CD groups_NNS of_IN seven_CD each_DT as_RB evenly_RB as_IN 2_CD THE_NNP EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP FEEDING_NNP THYROPROTEIN_NNP ON_NNP SEMEN_NNP (_( I_PRP )_) [_VBP Vol_NNP ._.

Throughout_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN under_IN uniform_JJ dietary_NN and_CC managerial_JJ regime_NN ._.

D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, A._NNP ROY_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 5_CD that_IN the_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN of_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN gradually_RB decreased_VBN during_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN ._.
Administration_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT exper-_JJ mental_NN group_NN not_RB only_RB prevented_VBD this_DT decrease_NN but_CC also_RB raised_VBD the_DT sperm_JJ concen-_JJ tration_NN ._. '_''
Reaction_NN time_NN '_POS and_CC the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT semen_NNS characteristics_NNS did_VBD not_RB appear_VB to_TO have_VB been_VBN greatly_RB affected_VBN by_IN thyroprotein_NN feeding_NN ._.
Table_NN I_PRP shows_VBZ the_DT average_NN '_POS reaction_NN time_NN ,_, '_'' and_CC ,_, the_DT averages_NNS of_IN the_DT semen_NNS characteristics_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS ,_, together_RB with_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN statistical_JJ analysis_NN of_IN data_NNS regarding_VBG these_DT characteris-_JJ tics_NNS during_IN the_DT entire_JJ experimental_JJ period_NN ._.
The_DT statistical_JJ analysis_NN was_VBD done_VBN according_VBG to_TO the_DT method_NN described_VBN by_IN Goulden_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT pretreatment_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT two_CD ,_, groups_NNS were_VBD almost_RB identical_JJ in_IN all_PDT the_DT characteristics_NNS under_IN study_NN ,_, except_IN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT average_JJ percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB highly_RB significant_JJ ,_, the_DT average_NN in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN being_VBG higher_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT treatment_NN period_NN ,_, highly_RB signi-_JJ ficant_NN differences_NNS in_IN volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN abnor-_JJ mal_JJ spermatozoa_NN were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS ._.
The_DT differences_NNS in_IN average_NN '_POS reaction_NN time_NN '_POS and_CC other_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN semen_NNS as_IN found_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS were_VBD due_JJ to_TO chance_NN variation_NN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ group_NN showed_VBD a_DT highly_RB significant_JJ decrease_NN in_IN semen_JJ volume_NN as_IN against_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP showed_VBD a_DT highly_RB significant_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT sperm_JJ concentration_NN ._.
As_IN in_IN the_DT pretreatment_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN remained_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ ;_: the_DT percentage_NN in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN was_VBD higher_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_IN the_DT dosage_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN administered_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS had_VBD an_DT adverse_JJ effect_NN on_IN semen_NNS volume_NN ._.
It_PRP undoubtedly_RB increased_VBD the_DT sperm_JJ concerntration_NN per_IN ml_NN ._.
of_IN semen_NNS ,_, but_CC failed_VBD to_TO reduce_VB the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP As_IN the_DT various_JJ methods_NNS used_VBN for_IN evaluating_VBG the_DT quality_NN of_IN semen_NNS are_VBP all_DT sub-_JJ jective_NN and_CC as_IN no_DT one_CD method_NN gives_VBZ a_DT correct_JJ appraisal_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ desirable_JJ that_IN each_DT semen_NNS sample_RB be_VB subjected_VBN to_TO several_JJ methods_NNS of_IN analyses_NNS ._.
Various_JJ physical_JJ tests_NNS ,_, therefore_RB ,_, were_VBD made_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN while_IN studying_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN feeding_VBG on_IN semen_NNS quality_NN of_IN goats_NNS during_IN an_DT unfavourable_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS show_VBP that_IN feeding_NN of_IN 1_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN thyroprotein_JJ daily_JJ increased_VBD the_DT sperm_JJ con-_JJ centration_NN per_IN unit_NN volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
This_DT result_NN ,_, on_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, agrees_VBZ with_IN that_DT of_IN Bogart_NNP and_CC Mayer_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP in_IN rams_NN ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN of_IN the_DT many_JJ probable_JJ factors_NNS one_CD ,_, which_WDT perhaps_RB accounts_NNS for_IN low_JJ sperm_JJ concentration_NN in_IN goats_NNS during_IN the_DT un-_JJ favourable_JJ seasons_NNS [_VBP Shukla_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP ,_, 1947_CD b_NN ]_NN ,_, is_VBZ subnormal_JJ secretion_NN of_IN thyroid_JJ hormone_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ common_JJ experience_NN of_IN workers_NNS in_IN artificial_JJ insemination_NN of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS that_WDT high_VBP initial_JJ motility_NN is_VBZ generally_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB associated_VBN with_IN high_JJ sperm_JJ con-_JJ centration_NN ._.
The_DT reason_NN for_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN significant_JJ difference_NN in_IN average_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN between_IN the_DT experimental_JJ and_CC control_NN groups_NNS might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN initial_JJ motility_NN rating_NN as_IN appraised_VBN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN was_VBD not_RB determined_VBN by_IN a_DT very_RB precise_JJ method_NN for_IN evaluating_VBG semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN could_MD at_IN best_JJS 6_CD THE_DT EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP FEEDING_NNP THYROPROTEIN_NNP ON_NNP SEMEN_NNP ._.
(_( I_PRP )_) [_VBP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, be_VB used_VBN to_TO distinguish_VB a_DT very_RB good_JJ sample_NN from_IN a_DT very_RB bad_JJ one_CD ._.
Grading_VBG of_IN samples_NNS with_IN small_JJ differences_NNS is_VBZ almost_RB impossible_JJ by_IN this_DT method_NN ._.
The_DT dosage_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN administered_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO have_VB a_DT deleterious_JJ effect_NN on_IN semen_NNS volume_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS of_IN the_DT experi-_JJ mental_JJ group_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB much_RB lower_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
A_DT conse-_JJ quential_JJ effect_NN of_IN such_JJ reduction_NN in_IN volume_NN was_VBD that_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN sperma-_JJ tozoa_NN failed_VBD to_TO show_VB any_DT significant_JJ difference_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS ,_, in_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT higher_JJR sperm_JJ concentration_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Bogart_NNP and_CC Mayer_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP '_POS the_DT results_NNS of_IN a_DT concentration_NN count_NN are_VBP indicative_JJ of_IN the_DT sperma-_JJ togenic_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT male_NN ,_, but_CC do_VBP not_RB give_VB a_DT true_JJ evaluation_NN unless_IN the_DT semen_NN volume_NN is_VBZ also_RB considered_VBN and_CC a_DT calculation_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ spermatozoa_NN per_IN ejaculate_NN is_VBZ made_VBN ._.
To_TO gain_VB any_DT degree_NN of_IN insight_NN into_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN high_JJ temperature_NN and_CC thyroxine_NN upon_IN spermatogenesis_NN the_DT data_NN on_IN total_JJ spermatozoa_NN per_IN ejaculate_NN and_CC the_DT semen_JJ volume_NN must_MD be_VB considered_VBN ._. '_''
Judged_VBN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN these_DT factors_NNS ,_, the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN shows_VBZ that_IN thyroprotein_NN feeding_NN has_VBZ little_JJ effect_NN on_IN spermato-_JJ genesis_NN ._.
Bogart_NNP and_CC Mayer_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN thyroactive_JJ protein_NN fed_VBN at_IN the_DT daily_JJ dosage_NN level_NN of_IN 1_CD gm_NN ._.
per_IN ram_NN failed_VBD to_TO maintain_VB or_CC raise_VB semen_JJ volume_NN during_IN periods_NNS of_IN high_JJ temperature_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT decrease_NN in_IN volume_NN due_JJ to_TO high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN was_VBD less_RBR in_IN the_DT treated_JJ group_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
This_DT obser-_JJ vation_NN is_VBZ contrary_JJ to_TO what_WP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ experiment_NN ._.
The_DT reason_NN for_IN the_DT decrease_NN in_IN semen_NNS volume_NN might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT high_JJ dosage_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN administered_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB uninfluenced_VBN by_IN thyroprotein_NN feeding_NN ._.
This_DT result_NN is_VBZ not_RB in_IN agreement_NN with_IN those_DT of_IN some_DT previous_JJ workers_NNS ._.
Bogart_NNP and_CC Mayer_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN by_IN feeding_VBG 1_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN thyroprotein_JJ per_IN day_NN per_IN ram_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 30_CD days_NNS during_IN the_DT summer_NN ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnor-_JJ mal_JJ spermatozoa_NN decreased_VBD considerably_RB ._.
Berliner_NNP and_CC Warbritton_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD that_IN two_CD intact_JJ and_CC one_CD thyroidectomised_VBD Hampshire_NNP rams_NNS with_IN high_JJ abnormality_NN counts_NNS returned_VBD to_TO normality_NN after_IN the_DT administration_NN of_IN two_CD doses_NNS (_( 2_CD mg._NN )_) of_IN thy-_JJ roxine_NN in_IN August_NNP ._.
In_IN contrast_NN to_TO these_DT results_NNS Eaton_NNP et_VBZ al._NN ,_, [_JJ 1948_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN feeding_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN to_TO rams_VB for_IN 15_CD weeks_NNS ,_, increased_VBD the_DT percentage_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ experiment_NN ,_, some_DT of_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN after_IN four_CD weeks_NNS of_IN thyroprotein_NN feeding_NN produced_VBN semen_NNS containing_VBG 30_CD to_TO 40_CD per_IN cent_NN beaded_VBD spermatozoa_NN ._.
These_DT were_VBD included_VBN as_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN although_IN such_JJ spermatozoa_NNS have_VBP been_VBN identified_VBN by_IN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1949_CD ]_NNP as_IN immature_NN forms_NNS ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN beaded_JJ spermatozoa_NN in_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT animals_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ inclusion_NN as_IN abnormal_JJ sperm_NN in_IN the_DT computation_NN of_IN results_NNS might_MD have_VB masked_VBN the_DT beneficial_JJ effect_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN feeding_VBG on_IN other_JJ true_JJ abnormalities_NNS ._.
But_CC in_IN a_DT study_NN from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN of_IN semen_NNS utility_NN ,_, the_DT beaded_JJ spermatozoa_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB excluded_VBN from_IN the_DT computation_NN of_IN results_NNS because_IN they_PRP ,_, like_IN the_DT other_JJ abnormalities_NNS ,_, reduce_VB the_DT fertilising_NN capacity_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._. '_''
Recation_NN time_NN '_'' is_VBZ an_DT indications_NNS of_IN sex_NN vigour_NN ._.
Reineke_NNP [_NN 1946_CD ]_NN found_VBD de-_JJ finite_JJ improvement_NN in_IN sex_NN drive_NN and_CC vigour_NN by_IN oral_JJ administration_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN to_TO 14_CD bulls_NNS which_WDT were_VBD sluggish_JJ ,_, lethargic_JJ and_CC showed_VBD lessened_VBN libido_NN before_IN treatment_NN ._.
Turner_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN a_DT Toggenburg_NNP buck_NN ,_, which_WDT showed_VBD a_DT definite_JJ lack_NN of_IN interest_NN in_IN oestrous_JJ does_VBZ ,_, displayed_VB sexual_JJ interest_NN after_IN the_DT feeding_NN of_IN one_CD gram_NN of_IN March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, A._NNP ROY_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 7_CD thyroprotein_NN per_IN day_NN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN the_DT lack_NN of_IN sexual_JJ urge_NN or_CC libido_NN in_IN males_NNS born_VBN with_IN hypothyroid_JJ condition_NN may_MD be_VB remedied_VBN by_IN the_DT administration_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT hypothyroid_JJ condition_NN created_VBD in_IN males_NNS by_IN external_JJ factors_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN high_JJ air_NN temperature_NN ,_, high_JJ relative_JJ humidity_NN and_CC high_JJ rainfall_NN ,_, does_VBZ not_RB reduce_VB the_DT sexual_JJ behaviour_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, the_DT feeding_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB little_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT sexual_JJ activity_NN as_IN measured_VBN by_IN the_DT '_POS reaction_NN time_NN '_POS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Observations_NNP made_VBD on_IN seven_CD goats_NNS treated_VBN with_IN thyroprotein_NN and_CC seven_CD control_NN animals_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 14_CD weeks_NNS during_IN May_NNP to_TO August_NNP revealed_VBD the_DT following_NN ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) Thyroprotein_NNP feeding_VBG had_VBD no_DT significant_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT '_POS reaction_NN time_NN '_'' ,_, initial_JJ motility_NN ,_, total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ per_IN ejaculate_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN abnor-_JJ mal_JJ spermatozoa_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Sperm_NNP concentration_NN increased_VBD due_JJ to_TO thyroprotein_VB feeding_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) A_DT highly_RB significant_JJ decrease_NN in_IN semen_JJ volume_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN due_JJ to_TO the_DT administration_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN ._.

of_IN semen_NNS March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN A._NNP ROY_NNP ,_, D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, S._NNP N._NNP LUKTUKE_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 13_CD difference_NN in_IN the_DT IFC_NNP and_CC rate_NN of_IN fructolysis_NN were_VBD only_RB significant_JJ at_IN five_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC two_CD per_IN cent_NN levels_NNS ,_, respectively_RB ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP Since_IN they_PRP discovered_VBD that_IN fructose_NN is_VBZ the_DT only_JJ glycolysable_JJ sugar_NN present_NN in_IN semen_NNS ,_, Mann_NNP and_CC his_PRP$ collaborators_NNS have_VBP investigated_VBN the_DT possibility_NN of_IN its_PRP$ utilisation_NN from_IN various_JJ aspects_NNS ._.
In_IN one_CD of_IN their_PRP$ communications_NNS [_VBP Mann_NNP ,_, 1948_CD ]_NN it_PRP was_VBD reported_VBN that_IN the_DT 'fructolysis_NNP index_NN '_'' of_IN a_DT good_JJ semen_NNS sample_VBP obtained_VBN from_IN healthy_JJ bulls_NNS with_IN good_JJ fertility_NN records_NNS was_VBD between_IN 1.4_CD and_CC 2.0_CD mg./10_NN sperm/_JJ hour_NN ._.
Further_RB ,_, the_DT semen_NNS samples_NNS obtained_VBN from_IN animals_NNS with_IN poor_JJ fertility_NN records_NNS were_VBD character-_NNS ised_VBN by_IN a_DT low_JJ content_NN of_IN fructose_NN ._.
Besides_IN these_DT ,_, the_DT rate_NN of_IN fructolysis_NN now_RB appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB the_DT most_RBS satisfactory_JJ method_NN for_IN assessing_VBG not_RB only_RB sperm_JJ activity_NN but_CC density_NN as_RB well_RB [_NNP Rothschild_NNP ,_, 1949_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN an_DT endeavour_NN to_TO put_VB the_DT relation_NN of_IN sperm_JJ concen-_JJ tration_NN to_TO the_DT degree_NN of_IN fructolysis_NN on_IN a_DT quantitative_JJ basis_NN ,_, we_PRP found_VBD in_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN that_IN the_DT ranges_NNS of_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC fructolysis_NN were_VBD significantly_RB correlated_VBN and_CC that_IN the_DT IFC_NNP and_CC sperm_JJ concentration_NN were_VBD also_RB similarly_RB related_VBN ._.
This_DT higher_JJR correlation_NN coefficient_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, indicated_VBD that_IN for_IN the_DT estimation_NN of_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN a_DT high_JJ accuracy_NN existed_VBN in_IN the_DT measurement_NN of_IN IFC_NNP and_CC fruc-_JJ tolysis_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB so_RB ,_, not_RB only_RB in_IN goats_NNS but_CC also_RB in_IN rams_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS [_NNP Roy_NNP ,_, et_NN al_NN ._.
1950_CD ]_NN ._.
Semen_NNS samples_NNS with_IN higher_JJR sperm_NN concentration_NN and_CC higher_JJR initial_JJ motility_NN have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN to_TO reduce_VB methylene_NN blue_RB much_RB faster_RBR than_IN those_DT with_IN lower_JJR sperm_NN concentration_NN and_CC lower_JJR initial_JJ motility_NN ._.
This_DT finding_NN agrees_VBZ with_IN those_DT reported_VBN by_IN Van_NNP Demark_NNP ,_, et_NN ._.
al_NN ._.
[_NN 1945_CD ]_NN in_IN bull_JJ semen_NNS ._.
Warwick_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1948_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN semen_NNS ,_, obtained_VBN from_IN rams_NNS receiving_VBG 0.5_CD g._NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN ,_, had_VBD high_JJ initial_JJ motility_NN and_CC reduced_JJ methylene_NN blue_NN faster_RBR than_IN samples_NNS obtained_VBN from_IN either_CC the_DT control_NN group_NN receiving_VBG 1.5_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN thyroprotein_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD in_IN this_DT experiment_NN show_NN that_IN the_DT average_JJ MBRT_NNP of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN did_VBD not_RB differ_VB significantly_RB from_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ due_JJ possibly_RB to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN MBRT_NNP ,_, like_IN initial_JJ motility_NN of_IN the_DT spermatozoa_NN ,_, is_VBZ not_RB a_DT precise_JJ method_NN of_IN appraising_VBG of_IN semen_NNS quality_NN and_CC can_MD only_RB be_VB used_VBN for_IN differentiating_VBG semen_NNS samples_NNS of_IN widely_RB varying_VBG qualities_NNS ._.
When_WRB the_DT variation_NN is_VBZ small_JJ ,_, the_DT evaluation_NN of_IN quality_NN even_RB within_IN reasonable_JJ limits_NNS by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN this_DT method_NN ,_, in_IN our_PRP$ experience_NN ,_, is_VBZ a_DT difficult_JJ task_NN indeed_RB ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Thyroprotein_NNP feeding_NN had_VBD no_DT significant_JJ effect_NN on_IN methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN time_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
Initial_JJ fructose_JJ content_NN decreased_VBN and_CC the_DT rate_NN of_IN fructolysis_NN of_IN semen_NNS increased_VBN significantly_RB due_JJ to_TO thyroprotein_VB feeding_NN ._.

There_EX was_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ positive_JJ correlation_NN coefficient_NN between_IN sperm_JJ concentration_NN and_CC rate_NN of_IN fructolysis_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.

EFFECT_NN ON_NNP PULSE_NNP RATE_NNP ,_, RATE_NNP OF_NNP RESPIRATION_NNP ,_, BODY_NNP TEM-_NNP PERATURE_NNP AND_NNP BODY_NNP WEIGHTS_NNP BY_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, S._NNP S._NNP JAWA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 1_CD April_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN two_CD text-figures_NNS )_) IN_NNP Parts_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP of_IN the_DT present_JJ series_NN the_DT results_NNS of_IN feeding_VBG thyroprotein_NN to_TO goats_VB on_IN their_PRP$ semen_NNS characteristics_NNS and_CC 'reaction_NN time_NN '_POS have_VBP been_VBN reported_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN by_IN feeding_VBG one_CD gram_NN of_IN thyroprotein_JJ per_IN day_NN per_IN animal_NN during_IN May_NNP to_TO August_NNP ,_, sperm_JJ concentration_NN per_IN unit_NN volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS increased_VBN with_IN concomitant_JJ decrease_NN in_IN seminal_JJ fructose_NN and_CC increase_NN in_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN fructolysis_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD also_RB an_DT appreciable_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT volume_NN of_IN semen_NNS ._.
The_DT other_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN semen_NNS remained_VBN unaffected_JJ ._.
That_IN the_DT improvement_NN brought_VBD about_RB in_IN semen_NNS quality_NN was_VBD rather_RB apparent_JJ than_IN real_JJ was_VBD also_RB discussed_VBN in_IN Part_NNP I_PRP ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN investigations_NNS on_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN season_NN and/or_NN feeding_VBG thyroprotein_NN to_TO animals_NNS on_IN their_PRP$ semen_NNS quality_NN are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO be_VB influenced_VBN by_IN the_DT various_JJ clima-_JJ tological_JJ factors_NNS obtaining_VBG during_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN observations_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, necessary_JJ therefore_RB ,_, to_TO correlate_VB the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN in_IN such_JJ investigations_NNS with_IN the_DT relevant_JJ detailed_JJ climatological_JJ data_NNS ._.
This_DT may_MD provide_VB a_DT satisfactory_JJ general_JJ explanation_NN for_IN the_DT various_JJ contradictions_NNS found_VBN in_IN the_DT literature_NN on_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN seasons_NNS or_CC thyroprotein_NN feeding_VBG on_IN semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ paper_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, besides_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN feeding_VBG thyroprotein_NN ,_, on_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN ,_, rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN ,_, body_NN temperature_NN and_CC body_NN weight_NN of_IN the_DT goats_NNS ,_, detailed_JJ information_NN regarding_VBG the_DT more_RBR important_JJ climatological_JJ factors_NNS prevailing_VBG during_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN and_CC their_PRP$ effect_NN on_IN goats_NNS have_VBP also_RB been_VBN reported_VBN ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP Pulse_NNP rate_NN ,_, rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_NN of_IN each_DT animal_NN were_VBD re-_JJ corded_JJ daily_NN and_CC their_PRP$ weekly_JJ body_NN weight_VBD record_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN during_IN the_DT entire_JJ experimental_JJ period_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
from_IN May_NNP to_TO August_NNP ._.
These_DT observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN in_IN the_DT morning_NN before_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD let_VBN out_RP for_IN grazing_VBG ._.
Daily_JJ readings_NNS of_IN maximum_NN ,_, minimum_NN ,_, dry_JJ and_CC wet_JJ bulb_NN thermometers_NNS were_VBD noted_VBN in_IN a_DT well_RB ventilated_VBN shed_VBN ._.
The_DT readings_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN once_RB a_DT day_NN at_IN about_RB 7_CD a.m._NN from_IN the_DT records_NNS the_DT average_JJ weekly_JJ air_NN temperature_NN and_CC relative_JJ humidity_NN have_VBP been_VBN calculated_VBN ._.
Body_NNP tempera-_JJ ture_NN was_VBD taken_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT clinical_JJ thermometer_NN inserted_VBN in_IN the_DT rectum_NN ._.
Pulse_NNP rate_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN feeling_VBG the_DT femoral_JJ artery_NN with_IN the_DT tips_NNS of_IN the_DT fingers_NNS ._.
Rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN a_DT stethoscope_NN applied_VBN on_IN the_DT chest_JJS wall_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.

Similarly_RB ,_, the_DT examination_NN of_IN the_DT regression_NN coefficients_NNS in_IN the_DT equation_NN for_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN shows_VBZ that_IN one_CD degree_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT atmos-_JJ pheric_JJ temperature_NN caused_VBD four_CD times_NNS and_CC five_CD times_NNS as_IN much_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT pulse_JJ rate_NN as_IN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO one_CD per_IN cent_NN change_NN in_IN humidity_NN and_CC one_CD inch_NN change_NN in_IN the_DT rainfall_NN ,_, respectively_RB ._.
From_IN the_DT two_CD equations_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ apparent_JJ that_IN of_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN ,_, humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD the_DT air_NN temperature_NN which_WDT was_VBD com-_NN paratively_RB the_DT important_JJ cause_NN for_IN fluctuations_NNS in_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN of_IN both_CC the_DT groups_NNS ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN on_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN were_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ ,_, showed_VBD that_IN with_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN ,_, the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN increased_VBD highly_RB significantly_RB ,_, but_CC this_DT was_VBD not_RB so_RB in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
An_DT increase_NN in_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN ,_, when_WRB temperature_NN and_CC rainfall_NN were_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ decreased_VBD the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN in_IN both_CC the_DT groups_NNS ._.
From_IN the_DT sizes_NNS of_IN the_DT correlation_NN coefficients_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ apparent_JJ that_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN reacted_VBD more_RBR sensitively_RB to_TO changes_NNS in_IN humidity_NN than_IN did_VBD the_DT experimental_NN group_NN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN rainfall_NN ,_, when_WRB humidity_NN and_CC air_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN were_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ ,_, was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB insignificant_JJ in_IN both_DT the_DT groups_NNS ._.
The_DT value_NN of_IN R_NNP in_IN the_DT control_NN groups_NNS is_VBZ 0.836_CD ,_, and_CC 0.931_CD for_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN ._.
These_DT values_NNS of_IN R_NNP suggest_VBP that_IN under_IN the_DT combined_VBN atmospheric_JJ changes_NNS in_IN temperature_NN ,_, humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ,_, the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN of_IN the_DT thyroprotein_NN treated_VBD animals_NNS tended_VBD to_TO react_VB in_IN a_DT more_RBR sensitive_JJ manner_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
The_DT multiple_JJ regression_NN equations_NNS for_IN the_DT estimated_VBN rates_NNS of_IN respiration_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
Control_NNP Group_NNP Y=35.1222_NNP THE_NNP EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP FEEDING_NNP THYROPROTEIN_NNP ON_NNP SEMEN_NNP (_( III_NNP )_) [_VBP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, factors_NNS were_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ ._.
The_DT values_NNS of_IN R_NNP for_IN control_NN and_CC experimental_JJ groups_NNS are_VBP 0.206_CD and_CC 0.361_CD ,_, respectively_RB ._.
These_DT values_NNS are_VBP non-significant_JJ ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT increase_NN in_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN ,_, rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN indicated_VBD that_IN by_IN feeding_VBG thyroprotein_NN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS their_PRP$ basal_JJ metabolism_NN increased_VBD ._.
The_DT conspicuous_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT body_NN weight_NN of_IN the_DT treated_JJ animals_NNS clearly_RB indicates_VBZ that_IN the_DT administration_NN of_IN thyroprotein_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN one_CD gram_NN daily_RB (_( this_DT is_VBZ the_DT dose_NN recommended_VBN by_IN the_DT manufacturer_NN )_) continuously_RB over_IN a_DT long_JJ period_NN proved_VBD excessive_JJ ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN an_DT over-dose_JJ was_VBD shown_VBN by_IN majority_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS after_IN 8_CD or_CC 9_CD weeks_NNS of_IN thyroprotein_NN feeding_NN by_IN their_PRP$ lethargic_JJ movements_NNS and_CC dull_JJ coat_NN colour_NN ._.
To_TO study_VB the_DT reactions_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS to_TO the_DT variable_JJ atmospheric_JJ conditions_NNS under_IN which_WDT the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD conducted_VBN ,_, the_DT data_NNS on_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN ,_, rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS and_CC atmospheric_JJ factors_NNS were_VBD statistically_RB analysed_VBN ._.
From_IN the_DT partial_JJ correlation_NN coefficients_NNS in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ apparent_JJ that_IN humidity_NN played_VBD a_DT significant_JJ part_NN in_IN the_DT fluctuations_NNS of_IN the_DT pulse_NN and_CC respiration_NN rates_NNS ._.
Increase_NN in_IN humidity_NN decreased_VBD the_DT pulse_NN and_CC respiration_NN rates_NNS and_CC vice_NN versa_NN ,_, when_WRB air_NN temperature_NN and_CC rainfall_NN were_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ ._.
Sheath_NNP and_CC Miller_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN in_IN dairy_NN animals_NNS ,_, changes_NNS in_IN air_NN temperature_NN or_CC relative_JJ humidity_NN had_VBD little_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT pulse_JJ rate_NN ._.
They_PRP further_VBP observed_VBD that_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN played_VBD a_DT minor_JJ role_NN and_CC air_NN temperature_NN a_DT major_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT variation_NN of_IN respiration_NN rate_NN ._.
Sheath_NNP and_CC Miller_NNP recorded_VBD an_DT average_JJ relative_JJ humidity_NN of_IN 56.8_CD per_IN cent_NN during_IN their_PRP$ study_NN ,_, whereas_RB in_IN this_DT experiment_NN the_DT average_JJ humidity_NN was_VBD observed_VBN to_TO be_VB 72.8_CD per_IN cent_NN (_( Table_NNP II_NNP )_) ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB possible_JJ that_IN a_DT low_JJ relative_JJ humidity_NN of_IN 56.8_CD per_IN cent_NN has_VBZ little_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN and_CC pulse_JJ rate_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT variations_NNS in_IN air_NN temperature_NN ,_, humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN ,_, as_IN already_RB stated_VBN ,_, that_DT fluctuations_NNS in_IN air_NN temperature_NN played_VBD a_DT major_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT variation_NN of_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN ._.
Under_IN similarly_RB variable_JJ atmospheric_JJ conditions_NNS the_DT varia-_JJ tions_NNS in_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN were_VBD mainly_RB due_JJ to_TO changes_NNS in_IN humidity_NN ._.
Importance_NN of_IN the_DT variations_NNS in_IN pulse_NN and_CC respiration_NN rates_NNS may_MD be_VB explained_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: Homeothermic_JJ animals_NNS ,_, like_IN goats_NNS ,_, maintain_VBP their_PRP$ normal_JJ body_NN temperature_NN with_IN the_DT help_NN of_IN thermo-regulative_JJ devices_NNS ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT major_JJ physical_JJ mechanisms_NN in_IN such_JJ animals_NNS for_IN dissipating_VBG their_PRP$ extra_JJ body_NN temperature_NN is_VBZ by_IN the_DT acceleration_NN of_IN their_PRP$ respiratory_NN mechanisms_NNS ._.
In_IN this_DT experiment_NN it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN when_WRB the_DT humidity_NN increased_VBD the_DT air_NN tempe-_JJ rature_NN decreased_VBN (_( partial_JJ correlation_NN coefficient_NN being_VBG March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP D._NNP P._NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, S._NNP S._NNP JAWA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 23_CD In_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN during_IN the_DT combined_JJ variations_NNS in_IN air_NN temperature_NN ,_, relative_JJ humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD the_DT air_NN temperature_NN which_WDT was_VBD comparatively_RB the_DT most_RBS important_JJ cause_NN of_IN variations_NNS in_IN both_DT pulse_JJ and_CC respira-_JJ tion_NN rates_NNS ._.
The_DT partial_JJ correlation_NN coefficients_NNS between_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN and_CC atmospheric_JJ factors_NNS in_IN this_DT group_NN suggest_VBP that_IN not_RB a_DT single_JJ atmospheric_JJ factor_NN played_VBD any_DT signi-_JJ ficant_JJ role_NN on_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN when_WRB the_DT other_JJ two_CD factors_NNS were_VBD held_VBN constant_JJ ._.
Rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN was_VBD influenced_VBN by_IN air_NN temperature_NN and_CC humidity_NN ._.
An_DT increase_NN in_IN air_NN temperature_NN increased_VBD the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN (_( partial_JJ correlation_NN coefficient_NN being_VBG +0.727_VBN )_) and_CC increase_VB in_IN relative_JJ humidity_NN decreased_VBD the_DT rate_NN of_IN respiration_NN (_( partial_JJ correlation_NN coefficient_NN being_VBG 24_CD THE_NNP EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP FEEDING_NNP THYROPROTEIN_NNP ON_NNP SEMEN_NNP (_( III_NNP )_) [_VBP Vol_NNP ._.
XXII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, inch_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT rainfall_NN ,_, respectively_RB ._.
Likewise_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT treated_JJ group_NN one_CD degree_NN change_NN in_IN air_NN temperature_NN caused_VBD four_CD and_CC five_CD times_NNS as_IN much_JJ change_NN as_IN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO one_CD per_IN cent_NN change_NN in_IN humidity_NN or_CC one_CD inch_NN change_NN in_IN rainfall_NN ,_, respectively_RB ._.
Multiple_JJ regression_NN equations_NNS for_IN respiration_NN rates_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN relative_JJ humidity_NN played_VBD a_DT major_JJ role_NN in_IN the_DT fluctuation_NN of_IN respiration_NN rate_NN whereas_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT treated_JJ group_NN it_PRP was_VBD the_DT air_NN temperature_NN which_WDT played_VBD the_DT major_JJ role_NN ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, The_DT vole_JJ bacillus_NN possesses_NNS certain_JJ characters_NNS ,_, which_WDT distinguish_VBP it_PRP from_IN the_DT human_JJ ,_, bovine_NN or_CC avian_JJ types_NNS of_IN tubercle_NN bacilli_NN ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT important_JJ distinguishing_NN features_NNS is_VBZ its_PRP$ shape_NN ._.
The_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT bacilli_NN are_VBP bent_VBN into_IN various_JJ forms_NNS ,_, which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN likened_VBN by_IN Griffith_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP to_TO a_DT shepherd_NN 's_POS crook_NN ,_, a_DT sickel_NN ,_, a_DT spiral_NN or_CC the_DT letter_NN S._NNP It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB uncommon_JJ to_TO see_VB the_DT bacillus_NN even_RB forming_VBG a_DT complete_JJ circle_NN ._.
There_EX are_VBP ,_, however_RB ,_, characteristics_NNS of_IN the_DT vole_JJ bacillus_NN ,_, which_WDT make_VBP it_PRP impossible_JJ to_TO classify_VB this_DT organism_NN otherwise_RB than_IN as_IN a_DT type_NN of_IN tubercle_NN bacillus_NN ._.
The_DT vole_NN bacillus_NN has_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, been_VBN recognised_VBN as_IN a_DT third_JJ mammalian_JJ type_NN of_IN tubercle_NN bacillus_NN and_CC is_VBZ named_VBN as_IN the_DT 'murine_NNP type_NN '_POS ._.
It_PRP occurs_VBZ naturally_RB ,_, mostly_RB in_IN wild_JJ voles_NNS (_( Microtus_NNP agrestis_NN )_) and_CC also_RB in_IN bank_NN vole_NN (_( Clethrionomys_NNP glareolus_NN )_) ,_, the_DT wood_NN mouse_NN (_( Apodemus_NNP sylvaticus_NN )_) and_CC shrew_$ (_( Sorex_NNP araneus_RB )_) ._.
Wells_NNP [_JJ 1937_CD ]_NN found_VBD it_PRP in_IN ._.
wild_JJ tuberculous_JJ voles_NNS in_IN aforested_JJ parts_NNS surrounding_VBG Lake_NNP Vyrnwy_NNP Estate_NNP in_IN Wales_NNP ._.
Such_JJ naturally_RB infected_VBN voles_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN other_JJ places_NNS in_IN England_NNP as_RB well_RB ._.
Vole_NNP bacillus_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB incapable_JJ of_IN producing_VBG progressive_JJ disease_NN in_IN laboratory_NN animals_NNS ,_, except_IN when_WRB administered_VBN in_IN very_RB large_JJ doses_NNS ._.
This_DT observation_NN suggested_VBD the_DT possibility_NN that_IN a_DT passing_NN infection_NN with_IN this_DT organism_NN might_MD confer_VB some_DT protection_NN against_IN subsequent_JJ infection_NN with_IN human_JJ or_CC bovine_JJ tubercle_NN bacilli_NN ._.
Wells_NNP and_CC Brooke_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT resistance_NN produced_VBN in_IN guinea-pigs_NNS on_IN vaccination_NN with_IN vole_JJ bacilli_NN to_TO subsequent_JJ infection_NN with_IN virulent_NN tuberculous_JJ organisms_NNS ._.
The_DT guinea-pigs_NNS were_VBD killed_VBN after_IN eleven_JJ weeks_NNS of_IN the_DT test_NN dose_NN ._.
On_IN ,_, post-mortem_JJ examination_NN it_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN the_DT animals_NNS which_WDT had_VBD received_VBN an_DT immunising_VBG dose_NN of_IN vole_NN bacilli_NN showed_VBD notably_RB less_RBR tuberculous_JJ infection_NN than_IN the_DT controls_NNS or_CC those_DT which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN injected_VBN with_IN B.C.G_NNP ._.
Similar_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD also_RB carried_VBN out_RP on_IN guinea-pigs_NNS by_IN Griffith_NNP and_CC Dalling_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP ._.
Ten_CD animals_NNS were_VBD given_VBN subcutaneously_RB 10_CD mg._NN of_IN a_DT culture_NN of_IN vole_JJ bacilli_NN divided_VBN in_IN nine_CD doses_NNS ,_, eight_CD of_IN 1_CD mg._NNS each_DT and_CC the_DT last_JJ of_IN 2_CD mg_NN ._.
The_DT interval_NN between_IN consecutive_JJ injections_NNS was_VBD one_CD week_NN ._.
Four_CD weeks_NNS after_IN the_DT last_JJ dose_NN the_DT immunised_JJ animals_NNS and_CC the_DT five_CD controls_NNS were_VBD each_DT injected_VBN subcutaneously_RB with_IN 0.001_CD mg._NNS of_IN virulent_JJ bovine-tubercle_NN bacilli_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT controls_NNS died_VBD of_IN severe_JJ generalised_VBN tuberculosis_NN in_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 87_CD days_NNS ,_, whereas_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS died_VBD in_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 152_CD days_NNS also_RB of_IN severe_JJ genera-_JJ ralized_JJ tuberculosis_NN ._.
They_PRP found_VBD in_IN another_DT experiment_NN that_WDT controls_VBZ died_VBN in_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 152_CD days_NNS ,_, also_RB of_IN severe_JJ generalized_VBN tuberculosis_NN ._.
They_PRP found_VBD in_IN another_DT experiment_NN that_WDT controls_VBZ died_VBN in_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 71_CD days_NNS and_CC the_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS which_WDT were_VBD killed_VBN 94_CD to_TO 95_CD days_NNS after_IN infection_NN ,_, showed_VBD lesions_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN of_IN a_DT moderate_JJ degree_NN ._.
They_PRP concluded_VBD that_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS vaccinated_VBD with_IN vole_JJ bacilli_NNS were_VBD more_RBR resistant_JJ to_TO tuberculosis_VB than_IN the_DT controls_NNS ._.
Living_VBG tubercle_NN bacilli_NN were_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, present_JJ in_IN the_DT lesions_NNS of_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS ,_, which_WDT suggests_VBZ that_IN these_DT bacilli_NNS would_MD have_VB caused_VBN progressive_JJ fatal_JJ disease_NN when_WRB the_DT immunising_VBG effect_NN of_IN the_DT vole_JJ acid-fast_JJ bacilli_NN had_VBD faded_VBN ._.
Similar_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD repeated_VBN on_IN calves_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ preliminary_JJ experiment_NN on_IN calves_NNS [_VBP Griffith_NNP and_CC Dalling_NNP ,_, 1940_CD ]_NN are_VBP given_VBN below_IN :_: Nine_JJ calves_NNS were_VBD given_VBN varying_VBG doses_NNS (_( total_JJ quantity_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN received_VBN by_IN different_JJ calves_NNS ranged_VBD from_IN 1.1_CD mg._NNS to_TO 125_CD mg._NN )_) of_IN vole_NN bacilli_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT intravenous_JJ or_CC subcutaneous_JJ routes_NNS or_CC by_IN the_DT combination_NN of_IN both_DT and_CC two_CD animals_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN as_IN controls_NNS ._.
These_DT animals_NNS were_VBD killed_VBN 208_CD to_TO 223_CD days_NNS after_IN infection_NN with_IN a_DT dose_NN of_IN virulent_JJ bovine_NN tubercle_NN bacilli_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD sufficient_JJ to_TO produce_VB progressive_JJ March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP J._NNP M._NNP LALL_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP C._NNP SEN_NNP 27_CD tuberculosis_NN in_IN normal_JJ animals_NNS ._.
All_PDT the_DT calves_NNS developed_VBD sensitiveness_NN to_TO tuberculin_VB after_IN vaccination_NN ._.
The_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS showed_VBD trivial_JJ tuberculous_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN glands_NNS of_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ tract_NN ,_, while_IN marked_VBN lesions_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT glands_NNS of_IN the_DT controls_NNS ._.
The_DT authors_NNS concluded_VBD that_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD with_IN vole_JJ vaccine_NN were_VBD unexpectedly_RB good_JJ ,_, better_JJR than_IN those_DT which_WDT followed_VBD the_DT use_NN of_IN B.C.G_NNP ._.
as_IN a_DT vaccine_NN ._.
With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO determine_VB that_IN the_DT vole_JJ bacillus_NN was_VBD safe_JJ for_IN human_JJ beings_NNS ,_, Sahai_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP tested_VBD the_DT strain_NN on_IN monkeys_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT only_JJ readily_RB available_JJ species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS closely_RB related_VBN to_TO man_NN ._.
One_CD monkey_NN was_VBD given_VBN intravenously_RB 1.0_CD mgm_NN ._.
of_IN a_DT young_JJ culture_NN and_CC another_DT 10.0_CD mgm_NN ._.
subcutaneously_RB ._.
Both_DT the_DT monkeys_NNS remained_VBD well_RB during_IN the_DT entire_JJ period_NN of_IN observation_NN (_( 146_CD days_NNS and_CC 126_CD days_NNS res-_RB pectively_RB )_) ,_, though_IN the_DT monkey_NN inoculated_VBD subcutaneously_RB developed_VBN a_DT local_JJ lesion_NN at_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN inoculation_NN which_WDT burst_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT resulting_JJ ulcer_NN healed_VBD spontaneously_RB and_CC the_DT animal_NN did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT disturbance_NN in_IN the_DT general_JJ health_NN ._.
The_DT one_CD inocu-_NN lated_VBD subcutaneously_RB was_VBD killed_VBN after_IN 126_CD days_NNS and_CC the_DT other_JJ after_IN 146_CD days_NNS for_IN a_DT thorough_JJ post-mortem_NN examination_NN ._.
No_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD met_VBN with_IN in_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT internal_JJ organs_NNS and_CC cultures_NNS made_VBN therefrom_NNS remained_VBD sterile_JJ ._.
The_DT monkeys_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN repeatedly_RB with_IN human_JJ tuberculin_NN both_DT intradermally_RB and_CC subcutaneously_RB ._.
In_IN the_DT former_JJ case_NN 0.1_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN tubarculin_NN diluted_VBD 1:10_CD and_CC 1:50_CD was_VBD inoculated_VBN into_IN the_DT skin_NN on_IN the_DT flexor_JJ aspect_NN of_IN the_DT forearm_NN ,_, while_IN for_IN the_DT subcu-_JJ taneous_JJ test_NN 1.5_CD to_TO 2.0_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN diluted_VBN tuberculin_NN (_( 1:10_CD )_) was_VBD injected_VBN under_IN the_DT skin_NN in_IN the_DT upper_JJ arm_NN ._.
In_IN no_DT case_NN any_DT characteristic_JJ reaction_NN was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_DT cattle_NNS and_CC guinea-pigs_NNS infected_VBN with_IN the_DT vole_JJ strain_NN of_IN acid-fast_JJ organisms_NNS show_VBP strong_JJ and_CC distinct_JJ allergy_NN ,_, to_TO mammalian_JJ tuberculin_NN ,_, so_RB perhaps_RB the_DT negative_JJ results_NNS in_IN these_DT monkeys_NNS may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT general_JJ unsatis-_JJ factory_NN nature_NN of_IN the_DT tuberculin_JJ test_NN in_IN this_DT species_NNS of_IN animal_NN ._.
Sahai_NNP [_NN 1943_CD and_CC 1944_CD ]_NN again_RB demonstrated_VBD the_DT almost_RB complete_JJ innocuousness_NN of_IN this_DT organism_NN (_( strain_JJ LV_NNP 285_CD )_) for_IN monkeys_NN ._.
He_PRP administered_VBD doses_NNS as_RB large_JJ as_IN 10_CD mgm_NN ._.
intravenously_RB ,_, subcutaneously_RB ,_, intraperitoneally_RB or_CC by_IN combination_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ routes_NNS to_TO ten_VB monkeys_NNS ,_, but_CC none_NN showed_VBD any_DT ill-effect_JJ excepting_VBG the_DT develop-_JJ ment_NN of_IN local_JJ abscesses_NNS after_IN subcutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN which_WDT healed_VBD spontaneously_RB ._.
One_CD monkey_NN was_VBD given_VBN only_RB a_DT single_JJ dose_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN ,_, others_NNS received_VBD two_CD to_TO four_CD ._.
Two_CD of_IN the_DT monkeys_NNS died_VBD of_IN dysentery_NN before_IN they_PRP could_MD be_VB tested_VBN for_IN immunity_NN ._.
The_DT rest_NN ,_, along_IN with_IN three_CD controls_NNS ,_, were_VBD injected_VBN subcutaneously_RB in_IN the_DT left_NN axilla_NN ,_, some_DT two_CD months_NNS after_IN the_DT administration_NN of_IN the_DT last_JJ dose_NN of_IN vole_JJ bacilli_NN with_IN 0.00001_CD mgm_NNS ._.
of_IN a_DT bovine_JJ culture_NN ._.
One_CD of_IN these_DT vaccinated_VBN monkeys_NNS ,_, again_RB died_VBD of_IN dysentery_NN after_IN being_VBG given_VBN the_DT test_NN dose_NN ._.

6A_CD 28_CD VOLE_NNP VACCNATION_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, There_EX are_VBP two_CD facts_NNS about_IN the_DT above_JJ experiment_NN to_TO which_WDT attention_NN might_MD be_VB drawn_VBN in_IN trying_VBG to_TO explain_VB the_DT discrepant_JJ results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN Sahai_NNP and_CC those_DT obtained_VBN by_IN other_JJ workers_NNS in_IN guinea-pigs_NNS ._.
The_DT first_JJ of_IN these_DT relates_NNS to_TO the_DT virulence_NN of_IN the_DT strain_NN used_VBN in_IN these_DT experiments_NNS ._.
This_DT strain_NN ,_, LV_NNP 285_CD ,_, had_VBD been_VBN isolated_VBN from_IN a_DT vole_JJ many_JJ years_NNS back_RB in_IN England_NNP and_CC ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT writer_NN [_NNP Sahai_NNP ]_NNP is_VBZ aware_JJ ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN maintained_VBN continuously_RB in_IN artificial_JJ culture_NN on_IN an_DT egg_NN medium_NN ;_: at_IN any_DT rate_NN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN so_RB maintained_JJ since_IN its_PRP$ receipt_NN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN nearly_RB two_CD years_NNS ago_RB ._.

The_DT results_NNS have_VBP been_VBN encouraging_JJ and_CC warrant_VB further_JJ work_NN since_IN the_DT advantages_NNS of_IN a_DT vaccine_NN made_VBN from_IN dead_JJ organisms_NNS only_RB are_VBP obvious_JJ ._.
Young_NNP and_CC Paterson_NNP [_NNP 1949_CD ]_NNP carried_VBD out_RP a_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS to_TO study_VB the_DT efficacy_NN of_IN vaccination_NN with_IN the_DT vole_JJ acid-fast_JJ bacillus_NN against_IN tuberculosis_NN in_IN cattle_NNS by_IN employing_VBG a_DT single_JJ dose_NN of_IN vaccine_NN intravenously_RB as_RB well_RB as_IN two-spaced_JJ doses_NNS ;_: the_DT efficacy_NN of_IN multiple_JJ puncture_NN skin_NN vaccination_NN was_VBD also_RB determined_VBN ._.

They_PRP also_RB recorded_VBD the_DT clinical_JJ effects_NNS of_IN inoculation_NN of_IN vole_JJ bacillus_NN into_IN cattle_NNS and_CC carried_VBD out_RP bacteriological_JJ and_CC histological_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT tissues_NNS of_IN such_JJ calves_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO them_PRP there_EX was_VBD little_JJ hope_NN for_IN the_DT bestowal_NN on_IN an_DT animal_NN of_IN a_DT life-time_JJ immunity_NN against_IN tuberculosis_NN by_IN vole_JJ vaccination_NN ,_, but_CC surely_RB the_DT vole_NN bacillus_NN was_VBD entitled_VBN to_TO be_VB ranked_VBN alongside_JJ B.C.G_NNP ._.
