A_DT single_JJ intravenous_JJ inoculation_NN of_IN 5_CD mgm_NN ._.
of_IN vole_JJ bacillus_NN could_MD raise_VB the_DT resistance_NN of_IN cattle_NNS to_TO infection_NN with_IN the_DT bovine_NN bacilli_NN to_TO a_DT high_JJ degree_NN ,_, this_DT resistance_NN being_VBG evidenced_VBN by_IN a_DT complete_JJ absence_NN or_CC by_IN a_DT marked_JJ diminution_NN in_IN the_DT severity_NN of_IN lesions_NNS following_VBG exposure_NN to_TO artificial_VB or_CC natural_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT resistance_NN took_VBD time_NN to_TO develop_VB ,_, reached_VBD its_PRP$ maximum_NN between_IN 6_CD to_TO 18_CD months_NNS after_IN vaccination_NN and_CC then_RB slowly_RB waned_VBN ._.
The_DT resistance_NN induced_VBN by_IN a_DT single_JJ inoculation_NN was_VBD ,_, how-_JJ ever_RB ,_, of_IN insufficient_JJ duration_NN in_IN many_JJ animals_NNS to_TO warrant_VB the_DT practice_NN of_IN single_JJ vac-_JJ cination_NN being_VBG used_VBN in_IN the_DT field_NN except_IN in_IN special_JJ circumstances_NNS ._.
They_PRP also_RB observed_VBD that_IN revaccination_NN could_MD intensify_VB resistance_NN provided_VBD it_PRP was_VBD delayed_VBN until_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT fourth_JJ week_NN ._.
Further_JJ work_NN is_VBZ being_VBG carried_VBN out_RP by_IN Young_NNP and_CC Paterson_NNP to_TO study_VB March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP J._NNP M._NNP LALL_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP C._NNP SEN_NNP 31_CD if_IN revaccination_NN in_IN addition_NN to_TO intensifying_VBG the_DT initial_JJ resistance_NN ,_, could_MD also_RB lengthen_VB its_PRP$ duration_NN ._.
These_DT workers_NNS were_VBD of_IN the_DT opinion_NN that_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN resistance_NN set_VBN up_RP in_IN cattle_NNS was_VBD correlated_VBN with_IN the_DT virulence_NN of_IN the_DT vaccinating_VBG strain_NN of_IN vole_JJ bacillus_NN for_IN its_PRP$ natural_JJ host_NN ._.
This_DT fact_NN would_MD necessitate_VB that_IN any_DT strain_NN used_VBN for_IN vaccine_NN purposes_NNS will_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB maintained_VBN at_IN a_DT high_JJ level_NN of_IN virulence_NN by_IN repeated_JJ passage_NN through_IN its_PRP$ native_JJ host_NN ._.
They_PRP have_VBP encountered_VBN one_CD strain_NN of_IN vole_JJ bacillus_NN (_( G._NNP 564_CD )_) ,_, which_WDT could_MD set_VB up_RP a_DT fatal_JJ infection_NN in_IN calves_NNS ._.
A_DT severe_JJ transient_NN lameness_NN following_VBG inoculation_NN affected_VBD a_DT proportion_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS and_CC the_DT joint_JJ lesions_NNS which_WDT were_VBD found_VBN in_IN such_JJ cases_NNS resembled_VBD those_DT generally_RB seen_VBN in_IN joints_NNS in_IN serum_NN sickness_NN ,_, allergy_NN and_CC anaphylaxis_NN ._.
Utmost_NNP care_NN is_VBZ therefore_RB necessary_JJ in_IN the_DT selec-_JJ tion_NN of_IN a_DT strain_NN of_IN the_DT vole_JJ bacillus_NN for_IN vaccine_NN purposes_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, nothing_NN was_VBD noted_VBN by_IN them_PRP ,_, which_WDT would_MD contra-indicate_VB the_DT use_NN of_IN strain_NN LV_NNP 285_CD ._.
The_DT histopathological_JJ studies_NNS carried_VBD out_RP by_IN Young_NNP and_CC Paterson_NNP revealed_VBD that_IN changes_NNS pathogonomic_VBP of_IN tuberculous_JJ infection_NN ,_, which_WDT followed_VBD the_DT intravenous_JJ inoculation_NN of_IN vole_JJ bacilli_NN ,_, were_VBD mainly_RB confined_VBN to_TO the_DT lungs_NNS and_CC thoracic_JJ glands_NNS ._.

(_( ii_NN )_) the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT functional_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT endocrine_JJ glands_NNS ._.
And_CC ,_, yet_RB another_DT very_RB interesting_JJ and_CC very_RB useful_JJ field_NN of_IN study_NN will_MD be_VB to_TO see_VB if_IN smaller_JJR doses_NNS of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN would_MD prove_VB effective_JJ if_IN given_VBN in_IN combination_NN with_IN a_DT vaccine_NN consisting_NN of_IN ultra-violet_JJ killed_VBN virulent_NN bovine_NN bacilli_NN or_CC comparatively_RB virulent_JJ vole_NN baccilli_NN or_CC suitable_JJ extracts_NNS of_IN these_DT bacilli_NNS ._.
Perhaps_RB they_PRP may_MD bring_VB about_RP a_DT state_NN of_IN resistance_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT cellular_NN and_CC humoral_JJ factors_NNS are_VBP more_JJR evenly_RB 8_CD 36_CD VOLE_NNP VACCINATION_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, balanced_VBD ,_, a_DT state_NN of_IN resistance_NN where_WRB there_EX are_VBP lesser_JJR chances_NNS of_IN exhaustion_NN following_VBG overstimulation_NN ._.
Till_NNP such_JJ time_NN ,_, as_IN detailed_JJ studies_NNS on_IN the_DT above_NN problems_NNS have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP ,_, it_PRP would_MD be_VB wise_JJ to_TO reserve_VB our_PRP$ definite_NN decisions_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT value_NN of_IN vaccination_NN with_IN the_DT vole_JJ bacillus_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN ,_, may_MD be_VB in_IN animals_NNS or_CC in_IN human_JJ beings_NNS ._.
Researches_NNS on_IN these_DT problems_NNS should_MD find_VB a_DT very_RB important_JJ place_NN in_IN the_DT programmes_NNS of_IN scientists_NNS engaged_VBN in_IN the_DT formidable_JJ task_NN of_IN control_NN of_IN bovine_JJ tuber-_JJ culosis_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT things_NNS are_VBP we_PRP have_VBP to_TO bear_VB in_IN mind_NN the_DT limitations_NNS of_IN vaccination_NN even_RB on_IN heavily_RB infected_VBN farms_NNS and_CC so_RB under_IN no_DT consideration_NN should_MD vaccination_NN be_VB used_VBN to_TO the_DT exclusion_NN of_IN time-honoured_JJ anti-tuberculosis_NN measures_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN enforcement_NN of_IN hygienic_JJ precautions_NNS against_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Vaccination_NN may_MD be_VB taken_VBN only_RB as_IN a_DT helpful_JJ adjunct_NN and_CC an_DT additional_JJ weapon_NN in_IN the_DT already_RB existing_VBG armament_NN to_TO fight_VB the_DT scourage_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN ._.
With_IN our_PRP$ present_JJ knowledge_NN ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN mass_NN vaccination_NN neither_CC with_IN the_DT B.C.G_NNP ._.
nor_CC with_IN vole_JJ bacillus_NN will_MD ever_RB be_VB attempted_VBN to_TO any_DT advantage_NN ,_, for_IN eradication_NN of_IN cattle_JJ tuberculosis_NN ,_, as_IN vaccination_NN renders_NNS animals_NNS allergic_RB and_CC a_DT very_RB useful_JJ method_NN of_IN detecting_VBG during_IN life_NN the_DT presence_NN of_IN tuberculous_JJ infection_NN ,_, loses_VBZ its_PRP$ effec-_JJ tiveness_NN to_TO a_DT very_RB great_JJ extent_NN ._.
The_DT writers_NNS are_VBP not_RB aware_JJ of_IN any_DT successful_JJ experi-_JJ ment_NN carried_VBD out_IN to_TO eradicate_VB bovine_JJ tuberculosis_NN from_IN any_DT country_NN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN vaccines_NNS ._.
In_IN Portugal_NNP in_IN 1928_CD ,_, vaccination_NN was_VBD tried_VBN as_IN a_DT part_NN of_IN an_DT official_JJ scheme_NN ,_, but_CC was_VBD abandoned_VBN in_IN 1931_CD [_NN Lucas_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT British_JJ Committee_NNP on_IN Cattle_NNP Diseases_NNP [_NNP Report_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ]_NN concluded_VBD that_IN even_RB if_IN vaccination_NN was_VBD effective_JJ ,_, the_DT regula-_JJ tions_NNS necessary_JJ to_TO govern_VB its_PRP$ use_NN would_MD be_VB as_IN onerous_JJ and_CC those_DT necessary_JJ for_IN an_DT eradication_NN scheme_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB well_RB to_TO stress_VB here_RB the_DT need_NN for_IN a_DT wider_NN interest_NN in_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN pathology_NN and_CC pathogenesis_NN of_IN bovine_JJ tuberculosis_NN ,_, and_CC not_RB simply_RB to_TO transfer_VB concepts_NNS gained_VBN by_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN human_JJ tuberculosis_NN ,_, otherwise_IN we_PRP are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO go_VB very_RB far_RB from_IN the_DT truth_NN ,_, as_IN tuberculosis_NN in_IN bovines_NNS differs_NNS in_IN some_DT very_RB fundamental_JJ ways_NNS from_IN that_DT in_IN human_JJ beings_NNS ._.
For_IN example_NN 'it_CD is_VBZ known_VBN that_IN the_DT primary_JJ focus_NN in_IN cattle_NNS may_MD remain_VB latent_JJ for_IN many_JJ years_NNS or_CC at_IN the_DT most_RBS progress_JJ very_RB slightly_RB [_NNP Bang_NNP ,_, 1899_CD ,_, 372_CD ;_: 1908b_CD ,_, 488_CD ;_: M'Fadyeen_NNP ,_, 1899c_CD ]_NN but_CC the_DT complete_JJ healing_NN which_WDT occurs_VBZ in_IN man_NN is_VBZ apparently_RB rare_JJ in_IN the_DT bovine_NN [_NNP Bull_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ;_: Stamp_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN and_CC the_DT lesions_NNS remain_VBP 'open_JJ '_POS ._.
This_DT view_NN is_VBZ supported_VBN by_IN much_JJ epidemiological_JJ evidence_NN which_WDT shows_VBZ that_IN if_IN any_DT animal_JJ reacting_NN to_TO the_DT tuberculin_NN test_NN ,_, even_RB with_IN very_RB slight_JJ lung_NN lesions_NNS ,_, is_VBZ left_VBN in_IN a_DT herd_NN ,_, spread_NN will_MD be_VB more_RBR or_CC less_RBR rapid_JJ ._.
The_DT problem_NN of_IN bovine_NN tuberculosis_NN is_VBZ therefore_RB ,_, a_DT very_RB important_JJ one_CD not_RB only_RB from_IN the_DT animal_JJ health_NN and_CC agricultural_JJ economics_NNS point_NN of_IN view_NN but_CC equally_RB so_RB from_IN the_DT public_JJ health_NN ,_, and_CC requires_VBZ being_VBG attacked_VBN from_IN all_PDT the_DT angles_NNS in_IN the_DT interest_NN of_IN national_JJ welfare_NN ._.
Unfortunately_RB no_DT statistics_NNS have_VBP yet_RB been_VBN collected_VBN to_TO show_VB the_DT huge_JJ monetary_JJ loss_NN that_IN our_PRP$ country_NN suffers_NNS annually_RB at_IN the_DT hands_NNS of_IN this_DT scourge_NN ,_, but_CC this_DT much_RB can_MD be_VB said_VBD with_IN confidence_NN that_IN the_DT loss_NN runs_VBZ into_IN millions_NNS of_IN rupees_NNS and_CC as_IN the_DT years_NNS go_VBP by_IN and_CC animals_NNS are_VBP brought_VBN more_RBR and_CC more_RBR under_IN domestication_NN and_CC are_VBP concentrated_VBN in_IN organised_JJ dairy_NN farms_NNS ,_, the_DT losses_NNS are_VBP bound_VBN to_TO increase_VB each_DT year_NN ,_, unless_IN concentrated_VBN efforts_NNS are_VBP made_VBN to_TO control_VB this_DT course_NN ._.
At_IN present_JJ our_PRP$ knowledge_NN of_IN bovine_JJ tuberculosis_NN in_IN general_JJ and_CC especially_RB under_IN Indian_JJ conditions_NNS is_VBZ very_RB meagre_JJ and_CC there_EX are_VBP very_RB March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP J._NNP M._NNP LALL_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP C._NNP SEN_NNP 37_CD many_JJ debatable_JJ points_NNS ,_, which_WDT require_VBP undoubtedly_RB serious_JJ studies_NNS to_TO gain_VB the_DT further_JJ pathological_NN ,_, epidemiological_JJ and_CC immunological_JJ background_NN which_WDT is_VBZ so_RB very_RB essen-_JJ tial_NN to_TO formulate_VB efficient_JJ measures_NNS for_IN the_DT ''_'' control_NN and_CC eradication_NN of_IN the_DT scourge_NN ._.

47_CD ,_, 39-78_JJ CUTANEOUS_NNP ERUPTIONS_NNP OF_NNP RINDERPEST_NNP IN_NNP GOATS_NNP By_IN RADHEY_NNP MOHAN_NNP ,_, L.V.P._NNP ,_, P.V.S_NNP ._.
II_NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP (_( Sheep_NNP and_CC Goats_NNP )_) ,_, Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP and_CC MANGAT_NNP RAI_NNP BAHL_NNP ,_, L.V.P._NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Assistant_NNP Surgeon_NNP ,_, Ferozepur_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 25_CD April_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP I_PRP )_) CUTANEOUS_NNP eruptions_NNS in_IN cattle_NNS due_JJ to_TO rinderpest_VB have_VB been_VBN reported_VBN by_IN several_JJ workers_NNS from_IN different_JJ countries_NNS ._.
The_DT following_JJ references_NNS have_VBP been_VBN cited_VBN by_IN Mohan_NNP [_NNP 1948_CD ]_NNP ._.
Curasson_NNP [_NN 1921_CD ,_, 1932_CD ]_NN mentioned_VBD that_IN the_DT cutaneous_JJ form_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN was_VBD known_VBN since_IN the_DT eighteenth_JJ century_NN and_CC that_IN the_DT relationship_NN between_IN the_DT exanthema_NN and_CC the_DT infection_NN had_VBD been_VBN recognised_VBN as_RB early_RB as_IN 1712_CD by_IN Ramazzini_NNP ,_, who_WP accord-_VBP ing_VBG to_TO Gerlach_NNP [_NN 1873_CD ]_NN ,_, went_VBD to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN designating_VBG rinderpest_NN as_IN Pocken-_NNP seuche_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
'Pock_CD disease_NN '_POS ._.
These_DT eruptions_NNS were_VBD repeatedly_RB noticed_VBN in_IN Holland_NNP ,_, Germany_NNP ,_, Hungary_NNP and_CC England_NNP during_IN the_DT great_JJ wars_NNS of_IN the_DT nineteenth_JJ century_NN and_CC were_VBD described_VBN by_IN Gerlach_NNP [_NNP LOC_NNP ._.
cit_NN ._.
]_NN ,_, Peuch_NNP [_NNP 1892_CD ]_NNP ,_, Nocard_NNP and_CC Leclainche_NNP [_NNP 1903_CD ]_NNP and_CC other_JJ workers_NNS ._.
Gartner_NNP [_JJ 1920_CD ]_NN recorded_VBN these_DT cutaneous_JJ eruptions_NNS as_IN a_DT constant_JJ feature_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN in_IN East_NNP Africa_NNP ._.
Hutyra_NNP and_CC Marek_NNP [_NNP 1916_CD ]_NNP describ-_JJ ed_NN similar_JJ eruptions_NNS from_IN Roumania_NNP and_CC steppes_NNS of_IN Russia_NNP ._.
Curasson_NNP [_NNP LOC_NNP ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
and_CC his_PRP$ colleagues_NNS found_VBD the_DT eruptions_NNS a_DT more_RBR or_CC less_RBR constant_JJ feature_NN in_IN Sudan_NNP and_CC other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN West_NNP Africa_NNP ._.
Croveri_NNP [_NN 1921_CD ]_NN in_IN Italian_JJ Somaliland_NNP ,_, Carlier_NNP [_NNP 1920_CD ]_NNP in_IN Belgian_NNP Congo_NNP ,_, Pecaud_NNP [_NNP 1924_CD ]_NNP in_IN Chad_NNP ,_, and_CC Malfrey_NNP [_NNP 1927_CD ]_NNP have_VBP all_DT reported_VBD the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN cutaneous_JJ eruptions_NNS in_IN rinderpest_NN ._.
MacGregor_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NN was_VBD the_DT first_JJ worker_NN in_IN India_NNP who_WP in_IN collaboration_NN with_IN Menon_NNP ,_, made_VBD some_DT preliminary_JJ observa-_JJ tions_NNS and_CC tests_NNS on_IN this_DT condition_NN ._.
Mohan_NNP [_NN 1948_CD ]_NNP published_VBD an_DT account_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN done_VBN by_IN him_PRP during_IN 1943-45_NNS ._.
The_DT above_JJ workers_NNS recorded_VBD the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN cutaneous_JJ eruptions_NNS in_IN cattle_NNS but_CC no_DT reference_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB available_JJ in_IN so_RB far_RB as_IN goats_NNS are_VBP concerned_VBN ._.
This_DT note_NN describes_VBZ an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN in_IN goats_NNS in_IN which_WDT some_DT of_IN the_DT animals_NNS showed_VBD cutaneous_JJ eruptions_NNS ._.
Symptoms_NNS The_DT outbreak_NN was_VBD reported_VBN from_IN Basti_NNP Bhattian_NNP ,_, Ferozepur_NNP ._.
There_EX were_VBD 115_CD goats_NNS in_IN all_DT in_IN the_DT Basti_NNP ,_, out_IN of_IN which_WDT 13_CD were_VBD affected_VBN ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT 13_CD goats_NNS affected_VBD ,_, eight_CD with_IN white_JJ or_CC grey_NN and_CC short_JJ hair_NN showed_VBD well_RB marked_VBN cutaneous_JJ lesions_NNS ._.
The_DT eruptions_NNS were_VBD mainly_RB seen_VBN on_IN the_DT udder_NN especially_RB the_DT base_NN of_IN the_DT teats_NNS ,_, ears_NNS ,_, scrotum_NN ,_, perineum_NN ,_, inside_IN of_IN the_DT thighs_NNS ,_, neck_NN and_CC back_RB ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS only_RB one_CD or_CC two_CD parts_NNS mentioned_VBN above_IN showed_VBD the_DT eruptions_NNS ,_, in_IN others_NNS the_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN on_IN three_CD or_CC more_JJR parts_NNS but_CC in_IN no_DT case_NN there_RB was_VBD generalisation_NN of_IN the_DT eruptions_NNS over_IN the_DT whole_JJ body_NN ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT affected_JJ animals_NNS showed_VBD any_DT lesion_NN on_IN the_DT por-_JJ tions_NNS below_IN the_DT hocks_NNS and_CC knees_NNS ._.
Diarrhoea_NNP was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN two_CD out_IN of_IN the_DT eight_CD goats_NNS showing_VBG cutaneous_JJ lesions_NNS whereas_IN it_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN three_CD out_IN of_IN the_DT remaining_VBG 39_CD 9_CD 40_CD CUTANEOUS_NNP ERUPTIONS_NNP OF_NNP RINDERPEST_NNP IN_NNP GOATS_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, five_CD goats_NNS which_WDT did_VBD not_RB show_VB cutaneous_JJ eruptions_NNS ._.
The_DT cutaneous_JJ eruptions_NNS in_IN the_DT beginning_NN were_VBD quite_RB small_JJ ,_, discrete_JJ and_CC presented_VBD a_DT congested_JJ appearance_NN ._.
In_IN goats_NNS which_WDT had_VBD thick_JJ hair_NN or_CC deep_JJ coloured_JJ skin_NN ,_, such_JJ lesions_NNS generally_RB escaped_VBD notice_NN unless_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD closely_RB examined_VBN ._.
Under_IN and_CC inside_IN of_IN the_DT external_JJ ears_NNS were_VBD the_DT sites_NNS where_WRB lesions_NNS appeared_VBD first_RB ._.
The_DT skin_NN of_IN these_DT regions_NNS is_VBZ thin_JJ and_CC fine_JJ ._.
These_DT initial_JJ eruptions_NNS developed_VBD into_IN pustules_NNS and_CC discharged_VBD thick_JJ sero-purulent_NN fluid_NN which_WDT caused_VBD matting_NN of_IN the_DT hair_NN ._.
Later_RB ,_, scabs_NNS were_VBD formed_VBN which_WDT remained_VBD sticking_VBG for_IN about_IN a_DT week_NN or_CC even_RB more_JJR and_CC fell_VBD off_RB after_IN 7_CD to_TO 10_CD days_NNS leaving_VBG hairless_JJ islets_NNS of_IN skin_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT 13_CD goats_NNS affected_VBD with_IN rinderpest_NN ,_, seven_CD diedIndian_JJ J._NNP Vet_NNP ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, SUMMARY_NNP An_DT outbreak_NN of_IN cutaneous_JJ rinderpest_NN in_IN goats_NNS is_VBZ recorded_VBN for_IN the_DT first_JJ time_NN ._.

Indian_JJ J._NNP vet_NN ._.
Sci_NNP ._.
18_CD ,_, 27_CD EFFECT_NN OF_NNP GROWTH_NNP STAGE_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP CHEMICAL_NNP COMPOSITION_NNP OF_NNP SOME_NNP INDIGENOUS_NNP GRASSES_NNP OF_IN INDIA_NNP By_IN NARINDAR_NNP NATH_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP B._NNP DAS_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 18_CD June_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN one_CD text-figure_NN )_) IMPROVEMENT_NNP of_IN livestock_NN is_VBZ closely_RB connected_VBN with_IN the_DT improvement_NN in_IN the_DT supply_NN of_IN feeds_NNS and_CC fodder_NN ._.
One_CD important_JJ requirement_NN for_IN bringing_VBG about_IN the_DT desired_JJ improvement_NN in_IN the_DT fodder_NN supply_NN is_VBZ a_DT thorough_JJ knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN and_CC nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN different_JJ feeding_VBG stuffs_NNS available_JJ in_IN the_DT country_NN and_CC thereby_RB grading_VBG them_PRP according_VBG to_TO their_PRP$ nutrient_JJ contents_NNS ._.
Grasses_VBZ cultivat-_JJ ed_NN or_CC naturally_RB grown_VBN constitute_NN a_DT major_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT animal_JJ ration_NN and_CC the_DT lack_NN of_IN knowledge_NN about_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN different_JJ species_NNS of_IN grasses_NNS found_VBN in_IN the_DT country_NN makes_VBZ the_DT judicious_JJ selection_NN and_CC cultivation_NN of_IN good_JJ varieties_NNS rather_RB difficult_JJ ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, some_DT of_IN the_DT grasses_NNS which_WDT are_VBP ordinarily_RB taken_VBN to_TO be_VB good_JJ from_IN nutritive_JJ point_NN of_IN view_NN may_MD be_VB deficient_NN in_IN some_DT nutrients_NNS at_IN certain_JJ stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN or_CC at_IN a_DT certain_JJ period_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, since_IN the_DT chemical_NN constituents_NNS of_IN plants_NNS are_VBP known_VBN to_TO vary_VB considerably_RB with_IN the_DT stage_NN of_IN growth_NN ,_, methods_NNS of_IN harvesting_NN ,_, soil_NN ,_, season_NN and_CC climate_NN ._.
Such_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN and_CC con-_NN sequently_RB in_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN plants_NNS are_VBP correspondingly_RB reflected_VBN on_IN the_DT pro-_JJ ductivity_NN of_IN the_DT cattle_NNS to_TO whom_WP they_PRP are_VBP fed_VBN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO assess_VB the_DT suit-_JJ ability_NN of_IN a_DT particular_JJ species_NNS of_IN a_DT grass_NN ,_, the_DT knowledge_NN of_IN its_PRP$ chemical_JJ composition_NN under_IN different_JJ systems_NNS of_IN cutting_VBG is_VBZ important_JJ ._.
If_IN such_JJ data_NNS about_IN various_JJ feed-_JJ ing_NN stuffs_NNS are_VBP available_JJ ,_, it_PRP may_MD also_RB help_VB to_TO put_VB the_DT nutrition_NN of_IN animals_NNS on_IN a_DT scientific_JJ basis_NN by_IN supplementing_VBG the_DT rations_NNS of_IN animals_NNS by_IN those_DT nutrients_NNS which_WDT are_VBP actually_RB required_VBN and_CC when_WRB they_PRP are_VBP required_VBN ._.
Several_JJ investigations_NNS dealing_VBG with_IN the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN of_IN plants_NNS have_VBP been_VBN reported_VBN from_IN India_NNP and_CC abroad_RB ._.
Ray_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD that_IN with_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT plant_NN and_CC increase_VB in_IN rainfall_PDT the_DT percentage_NN of_IN lime_NN and_CC phosphoric_JJ acid_NN increased_VBD ._.
Ramiah_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NNP noted_VBD a_DT striking_JJ parallelism_NN between_IN the_DT variations_NNS of_IN phosphoric_JJ acid_NN and_CC nitrogen_NN and_CC opposite_JJ variation_NN in_IN lime_NN ._.
Iyer_NNP [_NN 1935_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN with_IN advance_NN of_IN maturity_NN ,_, nitrogen_NN and_CC potash_NN fluctuated_VBD considerably_RB while_IN lime_NN and_CC magnesia_NN showed_VBD negligible_JJ variations_NNS ._.
Iyer_NNP and_CC Kayasth_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN the_DT soil_NN exerts_VBZ a_DT pronounced_JJ effect_NN in_IN determining_VBG the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN ._.
Narayana_NNP Iyer_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD that_IN uncultivated_JJ grasses_NNS are_VBP poorer_JJR than_IN the_DT British_JJ natural_JJ pastures_NNS ._.
Mathur_NNP and_CC Ray_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN crude_NN protein_NN and_CC phosphoric_JJ acid_NNS decreased_VBN while_IN lime_NN increased_VBN with_IN maturity_NN ._.
Lander_NNP [_NN 1942_CD ]_NN concluded_VBD that_IN longer_JJR intervals_NNS between_IN two_CD cuttings_NNS increased_VBD the_DT yield_NN of_IN green_JJ herbage_NN and_CC dry_JJ matter_NN but_CC decreased_VBD the_DT contents_NNS of_IN protein_NN ,_, phosphoric_JJ acid_NN and_CC potash_NN of_IN grasses_NNS ._.
These_DT findings_NNS of_IN Lander_NNP were_VBD later_RB confirmed_VBN by_IN Dharmani_NNP and_CC Singh_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NN with_IN 43_CD 10_CD 44_CD INDIGENOUS_NNP GRASSES_NNP OF_NNP INDIA_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, berseem_NN ._.
Talapatra_NNP and_CC Dev_NNP Goswami_NNP [_NNP 1949_CD ]_NNP noted_VBD a_DT decrease_NN with_IN age_NN in_IN the_DT mineral_NN and_CC protein_NN content_NN of_IN aquatic_JJ grasses_NNS of_IN Assam_NNP ._.
Srivastava_NNP ,_, Mukerjee_NNP and_CC Shrikhande_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NNP recorded_VBD decrease_NN in_IN digestible_JJ protein_NN ,_, ether_CC extract_NN and_CC other_JJ nutrients_NNS with_IN growth_NN and_CC found_VBD that_IN cuts_NNS improved_VBD the_DT nutrient_JJ status_NN ._.
Das_NNP Gupta_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP also_RB studied_VBD the_DT composition_NN of_IN berseem_NN as_IN affected_VBN by_IN maturity_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN three_CD important_JJ grasses_NNS ,_, namely_RB ,_, Amphilophis_NNP odorata_NN ,_, Iseilema_NNP laxum_NN and_CC Amphilophis_NNP glabra_NN have_VBP been_VBN analysed_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ chemi-_JJ cal_JJ constituents_NNS at_IN four_CD different_JJ stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN ,_, young_JJ ,_, preflowering_JJ ,_, flowering_JJ and_CC ripe_JJ stages_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Sampling_NNP ._.
The_DT various_JJ species_NNS of_IN grasses_NNS studied_VBN include_VBP some_DT of_IN the_DT grasses_NNS brought_VBD from_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN and_CC established_VBN in_IN sub-plots_NNS of_IN 1/300_CD acre_NN for_IN eaoh_NN of_IN the_DT grasses_NNS in_IN the_DT Division_NNP of_IN Agronomy_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Agricultural_NNP Re-_NNP search_NN Institute_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP ,_, in_IN the_DT year_NN 1943_CD ._.
The_DT nursery_NN has_VBZ been_VBN maintained_VBN since_IN then_RB under_IN irrigation_NN and_CC ammonium_NN sulphate_NN is_VBZ applied_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN two_CD maunds_NNS per_IN acre_NN ._.
The_DT grasses_NNS were_VBD cut_VBN at_IN four_CD stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT chronological_JJ dates_NNS ._.
For_IN young_JJ stage_NN ,_, all_PDT the_DT three_CD grasses_NNS were_VBD cut_VBN in_IN May_NNP when_WRB they_PRP had_VBD reached_VBN sufficient_JJ height_NN and_CC were_VBD fit_VBN for_IN grazing_VBG purpose_NN ._.
Samples_NNS for_IN the_DT preflowering_NN and_CC flowering_JJ stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN were_VBD taken_VBN on_IN the_DT same_JJ date_NN ,_, the_DT reason_NN being_VBG that_IN preflowering_VBG period_NN is_VBZ a_DT long_JJ one_CD extending_NN from_IN the_DT young_JJ stage_NN to_TO the_DT time_NN when_WRB the_DT plants_NNS flower_NN ._.
So_RB in_IN order_NN that_IN the_DT samples_NNS of_IN different_JJ grasses_NNS represent_VBP the_DT same_JJ preflowering_NN stage_NN of_IN growth_NN ,_, the_DT sampling_NN was_VBD done_VBN when_WRB more_JJR than_IN half_PDT the_DT plants_NNS had_VBD flowered_VBN ._.
Those_DT plants_NNS which_WDT had_VBD not_RB flowered_VBN were_VBD taken_VBN as_IN preflowering_VBG ones_NNS while_IN those_DT with_IN flowers_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN for_IN the_DT flowering_NN stages_NNS ._.
Samples_NNS for_IN the_DT ripe_JJ stage_NN were_VBD collected_VBN when_WRB the_DT plants_NNS begin_VBP to_TO drop_VB seedlings_NNS ._.
Samples_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN by_IN hand_NN cutting_VBG nearly_RB all_PDT the_DT surface_NN growth_NN leaving_VBG only_RB one_CD inch_NN to_TO two_CD inches_NNS of_IN the_DT herbage_NN ._.
The_DT dust_NN was_VBD removed_VBN by_IN shaking_VBG the_DT plants_NNS and_CC the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD immediately_RB taken_VBN to_TO the_DT laboratory_NN ,_, chopped_VBD to_TO small_JJ pieces_NNS and_CC a_DT representative_JJ part_NN of_IN each_DT sample_NN was_VBD dried_VBN in_IN an_DT air_NN oven_RB for_IN moisture_NN content_NN ._.
The_DT dried_JJ material_NN was_VBD ground_NN and_CC kept_NN in_IN stoppered_JJ bottles_NNS for_IN analysis_NN ._.
Analysis_NN ._.
The_DT methods_NNS ,_, adopted_VBN for_IN the_DT determination_NN of_IN various_JJ chemical_JJ constituents_NNS ,_, were_VBD mostly_RB those_DT recommended_VBN by_IN the_DT Association_NNP of_IN Official_NNP Agri-_NNP cultural_JJ Chemists_NNS [_VBP 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
Potassium_NN and_CC sodium_NN were_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN a_DT method_NN given_VBN in_IN the_DT Agricultural_NNP Analysis_NNP by_IN Wright_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NN by_IN converting_VBG and_CC separating_VBG them_PRP as_IN mixed_JJ sulphates_NNS ._.
Potassium_NN is_VBZ further_JJ determined_VBN in_IN the_DT mixed_JJ sulphates_NNS by_IN Piper_NNP 's_POS method_NN and_CC sodium_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN difference_NN ._.
Amphilophis_NNP glabra_NN is_VBZ a_DT densely_RB tufted_VBN perennial_JJ grass_NN ,_, one_CD of_IN the_DT common_JJ fodder_NN grasses_NNS of_IN the_DT Deccan_NNP [_NNP Blatter_NNP and_CC McCann_NNP ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT data_NN refers_NNS to_TO a_DT strain_NN of_IN the_DT grass_NN from_IN Delhi_NNP ._.
It_PRP flowers_VBZ in_IN August_NNP to_TO September_NNP ._.

As_IN seen_VBN from_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ,_, the_DT grass_NN shows_VBZ a_DT decrease_NN of_IN various_JJ nutrients_NNS with_IN age_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP General_NNP ,_, The_DT general_JJ behaviour_NN of_IN the_DT variations_NNS of_IN different_JJ chemical_JJ con-_NN stituents_NNS with_IN age_NN of_IN the_DT grasses_NNS studied_VBD shows_VBZ a_DT marked_JJ similarity_NN ._.
The_DT important_JJ March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN n._CC nath_NN and_CC n._JJ b._NN dass_NN 47_CD SHOWING_NN THE_NNP PROTEIN_NNP ,_, CRUDE_NNP FIBRE_NNP ,_, PHOSPHORIC_NNP ACID_NNP AND_NNP LIME_NNP OF_NNP GRASSES_NNP AT_NNP FOUR_NNP STAGES_NNP OF_NNP THEIR_NNP GROWTH_NNP [_NNP NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_JJ STAGE_NNP OF_NNP GROWTH_NNP Y48_NNP INDIGENOUS_NNP GRASSES_NNP OP_NNP INDIA_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, constituents_NNS like_IN protein_NN ,_, soluble_JJ ash_NN ,_, phosphoric_JJ acid_NN and_CC to_TO some_DT extent_NN ether_CC extract_NN decreased_VBN with_IN the_DT maturity_NN of_IN the_DT plants_NNS ._.
The_DT maximum_JJ fall_NN took_VBD place_NN in_IN the_DT ripe_JJ stage_NN ._.
Crude_NNP fibre_NN ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, increased_VBD steadily_RB from_IN young_JJ to_TO ripe_VB stage_NN ._.
Both_DT these_DT facts_NNS point_VBP out_RP the_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ quality_NN of_IN the_DT grass_NN with_IN age_NN ._.
(_( Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD ._. )_)
Protein_NNP ._.
Both_DT crude_VBP protein_NN and_CC true_JJ protein_NN contents_NNS of_IN the_DT grasses_NNS studied_VBD decreased_VBN with_IN the_DT maturity_NN of_IN the_DT plants_NNS ._.
A_DT comparison_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD types_NNS of_IN protein_NN shows_NNS (_( Tables_NNP I_PRP ,_, II_NNP and_CC III_NNP )_) that_WDT changes_VBZ in_IN the_DT two_CD were_VBD closely_RB correlated_VBN with_IN each_DT other_JJ ._.
The_DT distinction_NN between_IN crude_NN protein_NN and_CC true_JJ protein_NN is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN all_PDT the_DT nitrogen_NN in_IN plants_NNS is_VBZ not_RB in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN protein_NN ,_, but_CC is_VBZ partly_RB present_JJ as_IN ,_, non-proteinous_JJ compounds_NNS which_WDT are_VBP water_NN soluble_JJ ._.
Any_DT protein_NN ,_, which_WDT dissolves_VBZ in_IN water_NN ,_, is_VBZ also_RB precipitated_VBN by_IN boiling_VBG and_CC addition_NN of_IN copper_NN hydrate_NN reagent_NN ._.
Hart_NNP and_CC Bentley_NNP [_NNP 1915_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT non-proteinous_JJ nitrogen_NN in_IN grasses_NNS and_CC hays_NNS is_VBZ largely_RB composed_VBN of_IN free_JJ amino_NN acids_NNS ._.
Further_RB the_DT recognition_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN feed_NN for_IN its_PRP$ protein_NN nutrition_NN is_VBZ determined_VBN by_IN its_PRP$ amino_NN acid_NN content_NN has_VBZ caused_VBN the_DT distinction_NN between_IN crude_NN and_CC true_JJ protein_NN to_TO lose_VB its_PRP$ significance_NN ._.
But_CC opinion_NN still_RB differs_VBZ as_IN to_TO the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN non-_JJ proteinous_JJ nitrogen_NN ._.
In_IN Britain_NNP 50_CD per_IN cent_NN value_NN is_VBZ generally_RB given_VBN to_TO non-pro-_JJ teinous_JJ nitrogen_NN when_WRB calculating_VBG rations_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN from_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP ,_, II_NNP and_CC III_NNP that_WDT difference_NN between_IN crude_NN protein_NN and_CC true_JJ protein_NN decreased_VBD with_IN the_DT approach_NN of_IN maturity_NN of_IN the_DT plants_NNS ,_, the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT ripe_NN stage_NN being_VBG very_RB small_JJ ._.
In_IN other_JJ words_NNS ,_, in_IN old_JJ matured_JJ plants_NNS the_DT quantity_NN of_IN non-protein_JJ nitrogenous_JJ compounds_NNS decreases_NNS ._.
Amphilophis_NNP odorata_NN gives_VBZ the_DT least_JJS protein_JJ content_NN in_IN every_DT stage_NN of_IN growth_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO other_JJ grasses_NNS ._.
One_CD noteworthy_JJ point_NN is_VBZ that_IN the_DT protein_NN content_NN of_IN Iseilema_NNP laxum_FW slightly_RB increases_VBZ in_IN the_DT flowering_NN stage_NN and_CC this_DT value_NN is_VBZ not_RB much_JJ different_JJ from_IN that_DT reported_VBN in_IN the_DT young_JJ stage_NN ._.
This_DT fact_NN may_MD be_VB of_IN some_DT practical_JJ interest_NN in_IN that_DT this_DT grass_NN may_MD be_VB kept_VBN for_IN late_JJ harvesting_NN ._.
In_IN case_NN of_IN Amphilophis_NNP glabra_NN ,_, the_DT protein_NN content_NN does_VBZ not_RB change_VB much_RB upto_IN the_DT pre-_JJ flowering_NN stage_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP decreases_VBZ appreciably_RB in_IN the_DT flowering_NN stage_NN ._.
Ether_DT extract_NN ._.
Ether_NNP extract_NN ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO fats_NNS ,_, also_RB includes_VBZ various_JJ phos-_JJ phatides_NNS ,_, sterols_NNS ,_, plant_NN pigments_NNS ,_, some_DT essential_JJ oils_NNS and_CC carotene_NN which_WDT are_VBP ._.
removed_VBN with_IN the_DT fats_NNS during_IN extraction_NN of_IN a_DT material_NN with_IN ether_NN ._.
Fats_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, constitute_VBP the_DT major_JJ portion_NN and_CC are_VBP sources_NNS of_IN energy_NN ._.
Ether_NNP extract_NN content_NN did_VBD not_RB show_VB regular_JJ variations_NNS in_IN all_PDT the_DT three_CD species_NNS ,_, though_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT fall_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN ether_NN extract_NN in_IN the_DT ripe_NN stage_NN for_IN all_PDT the_DT grasses_NNS ._.
Highest_NNP percentage_NN of_IN ether_JJR extract_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN in_IN different_JJ stage_NN of_IN growth_NN in_IN each_DT case_NN ._.
Amphilophis_NNP glabra_NN gave_VBD the_DT highest_JJS content_NN of_IN ether_JJ extract_NN in_IN the_DT young_JJ stage_NN ._.
The_DT corresponding_JJ values_NNS for_IN Amphilophis_NNP odorata_NN and_CC Iseilema_NNP laxum_VBP reached_VBN in_IN the_DT preflowering_NN and_CC flowering_JJ stages_NNS respectively_RB ._.
Crude_NNP fibre_NN and_CC nitrogen-free-extract_JJ ._.
High_JJ crude_NN fibre_NN content_NN is_VBZ generally_RB associated_VBN with_IN low_JJ digestibility_NN and_CC palatability_NN of_IN the_DT feeds_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN from_IN the_DT Tables_NNP I_PRP ,_, II_NNP and_CC III_NNP that_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN crude_NN fibre_NNS increased_VBD progressively_RB from_IN young_JJ to_TO ripe_VB ._.
The_DT highest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN crude_NN fibre_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN in_IN the_DT ripe_JJ stage_NN ._.
Nitrogen-free-extract_JJ ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, did_VBD not_RB show_VB regular_JJ variations_NNS ,_, though_IN tending_VBG to_TO decrease_VB with_IN maturity_NN ._.
Marbh_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN N._NNP nath_NN and_CC n._JJ b._NN dass_NN 49_CD Crude_NNP ash_NN ,_, silica_NN ,_, insoluble_JJ residue_NN and_CC soluble_JJ ash_NN ._.
Crude_NNP ash_NN as_IN such_JJ does_VBZ not_RB give_VB any_DT idea_NN about_IN the_DT mineral_JJ content_NN as_IN it_PRP includes_VBZ both_CC the_DT essential_JJ ele-_JJ ments_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN inert_JJ silicous_JJ matter_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP forms_VBZ a_DT basis_NN for_IN determination_NN of_IN vari-_JJ ous_JJ minerals_NNS ._.
Silica_NNP and_CC ,_, insoluble_JJ residue_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT changes_NNS in_IN crude_NN ash_NN ._.
The_DT more_RBR valuable_JJ part_NN ,_, namely_RB soluble_JJ ash_NN is_VBZ actually_RB found_VBN to_TO decrease_VB with_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT plants_NNS ,_, being_VBG least_JJS in_IN the_DT ripe_JJ stage_NN ._.
Lime_NNP and_CC phosphoric_JJ acid_NN ._.
The_DT variations_NNS in_IN lime_JJ content_NN with_IN plant_NN develop-_JJ ment_NN were_VBD different_JJ in_IN different_JJ species_NNS ._.

In_IN case_NN of_IN Iseilema_NNP laxum_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT steady_JJ decrease_NN upto_IN the_DT flowering_JJ stage_NN but_CC no_DT further_JJ fall_NN in_IN the_DT ripe_JJ stage_NN of_IN growth_NN ._.
Lime_NNP content_NN of_IN Amphilophis_NNP odorata_NN decreased_VBD slightly_RB in_IN the_DT preflowering_NN stage_NN ,_, otherwise_VB it_PRP tended_VBD to_TO remain_VB more_JJR or_CC less_RBR constant_JJ throughout_IN the_DT plant_NN development_NN ._.
Phosphoric_NNP acid_NN displayed_VBD variations_NNS similar_JJ to_TO that_DT in_IN protein_NN content_NN and_CC decreased_VBN with_IN the_DT advance_NN in_IN maturity_NN of_IN the_DT plants_NNS ._.
In_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT actual_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN lime_NN and_CC phosphoric_JJ acid_NN in_IN plants_NNS ,_, their_PRP$ ratio_NN is_VBZ equally_RB important_JJ for_IN their_PRP$ proper_JJ assimilation_NN by_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN by_IN various_JJ workers_NNS that_IN this_DT ratio_NN should_MD be_VB between_IN 1_CD to_TO 1.5_CD parts_NNS of_IN lime_NN for_IN each_DT part_NN of_IN phosphoric_JJ acid_NN ._.
Table_JJ IV_NNP shows_VBZ that_IN if_IN the_DT plants_NNS are_VBP allowed_VBN to_TO grow_VB to_TO maturity_NN ,_, the_DT ratio_NN deviates_VBZ more_RBR from_IN the_DT standard_NN and_CC under_IN these_DT conditions_NNS these_DT grasses_NNS become_VBP ill-balanced_JJ with_IN respect_NN to_TO lime_VB and_CC phosphoric_JJ acid_NN ,_, being_VBG relatively_RB low_JJ in_IN the_DT latter_NN ._.
Table_JJ IV_NNP Lime/phosphoric_NNP acid_NN ratio_NN at_IN four_CD stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN Stages_NNP of_IN growth_NN Young_NNP Pre-flowering_NNP Flowering_NNP Ripe_NNP Amphilophis_NNP glabra_VBD 1.73_CD 2.02_CD 3.13_CD 3.45_CD Iseilema_NNP laxum_VBD 2.06_CD 2.06_CD 1.42_CD 3.48_CD Amphilophis_NNP odorata_VBD 1.58_CD 2.12_CD 1.95_CD 2.31_CD It_PRP is_VBZ further_JJ seen_VBN that_IN in_IN case_NN of_IN Iseilema_NNP laxum_VBP the_DT most_RBS suitable_JJ lime/phos-_JJ phoric_JJ acid_NN ratio_NN is_VBZ in_IN the_DT flowering_NN stage_NN when_WRB the_DT protein_NN content_NN too_RB has_VBZ not_RB decreased_VBN appreciably_RB as_IN compared_VBN to_TO that_DT in_IN the_DT young_JJ stage_NN ._.
This_DT fact_NN is_VBZ of_IN practical_JJ significance_NN as_IN it_PRP points_VBZ out_RP that_IN Iseilema_NNP laxum_VBD can_MD be_VB kept_VBN for_IN late_JJ harvest-_JJ ing_NN without_IN much_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT nutrient_NN status_NN ,_, to_TO suit_VB the_DT convenience_NN of_IN the_DT farmers_NNS who_WP are_VBP busy_JJ sowing_VBG and_CC in_IN other_JJ operations_NNS during_IN early_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ._.
Amphilophis_NNP odorata_NN and_CC Amphilophis_NNP glabra_NN on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN contain_NN lime_NN and_CC phosphoric_JJ acid_NN approaching_VBG the_DT standard_NN in_IN the_DT young_JJ stage_NN ._.
Potash_NNP and_CC soda_NN ._.

Chlorine_NNP ._.

There_EX was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, a_DT slight_JJ rise_NN in_IN the_DT ripe_JJ stage_NN in_IN case_NN of_IN Amphilophis_NNP odorata_NN ._.

Soda_NNP ,_, potash_NN and_CC chlorine_JJ contents_NNS of_IN the_DT grasses_NNS studied_VBN were_VBD high_JJ in_IN early_JJ stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN and_CC fell_VBD to_TO minimum_VB in_IN ripe_JJ stage_NN ._.

K._NNP ,_, A._NNP Alim_NNP ,_, Ph.D._NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Production_NNP ,_, Faculty_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, Farouk_NNP I_PRP University_NNP ,_, Alexandria_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN Publication_NNP on_IN 7_CD July_NNP 1952_CD )_) RENDEL_NNP and_CC Robertson_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NNP discussed_VBD the_DT possibilities_NNS of_IN estimating_VBG the_DT genetic_JJ improvement_NN which_WDT had_VBD in_IN fact_NN taken_VBN place_NN in_IN a_DT herd_NN of_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS without_IN ,_, confusing_VBG improvement_NN in_IN management_NN with_IN genetic_JJ gain_NN ._.
They_PRP concluded_VBD that_IN the_DT best_JJS way_NN was_VBD to_TO make_VB a_DT direct_JJ estimate_NN from_IN the_DT selection_NN practiced_VBD and_CC the_DT heritability_NN of_IN the_DT character_NN ._.
The_DT application_NN of_IN Rendel_NNP 's_POS and_CC Robertson_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1950_CD ]_NNP method_NN and_CC the_DT ,_, estima-_JJ tion_NN of_IN genetic_JJ gain_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN due_JJ to_TO selection_NN in_IN some_DT Ayrshire_NNP herds_NNS in_IN Scotland_NNP ,_, was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, carried_VBD out_RP by_IN Mahadevan_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NNP ._.
Afterwards_NNS ,_, Rendel_NNP ,_, Robertson_NNP and_CC Alim_NNP [_NNP 1951_CD ]_NNP adopted_VBD the_DT same_JJ method_NN and_CC calculated_VBD the_DT amount_NN of_IN genetic_JJ gain_NN for_IN milk_NN yield_NN in_IN England_NNP ._.
The_DT genetic_JJ gain_NN due_JJ to_TO selection_NN for_IN butterfat_NN per_IN cent_NN will_MD be_VB discussed_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN ._.
Collection_NN of_IN the_DT data_NNS ._.
Eleven_NNP herds_NNS of_IN pedigree_JJ dairy_NN cattle_NNS ,_, situated_VBN in_IN England_NNP ,_, were_VBD used_VBN in_IN this_DT study_NN ._.
These_DT herds_NNS belonged_VBD to_TO six_CD breeds_NNS :_: Ayrshire_NNP ,_, Guernsey_NNP ._.
Jersey_NNP ,_, Red_NNP Poll_NNP ,_, Shorthorn_NNP ,_, and_CC Kerry_NNP ._.
The_DT production_NN records_NNS in_IN these_DT ,_, herds_NNS ,_, except_IN ,_, the_DT Kerry_NNP ,_, were_VBD maintained_VBN on_IN the_DT English_NNP ._.
Milk_NN Marketing_NNP ,_, Boards_NNP System_NNP ._.
In_IN this_DT study_NN all_PDT the_DT lactations_NNS that_WDT were_VBD diseased_VBN ,_, or_CC lactations_NNS less_JJR than_IN 200_CD days_NNS ,_, were_VBD excluded_VBN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN culling_NN ._.

The_DT ,_, values_NNS for_IN the_DT later_JJ lactations_NNS were_VBD based_VBN on_IN small_JJ numbers_NNS to_TO be_VB given_VBN much_JJ weight_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN progeny_NN testing_VBG in_IN dairy_NN cattle_NNS ,_, the_DT method_NN of_IN Rendel_NNP and_CC Robertson_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NNP ,_, was_VBD used_VBN to_TO estimate_VB the_DT genetic_JJ rate_NN of_IN improvement_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT method_NN ,_, the_DT process_NN of_IN selection_NN is_VBZ divided_VBN into_IN two_CD parts_NNS :_: (_( a_DT )_) the_DT selection_NN of_IN cows_NNS whose_WP$ daughters_NNS will_MD be_VB incorporated_VBN into_IN the_DT herd_NN ,_, and_CC (_( b_NN )_) the_DT selection_NN of_IN cows_NNS whose_WP$ sons_NNS will_MD be_VB used_VBN in_IN the_DT herd_NN or_CC sold_VBN to_TO another_DT herd_NN ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT inten-_JJ sity_NN of_IN selection_NN in_IN sires_NNS on_IN future_JJ cows_NNS ,_, is_VBZ considerably_RB more_RBR than_IN when_WRB the_DT selec-_JJ tion_NN is_VBZ made_VBN for_IN heifers_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN ,_, while_IN the_DT male_NN progeny_NN could_MD be_VB bred_VBN from_IN the_DT top_JJ five_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT herd_NN [_NNP Lush_NNP ,_, 1945_CD ]_NN ,_, the_DT female_JJ offsprings_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB derived_VBN from_IN less_JJR than_IN 75_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ breeding_NN stock_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO provide_VB sufficient_JJ replacement_NN ._.
The_DT phenotypic_NN selection_NN differential_NN of_IN the_DT dams_NNS of_IN cows_NNS was_VBD computed_VBN by_IN finding_VBG the_DT mean_NN of_IN all_DT first_JJ lactations_NNS in_IN the_DT population_NN and_CC subtracting_VBG it_PRP from_IN the_DT production_NN record_NN of_IN the_DT dams_NNS ._.

The_DT legal_JJ definition_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, does_VBZ not_RB permit_VB the_DT ad-_JJ mixture_NN of_IN fat_JJ available_JJ from_IN any_DT other_JJ source_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB noted_VBN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ in_IN the_DT mixed_JJ form_NN that_IN ghee_NN is_VBZ usually_RB brought_VBN to_TO the_DT market_NN and_CC that_DT practically_RB the_DT whole_NN of_IN the_DT inter-provincial_JJ trade_NN is_VBZ in_IN mixed_JJ ghee_NN ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, U._NNP P._NNP ghee_NN is_VBZ valued_VBN as_IN the_DT best_JJS ghee_NN available_JJ in_IN the_DT market_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO low_JJ acid_NNS ,_, low_JJ B._NNP R._NNP and_CC high_JJ R._NNP M._NNP values_NNS ,_, and_CC fetches_VBZ the_DT maximum_JJ price_NN ._.
The_DT quality_NN has_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, deteriorated_VBN after_IN the_DT war_NN but_CC even_RB now_RB 66.6_CD per_IN cent_NN are_VBP of_IN 'special_JJ grade_NN ,_, and_CC 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN 'general_JJ grade_NN '_POS ._.
Of_IN late_JJ ,_, the_DT Calcutta_NNP market_NN is_VBZ being_VBG supplied_VBN largely_RB by_IN Guntur_NNP ghee_NN which_WDT ,_, however_RB ,_, is_VBZ inferior_JJ to_TO Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ghee_NN in_IN quality_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO high_JJ acid_NN ,_, high_JJ B._NNP R._NNP and_CC low_JJ R._NNP M._NNP values_NNS ,_, and_CC is_VBZ available_JJ at_IN a_DT lower_JJR price_NN ._.
The_DT quality_NN has_VBZ now_RB much_JJ improved_VBN and_CC 66.6_CD per_IN cent_NN are_VBP now_RB found_VBN to_TO conform_VB to_TO the_DT AGMARK_NNP 'general_NNP grade_NN '_POS ._.
'Special_JJ grade_NN '_POS ghee_NN is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, very_RB rare_JJ in_IN this_DT area_NN ._.
The_DT quality_NN of_IN ghee_NN of_IN unknown_JJ source_NN ,_, has_VBZ deteriorated_VBN much_RB ._.
Instead_RB of_IN 80_CD per_IN cent_NN 'special_JJ grade_NN '_POS ghee_NN previously_RB obtained_VBD the_DT amount_NN now_RB available_JJ is_VBZ only_RB 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
As_RB much_JJ as_IN 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS did_VBD not_RB conform_VB to_TO the_DT AGMARK_NNP of_IN Government_NNP specifications_NNS and_CC were_VBD rejected_VBN on_IN grounds_NNS of_IN quality_NN and_CC purity_NN ._.
The_DT high_JJ acid_NN values_NNS of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN samples_NNS might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO long_JJ storage_NN in_IN the_DT humid_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN Bengal_NNP but_CC the_DT provincial_JJ authorities_NNS do_VBP not_RB take_VB into_IN consideration_NN this_DT value_NN for_IN rejecting_VBG a_DT sample_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
Quality_NN of_IN ghee_NN collected_VBN from_IN the_DT retail_JJ markets_NNS In_IN order_NN to_TO ascertain_VB the_DT position_NN of_IN buffalo_NN ghee_NN in_IN the_DT retail_JJ markets_NNS of_IN Calcutta_NNP the_DT present_JJ authors_NNS actually_RB purchased_VBD small_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN ghee_NN during_IN the_DT months_NNS July-August_NNP ,_, 1950_CD ,_, from_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN retail_JJ shops_NNS selected_VBN at_IN random_NN from_IN the_DT principal_NN markets_NNS within_IN the_DT jurisdiction_NN of_IN the_DT corporation_NN of_IN Calcutta_NNP and_CC published_VBD a_DT preliminary_JJ report_NN in_IN the_DT Science_NNP and_CC Culture_NNP [_NNP Guha_NNP ,_, 1950_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT samples_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN from_IN tins_NNS which_WDT are_VBP usually_RB kept_VBN exposed_VBN till_NN completely_RB sold_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT retail_JJ market_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS detailed_VBD in_IN Table_NNP VI_NNP and_CC summarised_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VII_NNP show_VBP that_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN ghee_NN available_JJ in_IN the_DT retail_JJ market_NN is_VBZ far_RB worse_JJR than_IN that_DT ,_, in_IN the_DT wholesale_JJ market_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN 25_CD samples_NNS analysed_VBD only_RB five_CD were_VBD found_VBN to_TO conform_VB to_TO the_DT AGMARK_NNP speci-_JJ fications_NNS and_CC the_DT rest_NN were_VBD either_RB simply_RB hydrogenated_JJ oil_NN ,_, or_CC ghee_NN adulterated_VBN with_IN hydrogenated_JJ oil_NN ,_, or_CC highly_RB rancid_JJ ghee_NN unfit_NN for_IN consumption_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ noticed_VBN that_IN in_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN cases_NNS simply_RB coloured_VBD hydrogenated_VBN oil_NN is_VBZ being_VBG sold_VBN as_IN buffalo_JJ ghee_NN under_IN the_DT very_RB nose_JJ of_IN the_DT Public_NNP Health_NNP Authorities_NNP ._.
In_IN one_CD particular_JJ case_NN the_DT authors_NNS noticed_VBD that_IN a_DT stuff_NN selling_NN at_IN a_DT price_NN as_RB high_JJ as_IN rupees_NNS nine_CD per_IN seer_NN contained_VBN only_RB hydrogenated_JJ oil_NN and_CC nothing_NN else_RB ._.
All_PDT these_DT products_NNS were_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, found_VBD to_TO be_VB adulterated_VBN by_IN the_DT simple_JJ Villevecchia_NNP test_NN not_RB to_TO speak_VB of_IN the_DT other_JJ complicated_VBD methods_NNS prescribed_VBN for_IN the_DT detection_NN of_IN adulteration_NN ._.
The_DT question_NN is_VBZ why_WRB such_JJ a_DT thing_NN happens_VBZ when_WRB there_EX are_VBP people_NNS to_TO detect_VB such_JJ crimes_NNS and_CC when_WRB persons_NNS found_VBD guilty_JJ of_IN such_JJ crimes_NNS are_VBP punishable_JJ by_IN law_NN ._.
It_PRP might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ easier_JJR to_TO keep_VB vigilant_JJ eyes_NNS on_IN the_DT few_JJ wholesale_NN dealers_NNS than_IN on_IN the_DT very_RB large_JJ number_NN of_IN retail_JJ dealers_NNS ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, persons_NNS found_VBD guilty_JJ of_IN such_JJ crimes_NNS are_VBP in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS simply_RB fined_VBD ,_, which_WDT the_DT unscrupulous_JJ merchant_NN may_MD afford_VB to_TO pay_VB ._.
The_DT punishment_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT opinion_NN of_IN the_DT authors_NNS ,_, is_VBZ not_RB deterrent_JJ enough_RB to_TO prevent_VB repeatition_NN of_IN such_JJ crimes_NNS ._.
The_DT chemical_NN methods_NNS for_IN the_DT detection_NN of_IN adulteration_NN and_CC the_DT different_JJ provi-_JJ sions_NNS of_IN the_DT law_NN are_VBP all_DT essential_JJ to_TO prevent_VB the_DT practice_NN of_IN adulteration_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ true_JJ ,_, but_CC something_NN more_JJR should_MD be_VB done_VBN for_IN the_DT common_JJ man_NN who_WP can_MD not_RB be_VB expected_VBN to_TO analyse_VB each_DT and_CC every_DT sample_NN of_IN ghee_NN before_IN purchasing_VBG it_PRP from_IN the_DT retail_JJ market_NN ._.
March_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN M._NNP P._NNP GUHA_NNP AND_NNP MANISHI_NNP PROSAD_NNP GUHA_NNP 71_CD It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, suggested_VBD that_IN all_DT hydrogenated_VBD oils_NNS should_MD be_VB compulsorily_RB made_VBN to_TO contain_VB a_DT colouring_NN matter_NN so_RB that_IN when_WRB the_DT coloured_VBN vegetable_JJ product_NN is_VBZ mixed_JJ with_IN ghee_NN will_MD be_VB detected_VBN even_RB by_IN a_DT layman_NN by_IN visual_JJ observation_NN only_RB ._.
This_DT measure_NN will_MD no_DT doubt_NN greatly_RB minimise_VBZ the_DT scope_NN of_IN adulteration_NN of_IN ghee_NN with_IN hydrogenated_VBN oil_NN by_IN the_DT petty_JJ retail_JJ dealers_NNS ._.
In_IN Bengal_NNP ,_, no_DT particular_JJ attention_NN is_VBZ paid_VBN either_RB to_TO moisture_VB content_NN or_CC acid_JJ value_NN of_IN a_DT sample_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
Consequently_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN that_IN in_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS the_DT acid_NN value_NN ,_, an_DT important_JJ factor_NN for_IN judging_VBG the_DT age_NN and_CC quality_NN of_IN ghee_NN ,_, is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB very_RB high_JJ ._.
Bad_NNP odour_NN ,_, generally_RB inherent_JJ with_IN acidity_NN and_CC rancidity_NN was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, not_RB very_RB remarkable_JJ in_IN any_DT of_IN these_DT samples_NNS ._.
The_DT odour_NN was_VBD in_IN all_DT pro-_JJ bability_NN carefully_RB masked_VBN by_IN blending_VBG with_IN fresh_JJ ghee_NN or_CC by_IN adding_VBG a_DT small_JJ quantity_NN of_IN the_DT essence_NN of_IN ghee_NN ,_, available_JJ in_IN the_DT market_NN ._.
Samples_NNS having_VBG acid_RB values_NNS as_RB high_JJ as_IN 11.6_CD and_CC 5.56_CD are_VBP thus_RB easily_RB sold_VBN to_TO the_DT common_JJ man_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN Bengal_NNP there_EX is_VBZ at_IN present_JJ no_DT provision_NN in_IN the_DT law_NN to_TO check_VB this_DT undesirable_JJ practice_NN ._.
Considering_VBG these_DT facts_NNS the_DT authors_NNS recommend_VBP the_DT following_JJ measures_NNS to_TO be_VB adopted_VBN for_IN minimising_VBG the_DT scope_NN of_IN adulteration_NN of_IN ghee_NN :72_NNP STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP Ghee_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ,_, The_DT measures_NNS so_RB adopted_VBD should_MD be_VB given_VBN wider_JJR publicity_NN so_IN that_IN the_DT public_NN may_MD appreciate_VB them_PRP and_CC may_MD guard_VB themselves_PRP against_IN being_VBG deceived_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Results_NNP of_IN analysis_NN of_IN a_DT number_NN samples_NNS of_IN ghee_NN collected_VBN at_IN random_NN from_IN the_DT wholesale_JJ markets_NNS of_IN Calcutta_NNP before_IN and_CC after_IN the_DT war_NN ,_, have_VBP been_VBN discussed_VBN ._.
The_DT samples_NNS so_RB examined_VBN have_VBP been_VBN classified_VBN as_IN (_( a_DT )_) Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ghee_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) Guntur_NNP ghee_NN and_CC (_( c_NN )_) ghee_NN from_IN unknown_JJ source_NN ._.
So_RB far_RB as_IN quality_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ghee_NN is_VBZ valued_VBN as_IN the_DT best_JJS available_JJ in_IN market_NN ,_, and_CC fetches_VBZ the_DT maximum_JJ price_NN ._.
The_DT quality_NN has_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, deteriorated_VBN after_IN the_DT war_NN ._.
Results_NNS of_IN analysis_NN of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN samples_NNS collected_VBN at_IN random_NN from_IN the_DT retail_JJ shops_NNS of_IN Calcutta_NNP have_VBP also_RB been_VBN discussed_VBN ._.
Out_IN of_IN 25_CD samples_NNS so_RB examined_VBD only_RB five_CD have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN to_TO conform_VB to_TO AGMARK_NNP specifications_NNS and_CC the_DT rest_NN were_VBD rejected_VBN due_JJ to_TO adulteration_NN ,_, rancidity_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
The_DT quality_NN of_IN such_JJ ghee_NN is_VBZ far_RB worse_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN ghee_NN in_IN the_DT wholesale_JJ market_NN ._.
The_DT authors_NNS have_VBP recommended_VBN a_DT few_JJ important_JJ measures_NNS to_TO be_VB adopted_VBN for_IN minimising_VBG the_DT scope_NN of_IN adulteration_NN ._.

64_CD *_NN It_PRP is_VBZ reported_VBN that_IN the_DT committee_NN appointed_VBN by_IN the_DT Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP has_VBZ already_RB recommended_VBN that_IN vanaspati_NN should_MD be_VB made_VBN to_TO contain_VB sesame_JJ oil_NN and_CC also_RB carotene_JJ oil_NN concen-_JJ trate_NN so_IN that_IN the_DT product_NN may_MD have_VB an_DT orange_NN colour_NN ._.
ABSTRACTS_IN The_DT diseases_NNS of_IN small_JJ animals_NNS communicable_JJ to_TO man_NN ._.
CUMMINGS_NNP SUMNER_NNP ,_, K._NNP (_( 1952_CD )_) ._.
B._NNP Vet_NNP ._.
J_NNP ._.
108_CD ,_, 7_CD ,_, 246-256_CD THE_NNP W.H.O_NNP 's_POS report_NN [_NN 1951_CD ]_NN on_IN Zoonoses_NNS lists_NNS 80_CD diseases_NNS naturally_RB transmitted_VBN from_IN vertebrate_NN animals_NNS to_TO man_NN ;_: of_IN these_DT (_( excluding_VBG helminth_NN diseases_NNS )_) about_IN 13_CD are_VBP capable_JJ of_IN transmission_NN by_IN dogs_NNS and_CC about_IN five_CD by_IN cats_NNS ._.
The_DT author_NN has_VBZ detailed_VBN and_CC discussed_VBN the_DT role_NN of_IN small_JJ domestic_JJ animals_NNS in_IN the_DT transmission_NN of_IN diseases_NNS to_TO man_NN and_CC brought_VBD forth_JJ facts_NNS of_IN interest_NN and_CC import_NN from_IN a_DT public_JJ health_NN point_NN in_IN Britain_NNP ._.
Leptospira_NNP canicola_NN infects_NNS dog_NN and_CC man_NN and_CC with_IN 40_CD to_TO 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN urban_JJ dogs_NNS having_VBG been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB carrying_VBG infection_NN and_CC the_DT transmission_NN being_VBG possible_JJ through_IN unbroken_JJ skin_NN ,_, a_DT real_JJ danger_NN has_VBZ been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP ._.
Tuberculosis_NN ,_, mostly_RB occurring_VBG in_IN lungform_NN in_IN the_DT dog_NN ,_, presents_VBZ its_PRP$ risks_NNS ._.
Texoplasmosis_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ recently_RB been_VBN suggested_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR prevalent_JJ in_IN man_NN than_IN hitherto_NN suspected_VBN ,_, is_VBZ another_DT malady_NN to_TO be_VB looked_VBN into_IN ,_, specially_RB when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO diagnose_VB it_PRP clinically_RB and_CC the_DT methods_NNS of_IN transmission_NN as_IN also_RB the_DT portals_NNS of_IN entry_NN into_IN the_DT body_NN are_VBP still_RB not_RB definite_VB ._.
Rabies_NNS ,_, Hydatid_NNP disease_NN ,_, Leptospiral_NNP jaundice_NN ,_, Salmonella_NNP food_NN poisoning_NN and_CC Ringworm_NNP have_VBP also_RB been_VBN described_VBN and_CC the_DT risk_NN of_IN infection_NN to_TO man_NN notified_VBN ._.

by_IN 11_CD ,_, then_RB gradually_RB to_TO the_DT average_JJ maximum_NN of_IN 94.5°_CD at_IN 17_CD hours_NNS ,_, and_CC then_RB cooled_VBD back_RB to_TO 83°_CD at_IN six_CD ._.

ASSESSMENT_NNP OF_NNP WOOL_NNP QUALITY*_NNP By_IN B._NNP M._NNP Patel_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP and_CC M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Chemical_NNP Technology_NNP ,_, University_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC B._NNP K._NNP VAIDYA_NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Director_NNP ,_, The_DT Ahmedabad_NNP Textile_NNP Research_NNP Association_NNP ,_, Ahmedabad_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 12_CD September_NNP 1952_CD )_) (_( With_IN three_CD text-figures_NNS )_) THE_VBP quality_NN of_IN wool_NN is_VBZ closely_RB related_VBN to_TO the_DT principal_JJ physical_JJ attributes_NNS of_IN its_PRP$ fibres_NNS ._.
The_DT main_JJ characteristics_NNS that_WDT have_VBP a_DT decisive_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN re_VBP the_DT length_NN ,_, shape_NN ,_, fineness_NN ,_, coefficient_NN of_IN variation_NN crimps_NNS ,_, strength_NN ,_, resilience_VB colour_NN and_CC lusture_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS ._.
Vaidya_NNP and_CC Bhatt_NNP in_IN their_PRP$ paper_NN on_IN Indian_JJ Wool_NNP have_VBP stressed_VBN the_DT importance_NN and_CC relation_NN of_IN these_DT physical_JJ attributes_NNS to_TO the_DT assessment_NN of_IN wool_NN which_WDT is_VBZ generally_RB done_VBN by_IN its_PRP$ spinning_NN quality_NN ._.
But_CC it_PRP is_VBZ clearly_RB stated_VBN therein_NN that_IN there_EX are_VBP two_CD factors_NNS of_IN primary_JJ importance_NN in_IN assessing_VBG Indian_JJ wools_NNS ,_, namely_RB the_DT coefficient_NN of_IN variation_NN as_IN a_DT measure_NN of_IN heterogeneity_NN and_CC medullation_NN or_CC hairy_JJ portion_NN in_IN wool_NN ._.
As_RB far_RB as_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, a_DT systematic_JJ quantitative_NN study_NN of_IN these_DT attributes_NNS has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN made_VBN before_IN ._.
No_DT definite_NN standards_NNS ,_, therefore_RB ,_, exist_VBP to_TO judge_VB the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ types_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ known_VBN in_IN the_DT world_NN market_NN as_IN being_VBG of_IN a_DT very_RB coarse_JJ variety_NN producing_VBG yarns_NNS of_IN 36_CD 's_POS and_CC lower_JJR counts_NNS (_( corresponding_VBG to_TO fibre_VB diameters_NNS above_IN 40_CD microns_NNS )_) as_IN compared_VBN with_IN the_DT Australian_JJ Merino_NNP wools_NNS which_WDT easily_RB yield_VBP yarns_NNS of_IN 80_CD 's_POS ,_, 70_CD 's_POS and_CC 64_CD 's_POS (_( corresponding_VBG to_TO fibre_VB diameters_NNS 19-22_JJ microns_NNS )_) ._.
The_DT Indian_JJ wool_NN is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, mostly_RB used_VBN for_IN heavy_JJ woollen_JJ goods_NNS and_CC carpet_NN industry_NN ._.
A_DT factor_NN of_IN considerable_JJ importance_NN which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN responsible_JJ for_IN lowering_VBG the_DT economic_JJ value_NN of_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN ,_, is_VBZ its_PRP$ highly_RB heterogeneous_JJ nature_NN as_IN regards_NNS fineness_JJ distribution_NN of_IN fibres_NNS ,_, for_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB unusual_JJ to_TO find_VB in_IN a_DT single_JJ wool_NN sample_NN ready_JJ for_IN market_NN high_JJ proportions_NNS of_IN fibres_NNS ,_, varying_VBG in_IN thickness_NN from_IN 20_CD microns_NNS to_TO 100_CD microns_NNS ._.
(_( In_IN a_DT semi-quantitative_JJ estimate_NN of_IN the_DT tolerance_NN of_IN C._NNP V._NNP for_IN clothing_VBG material_JJ Barker_NNP sets_VBZ a_DT limit_NN of_IN 25_CD per_IN cent_NN C_NNP ._.
B_NNP ._. )_)
This_DT is_VBZ the_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT almost_RB total_JJ absence_NN of_IN the_DT proper_JJ grading_NN of_IN fleece_NN ,_, which_WDT ,_, if_IN carried_VBN out_RP at_IN all_DT ,_, is_VBZ done_VBN in_IN a_DT very_RB primitive_JJ fashion_NN ._.
Further_RB ,_, if_IN the_DT grading_NN is_VBZ carried_VBN out_IN according_VBG to_TO the_DT fineness_NN of_IN wool_NN on_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN sheep-skin_JJ ,_, as_IN is_VBZ the_DT practice_NN in_IN other_JJ wool_NN growing_VBG countries_NNS ,_, the_DT task_NN of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ graders_NNS would_MD be_VB difficult_JJ on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN Indian_JJ sheep_NN grow_NN wool_NN in_IN which_WDT wide_JJ variations_NNS occur_VBP in_IN the_DT diameter_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS even_RB on_IN a_DT small_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN the_DT sheep_NN ._.
With_IN coarseness_PDT the_DT heterogeneity_NN or_CC disuniformity_NN in_IN fibre_NN fineness_NN also_RB increases_VBZ ,_, parti-_JJ cularly_NN in_IN the_DT non-domesticated_JJ types_NNS of_IN sheep_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
Another_DT serious_JJ defect_NN with_IN the_DT coarse_JJ wool_NN is_VBZ the_DT generally_RB increasing_VBG amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN with_IN increase_NN in_IN diameter_NN :_: The_DT coarser_NN fibres_VBZ having_VBG diameter_RB above_IN 40_CD microns_NNS are_VBP generally_RB *_JJ Part_NNP I_PRP of_IN the_DT Series_NNP by_IN Vaidya_NNP and_CC Bhatt_NNP ,_, Current_NNP Science_NNP ,_, July_NNP 1947_CD ._.

ASSESSMENT_NNP OF_NNP QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, medullated_VBD ,_, i.e_NN ._.
more_RBR like_IN hair_NN than_IN wool_NN ._.
Ordinarily_RB ,_, a_DT medullated_JJ fibre_NN may_MD be_VB distinguished_VBN from_IN a_DT wool_NN fibre_NN by_IN its_PRP$ dead_JJ white_JJ appearance_NN and_CC non-resilient_JJ nature_NN ._.
A_DT non-medullated_JJ fibre_NN on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN is_VBZ semi-transparent_JJ or_CC translucent_JJ and_CC possesses_VBZ a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN of_IN elasticity_NN ._.
When_WRB viewed_VBN under_IN microscope_NN non-_RB medullated_VBN (_( wool_NN )_) fibres_NNS will_MD appear_VB to_TO have_VB the_DT outer_NN covering_VBG of_IN scales_NNS while_IN medullated_VBN (_( hair_NN )_) fibres_NNS will_MD present_VB an_DT appearance_NN of_IN a_DT hollow_JJ portion_NN with_IN dark_JJ channels_NNS running_VBG along_RB the_DT length_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS ,_, either_RB continuously_RB ,_, broken_VBD or_CC interrupted_VBN and_CC this_DT is_VBZ known_VBN as_IN medulla_NN ._.
These_DT two_CD defects_NNS of_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ wools_NNS ,_, namely_RB their_PRP$ complete_JJ heterogeneous_JJ nature_NN as_IN regards_NNS fineness_NN and_CC their_PRP$ high_JJ contamination_NN with_IN hair_NN ,_, greatly_RB enhance_VB the_DT difficulties_NNS of_IN the_DT task_NN of_IN wool_NN grading_NN ._.
The_DT comparison_NN of_IN the_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN with_IN foreign_JJ wools_NNS show_VBP that_IN these_DT are_VBP particularly_RB drawbacks_NNS in_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN ._.
METHODS_NNP OF_NNP ASSESSING_NNP THE_NNP FIBRE_NNP CHARACTERISTICS_NNP The_DT samples_NNS were_VBD scoured_VBN in_IN 04_CD per_IN cent_NN neutral_JJ soap_NN and_CC then_RB alcohol_NN extracted_VBD thrice_NN ,_, before_IN actual_JJ examination_NN of_IN their_PRP$ fibre_NN characteristics_NNS ._.
Measurement_NN of_IN length_NN The_DT crimpy_NN and_CC elastic_JJ nature_NN of_IN wool_NN makes_VBZ the_DT length_JJ measurement_NN uncertain_JJ unless_IN carried_VBN out_RP under_IN specified_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
The_DT methods_NNS of_IN measurement_NN of_IN length_NN may_MD be_VB divided_VBN into_IN two_CD main_JJ groups_NNS ,_, direct_JJ and_CC indirect_JJ ._.
The_DT simplest_JJS direct_JJ method_NN as_IN given_VBN by_IN Burns_NNP consists_VBZ in_IN lightly_RB stretching_VBG a_DT fibre_NN on_IN a_DT steel_NN scale_NN over_IN black_JJ velvet_NN box_NN between_IN a_DT thumb_NN and_CC a_DT forceps_NN ._.
This_DT method_NN was_VBD followed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ work_NN and_CC is_VBZ described_VBN by_IN Vaidya_NNP and_CC Bhatt_NNP ._.
The_DT other_JJ direct_JJ method_NN of_IN Kronacher_NNP is_VBZ by_IN threading_VBG fibres_NNS through_IN a_DT needle_JJ eye_NN and_CC using_VBG a_DT glass_NN scale_NN ,_, is_VBZ a_DT simple_JJ modification_NN of_IN this_DT ._.
Amongst_IN the_DT indirect_JJ methods_NNS the_DT gravimetric_JJ method_NN is_VBZ quite_RB important_JJ ._.
It_PRP consists_VBZ in_IN weighing_VBG a_DT fixed_JJ number_NN of_IN fibres_NNS and_CC also_RB certain_JJ length_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_NN on_IN a_DT micro-balance_NN ._.
B_NNP ._.
A._NNP S._NNP T._NNP M._NNP method_NN consists_VBZ in_IN using_VBG Suter_NNP stapler_NN in_IN combination_NN with_IN good_JJ balance_NN ._.
But_CC these_DT methods_NNS have_VBP two_CD principles_NNS drawbacks_NNS ._.
Firstly_RB the_DT amount_NN of_IN moisture_NN in_IN wool_NN varies_NNS with_IN temperature_NN and_CC humidity_NN which_WDT have_VBP hence_NN to_TO be_VB strictly_RB maintained_VBN constant_JJ and_CC secondly_RB these_DT give_JJ no_DT idea_NN of_IN the_DT statistical_JJ constants_NNS of_IN this_DT attribute_NN ._.
Measurement_NN of_IN diameter_NN Fibre_NNP fineness_NN is_VBZ the_DT principal_JJ characteristic_JJ which_WDT determines_VBZ the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT laboratory_NN of_IN the_DT Wool_NNP Research_NNP Association_NNP three_CD methods_NNS have_VBP been_VBN adopted_VBN for_IN fibre_JJ examination_NN :_: 1_CD ._.
Gravimetric_NNP methods_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.
Photomicrographs_NNP of_IN cross-sections_NNS ._.
3_CD ._.
Projection_NN at_IN high_JJ and_CC low_JJ magnification_NN ._.
Gravimetric_NNP method_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN provided_VBD the_DT density_NN or_CC specific_JJ gravity_NN of_IN the_DT material_NN is_VBZ known_VBN then_RB the_DT product_NN of_IN the_DT length_NN ,_, area_NN of_IN cross-_JJ section_NN and_CC density_NN of_IN a_DT rod_NN of_IN given_VBN material_NN is_VBZ equal_JJ to_TO its_PRP$ weight_NN ._.
June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP B._NNP M._NNP PATEL_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP AND_NNP b._VBD K._NNP VAIDYA_NNP 83_CD W=L_NNP ._.
A._NN D._NNP ,_, where_WRB W_NNP is_VBZ weight_VBN ,_, L_NNP is_VBZ length_VBN ,_, A_DT is_VBZ area_NN of_IN cross-section_NN and_CC d_NN is_VBZ density_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT determination_NN of_IN the_DT weight_NN of_IN a_DT wool_JJ fibre_NN two_CD methods_NNS are_VBP available_JJ :_: 1_CD ._.
Weighing_VBG the_DT fibres_NNS individually_RB on_IN a_DT micro-balance_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
Weighing_VBG a_DT known_JJ number_NN of_IN fibres_NNS together_RB which_WDT are_VBP of_IN equal_JJ length_NN and_CC calculating_VBG the_DT mean_JJ weight_NN per_IN fibre_NN from_IN the_DT result_NN ._.
This_DT weighing_NN can_MD be_VB done_VBN on_IN a_DT precision_NN Chemical_NNP balance_NN or_CC special_JJ micro-balance_NN ._.
Cross-section_NN method_NN ._.
The_DT cross-section_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN by_IN Hardy_NNP 's_POS microtome_NN and_CC the_DT diameter_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS were_VBD measured_VBN under_IN a_DT measuring_NN micrometer_NN ,_, correct_VBP to_TO a_DT micron_NN ._.
Microprojection_NNP method_NN ._.
Wool_NNP samples_NNS for_IN the_DT diameter_NN measurements_NNS were_VBD made_VBN up_RP in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN master_NN samples_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD prepared_VBN from_IN several_JJ sub-samples_NNS ,_, of_IN each_DT type_NN according_VBG to_TO the_DT statistical_JJ requirements_NNS ._.
Thus_RB ,_, depending_VBG on_IN the_DT limits_NNS of_IN the_DT percentage_NN error_NN derived_VBN and_CC the_DT average_JJ fineness_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_NN the_DT master_NN samples_NNS were_VBD required_VBN to_TO have_VB 500_CD to_TO 1000_CD fibres_NNS ._.
The_DT probable_JJ error_NN in_IN the_DT mean_NN was_VBD fixed_VBN ±2.5_NNP per_IN cent_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT one_CD generally_RB employed_VBN in_IN the_DT limits_NNS of_IN measurements_NNS ._.
The_DT prepared_JJ sample_NN was_VBD then_RB cut_VBN up_RP in_IN very_RB small_JJ lengths_NNS of_IN about_RB 0.384_CD INDIAN_NNP WOOL_NNP II_NNP ._.

Frequency_NNP distribution_NN curve_NN June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP B._NNP M._NNP PATEL_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP K._NNP VAIDYA_NNP 85_CD Mean_NNP M=Arbitrary_NNP origin_NN ±_NNP mv/n_NNP ×_NNP Group_NNP value_NN where_WRB m=class_NN frequency_NN v=the_FW class_NN value_NN and_CC n=number_NN of_IN fibres_NNS Standard_NNP deviation_NN [_NNP NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_JJ Coefficient_NNP of_IN variations_NNS C._NNP V._NNP =_VBD 86_CD INDIAN_NNP WOOL_NNP II_NNP ._.
ASSESSMENT_NNP OF_NNP QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, types_NNS of_IN fibres_NNS in_IN the_DT sample_NN ._.
But_CC though_IN it_PRP may_MD be_VB convenient_JJ method_NN of_IN assess-_JJ ment_NN form_NN the_DT manufacturing_NN point_NN of_IN view_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB a_DT correct_JJ measure_NN of_IN degree_NN of_IN medullation_NN since_IN a_DT single_JJ fibre_NN may_MD be_VB partly_RB medullated_VBN and_CC partly_RB unmedullated_JJ ._.
The_DT extensive_JJ examination_NN for_IN ,_, the_DT period_NN of_IN about_IN nine_CD years_NNS in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN show_NN that_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN such_JJ partially_RB medullated_VBN fibres_NNS is_VBZ very_RB large_JJ and_CC hence_NN to_TO get_VB more_RBR realistic_JJ idea_NN the_DT method_NN adopted_VBN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN has_VBZ particular_JJ advantage_NN over_IN other_JJ methods_NNS ._.
This_DT method_NN of_IN assessment_NN of_IN medullation_NN has_VBZ a_DT special_JJ ad-_JJ vantage_NN from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN of_IN breeding_VBG experiments_NNS over_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN assessing_VBG the_DT percentage_NN of_IN medullated_JJ fibres_NNS in_IN a_DT sample_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ felt_VBN that_IN the_DT method_NN followed_VBN by_IN Mahal_NNP ,_, Johnson_NNP and_CC Burns_NNP of_IN separating_VBG the_DT fibre_NN types_NNS is_VBZ also_RB not_RB convenient_JJ since_IN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB give_VB a_DT quantitative_JJ idea_NN of_IN medullation_NN ._.
So_RB far_RB the_DT methods_NNS available_JJ for_IN the_DT medullation_NN assessment_NN has_VBZ been_VBN based_VBN on_IN the_DT observation_NN of_IN Elphik_NNP ._.
When_WRB wool_NN fibres_NNS are_VBP immersed_VBN in_IN a_DT liquid_NN like_IN benzene_NN the_DT refractive_JJ index_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT same_JJ as_IN that_DT of_IN wool_NN ,_, all_PDT the_DT wool_NN fibres_VBZ become_VBN invisible_JJ while_IN hair_NN stand_VBP out_RP ,_, dead_JJ white_JJ in_IN appearance_NN due_JJ to_TO their_PRP$ hollow_JJ struc-_NN ._.
ture_NN and_CC they_PRP can_MD be_VB easily_RB picked_VBN out_RP on_IN account_NN of_IN their_PRP$ clear_JJ visibility_NN ._.
Although_IN an_DT idea_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ degree_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN a_DT sample_NN may_MD be_VB obtained_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN ,_, its_PRP$ quantitative_JJ determination_NN is_VBZ rendered_VBN impossible_JJ on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN partially_RB medullated_VBN fibres_NNS which_WDT may_MD have_VB developed_VBN medullation_NN along_IN the_DT major_JJ portion_NN of_IN their_PRP$ lengths_NNS or_CC may_MD be_VB medullated_VBN irregularly_RB at_IN intervals_NNS ._.
MacMahon_NNP [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, claims_NNS to_TO have_VB the_DT Elphick_NNP benzene_NN method_NN quan-_JJ titative_NN by_IN employing_VBG a_DT photoelectric_NN cell_NN to_TO show_VB the_DT degree_NN of_IN medullation_NN by_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN light_NN reflected_VBN from_IN the_DT opaque_JJ white_JJ medullated_VBN fibres_NNS immersed_VBN in_IN benzene_NN ._.
The_DT degree_NN of_IN medullation_NN is_VBZ thus_RB given_VBN by_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN galvanometer_NN deflection_NN produced_VBD when_WRB a_DT known_VBN weight_NN of_IN the_DT wool_NN sample_NN in_IN a_DT blackened_JJ glass_NN tray_NN is_VBZ illuminated_VBN under_IN a_DT constant_JJ source_NN of_IN light_NN ._.
Hair_NNP reflects_VBZ considerably_RB more_RBR light_JJ than_IN pure_JJ wool_NN when_WRB in_IN benzene_NN ._.
An_DT integration_NN of_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN light_NN reflected_VBD or_CC the_DT apparent_JJ whiteness_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN would_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, give_VB an_DT index_NN of_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN medullation_NN ._.
Based_VBN on_IN this_DT principle_NN MacMahon_NNP used_VBD a_DT photoelectric_JJ instrument_NN (_( medullometer_NN )_) for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ._.
Though_IN this_DT method_NN is_VBZ quick_JJ for_IN assessing_VBG medu-_JJ llation_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN quite_RB a_DT success_NN ;_: as_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN factors_NNS have_VBP to_TO be_VB considered_VBN which_WDT requires_VBZ careful_JJ control_NN such_JJ as_IN the_DT fluctuation_NN in_IN light_JJ intensity_NN ,_, the_DT fatigue_NN shown_VBN by_IN the_DT photo-cell_NN ,_, the_DT proper_JJ arrangement_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS and_CC the_DT refractive_JJ index_NN of_IN benzene_NN employed_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, found_VBD necessary_JJ for_IN this_DT reason_NN ,_, that_IN a_DT more_RBR direct_JJ ,_, simpler_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN more_RBR reliable_JJ method_NN should_MD be_VB evolved_VBN which_WDT could_MD be_VB adopted_VBN for_IN use_NN in_IN the_DT routine_JJ work_NN of_IN medullation_NN assessment_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT image_NN of_IN the_DT wool_NN fibre_NN is_VBZ projected_VBN on_IN the_DT screen_NN for_IN the_DT measurement_NN of_IN diameter_NN ,_, medullation_NN appears_VBZ along_IN the_DT length_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_NN as_IN dark_JJ channels_NNS ,_, continuous_JJ or_CC broken_VBN as_IN previously_RB noted_VBN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, while_IN measuring_VBG the_DT diameter_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT total_JJ length_NN of_IN the_DT individual_JJ fibres_NNS and_CC of_IN medullated_JJ portion_NN in_IN each_DT of_IN them_PRP is_VBZ also_RB measured_VBN ,_, the_DT percentage_NN amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN fibres_NNS measured_VBN could_MD be_VB easily_RB calculated_VBN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN these_DT two_CD methods_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
microprojection_NN and_CC medullo-_JJ meter_NN methods_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I._NNP June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP B._NNP M._NNP PATEL_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP K._NNP VAIDYA_NNP 87_CD TABLE_NNP I_PRP Medullation_NNP figures_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN two_CD different_JJ methods_NNS Microprojection_NNP Medullometer_NNP 25.4_CD 25.1_CD 30.2_CD 32.3_CD 17.2_CD 15.3_CD 39.2_CD 40.8_CD 27.1_CD 27.7_CD 32.1_CD 32.1_CD 25.9_CD 24.1_CD 19.7_CD 21.3_CD 26.6_CD 28.4_CD 35.5_CD 37.7_CD It_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT fairly_RB good_JJ agreement_NN between_IN the_DT medullation_NN figures_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN these_DT two_CD methods_NNS ._.
The_DT exact_NN relationship_NN which_WDT seems_VBZ to_TO exist_VB between_IN the_DT fineness_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ medullation_NN formed_VBD a_DT subject_NN of_IN a_DT close_NN study_NN in_IN the_DT present_JJ work_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB remarked_VBN that_IN among_IN the_DT well_NN developed_VBD breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN ,_, even_RB in_IN coarse_NN fibres_NNS (_( 40-50µ_JJ )_) ,_, there_EX is_VBZ hardly_RB any_DT medullation_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT Asiatic_NNP breeds_NNS ,_, this_DT defect_NN is_VBZ far_RB too_RB common_JJ ._.
During_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN work_NN it_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN fine_JJ wool_NN with_IN fibre_JJ diameter_NN below_IN 30_CD microns_NNS was_VBD rarely_RB medullated_VBN ,_, whereas_NNS with_IN increasing_VBG coarseness_JJ medu-_JJ llation_NN greatly_RB increased_VBD ._.
The_DT diagram_NN for_IN diameter_NN frequency_NN (_( Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD )_) wherein_VBD the_DT medullated_VBN and_CC non_RB medullated_VBN fibres_NNS are_VBP plotted_VBN in_IN a_DT distinguishable_JJ manner_NN ,_, showed_VBD that_IN generally_RB below_IN 30_CD microns_NNS the_DT fibres_NNS were_VBD non-medullated_JJ ,_, while_IN between_IN 30_CD to_TO 40_CD microns_NNS the_DT medullated_JJ fibres_NNS were_VBD few_JJ in_IN numbers_NNS ._.
Beyond_IN this_DT limit_NN almost_RB all_PDT the_DT fibres_NNS exhibited_VBN medullation_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO bring_VB out_RP any_DT quantitative_JJ relationship_NN which_WDT may_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, exist_VBP between_IN the_DT total_JJ fibre_NN diameter_NN and_CC the_DT diameter_NN of_IN the_DT medullated_JJ part_NN ,_, a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN measurements_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP recorded_VBN in_IN Fig_NNP ._.
2_CD ,_, wherein_VBD the_DT internal_JJ diameter_NN of_IN the_DT medu-_NN llated_JJ portion_NN is_VBZ measured_VBN against_IN the_DT total_JJ diameter_NN ._.
The_DT linear_JJ trend_NN of_IN the_DT points_NNS is_VBZ clearly_RB indicated_VBN in_IN the_DT diagram_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT mean_JJ line_NN extrapolated_VBN to_TO zero_CD medullation_NN cuts_VBZ the_DT diameter_NN axis_NN at_IN 26_CD microns_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ thus_RB obvious_JJ that_IN medullation_NN below_IN this_DT fineness_NN does_VBZ not_RB generally_RB occur_VBP ._.
The_DT same_JJ relation_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO hold_VB good_JJ when_WRB similar_JJ observations_NNS on_IN the_DT cross-sections_NNS of_IN the_DT medullated_JJ fibres_NNS were_VBD plotted_VBN (_( Fig_NNP ._.
