XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, TABLE_NNP II_NNP Observations_NNP on_IN the_DT cross_NN sections_NNS of_IN medullated_JJ fibres_NNS Total_JJ diameter_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_JJ Diameter_NNP of_IN medullated_JJ portion_NN Difference_NNP in_IN diameters_NNS 40_CD 18_CD 22_CD 45_CD 21_CD 24_CD 50_CD 27_CD 23_CD 55_CD 30_CD 25_CD 60_CD 39_CD 21_CD 65_CD 41_CD 24_CD 70_CD 45_CD 25_CD 80_CD 58_CD 22_CD 100_CD 80_CD 20_CD The_DT third_JJ column_NN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP indicates_VBZ an_DT interesting_JJ fact_NN that_IN the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT total_JJ diameter_NN and_CC its_PRP$ medullated_JJ portion_NN is_VBZ constant_JJ and_CC is_VBZ independent_JJ of_IN the_DT total_JJ diameter_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_NN ._.
The_DT microprojection_NN method_NN described_VBN above_IN ,_, however_RB ,_, consumes_VBZ a_DT good_JJ deal_NN of_IN time_NN and_CC has_VBZ to_TO be_VB necessarily_RB carried_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT dark_NN room_NN together_RB with_IN the_DT fineness_JJ assessment_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB of_IN interest_NN to_TO see_VB if_IN other_JJ quicker_NN methods_NNS either_DT physical_JJ or_CC chemical_NN were_VBD available_JJ which_WDT would_MD assess_VB medullation_NN ,_, preferably_RB in_IN bulk_NN ._.
Amongst_IN the_DT physical_JJ methods_NNS which_WDT were_VBD likely_JJ to_TO be_VB of_IN use_NN ,_, the_DT tensile_JJ strength_NN and_CC the_DT resilience_NN measurements_NNS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD considered_VBN suitable_JJ for_IN a_DT preliminary_JJ study_NN ._.
Relation_NN between_IN the_DT tensile_JJ strength_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_NN and_CC its_PRP$ degree_NN of_IN medullation_NN is_VBZ not_RB very_RB definite_RB on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT generally_RB heterogeneous_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_NN ,_, but_CC a_DT general_JJ decrease_NN of_IN strength_NN in_IN medullated_VBN fibre_NN has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN ._.
Resilient_JJ measurement_NN in_IN bulk_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB more_JJR promising_JJ as_IN it_PRP relates_VBZ the_DT resilience_NN characteristics_NNS of_IN wool_NN with_IN its_PRP$ quality_NN ._.
Colour_NN of_IN wool_NN also_RB plays_VBZ an_DT important_JJ part_NN in_IN assessment_NN of_IN its_PRP$ quality_NN ._.
Wool_NN from_IN the_DT more_RBR domesticated_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN is_VBZ always_RB nearly_RB white_JJ ._.
Quite_PDT a_DT large_JJ portion_NN of_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN especially_RB from_IN South_NNP and_CC East_NNP is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB coloured_VBN as_IN grey_NN ,_, brown_NN or_CC black_JJ ._.
This_DT is_VBZ another_DT factor_NN which_WDT lowers_VBZ the_DT value_NN of_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN ._.
Even_RB in_IN white_JJ wool_NN there_EX are_VBP various_JJ grades_NNS as_IN white_JJ ,_, dirty_JJ white_JJ ,_, creamy_JJ white_JJ ,_, pale_JJ yellow_NN or_CC yellow_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO judge_VB the_DT colour_NN of_IN a_DT single_JJ fibre_NN and_CC this_DT is_VBZ usually_RB done_VBN by_IN visual_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS in_IN bulk_NN ._.
The_DT Indian_JJ Standards_NNP Institution_NNP has_VBZ set_VBN up_RP certain_JJ standard_JJ specifications_NNS for_IN such_PDT a_DT classification_NN for_IN commercial_JJ use_NN ._.
Amongst_IN the_DT chemical_NN methods_NNS available_JJ sulphur_JJ content_NN of_IN wool_NN which_WDT is_VBZ known_VBN to_TO vary_VB between_IN 2.3_CD to_TO 4.1_CD per_IN cent_NN is_VBZ regarded_VBN by_IN some_DT workers_NNS as_IN dependent_NN on_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS ._.
A_DT great_JJ deal_NN of_IN uncertainty_NN is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, attached_VBN to_TO the_DT sulphur_NN June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP B._NNP M._NNP PATEL_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP K._NNP VAIDYA_NNP 91_CD content_NN of_IN wool_NN which_WDT would_MD necessarily_RB vary_VB with_IN genetical_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ factors_NNS connected_VBN with_IN the_DT individual_JJ cases_NNS ._.
Estimation_NNP carried_VBD out_RP on_IN various_JJ types_NNS of_IN samples_NNS ,_, where_WRB such_JJ factors_NNS were_VBD known_VBN to_TO a_DT certain_JJ extent_NN ,_, emphasize_VB the_DT caution_NN which_WDT is_VBZ necessary_JJ in_IN attempting_VBG any_DT correlation_NN or_CC wool_NN quality_NN with_IN its_PRP$ sulphur_NN content_NN ._.
Physico-chemical_JJ methods_NNS for_IN the_DT estimation_NN of_IN medullation_NN were_VBD however_RB considered_VBN best_JJS for_IN testing_VBG bulk_JJ medullation_NN of_IN a_DT sample_NN ;_: for_IN here_RB it_PRP was_VBD possible_JJ that_IN due_JJ to_TO the_DT larger_JJR differences_NNS in_IN the_DT surface_NN area_NN of_IN fine_NN ,_, coarse_NN and_CC medullated_VBD fibres_NNS ,_, the_DT rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN should_MD accordingly_VB show_VB variations_NNS ._.
If_IN this_DT rate_NN was_VBD then_RB measured_VBN under_IN specified_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, by_IN an_DT application_NN of_IN the_DT laws_NNS of_IN absorption_NN a_DT relation_NN may_MD be_VB obtained_VBN between_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN the_DT substance_NN absorbed_VBN from_IN the_DT solution_NN and_CC the_DT surface_NN area_NN presented_VBN by_IN the_DT fibres_NNS in_IN the_DT sample_NN ._.
Calculations_NNS of_IN surface_NN area_NN in_IN medullated_JJ fibres_NNS present_JJ some_DT difficulty_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT partially_RB hollow_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT medulla_NN ,_, but_CC these_DT could_MD be_VB done_VBN by_IN making_VBG one_CD or_CC two_CD minor_JJ assumptions_NNS ._.
There_EX is_VBZ evidence_NN to_TO show_VB that_IN the_DT behaviour_NN of_IN certain_JJ chemicals_NNS (_( acids_NNS ,_, alkalies_NNS ,_, bromine_NN and_CC permanganate_NN )_) absorbed_VBN by_IN the_DT two_CD types_NNS of_IN fibres_NNS namely_RB ,_, the_DT fine_JJ transparent_NN solid_JJ wool_NN and_CC the_DT coarse_NN opaque_NN and_CC hollow_JJ hair_NN fibres_NNS ,_, from_IN equeous_JJ solution_NN ,_, is_VBZ different_JJ ._.
Adsorption_NN experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP with_IN wool_NN samples_NNS varying_VBG in_IN quality_NN show_VBP that_IN from_IN the_DT knowledge_NN of_IN an_DT average_JJ fineness_NN of_IN a_DT sample_NN and_CC its_PRP$ corresponding_VBG absorption_NN value_NN (_( which_WDT ``_`` follows_VBZ Fick_NNP 's_POS Law_NNP of_IN 92_CD INDIAN_NNP WOOL_NNP II_NNP ._.

QUALITY_NN OF_NNP WOOL_NNP PRODUCED_NNP BY_NNP SHEEP_NNP BREEDS_NNP ,_, OF_NNP INDIA_NNP B._NNP M._NNP PATEL_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP ,_, T._NNP K._NNP DESAI_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Chemical_NNP Technology_NNP ,_, University_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC B._NNP K._NNP VAIDYA_NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Director_NNP ,_, The_DT Ahmadabad_NNP Textile_NNP Industries_NNPS ''_'' Research_NNP Association_NNP ,_, Ahmeda-_NNP bad_JJ ,_, (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 12_CD September_NNP 1952_CD )_) INDIA_NNP produces_VBZ annually_RB nearly_RB fifty_JJ five_CD million_CD pounds_NNS of_IN wool_NN ._.
Of_IN this_DT about_IN half_NN is_VBZ exported_VBN ,_, mostly_RB for_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN carpets_NNS ._.
However_RB like_IN cotton_NN ,_, Indian_JJ wool_NN in_IN common_JJ with_IN other_JJ Asiatic_NNP wools_NNS ,_, is_VBZ of_IN a_DT considerable_JJ coarser_NN type_NN as_IN Compared_NNP to_TO the_DT much_JJ finer_NN qualities_NNS produced_VBN in_IN other_JJ countries_NNS notably_RB Australia_NNP ._.
Indian_JJ wool_NN consumed_VBN in_IN this_DT country_NN and_CC abroad_RB is_VBZ useful_JJ only_RB for_IN coarse_JJ quality_NN goods_NNS such_JJ as_IN blankets_NNS ,_, carpets_NNS ,_, cheaper_JJR qualities_NNS of_IN felts_NNS and_CC as_IN a_DT lining_JJ material_NN for_IN clothings_NNS made_VBN from_IN finer_NN wools_NNS ._.
Indian_JJ woollen_NN mills_NNS producing_VBG yarns_NNS and_CC cloth_NN for_IN the_DT worsted_JJ and_CC clothing_NN types_NNS of_IN material_NN ,_, mostly_RB use_VBP foreign_JJ wools_NNS or_CC blends_NNS of_IN foreign_JJ and_CC Indian_JJ wool_NN of_IN selected_VBN varieties_NNS from_IN Kashmir_NNP and_CC Tibet_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB presumed_VBN from_IN what_WP has_VBZ been_VBN said_VBD about_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN ,_, that_IN this_DT country_NN is_VBZ incapable_JJ of_IN growing_VBG fine_JJ wool_NN or_CC that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT scope_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN for_IN developing_VBG goods_NNS breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN with_IN fine_JJ homogeneous_JJ and_CC non-hairy_JJ type_NN of_IN wool_NN ._.
India_NNP does_VBZ produce_VB a_DT fine_JJ quality_NN of_IN wool_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT undercoat_NN of_IN fine-wooled_JJ Pashmina_NNP goat_NN of_IN the_DT Kashmir_NNP frontier_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT production_NN of_IN this_DT wool_NN is_VBZ however_RB ,_, extremely_RB limited_JJ and_CC the_DT question_NN of_IN increasing_VBG the_DT population_NN of_IN this_DT animal_NN on_IN its_PRP$ own_JJ habitat_NN and_CC in_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN still_RB needs_VBZ a_DT systematic_JJ investigation_NN ._.
The_DT general_JJ survey_NN of_IN the_DT literature_NN unfortunately_RB shows_VBZ ,_, that_IN there_EX has_VBZ never_RB been_VBN an_DT extensive_JJ attempt_NN to_TO study_VB the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN produced_VBN by_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ sheep_NN of_IN this_DT country_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ attempt_NN under_IN the_DT patronage_NN of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP perhaps_RB represents_VBZ a_DT pioneer_NN effort_NN on_IN such_PDT a_DT big_JJ scale_NN ._.
Before_IN making_VBG any_DT attempts_NNS towards_NNS producing_VBG better_JJR quality_NN of_IN wool_NN it_PRP is_VBZ absolutely_RB necessary_JJ to_TO have_VB a_DT general_JJ survey_NN of_IN what_WP we_PRP have_VBP at_IN present_NN ._.
The_DT data_NN presented_VBD helps_NN to_TO do_VB it_PRP to_TO a_DT great_JJ extent_NN to_TO isolate_VB and_CC locate_VB the_DT local_JJ breeds_NNS producing_VBG good_JJ wool_NN and_CC indicates_VBZ the_DT potentialities_NNS for_IN further_JJ development_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB always_RB possible_JJ to_TO get_VB data_NNS according_VBG to_TO breed_NN ,_, since_IN such_PDT a_DT separation_NN of_IN sheep_JJ according_VBG to_TO breeds_NNS has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN done_VBN so_RB far_RB ._.
In_IN such_PDT a_DT case_NN the_DT data_NN on_IN the_DT regional_JJ basis_NN is_VBZ presented_VBN which_WDT it_PRP is_VBZ felt_VBN is_VBZ the_DT nearest_JJS approach_NN to_TO the_DT understanding_NN of_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN being_VBG produced_VBN in_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
Such_JJ a_DT data_NN has_VBZ amply_RB shown_VBN that_IN there_EX do_VBP exist_VB sheep_VB producing_VBG wool_NN comparable_JJ with_IN the_DT Merino_NNP quality_NN 56_CD '_POS 8_CD and_CC 58_CD '_'' 8_CD ._.
These_DT breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN are_VBP found_VBN in_IN the_DT Kashmir_NNP State_NNP (_( Karnah_NNP and_CC Gurez_NNP )_) in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP (_( Hissar_NNP dale_NN )_) ,_, in_IN the_DT Niligiri_NNP (_( Ootacamund_NNP )_) ,_, in_IN Gujerat_NNP (_( Patanwadi_NNP )_) ,_, 93_CD 3_CD AR/53_NNP 3_CD 94_CD INDIAN_NNP WOOL_NNP III_NNP ._.
QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, in_IN Rajasthan_NNP (_( Shekhavati_NNP )_) and_CC in_IN certain_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Saurashtra_NNP ,_, Kutch_NNP and_CC North_NNP Deccan_NNP ._.
However_RB ,_, it_PRP only_RB by_IN a_DT chance_NN that_IN a_DT few_JJ good_JJ individuals_NNS in_IN each_DT of_IN these_DT breeds_NNS survive_VBP ,_, for_IN no_DT attempt_NN has_VBZ ever_RB been_VBN made_VBN on_IN a_DT large_JJ scale_NN to_TO increase_VB the_DT number_NN of_IN good_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
The_DT few_JJ individuals_NNS of_IN the_DT better_JJR types_NNS are_VBP always_RB in_IN danger_NN of_IN being_VBG contaminated_VBN on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT primitive_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN indiscriminate_NN breeding_NN ,_, ignorance_NN of_IN the_DT breeders_NNS and_CC the_DT migration_NN of_IN the_DT flocks_NNS to_TO the_DT more_JJR fertile_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN during_IN seasons_NNS of_IN pasture_NN scarcity_NN often_RB involving_VBG long_JJ journeys_NNS ._.
These_DT factors_NNS allow_VBP sufficient_JJ scope_NN for_IN the_DT mixing_NN of_IN pure_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN good_JJ wool_NN with_IN inferior_JJ types_NNS ._.
Sheep_JJ breeding_NN farms_NNS established_VBN by_IN the_DT Government_NNP and_CC some_DT States_NNS do_VBP help_VB to_TO identify_VB ,_, isolate_VB ,_, conserve_NN and_CC breed_VB the_DT good_JJ types_NNS of_IN sheep_NN ,_, but_CC they_PRP alone_RB could_MD not_RB be_VB expected_VBN to_TO undertake_VB large_JJ scale_JJ breeding_NN operation_NN ,_, which_WDT should_MD be_VB done_VBN under_IN the_DT present_JJ conditions_NNS with_IN the_DT co-operation_NN of_IN the_DT private_JJ enterprises_NNS ._.
The_DT Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP has_VBZ for_IN sometime_RB been_VBN directing_VBG its_PRP$ attention_NN through_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP ,_, to_TO the_DT problem_NN of_IN improve-_JJ ment_NN of_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN ._.
Several_JJ experimental_JJ sheep_NN breeding_NN farms_NNS have_VBP been_VBN established_VBN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN where_WRB ,_, sheep_RB selected_VBN from_IN local_JJ breeds_NNS are_VBP maintained_VBN under_IN controlled_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC breeding_NN experiments_NNS are_VBP carried_VBN out_IN with_IN animals_NNS showing_VBG relatively_RB good_JJ type_NN of_IN .wool_NN ._.
Work_NN on_IN cross-breeding_NN with_IN established_VBN breeds_NNS of_IN stud_JJ rams_NNS ,_, Indian_JJ as_RB well_RB as_IN foreign_JJ ,_, is_VBZ also_RB undertaken_VBN at_IN the_DT farms_NNS while_IN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS observations_NNS on_IN wool_NN quality_NN are_VBP also_RB made_VBN with_IN changes_NNS in_IN feeding_NN and_CC under_IN various_JJ genetic_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
In_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, laboratory_JJ tests_NNS on_IN the_DT physical_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN the_DT fibres_NNS such_JJ as_IN length_NN ,_, diameter_NN ,_, crimp_NN ,_, hairy_JJ portion_NN (_( medullation_NN )_) ,_, density_NN ,_, tensile_JJ strength_NN are_VBP necessary_JJ in_IN order_NN to_TO arrive_VB at_IN a_DT satisfactory_JJ conclusion_NN regarding_VBG the_DT progress_NN of_IN wool_NN improvement_NN experiments_NNS of_IN the_DT farms_NNS ._.
Such_JJ tests_NNS also_RB give_VBP all_DT information_NN about_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN produced_VBN in_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
Under_IN the_DT auspices_NNS of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP ,_, the_DT Bombay_NNP University_NNP Wool_NNP Research_NNP Scheme_NNP is_VBZ going_VBG on_IN at_IN the_DT Department_NNP of_IN Chemical_NNP Techno-_NNP logy_NN ,_, Matunga_NNP ,_, since_IN August_NNP 1940_CD ._.
Under_IN this_DT Scheme_NNP wool_NN samples_NNS from_IN local_JJ sheep_NN of_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN and_CC also_RB of_IN various_JJ experimental_JJ sheep_NN farms_NNS are_VBP being_VBG examined_VBN for_IN the_DT principal_JJ fibre_NN characteristics_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ qualities_NNS reported_VBN upon_IN ._.
The_DT progress_NN of_IN farm_NN experiments_NNS is_VBZ judged_VBN accordingly_RB by_IN the_DT officer-in-_JJ charge_NN at_IN the_DT respective_JJ station_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ paper_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT existing_VBG breeds_NNS of_IN Kashmir_NNP State_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP State_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ,_, Bihar_NNP ,_, Madhya_NNP Pradesh_NNP and_CC Bombay_NNP State_NNP ._.
The_DT discussion_NN on_IN the_DT breeds_NNS of_IN Rajasthan_NNP is_VBZ purposely_RB omitted_VBN as_IN sufficient_JJ data_NNS is-_NN available_JJ in_IN the_DT printed_JJ report_NN ;_: Report_NNP of_IN Jaipur_NNP Wool_NNP Analysis_NNP Scheme_NNP ,_, sanctioned_VBN by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP from_IN 1_CD September_NNP ,_, 1949_CD to_TO 31_CD August_NNP ,_, 1950_CD ,_, by_IN Mr._NNP N._NNP C._NNP Narayan_NNP ,_, and_CC Mahals_NNP paper_NN [_NN 1951_CD ]_NN on_IN Bikaner_NNP wool_NN ._.

KASHMIR_NNP BREEDS_NNP Indigenous_NNP breeds_NNS Wool_NNP samples_NNS received_VBD from_IN the_DT Government_NNP Sheep_NNP Breeding_NNP Farm_NNP at_IN Banihal_NNP in_IN Kashmir_NNP indicated_VBD that_IN there_EX are_VBP four_CD principal_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN animals_NNS found_VBN in_IN this_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
These_DT are_VBP recognised_VBN as_IN the_DT Karnah_NNP ,_, Gurez_NNP ,_, Bhadarwah_NNP and_CC the_DT Bakarwal_NNP breeds_NNS ._.
Forty-seven_JJ samples_NNS (_( 16_CD Gurez_NNP ,_, 16_CD Karnah_NNP ,_, 14_CD Bhadarwah_NNP and_CC 1_CD Bakarwal_NNP )_) were_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ fibre_NN characteristics_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN from_IN Table_JJ I_PRP that_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS in_IN all_PDT the_DT four_CD breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
Gurez_NNP ,_, Karnah_NNP ,_, Bhadarwah_NNP and_CC Bakarwal_NNP ,_, lie_NN within_IN the_DT range_NN of_IN 76-100_JJ mm_NN ._.
with_IN respect_NN to_TO length_VB ,_, 26-40_JJ microns_NNS with_IN respect_NN to_TO diameter_VB ,_, 26-45_JJ per_IN cent_NN with_IN respect_NN to_TO C._NNP V._NNP and_CC 1-35_JJ per_IN cent_NN with_IN respect_NN to_TO medullation_NN ._.
The_DT detailed_JJ analysis_NN shows_VBZ that_IN of_IN the_DT Kashmir_NNP breeds_NNS ,_, Karnah_NNP wool_NN is_VBZ the_DT best_JJS of_IN the_DT four_CD types_NNS ,_, while_IN Gurez_NNP and_CC Bhadarwah_NNP occupy_VBP the_DT intermediate_JJ posi-_JJ tion_NN between_IN Karnah_NNP and_CC Bakarwal_NNP ._.
Cross-breeds_NNS A_DT very_RB important_JJ batch_NN of_IN samples_NNS were_VBD received_VBN from_IN Kashmir_NNP farm_NN in_IN three_CD lots_NNS consisting_VBG of_IN 195_CD ,_, 105_CD and_CC 116_CD samples_NNS representing_VBG the_DT cross-breeding_JJ experi-_JJ ments_NNS with_IN Merino_NNP rams_NNS ._.

QUALITY_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP :_: XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, bred_VBD animals_NNS wherein_VBP 46_CD out_IN of_IN 55_CD samples_NNS ,_, have_VBP diameter_VBN below_IN 25_CD microns_NNS and_CC 23_CD and_CC 32_CD samples_NNS fall_RB within_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD ranges_NNS of_IN C._NNP V._NNP Medullation_NNP also_RB successively_RB decreases_VBZ ._.

It_PRP clearly_RB shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT cross-breeding_JJ definitely_JJ improves_VBZ wool_JJ quality_NN as_RB far_RB as_IN all_PDT the_DT three_CD important_JJ characteristics_NNS are_VBP concerned_VBN ._.

The_DT reproducibility_NN of_IN the_DT data_NNS in_IN the_DT successive_JJ lots_NNS gives_VBZ confirmation_NN about_IN the_DT accuracy_NN of_IN the_DT analysis_NN ._.
As_RB far_RB as_IN June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP B._NNP M._NNP PATEL_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP ,_, T._NNP K._NNP DESAI_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP K._NNP VAIDYA_NNP 101_CD medullation_NN ._.
The_DT F1_NNP generation_NN Merico_NNP ewes_NN are_VBP comparable_JJ with_IN the_DT ½_NNP bloods_NNS except_IN that_DT there_EX is_VBZ a_DT slight_JJ deterioration_NN in_IN the_DT fibre_JJ homogeneity_NN ._.
Wool_NN from_IN the_DT castrated_JJ ram_NN of_IN this_DT generation_NN is_VBZ finer_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN non-castrated_JJ animal_NN but_CC it_PRP slightly_RB loses_VBZ in_IN quality_NN in_IN points_NNS of_IN homogeneity_NN and_CC medullation_NN ._.
MADRAS_NNP PROVINCE_NNP Nilgiri_NNP breeds_NNS (_( Oolacamund_NNP )_) Recently_RB an_DT interesting_JJ breed_NN of_IN sheep_JJ known_VBN as_IN Nilgiri_NNP breed_NN has_VBZ been_VBN located_VBN near_IN the_DT area_NN about_IN Ooty_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ interesting_JJ because_IN the_DT wool_NN is_VBZ perhaps_RB of_IN the_DT finest_JJS quality_NN amongst_NN that_WDT produced_VBD in_IN South_NNP India_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT breed_NN is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT very_RB few_JJ fine_JJ quality_NN wool_NN producing_VBG indigenous_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN ._.
The_DT only_JJ other_JJ breed_NN to_TO which_WDT it_PRP can_MD be_VB compared_VBN are_VBP the_DT few_JJ breeds_NNS from_IN Kashmir_NNP and_CC few_JJ from_IN Bikaner_NNP ._.
The_DT origin_NN of_IN this_DT breed_NN of_IN sheep_NN is_VBZ obscure_JJ but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ believed_VBN that_IN the_DT origin_NN must_MD be_VB perhaps_RB the_DT two_CD famous_JJ British_JJ breeds_NNS which_WDT were_VBD imported_VBN by_IN British_JJ planters_NNS in_IN Nilgiri_NNP and_CC which_WDT are_VBP found_VBN in_IN the_DT hilly_JJ regions_NNS of_IN England_NNP ,_, viz_NN ._.
South-_NNP down_RP developed_VBN in_IN the_DT chalky_NN hills_NNS of_IN Sussex_NNP and_CC Chaviots_NNP ,_, the_DT native_NN of_IN Chaviot_NNP on_IN the_DT border_NN between_IN England_NNP and_CC Scotland_NNP ._.
The_DT Nilgiri_NNP breed_NN is_VBZ also_RB found_VBN mainly_RB over_IN 6,000_CD feet_NNS ._.
It_PRP must_MD be_VB noted_VBN that_IN this_DT breed_NN has_VBZ been_VBN neglected_VBN for_IN some_DT time_NN past_JJ and_CC hence_RB some_DT deterioration_NN may_MD have_VB set_VBN in_IN the_DT wool_NN quality_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ therefore_RB believed_VBN that_IN this_DT enterprise_NN of_IN the_DT Madras_NNP Government_NNP is_VBZ quite_RB promising_JJ ._.
Ooty_NNP Two_CD hundred_VBD and_CC seventy_JJ three_CD samples_NNS in_IN two_CD lots_NNS of_IN 54_CD and_CC 219_CD were_VBD received_VBN from_IN Ooty_NNP for_IN fibre_JJ analysis_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ lot_NN of_IN Nilgiri_NNP breed_NN consisted_VBD of_IN six_CD rams_NNS and_CC 48_CD ewes_NN while_IN the_DT second_JJ lot_NN consisted_VBD of_IN 20_CD rams_NNS ,_, five_CD ram_NN lambs_NN ,_, 189_CD ewes_NN and_CC five_CD ewe_NNS lambs_NN ._.
The_DT variation_NN in_IN their_PRP$ fibre_NN characteristics_NNS with_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN samples_NNS falling_VBG in_IN each_DT group_NN of_IN length_NN ,_, diameter_NN ,_, C._NNP V._NNP and_CC medullation_NN are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP V._NNP It_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN that_IN out_IN of_IN 273_CD samples_NNS ,_, about_RB 95_CD samples_NNS have_VBP fibre_VBN fineness_RB below_IN 25_CD microns_NNS ,_, about_RB 177_CD samples_NNS between_IN 26-40_JJ microns_NNS and_CC only_RB one_CD sample_NN above_IN 40_CD microns_NNS ._.
As_RB far_RB as_IN C._NNP V._NNP is_VBZ concerned_VBN about_IN 96_CD are_VBP homogeneous_JJ and_CC 190_CD samples_NNS are_VBP moderately_RB homogeneous_JJ and_CC only_RB 13_CD samples_NNS are_VBP heterogeneous_JJ ._.
About_IN 106_CD samples_NNS are_VBP completely_RB free_JJ from_IN medullation_NN ,_, while_IN 76_CD samples_NNS have_VBP medullation_NN between_IN .1_NNP and_CC 10_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 95_CD samples_NNS lie_VBP between_IN 11_CD and_CC 35_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Only_RB five_CD samples_NNS have_VBP above_IN 35_CD per_IN cent_NN medullation_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN on_IN the_DT whole_NN that_IN this_DT particular_JJ breed_NN of_IN sheep_JJ produces_NNS medium_NN fine_NN ,_, moderately_RB homogeneous_JJ and_CC slightly_RB medullated_VBN wool_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS fall_VBP within_IN the_DT range_NN 1/2_CD blood_NN to_TO 3/8_CD blood_NN according_VBG to_TO American_JJ Standards_NNP or_CC 60_CD 's_POS to_TO 56_CD 's_POS accord-_JJ ing_NN to_TO the_DT British_JJ Standards_NNS ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part.II_NNP ,_, It_PRP is_VBZ observed_VBN from_IN the_DT table_NN that_IN out_IN of_IN 522_CD samples_NNS of_IN wool_NN examined_VBN ,_, about-_JJ 96_CD per_IN cent_NN have_VBP diameter_VBN above_IN 40_CD microns_NNS while_IN only_RB 4_CD per_IN cent_NN have_VBP diameter_VBN below_IN 40_CD microns_NNS ._.
This_DT shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT fibres_NNS are_VBP of_IN very_RB coarse_JJ and_CC inferior_JJ nature_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT samples_NNS are_VBP highly_RB medullated_VBN and_CC very_RB heterogeneous_JJ ._.
Due_JJ to_TO its_PRP$ high_JJ degree_NN of_IN coarseness_NN ,_, heterogeneity_NN and_CC medullation_NN ,_, the_DT samples_NNS can_MD be_VB used_VBN only_RB for_IN carpet_NN or_CC heavy_JJ woollens_NNS ._.
The_DT samples_NNS are_VBP from_IN animals_NNS collected_VBN in_IN the_DT farms_NNS from_IN the_DT breeds_NNS existing_VBG in_IN that_DT area_NN ._.
The_DT individual_JJ breeds_NNS are_VBP not_RB indicated_VBN and_CC hence_RB are_VBP grouped_VBN as_IN Bellary_NNP samples_NNS ._.
The_DT detailed_JJ analysis_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT abridged_NN table_NN shows_VBZ that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT major_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT fibre_NN characteristics_NNS in_IN various_JJ animals_NNS and_CC hence_RB the_DT results_NNS stated_VBD here_RB can_MD be_VB taken_VBN as_IN representative_NN of_IN wool_NN produced_VBN in_IN the_DT party_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN it_PRP covers_VBZ ._.
Coimbatore_IN The_DT analysis_NN figures_NNS of_IN 22_CD samples_NNS (_( Polayakothai_NNP nine_CD ,_, Sulur_NNP seven_CD ,_, Kane-_NNP polian_JJ five_CD and_CC unnamed_JJ one_CD )_) are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VII_NNP ._.

UTTAR_NNP PRADESH_NNP Meerut_NNP One_CD hundred_CD and_CC twenty-two_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD received_VBN from_IN the_DT Deputy_NNP Director_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Husbandry_NNP ,_, Meerut_NNP ,_, in_IN three_CD lots_NNS :_: The_DT first_JJ lot_NN consisted_VBN of_IN 58_CD samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN local_JJ sheep_NN from_IN various_JJ villages_NNS near_IN about_RB Meerut_NNP as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IX_NNP ._.

The_DT details_NNS of_IN the_DT 58_CD samples_NNS show_VBP that_IN of_IN the_DT 58_CD samples_NNS ,_, 38_CD have_VBP diameters_NNS above_IN 40µ_CD and_CC 21_CD between_IN 26-40µ_JJ ._.
The_DT samples_NNS are_VBP appreciably_RB medullated_VBN since_IN practically_RB ,_, all_PDT the_DT samples_NNS fall_VBP in_IN the_DT third_JJ and_CC fourth_JJ range_NN of_IN medullation_NN ._.
The_DT analysis_NN of_IN the_DT second_JJ lot_NN of_IN 41_CD samples_NNS consisting_VBG of_IN 22_CD local_JJ ewes_NN selected_VBN from_IN different_JJ villages_NNS other_JJ than_IN those_DT in_IN the_DT first_JJ lot_NN and_CC 19_CD first_JJ progenies_NNS from_IN goat_NN rams_NN shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT ewes_NN have_VBP a_DT better_JJR quality_NN wool_NN than_IN those_DT in_IN the_DT first_JJ lot_NN and_CC the_DT first_JJ progenies_NNS show_VBP a_DT further_JJ improvement_NN in_IN fibre_JJ characteristics_NNS ._.

Gaya_NNP Ninety-seven_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD received_VBN from_IN Gaya_NNP Sheep_NNP Breeding_NNP Farm_NNP for_IN fibre_JJ analysis_NN ._.

About_IN 86_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS have_VBP their_PRP$ diameter_NN above_IN 40_CD microns_NNS and_CC 60_CD per_IN cent_NN have_VBP C._NNP V._NNP above_IN 45_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC about_IN 90_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN samples_NNS have_VBP medullation_VBN above_IN 35_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Monghyr_NNP Samples_NNP from_IN Monghyr_NNP were_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ fibre_NN characteristics_NNS ._.
Table_JJ VIII_NNP gives_VBZ the_DT analytical_JJ data_NNS ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN the_DT castrated_JJ feeding_NN males_NNS are_VBP better_JJR than_IN the_DT rest_NN particularly_RB in_IN medullation_NN ._.
This_DT feeding_JJ test_NN does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB affected_VBN by_IN the_DT females_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT castrated_JJ males_NNS did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT marked_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT improvement_NN of_IN wool_NN quality_NN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT non-castrated_JJ males_NNS ._.
On_IN an_DT examination_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_JJ characteristic_JJ values_NNS of_IN each_DT group_NN ,_, the_DT detailed_JJ ana-_JJ lysis_NN shows_NNS that_IN castration_NN combined_VBN with_IN special_JJ feeding_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS (_( with_IN gram_NN and_CC maize_NN )_) lead_NN to_TO the_DT marked_JJ diminution_NN in_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ also_RB an_DT increased_JJ rate_NN of_IN growth_NN and_CC a_DT small_JJ gain_NN in_IN fibre_JJ fineness_NN ._.
The_DT conclusions_NNS however_RB ,_, are_VBP very_RB tentative_JJ since_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN samples_NNS for_IN each_DT ex-_JJ perimental_JJ condition_NN is_VBZ very_RB small_JJ and_CC secondly_RB the_DT fibre_JJ characteristic_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ animals_NNS before_IN and_CC after_IN the_DT experiment_NN does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO have_VB been_VBN done_VBN ._.
As_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN produced_VBN by_IN sheep_NN in_IN this_DT area_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN about_RB 86_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS are_VBP coarse_JJ (_( diameter_JJ above_IN 40_CD microns_NNS )_) and_CC highly_RB medullated_VBN (_( above_IN 35_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, while_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS are_VBP quite_RB heterogeneous_JJ (_( C._NNP V._NNP above_IN 45_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP ,_, MADHYA_NNP PRADESH_NNP Nagpur_NNP samples_VBZ Several_JJ samples_NNS of_IN black_JJ and_CC white_JJ wool_NN were_VBD received_VBN for_IN fibre_JJ analysis_NN from_IN Madhya_NNP Pradesh_NNP ._.
The_DT analysis_NN results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP X_NNP ._.
The_DT results_NNS showed_VBD that_IN both_DT black_JJ and_CC white_JJ samples_NNS are_VBP very_RB rough_JJ with_IN uneven_JJ distribution_NN in_IN diameter_NN and_CC are_VBP highly_RB medullated_VBN ._.
Practically_RB all_PDT the_DT samples_NNS have_VBP diameter_NN over_IN 40_CD microns_NNS and_CC C._NNP V._NNP between_IN 26_CD to_TO 40_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB determined_VBN by_IN the_DT microprojection_NN method_NN for_IN the_DT black_JJ samples_NNS but_CC from_IN the_DT general_JJ feel_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ almost_RB certain_JJ that_IN they_PRP are_VBP also_RB highly_RB medullated_VBN ._.
BOMBAY_NNP STATE_NNP Samples_NNP received_VBD from_IN Poona_NNP ,_, Bijapur_NNP ,_, Surat_NNP ,_, Ahmedabad_NNP ,_, Patna_NNP and_CC Cutch_NNP and_CC their_PRP$ fibre_NN characteristics_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP XI_NNP ._.
Thirty_NN samples_NNS (_( 10_CD ewes_NN and_CC 10_CD rams_NNS at_IN Mahad_NNP and_CC 10_CD ewes_NN at_IN Javala_NNP )_) of_IN Deccani_NNP wool_NN obtained_VBN from_IN experimental_JJ stations_NNS at_IN Mahad_NNP and_CC Javala_NNP ,_, where_WRB pure_NN flocks_NNS of_IN this_DT breed_NN are_VBP maintained_VBN ,_, showed_VBD the_DT general_JJ fibre_NN characteristics_NNS expected_VBN of_IN good_JJ animals_NNS in_IN this_DT breed_NN of_IN sheep_NN ._.
The_DT set_NN containing_VBG wool_NN samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN the_DT sheep_NN in_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP State_NNP in_IN the_DT districts_NNS of_IN Ahmedabad_NNP ,_, Surat_NNP ,_, Bijapur_NNP and_CC Dharwar_NNP had_VBD wool_NN which_WDT compared_VBN well_RB with_IN Bikaneri_NNP type_NN in_IN all_DT respects_NNS ._.
Dharwar_NNP and_CC Bijapur_NNP wools_NNS with_IN fibre_JJ fineness_NN as_RB good_JJ as_IN the_DT Ahmedabad_NNP type_NN and_CC having_VBG a_DT low_JJ amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN like_IN the_DT latter_NN ,_, were_VBD however_RB far_RB more_RBR heterogeneous_JJ as_IN compared_VBN to_TO Ahmedabad_NNP wool_NN ._.
Specimens_NNS of_IN coloured_JJ wool_NN from_IN Dharwar_NNP and_CC Bijapur_NNP were_VBD also_RB examined_VBN ._.
Their_PRP$ dark_NN colour_NN however_RB put_VBD them_PRP into_IN a_DT lower_JJR quality_NN ._.
Samples_NNS received_VBN from_IN Cutch_NNP ,_, compared_VBN in_IN general_JJ well_NN with_IN the_DT good_JJ type_NN of_IN Joria_NNP commmercial_JJ wool_NN ._.
The_DT eight_CD samples_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT Patanwadi_NNP (_( Gujarat_NNP )_) breed_VBD as_IN shown_VBN ,_, pro-_JJ duce_NN good_JJ quality_NN wool_NN comparable_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN Kashmir_NNP type_NN of_IN wool_NN ._.

21,94_CD INDIAN_NNP WOOL_NNP IV_NNP ._.
QUALITY_NN OF_NNP COMMERCIAL_NNP WOOL_NNP OF_NNP IMPORTANT_NNP MARKETING_NNP CENTRES_NNP By_IN B._NNP M._NNP PATEL_NNP ,_, G._NNP K._NNP WAGLE_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP R._NNP PADHYE_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Chemical_NNP Technology_NNP ,_, University_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 12_CD September_NNP 1952_CD )_) IT_NNP is_VBZ generally_RB recognized_VBN that_IN the_DT most_RBS important_JJ problem_NN in_IN the_DT marketing_NN of_IN Indian_JJ wool_NN abroad_RB is_VBZ to_TO organize_VB the_DT exports_NNS with_IN respect_NN to_TO the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN ._.
Such_JJ a_DT regulated_JJ trade_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO have_VB far_RB reaching_VBG effect_NN since_IN it_PRP gives_VBZ a_DT clear_JJ indication_NN to_TO the_DT purchaser_NN of_IN the_DT goods_NNS being_VBG purchased_VBN and_CC also_RB gives_VBZ the_DT margin_NN of_IN price_NN it_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO fetch_VB to_TO the_DT seller_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD also_RB stabilize_VB the_DT quality_NN of_IN wool_NN in_IN each_DT lot_NN so_IN that_IN the_DT usual_JJ blame_NN thrown_VBN on_IN Indian_JJ goods_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
the_DT lack_NN of_IN uniformity_NN and_CC standardization_NN ,_, will_MD be_VB avoided_VBN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, the_DT standardization_NN of_IN the_DT grades_NNS of_IN wool_NN for_IN export_NN is_VBZ an_DT essential_JJ pre-requisite_NN for_IN efficient_JJ marketing_NN of_IN this_DT commodity_NN and_CC for_IN maintaining_VBG the_DT reputation_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN in_IN international_JJ market_NN ._.
Recently_RB therefore_RB ,_, the_DT Indian_JJ Standards_NNP Institution_NNP ,_, Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP ,_, has_VBZ prepared_VBN standards_NNS for_IN grading_VBG Raw_NNP Wool_NNP for_IN export_NN ._.
The_DT rules_NNS are_VBP published_VBN by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Standards_NNP Institution_NNP as_IN Wool_NNP Grading_NNP and_CC Marketing_NNP Rules_NNP ,_, 1950_CD ._.
According_VBG to_TO standards_NNS ,_, raw_JJ wool_NN is_VBZ divided_VBN into_IN seven_CD grades_NNS accord-_JJ ing_NN to_TO colour_VB and_CC each_DT grade_NN is_VBZ further_RB divided_VBN into_IN three_CD qualities_NNS according_VBG to_TO percentage_NN yield_NN and_CC length_NN ._.
The_DT seven_CD grades_NNS are_VBP the_DT white_JJ ,_, pale_JJ white_JJ ,_, dirty_JJ white_JJ ,_, pale_JJ yellow_NN ,_, yellow_JJ ,_, deep_JJ yellow_NN and_CC coloured_VBD ._.
The_DT first_JJ quality_NN in_IN each_DT grade_NN has_VBZ yield_VBN of_IN 88±_CD 2_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC length_NN three_CD inches_NNS ._.
The_DT second_JJ quality_NN in_IN each_DT grade_NN has_VBZ 82±_CD 2_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC length_$ 2.25_CD inches_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT third_JJ quality_NN has_VBZ yield_VBN 75±_CD 3_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT length_NN same_JJ as_IN in_IN second_NN ._.
The_DT various_JJ grades_NNS are_VBP specified_VBN according_VBG to_TO colour_NN of_IN the_DT raw_JJ wool_NN with_IN the_DT tolerances_NNS of_IN fibres_NNS and_CC other_JJ colours_NNS ._.
The_DT standrads_NNS are_VBP thus_RB based_VBN on_IN three_CD attributes_NNS which_WDT are_VBP important_JJ for_IN carpet_NN wool_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
colour_NN ,_, yield_NN and_CC length_NN ;_: the_DT other_JJ attributes_NNS as_IN diameter_NN ,_, homo-_JJ geneity_NN (_( measured_VBN in_IN C._NNP V._NNP )_) in_IN length_NN of_IN diameter_NN and_CC medullation_NN are_VBP not_RB considered_VBN ,_, since_IN these_DT are_VBP not_RB thought_VBN to_TO be_VB of_IN primary_JJ importance_NN for_IN the_DT type_NN of_IN wool_NN India_NNP produces_VBZ ,_, though_IN they_PRP are_VBP not_RB necessary_JJ for_IN fabric_JJ fine_JJ wool_NN ._.
The_DT analysis_NN of_IN the_DT commercial_JJ samples_NNS presented_VBN here_RB is_VBZ done_VBN only_RB for_IN colour_JJ yield_NN and_CC length_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ paper_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT analysis_NN of_IN 802_CD samples_NNS of_IN wool_NN ._.
These_DT were_VBD selected_VBN by_IN the_DT Wool_NNP Expert_NNP with_IN the_DT Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN consisted_VBN of_IN samples_NNS from_IN both_DT April_NNP (_( Chaitra_NNP )_) and_CC October_NNP (_( Shrawan_NNP )_) shearing_NN ,_, 113_CD 3AR/53_CD 6_CD 114_CD INDIAN_NNP WOOL_NNP IV_NNP ._.

The_DT table_NN shows_VBZ that_IN as_RB far_RB as_IN length_NN and_CC yield_NN are_VBP concerned_VBN the_DT white_JJ and_CC yellow_JJ samples_NNS are_VBP practically_RB similar_JJ and_CC the_DT coloured_JJ samples_NNS are_VBP definitely_RB shorter_JJR than_IN both_DT ._.

It_PRP shows_VBZ the_DT white_JJ Marwar_NNP samples_NNS are_VBP superior_JJ to_TO yellow_VB or_CC coloured_VBN ,_, in_IN length_NN and_CC yield_NN ;_: then_RB comes_VBZ yellow_JJ and_CC lastly_RB the_DT coloured_NN ._.
The_DT work_NN done_VBN previously_RB in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN shows_VBZ that_IN coloured_VBD samples_NNS are_VBP inferior_JJ to_TO yellow_VB Marwar_NNP in_IN fineness_NN and_CC uniformity_NN ._.
The_DT white_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD unfortunately_RB not_RB then_RB available_JJ ._.
The_DT classification_NN of_IN Joria_NNP samples_NNS follows_VBZ that_IN of_IN the_DT Bikaneri_NNP type_NN ._.
Here_RB also_RB the_DT white_JJ and_CC yellow_JJ samples_NNS are_VBP similar_JJ in_IN character_NN in_IN length_NN and_CC yield_NN and_CC even_RB diameter_RBR and_CC medullation_NN when_WRB the_DT data_NN of_IN the_DT analysis_NN of_IN previous_JJ years_NNS is_VBZ taken_VBN into_IN account_NN ._.
The_DT coloured_JJ samples_NNS are_VBP inferior_JJ to_TO both_DT in_IN length_NN ,_, yield_NN and_CC even_RB diameter_RBR ._.
There_EX is_VBZ however_RB nothing_NN to_TO choose_VB between_IN the_DT white_JJ and_CC yellow_JJ samples_NNS ,_, except_IN colour_NN ._.
As_IN compared_VBN to_TO Bikaneri_NNP yellow_NN and_CC white_JJ ,_, the_DT Joria_NNP yellow_NN and_CC white_JJ are_VBP little_JJ shorter_JJR and_CC have_VBP slightly_RB higher_JJR yield_NN value_NN ._.

Bikaner_NNP ,_, Joria_NNP and_CC Kashmir_NNP ._.

The_DT table_NN shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT white_JJ Bikaner_NNP wool_NN is_VBZ all_DT grouped_VBN in_IN the_DT central_JJ range_NN and_CC there_EX is_VBZ greater_JJR probability_NN of_IN finding_VBG the_DT yellow_JJ Bikaner_NNP wool_NN in_IN the_DT higher_JJR grade_NN ._.

II_NNP and_CC III_NNP were_VBD given_VBN 1.25_CD lb_NN ._.
and_CC the_DT other_JJ four_CD ,_, one_CD pound_NN each_DT per_IN day_NN ;_: the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN different_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN maize_NNS cake_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD planned_VBN to_TO superimpose_VB the_DT quantities_NNS of_IN maize_NNS cake_VBP on_IN this_DT maintenance_NN ration_NN (_( wheat_JJ bhusa_NN and_CC maize_VB cake_NN )_) but_CC the_DT animals_NNS refused_VBD to_TO eat_VB the_DT extra_JJ quantity_NN ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP II_NNP TABLE_NNP IV_NNP Daily_NNP nitrogen_NN balance_NN in_IN grammes_JJ Period_NNP Heifer_NNP number_NN Intake_NNP in_IN feed_NN Total_JJ intake_NN Outgo_NNP Total_NNP outgo_JJ Balance_NNP Dung_NNP Urine_NNP Wheat_NNP bhusa_NN Berseem_NNP Maize_NNP cak_VBD 14-12-45_JJ to_TO 23-12-45_JJ I_PRP 14.98_CD June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP L._NNP C._NNP DHARMANI_NNP AND_NNP G._NNP V._NNP KARIRA_NNP 127_CD DISCUSSION_NNP Maize_NNP cake_NN is_VBZ richer_JJR in_IN fat_NN and_CC soluble_JJ carbohydrates_NNS but_CC poorer_NN in_IN protein_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO other_JJ cakes_NNS as_IN seen_VBN from_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ III_NNP that_WDT fat_VBZ in_IN maize_NNS cake_VBP is_VBZ slightly_RB more_RBR digestible_JJ than_IN other_JJ cakes_NNS ,_, (_( toria_NN and_CC sarson_NN cakes_NNS )_) while_IN digestibility_NN of_IN protein_NN is_VBZ less_RBR ._.
Diges-_NNP tibility_NN of_IN dry_JJ matter_NN in_IN maize_JJ cake_NN is_VBZ lower_JJR ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB noticed_VBN that_IN the_DT palatability_NN and_CC the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN maize_JJ cake_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT addition_NN of_IN green_JJ berseem_NN has_VBZ considerably_RB improved_VBN ._.
The_DT digestibility_NN of_IN its_PRP$ fat_NN and_CC protein_NN have_VBP increased_VBN by_IN 11_CD and_CC 6_CD per_IN cent_NN respectively_RB ,_, whilst_VBD the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN dry_JJ matter_NN and_CC soluble_JJ carbohydrates_NNS remained_VBD almost_RB unaltered_JJ ._.
The_DT figures_NNS for_IN total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS and_CC digestible_JJ protein_NN show_NN that_IN the_DT nutrients_NNS in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN maize_NNS cake_VBP when_WRB fed_VBN with_IN basal_JJ ration_NN of_IN berseem_NN and_CC wheat_NN bhusa_NNS have_VBP been_VBN utilised_VBN better_RBR by_IN the_DT animals_NNS than_IN when_WRB maize_JJ cake_NN was_VBD fed_VBN with_IN wheat_NN bhusa_NN alone_RB as_IN basal_JJ ration_NN ._.
Maynard_NNP mentions_NNS in_IN his_PRP$ book_NN on_IN Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NN on_IN page_NN 82_CD paras_NN 74_CD ,_, 75_CD as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
'It_NN is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ belief_NN that_IN the_DT Herbivora_NNP have_VBP a_DT low_JJ tolerance_NN for_IN fat_NN but_CC the_DT experimental_JJ evidence_NN in_IN its_PRP$ support_NN is_VBZ scanty_JJ ._.
Certainly_RB the_DT suckling_NN is_VBZ able_JJ to_TO handle_VB a_DT relatively_RB large_JJ amount_NN of_IN fat_NN ,_, since_IN milk_NN contains_NNS from_IN 25_CD to_TO 40_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN this_DT nutrient_NN on_IN a_DT dry_JJ matter_NN basis_NN ._.
The_DT studies_NNS have_VBP not_RB been_VBN extended_VBN to_TO other_JJ oils_NNS except_IN to_TO show_VB that_IN cotton_NN seed_NN oil_NN certainly_RB does_VBZ not_RB have_VB any_DT such_JJ effect_NN ._. '_''
Lander_NNP and_CC Dharmani_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP also_RB observed_VBD that_IN no_DT ill_JJ effects_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN on_IN the_DT health_NN of_IN animals_NNS when_WRB fed_VBN with_IN cotton_NN seeds_NNS ,_, having_VBG about_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN fat_NN ._.
Similar_NN are_VBP our_PRP$ findings_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN maize_NNS cake_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ rich_JJ in_IN fat_JJ contain-_JJ ing_VBG about_IN 19.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
No_DT untoward_JJ effects_NNS whatsoever_WDT were_VBD noticed_VBN on_IN the_DT general_JJ health_NN of_IN animals_NNS under_IN experiments_NNS ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN storage_NN on_IN the_DT com-_JJ position_NN and_CC keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN maize_NNS cake_VBP is_VBZ under_IN investigation_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Digestible_NNP coefficients_NNS of_IN maize_NNS cake_NNS have_VBP been_VBN determined_VBN ._.
It_PRP contains_VBZ higher_JJR total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS and_CC lower_JJR digestible_JJ protein_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO toria_NNS ,_, sarson_NN and_CC cotton_NN seed_NN cakes_NNS ._.

V_NNP ,_, 343-34_JJ SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP CONCEPTION_NNP RATES_NNP IN_NNP ARTIFICIALLY_NNP BRED_NNP COWS_NNP By_IN S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP ,_, Division_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 5_CD January_NNP 1953_CD )_) THE_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT seasonal_JJ trend_NN in_IN the_DT quality_NN and_CC quantity_NN of_IN semen_NNS produced_VBN by_IN bulls_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN by_IN many_JJ workers_NNS ._.
Erb_NNP ,_, Andrews_NNP and_CC Hilton_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP found_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ differences_NNS between_IN months_NNS in_IN respect_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT factors_NNS studied_VBD ._.
They_PRP observed_VBD that_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT semen_NNS produced_VBD during_IN the_DT spring_NN was_VBD significantly_RB superior_JJ to_TO that_DT produced_VBN during_IN the_DT summer_NN months_NNS ._.
Results_NNS similar_JJ in_IN a_DT large_JJ measure_NN to_TO those_DT of_IN Erb_NNP ,_, Andrews_NNP and_CC Hilton_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP were_VBD also_RB obtained_VBN by_IN Phillips_NNP ,_, et_VBZ al_NN ._.
[_NN 1943_CD ]_NN and_CC by_IN Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT former_JJ workers_NNS noted_VBD that_IN the_DT decrease_NN in_IN semen_JJ quality_NN during_IN summer_NN was_VBD reflected_VBN in_IN decreased_JJ breeding_NN efficiency_NN ._.
The_DT highest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN fertile_JJ matings_NNS (_( 69.6_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) occurred_VBD during_IN April_NNP and_CC the_DT lowest_JJS (_( 40.8_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) in_IN August_NNP ._.
Anderson_NNP [_NN 1945_CD ]_NN drew_VBD the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN 'there_EX is_VBZ a_DT seasonal_JJ similarity_NN between_IN semen_NNS quality_NN and_CC fertility_NN '_'' ._.
While_IN this_DT is_VBZ true_JJ in_IN free_JJ mating_NN populations_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ unlikely_JJ to_TO hold_VB good_JJ in_IN artificially_RB bred_VBN populations_NNS where_WRB each_DT sample_NN of_IN semen_NNS injected_VBN is_VBZ previously_RB tested_VBN for_IN quality_NN and_CC only_RB semen_NNS of_IN approved_JJ quality_NN is_VBZ generally_RB used_VBN ._.
Besides_NNS ,_, as_IN also_RB pointed_VBN out_RP by_IN Lasley_NNP and_CC Bogart_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP ,_, since_IN both_DT the_DT cow_NN and_CC the_DT bull_NN are_VBP involved_VBN in_IN fertility_NN ,_, the_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN of_IN it_PRP ,_, can_MD not_RB be_VB dependent_JJ entirely_RB on_IN the_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN ._.
Salisbury_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NN ,_, in_IN his_PRP$ studies_NNS on_IN feeding_VBG wheat_NN germ_JJ oil_NN as_IN a_DT supplement_NN to_TO the_DT normal_JJ rations_NNS of_IN bulls_NNS used_VBN for_IN artificial_JJ insemination_NN ,_, found_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN in_IN fertility_NN of_IN the_DT bulls_NNS from_IN month_NN to_TO month_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ interesting_VBG to_TO find_VB out_RP whether_IN any_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN conception_NN rates_NNS does_VBZ occur_VB in_IN any_DT unselected_JJ population_NN of_IN cows_NNS bred_VBN artificially_RB ,_, as_IN it_PRP has_VBZ a_DT special_JJ bearing_NN on_IN the_DT successful_JJ application_NN of_IN artificial_JJ insemination_NN on_IN a_DT large_JJ field_NN scale_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
Accord-_NNP ingly_RB ,_, the_DT relevant_JJ data_NNS ,_, from_IN the_DT records_NNS of_IN the_DT artificial_JJ insemination_NN centres_NNS run_VBN under_IN a_DT scheme_NN of_IN research_NN financed_VBN by_IN the_DT Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP were_VBD collected_VBN and_CC analysed_VBN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN ._.
DATA_NNP AND_NNP RESULTS_NNP For_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN this_DT study_NN calving_VBG data_NNS from_IN 2,596_CD inseminations_NNS performed_VBN at_IN the_DT Calcutta_NNP Artificial_NNP Insemination_NNP Centre_NNP and_CC 5,854_CD inseminations_NNS performed_VBN at_IN the_DT Patna_NNP Artificial_NNP Insemination_NNP Centre_NNP during_IN the_DT years_NNS 1946_CD to_TO 1948_CD were_VBD used_VBN ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT data_NNS collected_VBD during_IN 1947_CD and_CC 1948_CD (_( April_NNP to_TO December_NNP only_RB )_) at_IN the_DT Bangalore_NNP Artificial_NNP Insemination_NNP Centre_NNP ,_, comprising_VBG 1,284_CD inseminations_NNS ,_, was_VBD also_RB utilised_JJ ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN bulls_NNS involved_VBN was_VBD twenty_RB ._.
Since_IN no_DT purposeful_JJ selection_NN was_VBD made_VBN of_IN the_DT cows_NNS inseminated_VBD they_PRP were_VBD taken_VBN as_IN representing_VBG random_NN samples_NNS of_IN the_DT cow_NN populations_NNS in_IN the_DT areas_NNS concerned_VBN ._.
Details_NNS of_IN service_NN rates_NNS 129_CD 3_CD AR/53_NNP 10_CD 130_CD SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP CONCEPTION_NNP RATES_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.

In_IN this_DT study_NN ,_, the_DT actual_JJ figures_NNS used_VBN for_IN analysis_NN were_VBD number_NN of_IN services_NNS per_IN conception_NN obtained_VBN by_IN dividing_VBG the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN cows_NNS inseminated_VBN by_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN cows_NNS conceiving_VBG ._.

The_DT central_JJ purpose_NN of_IN the_DT study_NN was_VBD not_RB vitiated_VBN by_IN the_DT adoption_NN of_IN such_PDT a_DT procedure_NN ._.

Months_NNS 8_CD 0.4005_CD 0.0500_CD Years_NNS 1_CD 0.8277_CD 0.8277*_CD Months_NNS X_CD years_NNS (_( error_NN )_) 8_CD 0.7968_CD 0.0996_CD TOTAL_NN 17_CD 2.0250_CD *F.-ratio_JJ significant_JJ at_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN Table_NNP III_NNP also_RB shows_VBZ no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT month_NN to_TO month_NN conception_NN rates_NNS ,_, though_IN a_DT significant_JJ difference_NN ,_, is_VBZ found_VBN between_IN years_NNS ._.
CONCLUSION_NN It_PRP appears_VBZ from_IN our_PRP$ results_NNS that_IN no_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN conception_NN rates_NNS occurs_VBP in_IN animals_NNS artificially_RB inseminated_VBN ._.
The_DT year_NN to_TO year_NN and_CC centre_NN to_TO centre_VB significant_JJ differences_NNS are_VBP in_IN all_DT probability_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT acquisition_NN of_IN increased_VBN skill_NN by_IN the_DT operators_NNS coupled_VBD with_IN the_DT inherent_JJ initial_JJ difference_NN of_IN the_DT individual_NN operators_NNS and_CC the_DT speed_NN at_IN which_WDT they_PRP are_VBP able_JJ to_TO acquire_VB the_DT desired_JJ level_NN of_IN efficiency_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT conception_NN rates_NNS of_IN 2,596_CD and_CC 5,854_CD cows_NNS inseminated_VBN at_IN Calcutta_NNP and_CC Patna_NNP ,_, respectively_RB ,_, during_IN 1946_CD to_TO 1948_CD and_CC of_IN 1,284_CD cows_NNS inseminated_VBN at_IN Bangalore_NNP during_IN 1947_CD and_CC 1948_CD (_( only_RB April_NNP to_TO December_NNP figures_NNS in_IN both_DT years_NNS ,_, have_VBP been_VBN considered_VBN since_IN January_NNP to_TO March_NNP figures_NNS were_VBD missing_VBG for_IN the_DT year_NN 1947_CD )_) have_VBP been_VBN analysed_VBN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO detect_VB the_DT existence_NN of_IN seasonal_JJ trend_NN ,_, if_IN any_DT ._.
The_DT results_NNS failed_VBD to_TO bring_VB out_RP any_DT seasonal_JJ trend_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN interpreted_VBN as_IN due_JJ to_TO the_DT use_NN of_IN semen_NNS samples_NNS of_IN only_RB approved_VBN quality_NN for_IN insemination_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN case_NN of_IN the_DT Patna_NNP and_CC Calcutta_NNP artificial_JJ insemination_NN centres_NNS that_IN the_DT conception_NN rates_NNS differed_VBD significantly_RB ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT year_NN to_TO year_NN significant_JJ difference_NN also_RB ,_, which_WDT again_RB was_VBD different_JJ for_IN the_DT two_CD artificial_JJ insemination_NN centres_NNS ._.
A_DT year_NN to_TO year_NN significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN conception_NN rate_NN was_VBD also_RB observed_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN Bangalore_NNP Artificial_NNP Insemination_NNP Centre_NNP ._.
These_DT results_NNS were_VBD interpreted_VBN as_IN possibly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT acquisition_NN of_IN increased_JJ operative_JJ skill_NN by_IN the_DT artificial_JJ insemination_NN personnel_NNS June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 133_CD coupled_VBN with_IN their_PRP$ inherent_JJ initial_JJ difference_NN in_IN skill_NN and_CC the_DT subsequent_JJ speed_NN with_IN which_WDT they_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO attain_VB the_DT desired_JJ level_NN of_IN efficiency_NN ._.

108_CD ,_, 376-381_CD ,_, 31_CD THE_NNP paper_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN diagnosing_VBG Salmonella_NNP pullorum_NN and_CC Salo-_NNP monella_NN gallinarum_NN infection_NN by_IN thinly_RB plating_VBG a_DT clot_NN devoid_NN of_IN serum_NN from_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN infected_JJ birds_NNS on_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS medium_NN ._.
No_DT colonies_NNS develop_VBP on_IN plating_VBG with_IN whole_JJ blood_NN on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT bactericidal_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT serum_NN ._.
The_DT characteristics_NNS of_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN and_CC S._NNP pullorum_NN as_IN regards_NNS reaction_NN on_IN sugars_NNS ,_, pathogenicity_NN and_CC resistence_NN have_VBP been_VBN studied_VBN and_CC found_VBN to_TO resemble_VB each_DT other_JJ except_IN in_IN their_PRP$ reaction_NN on_IN maltose_NN which_WDT ,_, according_VBG to_TO the_DT author_NN is_VBZ not_RB sufficient_JJ basis_NN for_IN differentiation_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD ._.
The_DT above_JJ method_NN of_IN culture_NN is_VBZ suggested_VBN to_TO be_VB of_IN use_NN in_IN diagnosis_NN of_IN other_JJ bacteraemic_JJ diseases_NNS and_CC considered_VBN more_RBR reliable_JJ as_IN it_PRP avoids_VBZ variation_NN in_IN titre_NN ,_, agglutination_NN ,_, strains_NNS of_IN antigens_NNS and_CC suspicious_JJ reactions_NNS ._.

108_CD ,_, 298-306_CD THE_NNP paper_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT cardiac_JJ lesions_NNS produced_VBD due_JJ to_TO infection_NN of_IN T._NNP congolonse_NN and_CC T._NNP vivax_NN in_IN six_CD Guernseys_NNP and_CC 21_CD Zebus_NNP ._.
The_DT condition_NN in_IN the_DT heart_NN has_VBZ been_VBN referred_VBN to_TO as_IN '_'' a_DT secondary_JJ stage_NN of_IN trypanosomiasis_NN '_POS ._.
The_DT heart_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT main_JJ seat_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, even_RB in_IN cases_NNS where_WRB there_EX was_VBD no_DT general_JJ invasion_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN ;_: while_IN in_IN the_DT other_JJ organs_NNS such_JJ as_IN adrenals_NNS ,_, hameo-_JJ lymph_NN glands_NNS ,_, kidneys_NNS ,_, livers_NNS ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS and_CC spleens_NNS ,_, the_DT trypano-_JJ somes_NNS were_VBD found_VBN only_RB sporadically_RB ._.
The_DT infected_JJ heart_NN muscles_NNS showed_VBD necrosis_NN ,_, disintegration_NN of_IN muscle_NN fibres_NNS ,_, round_NN cell_NN infiltration_NN ,_, extreme_JJ capillary_JJ dilation_NN ,_, separation_NN of_IN fibres_NNS and_CC atrophy_NN ._.
Normal_JJ crypanosomes_NNS were_VBD also_RB observed_VBN in_IN capillaries_NNS of_IN cardiac_JJ muscle_NN ,_, though_RB mostly_RB degenerated_VBN trypanosomes_NNS were_VBD found_VBN ._.
These_DT were_VBD not_RB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT development_NN forms_NNS or_CC latent_JJ bodies_NNS ._.
This_DT fact_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, is_VBZ not_RB given_VBN as_IN proof_NN for_IN non-existence_NN of_IN latent_JJ bodies_NNS in_IN vertebrates_NNS ,_, on_IN account_NN of_IN all_DT organs_NNS not_RB having_VBG been_VBN examined_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN such_JJ severe_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT heart_NN cause_NN death_NN in_IN certain_JJ cases_NNS due_JJ to_TO direct_JJ failure_NN of_IN heart_NN action_NN ._.

108_CD ,_, 418-431_CD THE_DT paper_NN details_NNS experiments_NNS for_IN finding_VBG out_RP suitable_JJ disinfectants_NNS to_TO destroy_VB Salmonella_NNP organisms_NNS on_IN egg_NN shells_NNS ._.
Eggs_NNS were_VBD inoculated_VBN by_IN dropping_VBG over_RP them_PRP an_DT 18_CD hour_NN culture_NN of_IN Salmonella_NNP pullorum_NN containing_VBG about_IN ten_CD million_CD organisms_NNS ._.
Treatment_NN with_IN disinfectant_NN followed_VBD and_CC organisms_NNS ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, were_VBD recovered_VBN on_IN Selenite_NNP '_POS F_NNP '_POS medium_NN incubated_VBD for_IN 18_CD hours_NNS at_IN 37°C_CD and_CC later_RB identified_VBN ._.
Egg_NN dipping_VBG for_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS in_IN solutions_NNS of_IN 0.2_CD per_IN cent_NN sodium_NN salt_NN of_IN para-_JJ toluesulphono-chloramide_NN (_( Chloramine_NNP T_NNP )_) ,_, 1.8_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN sodium_NN hypochlorite_NN (_( Deosan_NNP )_) ,_, 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN cetylthrimethyl_NN ammonium_NN bromide_NN (_( Cetavlon_NNP )_) and_CC 1.5_CD per_IN cent_NN chlorometa_NN xylenol_NNP (_( Dettol_NNP )_) heated_VBD to_TO 25°C_CD was_VBD found_VBN effective_JJ in_IN killing_VBG Salmonella_NNP pullorum_NN while_IN dips_NNS with_IN lower_JJR temperature_NN than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT egg_NN were_VBD ineffective_JJ ._.
Addition_NN of_IN a_DT detergent_NN in_IN the_DT former_JJ two_CD enhanced_VBD their_PRP$ action_NN ._.
0.4_CD per_IN cent_NN solution_NN of_IN para-toluesulphonochloramide_JJ plus_CC detergent_JJ retained_VBD its_PRP$ ability_NN to_TO kill_VB Salmonella_NNP pullorum_NN to_TO a_DT maximum_NN of_IN 46_CD immersions_NNS ._.
Salmonella_NNP thompson_NN and_CC Solmonella_NNP typhimurium_NN were_VBD found_VBN more_RBR resistant_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN the_DT disinfectants_NNS tested_VBN ._.
Dipping_VBG eggs_NNS in_IN solutions_NNS of_IN double_JJ the_DT strength_NN of_IN various_JJ disinfectants_NNS required_VBN to_TO kill_VB Salmonella_NNP organisms_NNS did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT adverse_JJ effect_NN on_IN hatchability_NN ._.
These_DT disinfectants_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, did_VBD not_RB improve_VB the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN eggs_NNS by_IN controlling_VBG egg-rots_NNS ._.

33_CD ,_, 473-485_JJ IN_NNP order_NN to_TO find_VB out_RP if_IN different_JJ levels_NNS of_IN crude_NN fibre_NN in_IN the_DT feed_NN of_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS have_VBP any_DT influence_NN on_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC also_RB its_PRP$ optimum_JJ level_NN for_IN maximum_JJ yield_NN a_DT feeding_JJ experiment_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS of_IN Holstein-Friesian_JJ breed_NN ._.
Except_IN for_IN fibre_NN ,_, other_JJ nutritive_JJ factors_NNS (_( digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC T._NNP D._NNP N._NNP )_) were_VBD kept_VBN alike_RB in_IN the_DT different_JJ rations_NNS ._.
A_DT sufficient_JJ supply_NN of_IN vitamin_NN and_CC minerals_NNS were_VBD also_RB provided_VBN ._.
Four_CD different_JJ rations_NNS were_VBD tried_VBN ,_, viz_NN ._.
A_DT with_IN 60_CD lb_NN ._.
mature_NN Napier_NNP grass_NN (_( Pennisetum_NNP purpureum_NN )_) ,_, B_NNP with_IN 40_CD lb_NN ._.
Napier_NNP grass_NN ,_, C_NNP with_IN 20_CD lb_NN ._.
Napier_NNP grass_NN and_CC D_NNP with_IN no_DT Napier_NNP grass_NN ._.
The_DT protein_NN and_CC T._NNP D._NNP N._NNP needed_VBD to_TO balance_VB the_DT rations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN up_IN of_IN pine_NN apple_NN bran_NN ,_, soyabean_JJ oil_NN meal_NN ,_, fish_JJ meal_NN and_CC molasses_NNS ._.
The_DT crude_NN fibre_NN contents_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT different_JJ rations_NNS on_IN dry_JJ matter_NN basis_NN were_VBD :_: A_NNP ,_, 22.7_CD per_IN cent_NN ;_: B_NNP ,_, 19.6_CD per_IN cent_NN ;_: C_NNP ,_, 16.1_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC D_NNP ,_, 12.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN crude_NN fibre_NN in_IN the_DT rations_NNS tested_VBN had_VBD a_DT definite_JJ influence_NN upon_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC the_DT effect_NN of_IN its_PRP$ level_NN was_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ ,_, statistically_RB ._.
The_DT milk_NN yield_NN definitely_RB decreased_VBD as_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT crude_NN fibre_NN content_NN in_IN the_DT feed_NN increased_VBD over_IN 16_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, calculated_VBN on_IN the_DT dry_JJ matter_NN basis_NN ,_, regardless_RB of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN equal_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN T._NNP D._NNP N._NNP and_CC digestible_JJ protein_NN were_VBD fed_VBN ._.
June_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN ABSTRACTS_NNP 137_CD The_DT average_JJ daily_JJ yield_NN of_IN 4_CD per_IN cent_NN F._NNP C._NNP M._NNP per_IN cow_NN for_IN 12_CD weeks_NNS was_VBD 20.6_CD lb_NN ._.
on_IN ration_NN A_NNP ,_, 21.7_CD lb_NN ._.
on_IN ration_NN B_NNP ,_, 23.4_CD lb_NN ._.
on_IN ration_NN C_NNP and_CC 23.8_CD lb_NN ._.
on_IN ration_NN D._NNP Pulse_NNP rates_NNS per_IN minute_NN for_IN cows_NNS with_IN no_DT roughage_NN were_VBD 62_CD and_CC increased_VBD to_TO 69_CD with_IN roughage_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, for_IN high_JJ milk_NN production_NN ,_, the_DT crude_NN fibre_JJ level_NN in_IN the_DT feed_NN should_MD not_RB exceed_VB 16_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT dry_JJ matter_NN of_IN the_DT ration_NN ._.
This_DT holds_VBZ true_JJ for_IN feeds_NNS such_JJ as_IN mature_NN Napier_NNP grass_NN and_CC pine_NN apple_NN bran_NN as_IN major_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT rations_NNS ._.

6_CD ,_, 4_CD THE_NNP effect_NN of_IN supplements_NNS of_IN a_DT mixed_JJ ration_NN for_IN sheep_NN was_VBD studied_VBN ,_, using_VBG five_CD sheep_JJ in_IN each_DT treatment_NN ._.
Supplements_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN in_IN two_CD different_JJ quantities_NNS ,_, representing_VBG crude_NN fibre_NN ,_, ether_CC extract_NN ,_, protein_NN ,_, carbohydrate_NN and_CC urea_JJ respectively_RB ._.
By_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN crude_NN fibre_VBP the_DT total_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN protein_NN and_CC ether_NN extract_NN digested_VBN were_VBD reduced_VBN while_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN carbohydrate_NN reduced_VBD the_DT digestible_JJ crude_NN fibre_NN and_CC digestible_JJ protein_NN ._.
The_DT addition_NN of_IN casein_NN increased_VBD the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN protein_NN ,_, ether_CC extract_NN and_CC energy_NN and_CC decreased_VBD the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN the_DT crude_NN fibre_NN and_CC nitrogen-free_JJ extract_NN ._.
Urea_NNP significantly_RB increased_VBD the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN protein_NN ,_, while_IN corn_NN oil_NN ,_, in_IN small_JJ amounts_NNS ,_, increased_VBD the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN each_DT feed_NN constituent_NN ._.
When_WRB a_DT larger_JJR amount_NN of_IN corn_NN oil_NN was_VBD given_VBN ,_, the_DT effect_NN was_VBD just_RB the_DT reverse_NN ._.
[_JJ K._NNP C._NNP ]_NNP Surface_NNP active_JJ agents_NNS as_IN growth_NN stimulators_NNS in_IN chick_JJ rations_NNS ._.

8_CD ,_, 2_CD ,_, 133-144_JJ RESULTS_NNP of_IN experiments_NNS on_IN 108_CD experimental_JJ groups_NNS ,_, which_WDT included_VBD 3,500_CD chicks_NNS ,_, showed_VBD positive_JJ growth_NN responses_NNS in_IN which_WDT surfactants_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN ._.
Of_IN the_DT surfactants_NNS reported_VBD ,_, lauryl_JJ ethylene_NN oxide_JJ condensate_NN ,_, sodium_NN ethylene_NN diamine_NN tetra_JJ acetic_JJ acid_NN ,_, quaternary_JJ ammonium_NN compounds_NNS ,_, sodium_NN alkyl_NN aryl_NN sulfanate_NN and_CC certain_JJ specially_RB formulated_VBN products_NNS gave_VBD the_DT best_JJS growth_NN stimulating_VBG effect_NN in_IN market_NN weight_NN comparisons_NNS ._.
A_DT very_RB high_JJ degree_NN of_IN correlation_NN was_VBD noted_VBN bet-_JJ ween_IN the_DT growth_NN response_NN on_IN the_DT surfactants_NNS and_CC antibiotics_NNS ._.
This_DT observation_NN added_VBD weight_NN to_TO the_DT hypothesis_NN that_IN the_DT two_CD products_NNS react_VBP similarly_RB on_IN chicks_NNS ._.
A_DT total_NN of_IN 21_CD tests_NNS showed_VBD that_IN vitamin_NN B12_NNP supplements_NNS were_VBD more_RBR effective_JJ as_IN the_DT lone_NN supplement_NN to_TO all_DT vegetable_JJ basal_NN diets_NNS than_IN either_DT surfactants_NNS or_CC anti-_JJ biotics_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ of_IN interest_NN to_TO note_VB that_IN chicks_NNS fed_VBN on_IN all_DT vegetable_JJ basal_JJ diets_NNS supple-_JJ mented_VBN with_IN vitamin_NN B12_NNP showed_VBD remarkable_JJ growth_NN increases_NNS during_IN the_DT early_JJ weeks_NNS ,_, whereas_NNS with_IN surfactant_NN or_CC antibiotics_NNS ,_, growth_NN improvement_NN over_IN the_DT control_NN lots_NNS was_VBD shown_VBN only_RB after_IN the_DT sixth_JJ or_CC seventh_JJ week_NN ._.
Two_CD theories_NNS have_VBP been_VBN proposed_VBN concerning_VBG the_DT mode_NN of_IN action_NN of_IN surfactants_NNS in_IN stimulating_JJ growth_NN ._.
These_DT are_VBP (_( 1_CD )_) selective_JJ inhibition_NN of_IN non-coli-aerogenes_JJ bacteria_NNS in_IN the_DT intestine_NN of_IN the_DT chick_NN and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) more_RBR rapid_JJ assimilation_NN of_IN nutritional_JJ factors_NNS from_IN the_DT intestine_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT wetting_VBG properties_NNS of_IN surfactants_NNS ._.

90-98_CD DATA_NNP are_VBP presented_VBN from_IN recent_JJ experiments_NNS conducted_VBN by_IN the_DT authors_NNS in_IN Eng-_NNP land_NN on_IN the_DT preservation_NN of_IN bull_JJ semen_NNS in_IN solid_JJ carbon_NN dioxide_NN at_IN 79°C_CD ._.
Survi-_JJ val_NN of_IN bull_NN spermatozoa_NN at_IN low_JJ temperatures_NNS depended_VBN on_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN glycerol_NN to_TO the_DT diluent_NN so_RB as_IN to_TO get_VB a_DT 10_CD per_IN cent_NN concentration_NN in_IN the_DT diluted_JJ semen_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN dilution_NN is_VBZ best_RB carried_VBN out_RP at_IN 5°C_CD ._.
Before_IN freezing_NN ,_, the_DT semen_NNS samples_NNS are_VBP allowed_VBN to_TO remain_VB for_IN 12_CD to_TO ._.
20_CD hours_NNS at_IN 5°C_CD and_CC subsequent_JJ cooling_NN is_VBZ done_VBN upto_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN -15°C_NN at_IN a_DT rate_NN not_RB exceeding_VBG 20_CD per_IN minute_NN and_CC thereafter_RB at_IN a_DT quicker_NN rate_NN ._.
Eighty_NNP per_IN cent_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ thus_RB frozen_RB resumed_VBN motility_NN when_WRB thawed_VBN at_IN 40°C_CD ._.
Thirty-eight_JJ cows_NNS inseminated_VBN with_IN frozen_JJ semen_NNS gave_VBD a_DT concep-_JJ tion_NN rate_NN of_IN 79_CD per_JJ cent_NN as_IN against_IN 76_CD per_IN cent_NN obtained_VBN from_IN unfrozen_JJ samples_NNS ._.
Pregnancies_NNS have_VBP been_VBN obtained_VBN with_IN frozen_JJ semen_NNS 'banked_VBD '_'' for_IN 20_CD weeks_NNS ._.
The_DT possible_JJ use_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ method_NN of_IN semen_NNS preservation_NN in_IN artificial_JJ insemination_NN work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN discussed_VBN ._.

TABLE_NNP II_NNP Scheme_NNP of_IN feeding_VBG fodders_NNS Names_NNP of_IN cows_NNS Period_NNP I_PRP Period_NNP II_NNP Period_NNP III_NNP Period_NNP IV_NNP A_NNP B_NNP C_NNP D_NNP Lenjurki_NNP (_( 732_CD )_) Unmanured_VBD berseem_NN Manured_NNP *_NNP beraeem_VBP Lucerne_NNP Jowar_NNP silage_NN plus_CC lucerne_JJ hay_NN B_NNP C_NNP D_NNP A_NNP Larajbani_NNP (_( 932_CD )_) Manured*_NNP berseem_VBP Lucerne_NNP Jowar_NNP silage_NN plus_CC lucerne_JJ hay_NN Unmanured_NNP berseem_VBP C_NNP D_NNP A_NNP B_NNP Haskila_NNP (_( 955_CD )_) Lucerne_NNP Jowar_NNP silage_NN plus_CC lucerne_JJ hay_NN Unmanured_NNP berseem_NN Manured_NNP berseem*_NN D_NNP A_NNP B_NNP C_NNP Yulamati_NNP (_( 966_CD )_) Jowar_NNP silage_NN lucerne_JJ hay_NN Unmanured_NNP berseem_NN Manured*_NNP berseem_VBP Lucerne_NNP *_NNP Manured_NNP with_IN four_CD maunds_NNS of_IN ammonium_NN phosphate_NN per_IN acre_JJ September_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN M._NNP L._NNP MATHUR_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP V._NNP DESAI_NNP 145_CD In_IN addition_NN to_TO these_DT fodders_NNS ,_, small_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN bhusa_NN (_( wheat_JJ straw_NN )_) ,_, varying_VBG from_IN 2_CD to_TO 4_CD pounds_NNS per_IN animal_NN was_VBD also_RB given_VBN to_TO these_DT animals_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN that_IN these_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS ,_, along_IN with_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT herd_NN ,_, were_VBD being_VBG fed_VBN this_DT concentrate_NN mixture_NN and_CC these_DT fodders_NNS for_IN the_DT last_JJ five_CD or_CC six_CD months_NNS ._.
At_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN ,_, these_DT four_CD animals_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN for_IN the_DT metabolic_JJ trial_NN and_CC the_DT fodders_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN singly_RB according_VBG to_TO Table_NNP II_NNP ._.
Thus_RB the_DT animals_NNS adopting_VBG them-_JJ selves_NNS to_TO a_DT new_JJ feed_NN was_VBD not_RB a_DT factor_NN in_IN these_DT results_NNS ._.
During_IN each_DT period_NN one_CD fodder_NN was_VBD given_VBN except_IN in_IN case_NN of_IN jowar_NN silage_NN which_WDT was_VBD supplemented_VBN with_IN one_CD to_TO four_CD pounds_NNS of_IN lucerne_JJ hay_NN ;_: thus_RB ,_, jowar_JJ silage_NN remained_VBD the_DT principal_JJ fodder_NN ._.
Each_DT experimental_JJ day_NN began_VBD at_IN 8_CD a.m._NN and_CC ended_VBD at_IN 8_CD a.m._RB on_IN next_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT rations_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN four_CD times_NNS a_DT day_NN ._.
Each_DT day_NN 's_POS grain_NN mixture_NN was_VBD thoroughly_RB mixed_JJ and_CC weighed_JJ amounts_NNS were_VBD put_VBN before_IN the_DT cows_NNS just_RB before_IN milking_VBG ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN the_DT cows_NNS consumed_VBD all_PDT the_DT grain_NN mixture_NN without_IN any_DT waste_NN except_IN occasionally_RB when_WRB some_DT cow_NN left_VBD a_DT little_JJ quantity_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD removed_VBN immediately_RB and_CC reweighed_VBD ._.
The_DT fodders_NNS required_VBN for_IN the_DT day_NN were_VBD out_RB in_IN the_DT fields_NNS and_CC brought_VBD to_TO the_DT dairy_NN buildings_NNS ,_, when_WRB samples_NNS for_IN analysis_NN were_VBD taken_VBN ._.
Weighed_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN fodders_NNS were_VBD placed_VBN before_IN the_DT cows_NNS ._.
These_DT were_VBD generally_RB consumed_VBN ,_, but_CC small_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN residues_NNS when_WRB left_VBN were_VBD accounted_VBN for_IN ._.
The_DT appetite_NN of_IN the_DT cows_NNS were_VBD keen_JJ and_CC at_IN no_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN impaired_VBN and_CC they_PRP did_VBD not_RB suffer_VB from_IN constipation_NN ._.
Water_NNP was_VBD given_VBN at_IN definite_JJ times_NNS in_IN buckets_NNS and_CC the_DT amounts_NNS taken_VBN were_VBD recorded_VBN ._.
The_DT cows_NNS were_VBD milked_VBN four_CD times_NNS a_DT day_NN at_IN 3_CD a.m._RB ,_, 8_CD a.m._NN ,_, 3_CD p.m._NN and_CC 8_CD p.m_NN ._.

A_DT composite_JJ sample_NN of_IN the_DT days_NNS milk_NN was_VBD prepared_VBN by_IN taking_VBG 5_CD c.c_NN ._.
per_IN pound_NN ._.

Out_IN of_IN the_DT twelve_JJ days_NNS of_IN each_DT period_NN ,_, the_DT first_JJ six_CD days_NNS were_VBD non-experimental_JJ and_CC the_DT second_JJ six_CD days_NNS experimental_JJ or_CC collection_JJ period_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT non-experi-_JJ mental_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT cows_NNS were_VBD given_VBN experimental_JJ fodder_NN and_CC grain_NN mixture_NN so_IN that_IN they_PRP adapted_VBD themselves_PRP to_TO the_DT new_JJ fodder_NN and_CC eliminated_VBD the_DT carryover_NN effect_NN of_IN the_DT previous_JJ fodder_NN from_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT collection_NN period_NN an_DT accurate_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT amounts_NNS of_IN feed_NN given_VBN ,_, the_DT quantities_NNS of_IN milk_NN secreted_VBN and_CC of_IN the_DT faeces_NNS and_CC urine_NN voided_VBD each_DT day_NN was_VBD kept_VBN ,_, and_CC samples_NNS taken_VBN for_IN analysis_NN ._.

DESAI_NNP 167_CD TABLE_NNP XXVIII_NNP Balance_NNP of_IN K2O_NNP in_IN different_JJ fodders_NNS Treatments_NNS Balance_NNP of_IN K2O_NNP Unmanured_NNP berseem_VBD 9.90_CD Manured_NNP berseem_VBD 0.72_CD Lucerne_NNP 10.16_CD Jowar_NNP silage_NN 10.77_CD The_DT analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN of_IN average_JJ balance_NN of_IN K2O_NNP showed_VBD that_IN fodders_NNS ,_, cows_NNS and_CC periods_NNS were_VBD not_RB significant_JJ at_IN five_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN and_CC the_DT error_NN was_VBD high_JJ ._.
SODIUM_NN :_: POTASSIUM_NNP RATIO_NNP The_DT importance_NN of_IN sodium_NN :_: potassium_NN ratio_NN in_IN influencing_VBG the_DT assimilation_NN of_IN these_DT elements_NNS ,_, specially_RB sodium_NN ,_, has_VBZ received_VBN some_DT recognition_NN for_IN some_DT time_NN past_NN ._.

Bunge_NNP [_NN 1873_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN an_DT excessive_JJ ingestion_NN of_IN potassium_NN salts_NNS cause_VBP an_DT elimination_NN of_IN sodium_NN and_CC chlorine_NN ._.
The_DT farm_NN animals_NNS generally_RB take_VBP large_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN green_JJ forage_NN which_WDT contains_VBZ little_JJ of_IN sodium_NN and_CC more_JJR of_IN potassium_NN ._.
Thus_RB the_DT intake_NN of_IN potassium_NN is_VBZ high_JJ and_CC that_IN of_IN sodium_NN less_CC ,_, resulting_VBG in_IN an_DT unbalanced_JJ Na_NN :_: K_NNP ratio_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ of_IN importance_NN in_IN practical_JJ feeding_NN of_IN farm_NN animals_NNS ,_, because_IN a_DT depletion_NN of_IN sodium_NN and_CC chlorine_NN tend_VBP to_TO react_VB unfavourably_RB on_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
Hart_NNP ,_, et_RB al_NN ._.
[_NN 1911_CD ]_NN ,_, have_VBP however_RB shown_VBN that_IN Bunge_NNP 's_POS theory_NN was_VBD not_RB complete_JJ ._.

SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.

unmanured_JJ berseem_NN ,_, manured_VBD berseem_NN ,_, green_JJ lucerne_NN and_CC jowar_JJ silage_NN plus_CC lucerne_JJ hay_NN with_IN supplements_NNS of_IN chalk_NN and_CC salt_NN ,_, on_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN ,_, its_PRP$ composition_NN and_CC mineral_JJ reten-_JJ tion_NN in_IN four_CD high_JJ milk_NN yielding_VBG sahiwal_JJ cows_NNS was_VBD conducted_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT four_CD fodders_NNS and_CC the_DT mineral_JJ supplements_NNS did_VBD not_RB bring_VB about_IN any_DT significant_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT live_JJ weights_NNS and_CC milk_NN yields_NNS of_IN the_DT cows_NNS during_IN the_DT seven_CD weeks_NNS of_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT mineral_JJ composition_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN was_VBD not_RB influenced_VBN by_IN the_DT feeding_NN of_IN fodders_NNS which_WDT were_VBD rich_NNS in_IN some_DT and_CC poor_JJ in_IN other_JJ elements_NNS ._.
4_CD ._.

5_CD ._.
The_DT fodders_NNS were_VBD significantly_RB different_JJ amongst_NN themselves_PRP in_IN affording_VBG mineral_JJ assimilation_NN ._.
6_CD ._.
The_DT legume_JJ fodders_NNS like_IN berseem_NN and_CC lucerne_NN are_VBP three_CD times_NNS richer_RB in_IN calcium_NN contents_NNS than_IN the_DT non-legume_JJ fodder_NN like_IN jowar_JJ silage_NN ._.
The_DT sodium_NN contents_NNS of_IN manured_JJ and_CC unmanured_JJ berseem_NN are_VBP about_IN ten_JJ times_NNS higher_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN green_JJ lucerne_NN ,_, lucerne_JJ hay_NN and_CC jowar_JJ silage_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT chlorine_NN contents_NNS are_VBP only_RB twice_RB as_RB high_JJ ._.
September_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN M.A_NNP ._.

9_CD ._.

10_CD ._.
