Extra_NNP sodium_NN chloride_NN ,_, according_VBG to_TO the_DT needs_NNS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS whether_IN growing_VBG or_CC milch_JJ cattle_NNS ,_, is_VBZ also_RB provided_VBN as_IN salt_NN licks_NNS or_CC half_NN to_TO one_CD ounce_NN mixed_NN in_IN the_DT concentrate_NN feed_NN ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN sulphur_NN is_VBZ adjusted_VBN according_VBG to_TO the_DT sulphur_NN contents_NNS of_IN the_DT ration_NN and_CC common_JJ salt_NN substituted_VBN in_IN its_PRP$ place_NN ._.
December_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN M.L_NNP ._.
MATHUR_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP V._NNP DESAI_NNP 241_CD This_DT mixture_NN may_MD be_VB fed_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN one_CD ounce_NN per_IN day_NN in_IN case_NN of_IN growing_VBG animals_NNS and_CC two_CD ounces_NNS per_IN day_NN or_CC one_CD to_TO two_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT dairy_NN mixture_NN in_IN case_NN of_IN lactating_VBG animals_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_JJ composition_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN in_IN high_JJ ,_, medium_NN and_CC low_JJ milking_NN cows_NNS from_IN the_DT pre-calving_JJ period_NN to_TO the_DT end_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, with_IN reference_NN to_TO any_DT possible_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ feeds_NNS on_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN studied_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT curves_NNS for_IN CaO_NNP and_CC P2O5_NNP percentage_NN for_IN thirteen_JJ cows_NNS from_IN pre-calving_JJ period_NN to_TO the_DT end_NN of_IN lactation_NN have_VBP been_VBN shown_VBN on_IN photographs_NN ._.
These_DT indicated_VBD that_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT age_NN ,_, breed_NN ,_, individuality_NN and_CC state_NN of_IN health_NN and_CC the_DT time_NN in_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN lactation_NN of_IN the_DT cow_NN ._.
The_DT mineral_JJ contents_NNS of_IN the_DT ration_NN did_VBD not_RB directly_RB effect_NN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN in_IN a_DT definite_JJ way_NN though_IN it_PRP may_MD effect_NN the_DT retention_NN of_IN the_DT minerals_NNS by_IN the_DT cows_NNS ._.
Similarly_RB fresh_JJ green_JJ fodder_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO silage_VB or_CC hay_VB prepared_VBN out_IN of_IN them_PRP ,_, may_MD effect_NN the_DT assimilation_NN of_IN the_DT minerals_NNS from_IN them_PRP ,_, but_CC not_RB the_DT composition_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN contents_NNS of_IN the_DT milk_NN were_VBD lower_JJR during_IN the_DT flush_JJ period_NN than_IN in_IN other_JJ period_NN of_IN lactation_NN after_IN calving_VBG ._.
4_CD ._.
Negative_JJ calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN balances_NNS in_IN high_JJ milking_NN cows_NNS were_VBD indicated_VBN after_IN two_CD weeks_NNS of_IN calving_VBG and_CC were_VBD maintained_VBN for_IN twenty_NN to_TO thirty_VB weeks_NNS of_IN lacata-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT storage_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN was_VBD possible_JJ as_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT milk_NN production_NN decreased_VBD to_TO less_JJR than_IN fifteen_JJ pounds_NNS per_IN day_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT group_NN of_IN cows_NNS of_IN low_JJ milking_VBG capacities_NNS giving_VBG about_IN 4,500_CD pounds_NNS for_IN the_DT whole_JJ lactation_NN also_RB lost_VBD calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN during_IN the_DT flush_JJ period_NN when_WRB the_DT daily_JJ milk_NN yield_NN was_VBD about_IN 25_CD pounds_NNS ._.
6_CD ._.
Seventy-five_JJ grams_NNS of_IN CaO_NNP and_CC 80_CD gm_NN ._.
P2O5_NNP were_VBD the_DT minimum_JJ amounts_NNS necessary_JJ in_IN the_DT feed_NN of_IN average_JJ milking_JJ cows_NNS giving_VBG about_IN 20_CD pounds_NNS milk_JJ per_IN day_NN to_TO avoid_VB losses_NNS of_IN these_DT minerals_NNS ._.
ACKNOWLEDGMENT_IN The_DT authors_NNS are_VBP grateful_JJ to_TO Mr._NNP C._NNP H._NNP Parr_NNP ,_, then_RB Imperial_NNP Agriculturist_NNP and_CC Mr._NNP N._NNP P._NNP Fernendez_NNP ,_, Cattle_NNP Superintendent_NNP ,_, for_IN giving_VBG facilities_NNS to_TO conduct_VB the_DT experiments_NNS in_IN his_PRP$ Division_NN and_CC for_IN taking_VBG keen_JJ interest_NN in_IN the_DT work_NN ._.
REFERENCES_NNP Desai_NNP ,_, S._NNP V._NNP and_CC Mathur_NNP ,_, M._NNP L._NNP (_( 1945_CD )_) ._.

23_CD ,_, 143-172_JJ ASSIMILATION_NNP OF_NNP PHYTIN_NNP PHOSPHORUS_NNP BY_NNP DAIRY_NNP COWS_NNP By_IN M._NNP L._NNP MATHUR_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD January_NNP ,_, 1951_CD )_) It_PRP has_VBZ long_RB been_VBN known_VBN that_IN a_DT large_JJ part_NN of_IN organic_JJ phosphorus_NN of_IN cereals_NNS and_CC cakes_NNS which_WDT are_VBP the_DT principal_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN concentrate_NN mixtures_NNS usually_RB fed_VBP to_TO cows_NNS ,_, occurs_VBZ in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN (_( inositolhexaphosphoric_JJ acid_NN )_) or_CC phytin_NN which_WDT is_VBZ calcium_JJ magnesium_NN salt_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Starkenstein_NNP [_JJ 1910_CD ]_NN and_CC Plimmer_NNP [_NNP 1913_CD ]_WDT were_VBD the_DT earliest_JJS workers_NNS ,_, who_WP provided_VBD evidence_NN ,_, that_WDT phytin_VBD when_WRB fed_VBN to_TO animals_NNS ,_, was_VBD not_RB directly_RB absorbed_VBN from_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN ,_, but_CC was_VBD simply_RB hydrolysed_VBN by_IN bacterial_JJ action_NN ._.
Rather_RB [_JJ 1918_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN almost_RB all_DT phytin_JJ phosphorus_NN fed_VBN to_TO pigs_NNS was_VBD hydrolysed_VBN and_CC excreted_VBN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN orthophosphoric_JJ acid_NN ._.
Bruce_NNP and_CC Callow_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN phytin_NN phosphorus_NN which_WDT was_VBD about_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN rats_NNS was_VBD not_RB available_JJ to_TO them_PRP ._.
McCance_NN and_CC Widdowson_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN 20_CD to_TO 60_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT phytin_NN fed_NN to_TO human_JJ beings_NNS was_VBD excreted_VBN unchanged_JJ in_IN the_DT faeces_NNS ._.
They_PRP suggested_VBD that_IN the_DT rest_NN may_MD also_RB have_VB been_VBN unabsorbed_JJ and_CC present_JJ in_IN other_JJ forms_NNS in_IN the_DT faeces_NNS ._.
Young_NNP ,_, Gregory_NNP and_CC Vere_NNP Jones_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN part_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN phosphorus_NN was_VBD hydrolysed_VBN in_IN the_DT stomach_NN of_IN rabbits_NNS and_CC excreted_VBD as_IN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN ._.
Low_NNP and_CC Steenbook_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP also_RB found_VBD that_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN was_VBD partially_RB available_JJ to_TO rats_VB on_IN a_DT low_JJ calcium_NN ration_NN but_CC the_DT addition_NN of_IN calcium_NN carbonate_NN makes_VBZ it_PRP almost_RB completely_RB unavailable_JJ ._.
Kreigher_NNP and_CC Steenbook_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP also_RB confirmed_VBD that_IN increase_NN of_IN Ca/P_NNP ratio_NN from_IN 1:1_CD to_TO 2:1_CD decreased_VBN the_DT availability_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN phosphorus_NN ._.
It_PRP seemed_VBD desirable_JJ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, to_TO study_VB the_DT metabolism_NN of_IN phytin_NN phosphorus_NN in_IN milch_NN cows_NNS ._.
Generally_RB about_IN 80_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT P2O5_NNP in_IN the_DT rations_NNS of_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS ,_, is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN the_DT concentrated_JJ feed_NN ;_: and_CC more_JJR than_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN this_DT is_VBZ phytin_JJ phosphorus_NN ._.
It_PRP would_MD therefore_RB be_VB of_IN great_JJ advantage_NN to_TO know_VB (_( a_DT )_) how_WRB far_RB this_DT amount_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN present_NN in_IN the_DT concentrated_JJ feed_NN met_VBD the_DT requirements_NNS of_IN the_DT animal_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) whether_IN it_PRP was_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO add_VB more_JJR phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN mineral_JJ salts_NNS in_IN the_DT diet_NN or_CC improve_VB the_DT fodder_NN by_IN manuring_VBG it_PRP and_CC (_( c_NN )_) the_DT influence_NN of_IN calcium_NN carbonate_NN on_IN the_DT assimilation_NN of_IN phytin_NN phosphorus_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Four_NNP high_JJ milking_NN Sahiwal_NNP cows_NNS of_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ age_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT same_JJ stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN were_VBD selected_VBN ._.
All_PDT the_DT cows_NNS received_VBD the_DT same_JJ concentrated_JJ feed_NN in_IN different_JJ quantities_NNS according_VBG to_TO its_PRP$ requirements_NNS and_CC fodders_NNS ad_NN lib_NN ._.
according_VBG to_TO the_DT latin_JJ square_NN as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Table_JJ 1_CD ._.
Small_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN wheat_NN straw_NN (_( 2_CD to_TO 4_CD lb_NN ._. )_)
were_VBD also_RB given_VBN to_TO avoid_VB loose_JJ faeces_NNS by_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT 12_CD days_NNS of_IN each_DT period_NN ,_, the_DT first_JJ six_CD days_NNS were_VBD non-experimental_JJ and_CC remaining_VBG six_CD days_NNS experimental_RB ,_, when_WRB accurate_JJ account_NN of_IN feed_NN consumed_VBN and_CC 7_CD AR/53_NNP 243_CD 5_CD 244_CD ASSIMILATION_NNP OF_NNP PHYTIN_NNP PHOSPHORUS_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, faeces_NNS voided_VBD was_VBD kept_VBN ._.
Each_DT experimental_JJ day_NN began_VBD at_IN 8_CD a.m._NN and_CC ended_VBD at_IN 8_CD a.m._NN on_IN the_DT next_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN four_CD times_NNS in_IN 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN milking_NN ._.
Each_DT morning_NN ,_, the_DT faeces_NNS were_VBD weighed_VBN ,_, thoroughly_RB mixed_JJ and_CC samples_NNS taken_VBN for_IN analysis_NN ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Feeding_VBG scheme_NN of_IN fodders_NNS Name_NNP of_IN the_DT cow_JJ Period_NNP I_PRP 28-3-46_JJ to_TO 8-4-46_JJ Period_NNP II_NNP 9-4-46_CD to_TO 20-4-46_JJ Period_NNP III_NNP 21-4-46_JJ to_TO 2-5-46_JJ Period_NNP IV_NNP 3-5-46_JJ to_TO 14-5-46_JJ Lenjurki_NNP A_NNP B_NNP C_NNP D_NNP Larajbani_NNP B_NNP C_NNP D_NNP A_NNP Haskila_NNP C_NNP D_NNP A_NNP B_NNP Yulamati_NNP D_NNP A_NNP B_NNP C_NNP A=Unmanured_NNP berseem_NN B=Manured_NNP berseemDecember_NN ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN M._NNP L._NNP MATHUR_NNP 245_CD materials_NNS and_CC food_NN stuffs_NNS and_CC found_VBD that_IN its_PRP$ accuracy_NN was_VBD not_RB affected_VBN by_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN non-phytic_JJ substances_NNS in_IN plant_NN extracts_NNS ._.
This_DT method_NN involved_VBD the_DT titration_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN in_IN 0.6_CD per_IN cent_NN HCl_NNP ,_, ammonium_NN thiocyanate_NN being_VBG used_VBN as_IN internal_JJ indicator_NN ._.
Heubner_NNP and_CC Stadler_NNP recommended_VBD that_IN the_DT end_NN point_NN was_VBD reached_VBN when_WRB a_DT flesh_JJ pink_NN colour_NN persisting_VBG for_IN five_CD minutes_NNS was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
The_DT disadvantage_NN of_IN this_DT method_NN was_VBD that_IN the_DT end_NN point_NN was_VBD not_RB sharp_JJ owing_VBG to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN colloidal_JJ precipitation_NN of_IN ferric_JJ phytate_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD formed_VBN during_IN the_DT titration_NN ._.
To_TO avoid_VB that_IN difficulty_NN various_JJ modifications_NNS had_VBD been_VBN suggested_VBN by_IN Knowles_NNP and_CC Watkin_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP ,_, Andrews_NNP and_CC Bailey_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP ,_, Harris_NNP and_CC Mosher_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP and_CC Young_NNP (_( 1936_CD )_) ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ metabolic_JJ experiments_VBZ the_DT feeding_NN stuffs_NNS and_CC the_DT faeces_NNS had_VBD to_TO be_VB analysed_VBN ._.
The_DT feeding_NN stuffs_NNS could_MD be_VB analysed_VBN by_IN the_DT modified_JJ method_NN of_IN Andrews_NNP and_CC Bailey_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP ._.
Since_IN the_DT faeces_NNS gave_VBD coloured_VBN extracts_NNS with_IN HCl_NNP ,_, this_DT procedure_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB applied_VBN ._.
Knowles_NNS and_CC Watkin_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP used_VBD ether_DT to_TO remove_VB colouring_VBG materials_NNS ;_: but_CC in_IN the_DT present_JJ experiments_NNS ether_CC was_VBD not_RB found_VBN to_TO remove_VB the_DT colour-_JJ ing_NN materials_NNS completely_RB ._.
Experiments_NNS with_IN adsorbents_NNS such_JJ as_IN kaolin_NN ,_, alumina_NN ,_, Fuller_NNP 's_POS earth_NN ,_, norite_JJ charcoal_NN and_CC activated_JJ charcoal_NN ,_, prepared_VBN from_IN paddy_JJ husk_NN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN ,_, showed_VBD that_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN was_VBD partially_RB adsorbed_VBN on_IN these_DT substances_NNS ,_, though_IN the_DT colouring_NN matter_NN was_VBD removed_VBN ._.
The_DT method_NN suggested_VBN by_IN Young_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP was_VBD used_VBN with_IN slight_JJ modification_NN ._.
Determination_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN in_IN faeces_NNS FeCl3_NNP in_IN N/HCl_NNP :_: A_DT solution_NN containing_VBG 1.5_CD mg._JJ per_IN c.c_NN ._.
N/2_NNP HCl_NNP solution_NN 5_CD N_NNP and_CC N/2_NNP NaOH_NNP solutions_NNS ._.
Eight_CD grams_NNS of_IN oven-dried_JJ faeces_NNS were_VBD extracted_VBN with_IN 200_CD c.c_NNS ._.
of_IN two_CD per_IN cent_NN HCl_NNP solution_NN in_IN a_DT glass_NN stoppered_VBD bottle_NN for_IN three_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT extract_NN was_VBD filtered_VBN on_IN a_DT Buchner_NNP funnel_NN ,_, through_IN double_JJ layer_NN of_IN hardened_JJ filter_JJ paper_NN ._.
25_CD c.c_NN ._.
aliquot_NN (_( containing_VBG not_RB more_RBR than_IN 4_CD mg._JJ phytic_JJ acid_NN )_) was_VBD taken_VBN in_IN a_DT 50_CD c.c_NN ._.
graduated_VBN centrifuge_NN tube_NN ,_, neutralized_VBN with_IN 5_CD N._NNP NaOH_NNP ,_, made_VBD just_RB acidic_JJ to_TO litmus_VB with_IN HCl_NNP ._.
After_IN taking_VBG the_DT reading_NN in_IN the_DT tube_NN ,_, one_CD fifth_NN of_IN its_PRP$ volume_NN of_IN FeCl3HCl_NNP solution_NN was_VBD added_VBN ._.
The_DT tube_NN and_CC its_PRP$ contents_NNS were_VBD heated_VBN in_IN a_DT rack_NN ,_, in_IN boiling_VBG water_NN bath_NN ,_, for_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS ,_, with_IN level_NN of_IN water_NN above_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT contents_NNS of_IN the_DT tube_NN ,_, then_RB cooled_VBN in_IN a_DT bath_NN of_IN cold_JJ water_NN for_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS and_CC centrifuged_VBD for_IN 10_CD minutes_NNS at_IN about_IN 3,000_CD rounds_NNS per_IN minute_NN ._.
The_DT supernatent_NN liquid_NN was_VBD decanted_VBN and_CC the_DT tube_NN allowed_VBD to_TO drain_VB ._.
The_DT precipitate_NN was_VBD suspended_VBN in_IN 10_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN hot_JJ water_NN in_IN the_DT centrifuge_NN tube_NN and_CC heated_VBN in_IN boiling_VBG water_NN bath_NN for_IN two_CD minutes_NNS ._.
To_TO the_DT hot_JJ suspension_NN ,_, 2_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN N/2_NNP NaOH_NNP were_VBD added_VBN with_IN stirring_NN and_CC heating_NN in_IN the_DT water_NN bath_NN was_VBD continued_VBN with_IN occasional_JJ stirring_NN ._.
The_DT precipitate_NN of_IN ferric_JJ hydroxide_NN was_VBD filtered_VBN on_IN a_DT 7_CD cm_NN ._.
whatman_JJ filter_NN paper_NN (_( No_UH ._.
31_CD )_) and_CC washed_VBN with_IN hot_JJ water_NN ._.
The_DT filtrate_NN and_CC wash-_JJ ings_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN in_IN a_DT graduated_JJ cylinder_NN ,_, allowed_VBN to_TO cool_VB and_CC made_VB just_RB acidic_JJ to_TO litmus_VB ._.
N/2_NNP HCl_NNP was_VBD then_RB added_VBN to_TO bring_VB the_DT resultant_JJ acidity_NN to_TO 0.6_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT volume_NN made_VBD up_RP ._.
Fifty_NNP c.c_NN ._.

of_IN 0.3_CD per_IN cent_NN ammonium_NN thiocyanate_NN and_CC standard_JJ ferric_JJ chloride_NN solution_NN was_VBD added_VBN from_IN a_DT microburette_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT end_NN point_NN had_VBD nearly_RB reached_VBN ,_, the_DT titration_NN was_VBD stopped_VBN and_CC the_DT solution_NN allowed_VBD to_TO stand_VB for_IN five_CD minutes_NNS or_CC heated_VBN on_IN a_DT water_NN bath_NN for_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS ,_, cooled_VBD and_CC then_RB filtered_VBD ._.
The_DT titration_NN was_VBD concluded_VBN in_IN the_DT filtrate_NN ._.

TABLE_NNP III_NNP The_DT distribution_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT grain_NN mixture_NN and_CC its_PRP$ components_NNS Feed_NNP Phytin_NNP phosphorus_NN per_IN cent_NN Total_NNP phosphorus_NN per_IN cent_NN Total_JJ phos-_JJ phorus_NN as_IN P2O5_NNP per_IN cent_NN Bran_NNP 0.893_CD 1.281_CD 2.934_CD Barley_NNP 0.116_CD 0.331_CD 0.757_CD Cowpeas_NNP 0.063_CD 0.371_CD 0.849_CD Linseed_NNP cake_VBP 0.304_CD 0.741_CD 1.698_CD Groundnut_NNP cake_VBP 0.411_CD 0.593_CD 1.359_CD Grain_NNP mixture_NN 0.321_CD 0.611_CD 1.399_CD It_PRP shows_VBZ that_IN 52.54_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT grain_NN mixture_NN was_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN phytic_JJ phosphorus_NN ._.
While_IN studying_VBG the_DT mineral_NN balances_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN negative_JJ phosphorus_NN balances_NNS occurred_VBD in_IN all_DT animals_NNS during_IN almost_RB all_DT periods_NNS ,_, hence_RB the_DT distribution_NN of_IN phytin_NN was_VBD likely_JJ to_TO throw_VB some_DT light_NN on_IN the_DT unavailability_NN of_IN such_JJ large_JJ amount_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ daily_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN phytic_JJ phosphorus_NN present_NN in_IN the_DT concentrate_NN mixture*_NN and_CC that_IN excreted_VBD unchanged_JJ in_IN the_DT faeces_NNS during_IN the_DT various_JJ periods_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP ._.

per_IN day_NN and_CC hence_NN it_PRP has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN taken_VBN into_IN consideration_NN ._.
December_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NN M._NNP L._NNP MATHUR_NNP 247_CD It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ IV_NNP that_WDT 35_CD to_TO 51_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN phytic_JJ phosphorus_NN was_VBD recovered_VBN unchanged_JJ and_CC rest_NN was_VBD hydrolysed_VBN ._.
The_DT grain_NN mixture_NN contained_VBD 30_CD per_IN cent_NN barley_NN ,_, and_CC hence_RB the_DT enzymic_JJ cleavage_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN by_IN the_DT enzyme_JJ phytase_NN ,_, may_MD have_VB taken_VBN place_NN in_IN the_DT intestine_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ assumed_VBN that_IN after_IN hydrolysis_NN or_CC enzymic_JJ cleavage_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN ,_, the_DT products_NNS are_VBP similar_JJ to_TO other_JJ inorganic_JJ forms_NNS found_VBN in_IN green_JJ fodder_NN and_CC absorbed_VBN as_IN such_JJ ._.
The_DT reason_NN ,_, why_WRB such_JJ large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ withdrawn_VBN from_IN metabolism_NN and_CC not_RB available_JJ to_TO the_DT cows_NNS ,_, can_MD also_RB be_VB explained_VBN ._.
The_DT diet_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS contain-_JJ ed_RB large_JJ amount_NN of_IN calcium_NN in_IN chalk_NN and_CC it_PRP may_MD be_VB assumed_VBN that_IN this_DT calcium_NN prevents_VBZ the_DT splitting_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN by_IN precipitating_VBG it_PRP as_IN calcium_NN phytate_NN in_IN the_DT small_JJ intes-_JJ tine_NN ._.
Even_RB if_IN the_DT enzyme_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN the_DT food_NN ,_, the_DT phytic_JJ acid_NN which_WDT is_VBZ precipitated_VBN as_IN calcium_NN phytate_NN is_VBZ rendered_VBN unavailable_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN phytase_NN ._.
Thus_RB both_DT calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN are_VBP rendered_VBN unavailable_JJ for_IN absorption_NN in_IN the_DT system_NN ._.
It_PRP would_MD thus_RB appear_VB that_IN excess_NN of_IN calcium_NN depresses_VBZ the_DT absorption_NN of_IN phytic_JJ phosphorus_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN excess_NN of_IN phytic_JJ acid_NN also_RB renders_VBZ calcium_JJ un-_JJ available_JJ ._.
Considering_VBG these_DT it_PRP would_MD suggest_VB that_IN a_DT suitable_JJ calcium_NN phosphorus_NN ratio_NN in_IN the_DT food_NN should_MD be_VB aimed_VBN at_IN ._.
Table_JJ V_NNP gives_VBZ the_DT CaO_NN :_: P2O5_NNP ratio_NN in_IN the_DT food_NN during_IN the_DT experiments_NNS ._.

The_DT high_JJ values_NNS for_IN cow_NN 's_POS colostrum_NN have_VBP been_VBN noted_VBN amongst_IN other_JJ workers_NNS by_IN Schuette_NNP and_CC Huebner_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP and_CC Elsdon_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP ._.
Though_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR during_IN the_DT colostral_JJ period_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD interesting_VBG to_TO note_VB that_IN ,_, excepting_VBG the_DT values_NNS for_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD days_NNS when_WRB the_DT values_NNS were_VBD low_JJ ,_, the_DT lactose-chloride_JJ relationship_NN calculated_VBD according_VBG to_TO the_DT for-_JJ mula_NN of_IN Davies_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NN showed_VBD almost_RB the_DT same_JJ value_NN as_IN for_IN normal_JJ milk_NN (_( Table_JJ XII_NN )_) ._.
This_DT leads_VBZ to_TO the_DT inference_NN that_IN higher_JJR depression_NN during_IN the_DT colostral_JJ period_NN was_VBD not_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN larger_JJR amounts_NNS of_IN lactose_NN and_CC chloride_NN but_CC due_JJ to_TO some_DT other_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN milk_NN ._.
TABLE_NNP X_NNP Effect_NNP of_IN addition_NN of_IN starch_NN and_CC cane_NN sugar_NN to_TO milk_VB on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN Particulars_NNP Trial_NNP I_PRP Freezing_VBG point_NN (_( December_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP C._NNP S._NNP DHARMARAJAN_NNP ,_, R._NNP V._NNP RAO_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP 261_CD TABLE_NNP XI_NNP Freezing_NNP point_NN of_IN cow_NN milk_NN ,_, buffalo_JJ milk_NN and_CC toned_VBD milk_NN Sample_NNP number_NN Reconsti-_NNP tuted_VBD milk_NN powder_NN solution_NN (_( 262_CD FREEZING_NNP POINT_NNP OF_NNP COW_NNP AND_NNP BUFFALO_NNP MILK_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, TABLE_NNP XIDecember_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP C._NNP S._NNP DHARMARAJAN_NNP ,_, R._NNP V._NNP RAO_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP 263_CD A_NNP study_NN of_IN Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD ,_, wherein_VBD the_DT changes_NNS in_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN have_VBP been_VBN recorded_VBN for_IN complete_JJ lactations_NNS ,_, showed_VBD that_IN the_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS may_MD be_VB roughly_RB divided_VBN into_IN four_CD stages_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT first_JJ 12_CD days_NNS of_IN lactation_NN the_DT values_NNS were_VBD high_JJ ,_, from_IN 12_CD to_TO 120_CD days_NNS the_DT values_NNS were_VBD a_DT little_JJ below_IN the_DT average_NN for_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT lactation_NN ,_, from_IN 120_CD to_TO 220_CD days_NNS values_RB fluctuated_VBN about_IN the_DT average_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT end_NN period_NN when_WRB the_DT values_NNS were_VBD a_DT little_JJ higher_JJR ._.
However_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD buffaloes_NNS ,_, apart_RB from_IN the_DT colostral_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT other_JJ three_CD stages_NNS were_VBD not_RB so_RB well_RB defined_VBN ._.
Aschaffenburg_NNP and_CC Veinoglou_NNP [_NNP 1942-44_JJ ]_NN in_IN a_DT study_NN with_IN Shorthorn_NNP cows_NNS found_VBD no_DT ._.
relationship_NN between_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN and_CC the_DT stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, the_DT age_NN of_IN the_DT cow_NN ,_, or_CC the_DT milk_NN vield_NN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN season_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_JJ point_NN of_IN milk_NN The_DT results_NNS of_IN examinations_NNS of_IN samples_NNS from_IN different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cows_NNS and_CC Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 13_CD months_NNS have_VBP been_VBN illustrated_VBN in_IN Fig_NNP ._.
2_CD ._.
These_DT results_NNS do_VBP not_RB reveal_VB any_DT significant_JJ variation_NN which_WDT could_MD be_VB ascribed_VBN to_TO season_NN ._.
This_DT may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT equitable_JJ climate_NN of_IN Bangalore_NNP and_CC more_RBR or_CC less_RBR uniform_JJ rations_NNS given_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
A_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT literature_NN of_IN other_JJ countries_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, does_VBZ not_RB reveal_VB any_DT uniformity_NN of_IN results_NNS as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN season_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, Elsdon_NNP and_CC Walker_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NN from_IN a_DT study_NN of_IN their_PRP$ results_NNS concluded_VBD that_IN abnormal_JJ weather_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN ._.
Earlier_RBR ,_, Buchanan_NNP and_CC Lowman_NNP [_NNP 1929_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN during_IN the_DT spring_NN months_NNS the_DT freezing_NN point_NN was_VBD lower_JJR than_IN during_IN other_JJ seasons_NNS ._.
In_IN recent_JJ studies_NNS Aschefferburg_NNP and_CC Temple_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP ,_, and_CC Aschaffenburg_NNP and_CC Veinoglou_NNP [_NNP 1942-44_JJ ]_NN obtained_VBD varying_VBG results_NNS in_IN studies_NNS extending_VBG over_IN two_CD years_NNS and_CC concluded_VBD that_IN the_DT smaller_JJR freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN observed_VBD during_IN the_DT spring_NN was_VBD 'due_JJ not_RB to_TO the_DT season_NN as_IN such_JJ but_CC a_DT factor_NN connected_VBN with_IN it_PRP '_'' ._.
The_DT factor_NN presumably_NN was_VBD the_DT sudden_JJ change_NN over_IN to_TO more_RBR palatable_JJ feeding_JJ stuffs_NNS from_IN that_DT given_VBN indoors_NNS during_IN the_DT winter_JJ months_NNS ._.
Rees_NNS [_VBP 1949_CD ]_NN in_IN studies_NNS with_IN bulk_JJ market_NN milk_NN in_IN Australia_NNP found_VBD the_DT freezing_NN point_NN to_TO show_VB a_DT close_JJ seasonal_JJ trend_NN reaching_VBG two_CD peaks_NNS during_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, in_IN late_JJ spring_NN and_CC autumn_NN ._.
The_DT values_NNS were_VBD further_RBR closely_RB correlated_VBN with_IN the_DT S._NNP N._NNP F._NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, a_DT conclusion_NN not_RB substantiated_VBN by_IN the_DT earlier_JJR results_NNS of_IN Stubbs_NNP and_CC Elsdon_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP ._.
Effect_NN of_IN souring_VBG on_IN the_DT freezing_JJ point_NN of_IN milk_NN A_NNP study_NN of_IN the_DT results_NNS in_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP show_VBP that_IN an_DT increase_NN in_IN freezing_VBG point_NN depression_NN of_IN milk_NN occurred_VBN on_IN souring_NN ._.
A_DT perceptible_JJ increase_NN was_VBD noted_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 4_CD to_TO 5_CD hours_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cow_NN milk_NN ,_, and_CC 5_CD to_TO 6_CD hours_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN ._.
In_IN cow_NN milk_NN the_DT increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN when_WRB the_DT samples_NNS gave_VBD positive_JJ boiling_NN test_NN varied_VBD from_IN 0.02_CD to_TO 0.12_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT corresponding_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN varied_VBD between_IN 0.006º_CD to_TO 0.046ºC._CD ,_, the_DT average_JJ increase_NN in_IN freezing_VBG point_NN depression_NN per_IN 0.01_CD per_IN cent_NN increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN being_VBG 0.0036ºC_CD ._.
(_( Table_NNP III_NNP )_) ._.
In_IN case_NN of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN the_DT increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN when_WRB the_DT milk_NN showed_VBD positive_JJ boiling_VBG test_NN varied_VBD from_IN 0.03_CD to_TO 0.16_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT increase_NN in_IN freezing_VBG point_NN depression_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ stage_NN varied_VBD from_IN 0.012º_CD to_TO 0.046ºC._CD ,_, the_DT average_JJ increase_NN in_IN freezing_VBG point_NN depression_NN per_IN 0.01_CD per_IN cent_NN increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN 264_CD FREEZING_NNP POINT_NNP OF_NNP COW_NNP AND_NNP BUFFALO_NNP MILK_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, being_VBG 0.0038ºC_CD ._.
Thus_RB the_DT increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN can_MD seriously_RB interfere_VB with_IN the_DT inter-_JJ pretation_NN of_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN test_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ essential_JJ to_TO know_VB the_DT acidity_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS before_IN drawing_VBG any_DT conclusion_NN ._.
Various_JJ methods_NNS of_IN applying_VBG corrections_NNS to_TO the_DT freezing_VBG point_NN of_IN sour_JJ milk_NN have_VBP been_VBN suggested_VBN ranging_VBG from_IN the_DT strict_JJ adherance_NN that_IN only_RB fresh_JJ milk_NN should_MD be_VB used_VBN for_IN the_DT test_NN [_NN A._NNP O_NNP ._.
A._NN C._NNP ,_, 1950_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT sub-committee_NN of_IN the_DT Scientific_NNP Advisory_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Health_NNP for_IN Scotland_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NN after_IN reviewing_VBG the_DT available_JJ evidence_NN suggested_VBD that_IN the_DT best_JJS estimate_NN of_IN the_DT original_JJ freezing_NN point_NN of_IN the_DT fresh_JJ milk_NN was_VBD given_VBN by_IN a_DT correction_NN equivalent_NN to_TO 0.0034ºC._CD ,_, per_IN 0.01_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, which_WDT should_MD be_VB subtracted_VBN from_IN the_DT apparent_JJ freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN when_WRB the_DT acidity_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN sample_NN exceeded_VBD 0.18_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ._.
The_DT correction_NN found_VBD in_IN the_DT present_JJ studies_NNS was_VBD a_DT little_JJ higher_JJR than_IN that_DT recommended_VBD above_IN ,_, and_CC for_IN practical_JJ purposes_NNS may_MD be_VB taken_VBN as_IN 0.0037ºC_CD ._.
per_IN 0.01_CD per_IN cent_NN increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN ._.
Examination_NN of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN results_NNS show_VBP that_IN when_WRB the_DT correction_NN was_VBD taken_VBN as_IN 0.0034ºC_CD ._.
the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN found_VBN by_IN calculation_NN exceeded_VBD the_DT true_JJ value_NN by_IN 0.021ºC_CD ._.
on_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, while_IN if_IN the_DT value_NN taken_VBN as_IN 0.0037ºC_CD ._.
the_DT average_JJ difference_NN was_VBD only_RB 0.003ºC_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, well_UH to_TO remember_VB that_IN any_DT correction_NN at_IN best_RBS is_VBZ only_RB an_DT approximation_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT high_JJ apparent_JJ acidity_NN of_IN milk_NN may_MD not_RB be_VB due_JJ to_TO lactic_JJ acid_NN but_CC also_RB due_JJ to_TO other_JJ factors_NNS ._.
The_DT safest_JJS rule_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB to_TO work_VB only_RB with_IN fresh_JJ samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN ,_, or_CC samples_NNS which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN stored_VBN at_IN a_DT sufficiently_RB low_JJ temperature_NN that_IN no_DT appreciable_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN occurs_VBZ ._.
As_IN a_DT workable_JJ solution_NN it_PRP is_VBZ recommended_VBN that_IN a_DT sample_NN of_IN milk_NN should_MD be_VB examined_VBN by_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN test_NN only_RB when_WRB its_PRP$ acidity_NN does_VBZ not_RB exceed_VB 0.19_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, and/or_NN when_WRB the_DT sample_NN does_VBZ not_RB give_VB a_DT positive_JJ boiling_NN test_NN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN removal_NN of_IN fat_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_JJ point_NN of_IN milk_NN The_DT results_NNS in_IN Table_JJ IV_NNP show_NN that_IN for_IN practical_JJ purposes_NNS the_DT removal_NN of_IN fat_NN does_VBZ not_RB effect_NN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN of_IN 12_CD trials_NNS was_VBD less_JJR than_IN 0.001ºC_CD ._.
This_DT increase_NN presumably_NN may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT small_JJ increase_NN in_IN concentration_NN of_IN other_JJ constituents_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT removal_NN of_IN fat_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT S._NNP N._NNP F._NNP of_IN separated_JJ milk_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN whole_JJ milk_NN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN processing_NN of_IN milk_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN Pasteurisation_NNP of_IN milk_NN by_IN the_DT holding_VBG method_NN or_CC the_DT H._NNP T._NNP S._NNP T._NNP method_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN as_IN shown_VBN by_IN the_DT results_NNS in_IN Table_NNP V._NNP On_IN boiling_VBG the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN increased_VBD ,_, and_CC the_DT value_NN increased_VBD further_RBR when_WRB milk_NN was_VBD simmered_VBN ._.
However_RB ,_, there_EX was_VBD no_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT freezing_JJ point_NN of_IN boiled_VBN milk_NN on_IN storing_NN (_( Table_NNP VI_NNP )_) ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN freezing_VBG point_NN depression_NN during_IN processing_NN was_VBD in_IN a_DT large_JJ measure_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT loss_NN of_IN moisture_NN by_IN evaporation_NN ._.
Elsdon_NNP and_CC Stubbs_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN also_RB that_IN the_DT freezing_VBG point_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD not_RB altered_VBN when_WRB it_PRP was_VBD heated_VBN in_IN a_DT closed_JJ container_NN in_IN an_DT autoclave_NN for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS at_IN 110ºC_CD ._.
Effect_NN of_IN diluting_VBG milk_NN with_IN water_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN As_NNP was_VBD to_TO be_VB expected_VBN the_DT freezing_VBG point_NN depression_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD lowererd_VBN by_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN water_NN (_( Table_NNP VII_NNP )_) ._.
Addition_NN of_IN small_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN water_NN ,_, from_IN 1_CD to_TO 5_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, brought_VBD about_RP relatively_RB less_JJR change_NN than_IN when_WRB the_DT amount_NN of_IN water_NN December_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP C._NNP S._NNP DHARMARAJAN_NNP ,_, R._NNP V._NNP RAO_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP 265_CD added_VBD was_VBD 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
With_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN water_NN the_DT average_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT freez-_JJ ing_NN point_NN depression_NN was_VBD 0.058ºC_CD ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN using_VBG water_NN from_IN different_JJ sources_NNS ,_, that_DT is_VBZ distilled_VBN ,_, farm_NN well_NN and_CC municipal_JJ tap_NN ,_, was_VBD also_RB studied_VBN ._.
Though_IN the_DT total_JJ solids_NNS in_IN different_JJ samples_NNS of_IN water_NN varied_VBN ,_, these_DT had_VBD no_DT appreciable_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN of_IN the_DT diluted_JJ milk_NN as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VIII_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT past_NN ,_, attempts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO calculate_VB the_DT exact_JJ amount_NN of_IN water_NN added_VBD to_TO milk_VB from_IN its_PRP$ freezing_NN point_NN ._.
The_DT A._NNP O_NNP ._.
A._NN C._NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NNP has_VBZ suggested_VBN the_DT following_JJ formula_NN :_: W_NNP =_NNP (_( T266_NNP FREEZING_NNP POINT_NNP OF_NNP COW_NNP AND_NNP BUFFALO_NNP MILK_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, water_NN ._.
Addition_NN of_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN cane_NN sugar_NN sufficed_VBD to_TO mask_VB the_DT addtion_NN of_IN over_IN 15_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN water_NN ._.
Thus_RB the_DT test_NN should_MD be_VB used_VBN judiciously_RB in_IN inter-_JJ preting_VBG the_DT results_NNS ,_, and_CC more_JJR as_IN a_DT supplement_NN to_TO other_JJ methods_NNS rather_RB than_IN as_IN the_DT sole_JJ criterion_NN for_IN judging_VBG the_DT purity_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
With_IN reconstituted_VBN skimmed_JJ milk_NN powder_VBP the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN varied_VBD from_IN 0.482º_CD to_TO 0.522ºC_CD ._.
in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN spray-dried_JJ powder_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN 0.455º_CD to_TO 0.480ºC_CD ._.
in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN roller-dried_JJ powder_NN (_( Table_NNP XI_NNP )_) ._.
Similar_JJ results_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN by_IN Featro_NNP and_CC Moore_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NN who_WP ascribed_VBD the_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN of_IN dried_JJ skim_NN milk_NN solids_NNS to_TO the_DT lowered_JJ solubility_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT constituents_NNS of_IN milk_NN ._.
Whole_JJ milk_NN toned_VBN with_IN reconstituted_JJ milk_NN powder_NN also_RB behaved_VBD similarly_RB ,_, so_IN the_DT test_NN may_MD be_VB used_VBN as_IN an_DT additional_JJ confirmatory_NN test_NN when_WRB the_DT addition_NN of_IN milk_NN powder_NN to_TO milk_NN is_VBZ suspected_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP A_NNP study_NN of_IN the_DT freezing_JJ point_NN of_IN milk_NN of_IN three_CD cows_NNS and_CC two_CD buffaloes_NNS over_IN complete_JJ lactations_NNS showed_VBD that_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN was_VBD high_JJ during_IN the_DT colostral_JJ period_NN ._.
The_DT values_NNS became_VBD normal_JJ in_IN about_RB 12_CD days_NNS ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN these_DT high_JJ values_NNS during_IN the_DT colostral_JJ period_NN ,_, the_DT lactose-chloride_JJ relationship_NN was_VBD almost_RB the_DT same_JJ from_IN about_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT average_NN found_VBD for_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT lactation_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS after_IN the_DT colostral_JJ period_NN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN remained_VBD below_IN the_DT average_NN for_IN full_JJ lactation_NN till_NN about_IN 120th_CD day_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, then_RB the_DT values_NNS fluctuated_VBD uniformly_RB about_IN the_DT average_NN till_NN about_IN the_DT 220th_JJ day_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB showed_VBD a_DT tendency_NN to_TO increase_VB ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS these_DT changes_NNS were_VBD not_RB noticeable_JJ ._.
The_DT freezing_JJ point_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD not_RB affected_VBN by_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN seasons_NNS under_IN the_DT conditions_NNS prevailing_VBG in_IN Bangalore_NNP during_IN this_DT study_NN ._.
Development_NNP of_IN acidity_NN in_IN milk_NN increased_VBD the_DT value_NN of_IN freezing_VBG point_NN depres-_JJ sion_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT stage_NN when_WRB milk_NN showed_VBD positive_JJ boiling_NN test_NN ,_, the_DT increase_NN in_IN freezing_VBG point_NN depression_NN per_IN 0.01_CD per_IN cent_NN increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN was_VBD 0.0036ºC_CD ._.
in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cow_NN milk_NN ,_, and_CC 0.0038ºC_CD ._.
in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN for_IN freez-_JJ ing_NN point_NN test_NN a_DT sample_NN should_MD be_VB examined_VBN only_RB when_WRB its_PRP$ acidity_NN does_VBZ not_RB exceed_VB 0.19_CD per_JJ cent_NN as_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, and/or_NN when_WRB the_DT sample_NN does_VBZ not_RB give_VB a_DT positive_JJ boiling_NN test_NN ._.
Removal_NN of_IN fat_NN from_IN milk_NN or_CC pasteurisation_NN of_IN milk_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN values_NNS ._.
On_IN boiling_NN and_CC simmering_VBG the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN increased_VBD ._.
Addition_NN of_IN water_NN lowered_VBD the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT formulae_NN tested_VBD gave_VBD satisfactory_JJ results_NNS for_IN calculating_VBG the_DT amount_NN of_IN added_JJ water_NN when_WRB the_DT original_JJ freezing_NN point_NN of_IN samples_NNS was_VBD unknown_JJ ._.
While_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN starch_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN ,_, presence_NN of_IN cane_NN sugar_NN increased_VBD the_DT value_NN ._.
Addition_NN of_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN sugarmasked_VBD the_DT presence_NN of_IN over_IN 15_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN added_JJ water_NN ._.
Reconstituted_VBN skimmed_VBD milk_NN powder_NN ,_, both_DT roller_NN and_CC spray_NN dried_VBD ,_, showed_VBD a_DT smaller_JJR freezing_NN point_NN depression_NN than_IN milk_NN ._.

This_DT information_NN is_VBZ lacking_VBG in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN Egyptian_JJ sheep_NN ;_: therefore_RB this_DT study_NN was_VBD made_VBN ._.

mm_NN ._.
in_IN sheep_NN ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, MATERIALS_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP Blood_NNP samples_NNS were_VBD drawn_VBN from_IN 60_CD sheep_JJ belonging_NN to_TO Breeding_NNP Department_NNP in_IN the_DT Faculty_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ._.
They_PRP were_VBD under_IN good_JJ management_NN representing_VBG the_DT best_JJS in_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD classified_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: Group_NNP No_NNP ._.
1_CD included_VBD new-born_JJ lambs_NNS from_IN 1_CD to_TO 60_CD days_NNS old_JJ Group_NNP No_NNP ._.
2_CD included_VBD lambs_NN from_IN 2_CD to_TO 12_CD months_NNS old_JJ ._.
Group_NNP No_NNP ._.
3_CD included_VBD young_JJ sheep_NN from_IN 1_CD to_TO 2_CD years_NNS old_JJ ._.
Group_NNP No_NNP ._.
4_CD included_VBD adult_NN sheep_NN from_IN 2_CD to_TO 5_CD years_NNS old_JJ ._.
Blood_NN specimens_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN from_IN the_DT marginal_JJ vein_NN of_IN the_DT ear_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ drop_NN was_VBD wipped_VBN and_CC the_DT second_JJ drops_NNS were_VBD used_VBN for_IN the_DT following_JJ determinations_NNS :_: 1_CD ._.
Red_JJ blood_NN corpuscles_NNS (_( erythrocytes_NNS )_) ._.
2_CD ._.
Hæmoglobin_NNP percentage_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
White_NNP blood_NN corpuscles_NNS (_( leucocytes_NNS )_) ._.
4_CD ._.
Differential_NNP count_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS ._.
Blood_NNP films_NNS were_VBD stained_VBN after_IN the_DT panoptic_JJ method_NN by_IN using_VBG May-Gruenwald_NNP stain_NN followed_VBN by_IN Giemsa_NNP stain_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD then_RB examined_VBN for_IN differential_JJ count_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS ._.
In_IN counting_VBG cells_NNS a_DT Neubauer_NNP hæmocytometer_NN was_VBD used_VBN ._.
The_DT Sahli_NNP hæmoglobinometer_NN was_VBD chosen_VBN for_IN determination_NN of_IN hæmoglobin_NN ._.
RESULTS_NNP AND_CC DISCUSSION_NNP Red_NNP blood_NN corpuscles_VBZ The_DT new-born_JJ lambs_NN recorded_VBD a_DT maximum_JJ count_NN of_IN 12.780_CD millions_NNS and_CC a_DT minimum_JJ one_CD of_IN 9.080_CD millions_NNS with_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 10.930_CD millions_NNS per_IN cu_NN ._.
mm_NN ._.
The_DT count_NN for_IN the_DT adult_NN sheep_VBD ranged_VBD between_IN 9.210_CD millions_NNS for_IN the_DT maximum_NN and_CC 7.960_CD millions_NNS for_IN the_DT minimum_NN with_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 8.585_CD millions_NNS per_IN cu_NN ._.
mm_NN ._.
Lambs_NNP and_CC young_JJ sheep_NN recorded_VBD averages_NNS of_IN 10.598_CD millions_NNS and_CC 9.735_CD millions_NNS per_IN cu_NN ._.
mm_NN ._.
respectively_RB ,_, while_IN their_PRP$ maximum_JJ counts_NNS were_VBD 9.240_CD and_CC 9.220_CD per_IN cu_NN ._.
mm_NN ._.
respectively_RB ._.
In_IN the_DT four_CD groups_NNS the_DT counts_NNS were_VBD high_JJ in_IN new-born_JJ lambs_NNS and_CC low_JJ in_IN adult_NN sheep_NN ;_: while_IN lambs_NNS and_CC young_JJ sheep_NN were_VBD medium_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS ._.
Table_NN I_PRP contains_VBZ the_DT averages_NNS of_IN the_DT differential_JJ count_NN in_IN the_DT four_CD groups_NNS ._.

Hæmoglobin_NNP percentage_NN The_DT percentage_NN of_IN hæmoglobin_NN varied_VBN from_IN 72_CD to_TO 54_CD in_IN all_DT groups_NNS ,_, the_DT averages_NNS recorded_VBN for_IN the_DT four_CD groups_NNS were_VBD 70.5_CD for_IN new-born_JJ ,_, 72_CD for_IN lambs_NNS ,_, 62.5_CD for_IN the_DT young_JJ sheep_NN and_CC 54_CD for_IN adult_NN sheep_NN ._.
Here_RB too_RB ,_, the_DT hæmoglobin_NN percentage_NN tended_VBD to_TO be_VB high_JJ in_IN young_JJ animals_NNS and_CC low_JJ in_IN adult_NN ones_NNS ._.
White_NNP blood_NN corpuscles_VBZ The_DT number_NN of_IN white_JJ blood_NN corpuscles_NNS per_IN cu_NN ._.
mm_NN ._.
for_IN sheep_NN as_IN a_DT whole_JJ varied_NN from_IN 8,000_CD to_TO 10,000_CD ._.
Averages_NNS being_VBG 10,000_CD for_IN new-born_JJ lambs_NNS ,_, 8,500_CD for_IN lambs_NNS ,_, 9,200_CD for_IN young_JJ sheep_NN and_CC 8,000_CD for_IN adult_NN sheep_NN ._.
The_DT lowest_JJS average_NN recorded_VBD was_VBD that_IN of_IN the_DT adult_NN sheep_NN ._.
The_DT highest_JJS average_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN by_IN new-born_JJ lambs_NNS ,_, then_RB it_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN the_DT averages_NNS tended_VBD to_TO be_VB lowered_VBN in_IN lambs_NN while_IN it_PRP increased_VBD a_DT little_JJ in_IN young_JJ sheep_NN ._.
Differential_NNP count_NN A_NNP ._.
The_DT neutrophile_JJ granulocytes_VBZ The_DT neutrophile_JJ cells_NNS ,_, according_VBG to_TO their_PRP$ percentages_NNS occupy_VBP a_DT second_JJ place_NN to_TO the_DT lymphocytes_NNS in_IN all_DT groups_NNS except_IN animals_NNS of_IN group_NN 1_CD new-born_JJ lambs_NN ,_, where_WRB the_DT neutrophile_JJ cells_NNS recorded_VBD a_DT higher_JJR percentages_NNS than_IN the_DT lymphocytes_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ percentage_NN of_IN neutrophiles_NNS were_VBD 64.5_CD ,_, 39.0_CD ,_, 43.0_CD and_CC 41.0_CD for_IN the_DT four_CD groups_NNS respectively_RB ._.
B_NNP ._.
The_DT lymphocytes_VBZ The_DT lymphocytes_NNS occupied_VBD as_IN a_DT whole_NN the_DT first_JJ place_NN in_IN all_DT groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS except_IN the_DT new-born_JJ lambs_NN ._.
This_DT trend_NN was_VBD similar_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT neutrophiles_NNS ._.
Averages_NNS of_IN lymphocytes_NNS were_VBD 44.0_CD ,_, 55.0_CD 48.5_CD ,_, and_CC 50.0._CD per_IN cent_NN respectively_RB for_IN the_DT four_CD groups_NNS ._.
C._NNP The_DT eosinophile_NN granulocytes_VBZ These_DT cells_NNS are_VBP not_RB so_RB numerous_JJ as_IN the_DT lymphocytes_NNS and_CC neutrophiles_NNS ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN these_DT cells_NNS in_IN the_DT circulating_NN blood_NN in_IN the_DT four_CD groups_NNS varied_VBD widely_RB ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN eosinophiles_NNS increased_VBN in_IN a_DT parallel_JJ direction_NN with_IN the_DT age_NN ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN it_PRP was_VBD lowest_VBN in_IN young_JJ animals_NNS and_CC highest_JJS in_IN adult_NN ones_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ percentages_NNS recorded_VBN for_IN the_DT animals_NNS studied_VBN were_VBD 0.2_CD ,_, 2.5_CD ,_, 4.0_CD and_CC 5.7_CD respectively_RB ._.
D._NNP The_DT basophile_NN granulocytes_VBZ These_DT cells_NNS are_VBP very_RB scanty_RB in_IN the_DT blood_NN as_IN they_PRP were_VBD not_RB demonstrable_JJ in_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN 60_CD animals_NNS examined_VBD ._.
Averages_NNS were_VBD 0.1_CD ,_, 0.5_CD ,_, 0.2_CD and_CC 0.3_CD for_IN the_DT four_CD groups_NNS ._.
E._NNP The_DT monocytes_NNS These_DT cells_NNS were_VBD not_RB very_RB numerous_JJ in_IN the_DT blood_NN ._.
They_PRP showed_VBD high_JJ counts_NNS in_IN young_JJ sheep_NN ,_, being_VBG 4.3_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC low_JJ counts_NNS in_IN new-born_JJ lambs_NN being_VBG ,_, 1.2_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Close_JJ agreement_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN between_IN our_PRP$ records_NNS and_CC that_DT of_IN Burnett_NNP [_NNP 1917_CD ]_NNP and_CC Holmann_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, TABLE_NNP II_NNP Comparison_NNP of_IN count_NN of_IN cells_NNS by_IN two_CD authors_NNS Author_VBP Neutro-_JJ philes_NNS Lympho-_JJ cytes_NNS Eosino-_JJ philes_NNS Basophile_NNP Monocytes_NNP Burnett_NNP [_NNP 1917_CD ]_VBD 37_CD 53_CD 1.7_CD 0.3_CD 8_CD Holmann_NNP [_NN 1945_CD ]_VBD 17_CD 74_CD 5.0_CD 1.0_CD 3_CD SUMMARY_NNP Sixty_NNP normal_JJ samples_NNS of_IN blood_NN were_VBD examined_VBN for_IN R._NNP B._NNP C._NNP ,_, W._NNP B._NNP C._NNP ,_, H.B_NNP ._.
per_IN cent_NN and_CC differential_JJ count_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT number_NN of_IN red_JJ blood_NN corpuscles_NNS per_IN cubic_JJ millimeter_NN of_IN blood_NN varies_NNS with_IN the_DT age_NN of_IN animals_NNS ._.
The_DT counts_NNS being_VBG higher_JJR in_IN the_DT new-born_JJ sheep_NN and_CC low_JJ in_IN the_DT adult_NN ones_NNS ._.
Lambs_NNP and_CC young_JJ sheep_NN were_VBD inter-_JJ mediate_NN ._.
Males_NNS recorded_VBN high_JJ counts_NNS than_IN those_DT of_IN females_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT hæmoglobin_NN percentage_NN showed_VBD the_DT same_JJ trace_NN of_IN R.B.C_NNP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN young_JJ animals_NNS than_IN in_IN the_DT older_JJR ones_NNS ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) The_DT white_JJ blood_NN corpuscles_NNS counts_NNS also_RB behave_VBP in_IN a_DT similar_JJ manner_NN ,_, being_VBG higher_JJR in_IN new-born_JJ lambs_NNS and_CC lower_JJR in_IN adult_NN sheep_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) The_DT neutrophiles_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB higher_JJR in_IN percentage_NN than_IN the_DT lympho-_JJ cytes_NNS in_IN the_DT new-born_JJ lambs_NN ._.
(_( 5_CD )_) The_DT lymphocytes_NNS were_VBD of_IN high_JJ percentage_NN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS except_IN in_IN the_DT new-_JJ born_JJ lambs_NNS ._.
(_( 6_CD )_) The_DT eosinophiles_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO increase_VB in_IN a_DT parallel_JJ direction_NN with_IN age_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD lowest_JJS in_IN the_DT young_JJ and_CC highest_JJS in_IN adult_NN ones_NNS ._.
(_( 7_CD )_) The_DT basophiles_NNS were_VBD the_DT lowest_JJS cells_NNS in_IN the_DT blood_NN ._.
(_( 8_CD )_) The_DT monocytes_NNS were_VBD not_RB very_RB numerous_JJ ,_, they_PRP were_VBD low_JJ in_IN the_DT new-born_JJ lambs_NN ._.

7_CD ,_, 119_CD COMPARISON_NNP OF_NNP FOUR_NNP EJACULATES_NNP COLLECTED_NNP IN_NNP RAPID_NNP SUCCESSION_NNP FROM_NNP THE_NNP INDIAN_NNP WATER_NNP BUFFALO_NNP (_( B._NNP BUBALIS_NNP )_) By_IN S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP and_CC U._NNP D._NNP SHARMA_NNP ,_, Division_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD March_NNP 1953_CD )_) COMPARATIVELY_NNP little_JJ information_NN on_IN the_DT factors_NNS affecting_VBG the_DT semen_NNS of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ water_NN buffalo_NN ,_, B._NNP bubalis_NN ,_, is_VBZ available_JJ in_IN literature_NN ._.
Kushwaha_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1951_CD ]_NNP ,_, Kushwaha_NNP ,_, Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1952_CD ]_NNP ,_, and_CC Malkani_NNP and_CC Patel_NNP [_NNP unpublished_VBD ]_NNP present_JJ data_NNS on_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN buffalo_JJ semen_NNS ._.
Kushwaha_NNP and_CC co-workers_NNS had_VBD worked_VBN on_IN the_DT semen_NNS of_IN buffalo_NN breed_NN commonly_RB found_VBN in_IN Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP ,_, while_IN Malkani_NNP and_CC Patel_NNP had_VBD studied_VBN the_DT Surati_NNP breed_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
Prabhu_NNP and_CC Bhattacharya_NNP [_NNP 1951_CD ]_NNP ,_, compared_VBN the_DT first_JJ and_CC second_JJ ejaculates_NNS collected_VBN in_IN rapid_JJ succession_NN from_IN eight_CD buffalo_NNS bulls_NNS at_IN weekly_JJ intervals_NNS ._.
They_PRP found_VBD that_IN while_IN highly_RB significant_JJ difference_NN existed_VBD between_IN bulls_NNS ,_, out_IN of_IN the_DT 12_CD criteria_NNS of_IN semen_NNS quality_NN studied_VBN ,_, only_RB percentages_VBZ of_IN abnormal_JJ and_CC dead_JJ sperm_NN showed_VBD statistically_RB significant_JJ difference_NN between_IN ejaculates_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN in_IN the_DT ejaculate_NN approached_VBD five_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN of_IN significance_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ paper_NN four_CD ejaculates_VBZ taken_VBN in_IN quick_JJ succession_NN from_IN 12_CD buffalo_NN bulls_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT breed_NN commonly_RB found_VBN in_IN Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP are_VBP analysed_VBN and_CC compared_VBN ._.
METHODS_NNP The_DT twelve_NN bulls_NNS selected_VBN for_IN the_DT study_NN were_VBD purchased_VBN locally_RB so_RB that_IN their_PRP$ exact_JJ ages_NNS were_VBD not_RB known_VBN ._.
They_PRP all_DT possessed_VBD full_JJ mouths_NNS and_CC were_VBD healthy_JJ and_CC vigorous_JJ ._.
Preliminary_JJ trials_NNS showed_VBD that_IN they_PRP were_VBD suitable_JJ for_IN artificial_JJ service_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD kept_VBN on_IN a_DT uniform_JJ schedule_NN of_IN rations_NNS ,_, which_WDT consisted_VBD of_IN bhoosa_NN or_CC hay_VB given_VBN ad_NN lib_NN and_CC concentrates_NNS made_VBD up_IN of_IN two_CD parts_NNS crushed_VBD oats_NNS and_CC one_CD part_NN linseed_VBD cake_VB given_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 3_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN 800_CD lb_NN ._.
live-weight_NN ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, each_DT bull_NN was_VBD fed_VBN 10_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN green_JJ grass_NN ._.
The_DT experiment_NN was_VBD started_VBN on_IN 26_CD May_NNP ,_, 1952_CD and_CC the_DT last_JJ collections_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN 16_CD July_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ._.
To_TO facilitate_VB work_NN ,_, six_CD bulls_NNS at_IN a_DT time_NN were_VBD studied_VBN ._.
Collections_NNS from_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS of_IN six_CD bulls_NNS were_VBD made_VBN at_IN an_DT interval_NN of_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
For_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN analysis_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, all_DT collections_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN as_IN if_IN made_VBN on_IN the_DT same_JJ day_NN ._.
Each_DT ejaculate_NN was_VBD studied_VBN for_IN the_DT following_JJ criteria_NNS of_IN semen_NNS quality_NN ._.
(_( i_NN )_) Volume_NN ,_, (_( ii_NN )_) Initial_NNP motility_NN ,_, (_( iii_NN )_) Sperm_NNP concentration_NN ,_, (_( iv_NN )_) Total_NNP spermatozoa_NN in_IN an_DT ejaculate_NN and_CC (_( v_NN )_) Initial_NNP pH_NN ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, reaction_NN time_NN was_VBD also_RB recorded_VBN ._.
Altogether_RB ,_, per_IN bull_NN eight_CD collections_NNS each_DT consisting_VBG of_IN four_CD ejaculates_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN and_CC studied_VBN ._.

(_( v_NN )_) Initial_NNP pH_NN As_IN in_IN previous_JJ criteria_NNS of_IN semen_NNS quality_NN ,_, pH_NN showed_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ varia-_JJ tion_NN in_IN case_NN of_IN both_DT bulls_NNS and_CC ejaculates_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN with_IN the_DT frequency_NN of_IN collection_NN the_DT pH_NN turned_VBD from_IN acidity_NN to_TO definite_VB alkalinity_NN ._.

(_( vi_NN )_) Reaction_NN time_NN Reaction_NNP time_NN showed_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ difference_NN from_IN bull_NN to_TO bull_VB and_CC from_IN ejaculate_NN to_TO ejaculate_VB ._.
Besides_IN ,_, the_DT difference_NN among_IN ejaculates_NNS also_RB varied_VBD signi-_JJ ficantly_RB from_IN bull_NN to_TO bull_VB ._.
On_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, the_DT first_JJ two_CD ejaculates_NNS individually_RB differed_VBN significantly_RB from_IN the_DT remaining_VBG two_CD ejaculates_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT first_JJ and_CC second_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
The_DT results_NNS presented_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN confirm_VBZ the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Prabhu_NNP and_CC Bhatta-_NNP charya_NN [_NN 1951_CD ]_NN ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD ejaculates_NNS taken_VBN in_IN rapid_JJ succession_NN are_VBP con-_JJ cerned_VBN ._.
Further_RB ,_, in_IN all_PDT the_DT five_CD items_NNS of_IN semen_NNS criteria_NNS and_CC reaction_NN time_NN compared_VBN ,_, the_DT first_JJ two_CD ejaculates_NNS appear_VBP to_TO be_VB superior_JJ to_TO the_DT subsequent_JJ two_CD ejaculates_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN the_DT third_JJ and_CC fourth_JJ ejaculates_NNS contained_VBD less_JJR semen_JJ volumes_NNS ,_, of_IN lower_JJR initial_JJ motility_NN rating_NN ,_, of_IN lower_JJR sperm_NN concentration_NN ,_, of_IN lower_JJR total_JJ number_NN of_IN sperm_JJ and_CC of_IN higher_JJR pH_NN value_NN than_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD ejaculates_NNS ._.
Besides_IN ,_, the_DT reaction_NN times_NNS in_IN the_DT former_JJ cases_NNS were_VBD higher_JJR ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ therefore_RB that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ undesirable_JJ to_TO take_VB more_JJR than_IN two_CD ejaculates_NNS at_IN a_DT time_NN from_IN the_DT buffalo_NN bulls_VBZ when_WRB a_DT schedule_NN of_IN collections_NNS at_IN weekly_JJ intervals_NNS is_VBZ followed_VBN at_IN the_DT artificial_JJ insemination_NN centres_NNS ._.
Even_RB so_RB ,_, there_EX could_MD be_VB exceptions_NNS as_IN seen_VBN by_IN the_DT large_JJ bull_NN to_TO bull_VB variation_NN and_CC significant_JJ 'bull_JJ X_NNP ejaculate_NN '_POS interaction_NN ._.
A_DT safer_JJR course_NN may_MD be_VB to_TO follow_VB generally_RB the_DT suggestion_NN made_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN and_CC introduce_VB modification_NN only_RB under_IN special_JJ circumstances_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
Four_CD ejaculates_VBZ taken_VBN in_IN rapid_JJ succession_NN at_IN weekly_JJ intervals_NNS from_IN twelve_NN buffalo_NN bulls_NNS of_IN the_DT type_NN commonly_RB found_VBN in_IN Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP were_VBD analysed_VBN in_IN respect_NN of_IN five_CD semen_NNS criteria_NNS and_CC reaction_NN time_NN ._.
December_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP U._NNP D._NNP SHARMA_NNP 277_CD 2_CD ._.
On_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ undesirable_JJ to_TO take_VB more_JJR than_IN two_CD ejaculates_NNS at_IN a_DT time_NN from_IN buffalo_NN bulls_NNS ,_, though_IN in_IN special_JJ cir-_JJ cumstances_NNS depending_VBG upon_IN the_DT individual_JJ behaviour_NN of_IN the_DT bulls_NNS a_DT slight_JJ departure_NN from_IN this_DT rule_NN may_MD be_VB made_VBN ._.

As_IN compared_VBN to_TO Milovanov_NNP 's_POS statement_NN [_NN 1932_CD ]_NN that_IN the_DT distance_NN to_TO which_WDT bull_NN semen_NNS is_VBZ to_TO be_VB transported_VBN should_MD not_RB exceed_VB two_CD hours_NNS '_POS journey_NN and_CC that_IN not_RB more_JJR than_IN six_CD hours_NNS should_MD lapse_VB between_IN collection_NN and_CC insemination_NN ,_, Lambert_NNP and_CC MacKenzie_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD successful_JJ impregnation_NN with_IN semen_NNS air_NN lifted_VBN from_IN Beltsville_NNP ,_, Maryland_NNP to_TO Piran_NNP in_IN the_DT Province_NNP of_IN Buenos_NNP Aires_NNP ,_, with_IN the_DT total_JJ time-lapse_NN of_IN seven_CD days_NNS between_IN collection_NN and_CC insemination_NN ._.
Cows_NNS in_IN England_NNP have_VBP been_VBN successfully_RB inseminated_VBN with_IN semen_NNS sent_VBN by_IN air_NN from_IN Denmark_NNP [_NNP Edwards_NNP ,_, Walton_NNP and_CC Siebenga_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ]_NN and_CC those_DT in_IN Italy_NNP from_IN semen_NNS air_NN lifted_VBN from_IN South_NNP and_CC North_NNP America_NNP [_NNP Bonadonna_NNP ,_, 1949_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, successful_JJ inseminations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN per-_JJ formed_VBN with_IN Hariana_NNP semen_NNS sent_VBD either_DT way_NN between_IN Izatnagar_NNP and_CC Calcutta_NNP ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, over_IN 250_CD inseminations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN performed_VBN at_IN Cochin_NNP ,_, Ernakulam_NNP and_CC Colombo_NNP from_IN air-borne_JJ semen_NNS from_IN Sindhi_NNP bulls_NNS stationed_VBD at_IN the_DT Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Division_NNP 's_POS field_NN station_NN at_IN Indian_JJ Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, among_IN the_DT various_JJ problems_NNS associated_VBN with_IN long_JJ range_NN paternity_NN ,_, the_DT economics_NNS of_IN the_DT time_NN factor_NN involved_VBN between_IN despatch_NN of_IN semen_NNS from_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN collection_NN to_TO the_DT sites_NNS of_IN insemination_NN is_VBZ an_DT important_JJ one_CD ._.
This_DT is_VBZ specially_RB so_RB in_IN cases_NNS where_WRB the_DT animals_NNS to_TO be_VB inseminated_VBN are_VBP located_VBN right_RB in_IN the_DT interior_NN ,_, and_CC are_VBP reached_VBN only_RB through_IN primitive_JJ modes_NNS of_IN conveyance_NN over_IN difficult_JJ road_NN and_CC terrain_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT heavy_JJ expenditure_NN inevitable_JJ in_IN such_JJ cases_NNS ,_, one_CD has_VBZ to_TO see_VB whether_IN it_PRP is_VBZ repaid_VBN by_IN a_DT proportionately_RB reasonable_JJ level_NN of_IN fertility_NN ._.
To_TO investigate_VB this_DT problem_NN ,_, the_DT present_JJ study_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN ._.
METHODS_NNP AND_CC RESULTS_NNP In_IN order_NN to_TO ensure_VB that_DT sufficient_JJ number_NN of_IN cows_NNS would_MD be_VB available_JJ on_IN a_DT given_VBN day_NN for_IN insemination_NN ,_, the_DT corpus_NN lutea_NN of_IN cows_NNS in_IN groups_NNS of_IN 6-10_JJ from_IN the_DT experimental_JJ herd_NN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP were_VBD manually_RB removed_VBN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS usually_RB came_VBD on_IN heat_NN from_IN 3rd_CD to_TO 4th_CD day_NN after_IN the_DT treatment_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN oestrus_JJ cycles_NNS of_IN a_DT group_NN of_IN cows_NNS were_VBD so_RB adjusted_VBN as_IN to_TO ensure_VB sufficient_JJ number_NN of_IN cows_NNS on_IN heat_NN to_TO be_VB ready_JJ at_IN about_IN the_DT dates_NNS required_VBN ._.
Semen_NNP samples_NNS of_IN good_JJ quality_NN from_IN two_CD young_JJ bulls_NNS were_VBD in_IN the_DT meantime_NN processed_VBN and_CC kept_VB ready_JJ so_RB that_IN when_WRB the_DT cows_NNS came_VBD on_IN heat_NN and/or_NN repeated_VBD ,_, semen_NNS samples_NNS with_IN storage_NN times_NNS ranging_VBG from_IN 120-241_JJ hours_NNS were_VBD available_JJ for_IN artificial_JJ service_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN ,_, 21_CD cows_NNS were_VBD inseminated_VBN 279_CD 7_CD AR/53_NNP ._.
13_CD 280_CD FERTILITY_NNP OF_NNP BULL_NNP SEMEN_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.

TABLE_NNP II_NNP Age_NNP of_IN semen_NNS used_VBN in_IN the_DT successful_JJ cases_NNS Cow_NNP number_NN Age_NNP of_IN semen_NNS in_IN hours_NNS Bull_NNP number_NN 1_CD 216_CD 2_CD 2_CD 216_CD 2_CD 3_CD 120_CD 1_CD 4_CD 241_CD 1_CD 6_CD 241_CD 1_CD 6_CD 197_CD 1_CD 7_CD 168_CD 1_CD 8_CD 192_CD 1_CD 9_CD 126_CD 1_CD DISCUSSION_NN In_IN our_PRP$ study_NN ,_, more_JJR than_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT successes_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN with_IN semen_NNS stored_VBN for_IN 9-10_JJ days_NNS ._.
Such_JJ samples_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT unpublished_JJ data_NNS collected_VBN by_IN Bhatnagar_NNP contain_NN on_IN an_DT average_JJ 15-20_JJ per_IN cent_NN motile_NN sperm_NN ._.
Of_IN this_DT ,_, a_DT small_JJ proportion_NN differing_VBG with_IN semen_NNS samples_NNS are_VBP progressively_RB motile_JJ ._.
The_DT actual_JJ percentage_NN of_IN total_JJ and_CC progressively_RB motile_JJ sperm_JJ present_NN in_IN the_DT stored_JJ semen_NNS samples_NNS depended_VBD on_IN the_DT bulls_NNS and_CC varied_VBN from_IN ejaculate_NN to_TO ejaculate_VB within_IN a_DT bull_NN ._.
Report_NNP of_IN Margolin_NNP ,_, Bartlett_NNP and_CC Lepard_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NN shows_VBZ significant_JJ correlation_NN between_IN December_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP ,_, K._NNP D._NNP BHAYA_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP 281_CD longevity_NN of_IN preserved_JJ semen_NNS stored_VBD at_IN 4ºC_CD ._.
and_CC fertility_NN ._.
In_IN our_PRP$ study_NN ,_, estimations_NNS of_IN motile_JJ sperm_NN in_IN semen_NNS samples_NNS were_VBD not_RB carried_VBN out_RP ._.
But_CC considering_VBG the_DT average_NN values_NNS ,_, an_DT estimate_NN can_MD be_VB arrived_VBN at_IN regarding_VBG the_DT probable_JJ number_NN of_IN motile_JJ sperm_JJ present_NN on_IN an_DT average_NN in_IN such_JJ samples_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP approximates_VBZ to_TO the_DT estimate_NN given_VBN by_IN Salisbury_NNP and_CC Bratton_NNP [_NNP 1948_CD ]_NNP as_IN to_TO the_DT number_NN of_IN live_JJ sperm_NN that_WDT should_MD be_VB introduced_VBN in_IN the_DT reproductive_JJ tract_NN of_IN the_DT cows_NNS for_IN ensuring_VBG conception_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ over-all_JJ fertility_NN for_IN all_DT inseminations_NNS works_NNS at_IN 16.07_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
If_IN the_DT 16_CD cows_NNS ,_, on_IN which_WDT 30_CD inseminations_NNS were_VBD performed_VBN ,_, are_VBP omitted_VBN (_( in_IN view_NN of_IN their_PRP$ proving_NN to_TO be_VB shy_JJ breeders_NNS )_) the_DT overall_JJ fertility_NN rate_NN rises_VBZ to_TO 34.60_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Further_RB ,_, a_DT certain_JJ correction_NN has_VBZ to_TO be_VB applied_VBN for_IN inseminations_NNS made_VBN at_IN induced_JJ heats_NNS ,_, which_WDT according_VBG to_TO foreign_JJ workers_NNS ,_, produce_VBP lower_JJR conceptions_NNS ._.
Taking_VBG into_IN account_NN all_DT relevant_JJ factors_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD not_RB be_VB considered_VBN unreasonable_JJ to_TO estimate_VB that_IN given_VBN good_JJ quality_NN semen_NNS to_TO start_VB with_IN ,_, preservation_NN for_IN 9-10_JJ days_NNS at_IN 4ºC_CD ._.
gives_VBZ a_DT fertility_NN rate_NN lying_VBG between_IN 35-40_JJ per_IN cent_NN ._.
No_DT doubt_NN ,_, this_DT fertility_NN rate_NN is_VBZ 20_CD to_TO 25_CD per_IN cent_NN less_JJR than_IN what_WP is_VBZ normally_RB obtained_VBN ,_, yet_RB ,_, in_IN our_PRP$ opinion_NN ,_, the_DT results_NNS offer_VBP a_DT reasonably_RB sound_JJ basis_NN for_IN undertaking_VBG long_JJ range_NN paternity_NN programmes_NNS ,_, where_WRB the_DT time-lag_NN between_IN collection_NN and_CC insemination_NN is_VBZ of_IN the_DT order_NN of_IN 9-10_JJ days_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ to_TO be_VB remembered_VBN that_IN the_DT findings_NNS reported_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN pertain_NN to_TO currently_RB used_VBN methods_NNS of_IN preservation_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT new_JJ technique_NN of_IN preserving_VBG sperm_NN at_IN very_RB low_JJ temperatures_NNS [_VBP Polge_NNP and_CC Rowson_NNP ,_, 1952_CD ]_NN developed_VBD in_IN Britain_NNP ,_, far_RB reaching_VBG changes_NNS affecting_VBG long_JJ range_NN paternity_NN are_VBP expected_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NN From_IN a_DT study_NN of_IN 56_CD inseminations_NNS performed_VBN with_IN good_JJ quality_NN bull_NN semen_NNS preserved_VBD upto_JJ 10_CD days_NNS at_IN 4ºC._CD ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN estimated_VBN that_IN about_IN 35-40_JJ per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT cows_NNS may_MD be_VB expected_VBN to_TO hold_VB ,_, which_WDT provide_VBP a_DT reasonably_RB sound_JJ basis_NN for_IN undertaking_VBG long_JJ range_NN paternity_NN service_NN ,_, when_WRB required_VBN ._.

31_CD (_( 9_CD )_) ,_, 817-822_JJ ACCURACY_NNP OF_IN A_NNP SIMPLE_NNP METHOD_NNP FOR_NNP ESTIMATING_NNP THE_NNP PERCENTAGE_NNP OF_NNP ABNORMAL_NNP SPERMATOZOA_NNP IN_NNP SEMEN_NNP SAMPLES_NNP By_IN S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP and_CC U._NNP D._NNP SHARMA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Genetics_NNP Division_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, Uttar_NNP Pradesh_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 23_CD May_NNP 1953_CD )_) FOR_IN the_DT assessment_NN of_IN potential_JJ fertility_NN of_IN semen_NNS samples_NNS used_VBN in_IN artificial_JJ breeding_NN ,_, microscopic_JJ examination_NN of_IN stained_JJ spermatozoa_NN is_VBZ still_RB the_DT routine_JJ procedure_NN followed_VBN in_IN all_DT advanced_JJ artificial_JJ insemination_NN laboratories_NNS ._.
Details_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ methods_NNS in_IN vogue_NN are_VBP given_VBN by_IN Anderson_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP ._.
Salisbury_NNP ,_, Willet_NNP and_CC Seligman_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP ,_, who_WP tested_VBD four_CD methods_NNS of_IN making_VBG semen_JJ smears_NNS ,_, found_VBD that_IN the_DT most_RBS satisfactory_JJ one_CD consisted_VBN of_IN drawing_VBG a_DT drop_NN of_IN diluted_JJ semen_NNS between_IN two_CD microscope_NN slides_NNS ,_, drying_VBG and_CC clearing_VBG in_IN chlorazine_NN and_CC staining_VBG in_IN carbol-fuchsin_NN and_CC gentian_JJ voilet_NN ._.
Gunn_NNP ,_, et_RB al_NN ._.
[_NN 1942_CD ]_NN have_VBP obtained_VBN uniformly_RB satisfactory_JJ results_NNS with_IN a_DT modified_JJ method_NN of_IN Cary_NNP and_CC Hotchkiss_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP using_VBG Mayer_NNP 's_POS acid_NN haemalum_NN and_CC eosin_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN these_DT methods_NNS involve_VBP considerable_JJ labour_NN and_CC time_NN ;_: a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN of_IN skill_NN in_IN preparing_VBG the_DT smears_NNS and_CC later_RB ,_, in_IN staining_VBG them_PRP is_VBZ also_RB essential_JJ ._.
Besides_IN ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT processing_NN at_IN the_DT various_JJ stages_NNS of_IN its_PRP$ preparation_NN ,_, an_DT inevitable_JJ increase_NN in_IN certain_JJ types_NNS of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN may_MD occur_VB ._.
Mercier_NNP and_CC Salisbury_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ,_, who_WP studied_VBD the_DT effects_NNS of_IN the_DT methods_NNS of_IN making_VBG ,_, clearing_NN and_CC staining_VBG smears_NNS on_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN tailless_JJ heads_NNS and_CC on_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN abnormally_RB formed_VBN spermatozoa_NN in_IN fresh_JJ and_CC stored_JJ semen_NNS of_IN fertile_NN bulls_NNS ,_, observed_VBD that_IN (_( a_DT )_) the_DT 'pulling_VBG '_POS and_CC 'drop_NNP '_POS methods_NNS of_IN making_VBG smears_NNS gave_VBD the_DT same_JJ result_NN when_WRB the_DT smears_NNS were_VBD of_IN uniform_JJ thickness_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) fixing_VBG smears_NNS by_IN heat_NN or_CC by_IN albumen_NNS did_VBD not_RB influence_VB the_DT proportion_NN of_IN tailless_JJ heads_NNS or_CC true_JJ abnormals_NNS ,_, (_( c_NN )_) clearing_NN of_IN smears_NNS with_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN chlorazine_NN was_VBD responsible_JJ for_IN producing_VBG most_JJS of_IN the_DT tailless_NN heads_NNS and_CC (_( d_NN )_) with_IN semen_NNS of_IN fertile_NN bulls_NNS ,_, the_DT staining_NN of_IN thin_JJ uncleared_JJ smears_NNS eliminated_VBD most_JJS of_IN the_DT tailless_NN heads_NNS ._.
At_IN artificial_JJ insemination_NN field_NN stations_NNS elaborate_VBP laboratory_NN facilities_NNS are_VBP not_RB always_RB available_JJ ._.
To_TO meet_VB the_DT special_JJ needs_NNS of_IN the_DT persons_NNS entrusted_VBN with_IN such_JJ work_NN it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO place_VB in_IN their_PRP$ hands_NNS a_DT method_NN which_WDT ,_, while_IN requiring_VBG a_DT minimum_NN of_IN laboratory_NN equipment_NN ,_, may_MD at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN be_VB expected_VBN to_TO give_VB results_NNS of_IN about_IN equal_JJ precision_NN as_IN of_IN the_DT elaborate_JJ tests_NNS ._.
Such_JJ a_DT method_NN has_VBZ been_VBN experi-_JJ mented_VBN upon_IN by_IN us_PRP ;_: in_IN this_DT paper_NN its_PRP$ results_NNS are_VBP compared_VBN with_IN those_DT got_VBN by_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT more_RBR elaborate_JJ laboratory_NN methods_NNS ._.
Incidentally_RB ,_, the_DT comparison_NN also_RB reveals_VBZ the_DT relative_JJ merits_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD methods_NNS of_IN processing_NN of_IN sperm284_NN ESTIMATING_NNP ABNORMAL_NNP SPERMATOZOA_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, on_IN it_PRP ,_, as_IN is_VBZ done_VBN in_IN temporary_JJ mounts_NNS for_IN rapid_JJ examination_NN ._.
To_TO prevent_VB the_DT evaporation_NN of_IN the_DT liquid_NN under_IN the_DT coverslip_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD completely_RB sealed_VBN with_IN a_DT thick_JJ side_NN coating_NN of_IN vaseline_NN ._.
Thus_RB protected_VBN ,_, the_DT slide_NN can_MD be_VB examined_VBN at_IN leisure_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ method_NN smears_NNS were_VBD prepared_VBN as_IN described_VBN by_IN Gunn_NNP ,_, et_RB al_NN ._.
[_NN 1942_CD ]_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
smear_NN was_VBD fixed_VBN in_IN methyl-alcohol_NN ,_, washed_VBN in_IN water_NN ,_, stained_VBN with_IN Mayer_NNP 's_POS acid_NN haemalum_NN ,_, counterstained_VBN with_IN acidified_JJ saturated_VBN alcohol_JJ solution_NN of_IN eosin_NN ,_, washed_VBN in_IN water_NN and_CC dried_VBN ._.
For_IN each_DT ejaculate_NN ,_, two_CD slides_NNS per_IN method_NN were_VBD made_VBN ,_, and_CC at_IN least_JJS 300_CD spermatozoa_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN per_IN slide_NN under_IN high_JJ dry_JJ power_NN objective_NN ._.

XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, The_DT figures_NNS presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP are_VBP bull-wise_JJ averages_NNS got_VBD with_IN the_DT two_CD methods_NNS ._.
These_DT were_VBD tested_VBN by_IN the_DT technique_NN of_IN analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN [_NNP Snedecor_NNP ,_, 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
Results_NNS are_VBP discussed_VBN below_IN :_: (_( i_NN )_) Head_NNP abnormality_NN ._.
The_DT actual_JJ percentage_NN varied_VBD from_IN 0.3_CD to_TO 1.0_CD ._.
It_PRP formed_VBD the_DT smallest_JJS portion_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ morphological_JJ abnormalities_NNS of_IN the_DT sperm_NN observed_VBD ._.
On_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, the_DT abnormality_NN was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN the_DT second_JJ than_IN in_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD statistically_RB highly_RB significant_JJ ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) Mid-piece_NNP abnormality_NN ._.
The_DT actual_JJ percentage_NN varied_VBD from_IN 0.46_CD to_TO 1.42_CD and_CC on_IN an_DT average_NN was_VBD slightly_RB higher_JJR than_IN (_( i_JJ )_) above_IN ._.
On_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, the_DT abnormality_NN was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN the_DT second_JJ than_IN in_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN ,_, after_IN eliminating_VBG the_DT variation_NN due_JJ to_TO bulls_NNS and_CC ejaculates_NNS ,_, was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB not_RB significant_JJ ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) Tail_NNP abnormality_NN ._.
These_DT form_VBP the_DT largest_JJS portion_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ abnormality_NN observed_VBD and_CC varied_VBD from_IN 1.91-9.07_JJ per_IN cent_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, the_DT percentage_NN was_VBD higher_JJR in_IN the_DT second_JJ than_IN in_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN was_VBD statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
In_IN addition_NN with_IN different_JJ bulls_NNS significantly_RB different_JJ percentages_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
(_( iv_NN )_) Total_NNP abnormality_NN ._.
The_DT percentage_NN varied_VBD from_IN 3.00_CD to_TO 11.09_CD ._.
The_DT second_JJ method_NN gave_VBD significantly_RB higher_JJR percentage_NN than_IN the_DT first_JJ ._.
CONCLUSION_NNP The_DT second_JJ method_NN gave_VBD ,_, on_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, significantly_RB higher_JJR estimates_NNS of_IN morphologically_RB abnormal_JJ sperm_NN than_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD so_RB particularly_RB in_IN case_NN of_IN head_NN and_CC tail_NN abnormalities_NNS ._.
As_IN stated_VBN earlier_RBR ,_, the_DT second_JJ method_NN involves_VBZ a_DT more_RBR elaborate_JJ processing_NN of_IN sperm_NN than_IN the_DT first_JJ ._.
The_DT higher_JJR percentage_NN of_IN abnormals_NNS thus_RB appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB due_JJ in_IN large_JJ measure_NN to_TO the_DT additional_JJ manipulations_NNS to_TO which_WDT the_DT sperm_NN were_VBD subjected_VBN ._.
This_DT will_MD be_VB seen_VBN by_IN the_DT larger_JJR number_NN of_IN broken_JJ mid-piece_NN ,_, degenerate_JJ head_NN ,_, bent_NN and_CC tailless_NN abnormalities_NNS shown_VBN by_IN the_DT second_JJ method_NN (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN this_DT ,_, it_PRP may_MD reasonably_RB be_VB concluded_VBN that_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN gives_VBZ a_DT better_JJR estimate_NN of_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN morphologically_RB abnormal_JJ sperm_NNS actually_RB present_JJ than_IN the_DT second_JJ ._.
Besides_IN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT easier_JJR of_IN the_DT two_CD methods_NNS to_TO learn_VB and_CC practice_NN ,_, requiring_VBG minimum_JJ laboratory_NN facilities_NNS ._.
As_IN such_JJ it_PRP can_MD conveniently_RB be_VB adopted_VBN by_IN all_DT workers_NNS in_IN the_DT field_NN for_IN routine_JJ semen_NNS examination_NN without_IN sacrificing_VBG accuracy_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
Two_CD methods_NNS of_IN making_VBG semen_NNS smears_NNS for_IN estimating_VBG the_DT proportion_NN of_IN morphologically_RB abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN in_IN semen_NNS samples_NNS were_VBD compared_VBN ._.
For_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN ,_, temporary_JJ mounts_NNS made_VBN with_IN eosin_NN stained_VBN semen_NNS samples_NNS were_VBD used_VBN ,_, while_IN for_IN the_DT second_JJ ,_, permanent_JJ mounts_NNS prepared_VBD as_IN described_VBN by_IN Gunn_NNP ,_, et_RB al_NN ._.
[_NN 1942_CD ]_NN were_VBD used_VBN ._.
Two_CD slides_NNS per_IN method_NN per_IN ejaculate_NN and_CC 52_CD first_JJ and_CC 53_CD second_JJ ejaculates_NNS obtained_VBN in_IN quick_JJ succession_NN were_VBD studied_VBN ._.
Per_NNP slide_NN about_IN 300_CD spermatozoa_NNS were_VBD counted_VBN ._.
December_NNP ,_, 1953_CD ]_NNP S._NNP S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP U._NNP D._NNP SHARMA_NNP 287_CD 2_CD ._.
Results_NNS showed_VBD that_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN gave_VBD ,_, on_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, a_DT significanty_NN lower_JJR proportion_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ spermatozoa_NN than_IN the_DT second_JJ method_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT comparatively_RB fewer_JJR manipulations_NNS to_TO which_WDT the_DT speraatozoa_NN were_VBD subjected_VBN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN shown_VBN that_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN ,_, being_VBG the_DT easier_JJR one_CD of_IN the_DT two_CD ,_, can_MD be_VB used_VBN in_IN place_NN of_IN the_DT second_JJ one_CD at_IN field_NN artificial_JJ insemination_NN centres_NNS for_IN routine_JJ semen_NNS examinations_NNS without_IN sacrificing_VBG accuracy_NN of_IN estimates_NNS ._.
