(_( The_DT Collegiate_NNP Press_NNP ,_, Inc._NNP Iowa_NNP )_) PADDY-CUM-FISH_JJ CULTURE_NNP PILOT_NNP STUDIES_NNP CONDUCTED_NNP AT_NNP HESSERAGHATTA_NNP AND_NNP VISWESWARAYA_NNP CANAL_NNP FARMS_NNP IN_NNP MYSORE_NNP STATE_NNP By_IN H._NNP D._NNP R._NNP IYENGAR_NNP ,_, M.Sc._NNP ,_, PH.D._NNP (_( Washington_NNP )_) ,_, Fisheries_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Husbandry_NNP ,_, Government_NNP of_IN Mysore_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 22_CD April_NNP 1953_CD )_) (_( With_IN three_CD text-figures_NNS )_) ONE_CD of_IN the_DT several_JJ items_NNS of_IN fishery_NN development_NN work_NN is_VBZ the_DT practice_NN of_IN rearing_VBG fish_NN in_IN paddy_JJ fields_NNS ._.
The_DT vast_JJ stretches_NNS of_IN water_NN 6_CD in_IN ._.
to_TO 8_CD in_IN ._.
deep_NN that_WDT are_VBP maintained_VBN in_IN the_DT paddy_NN fields_NNS are_VBP rich_JJ in_IN fish_JJ food_NN ,_, hence_RB form_JJ excellent_JJ nurseries_NNS for_IN fish_NN ._.
The_DT idea_NN of_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN is_VBZ new_JJ only_RB to_TO India_NNP ,_, for_IN it_PRP is_VBZ extensively_RB practised_VBN in_IN several_JJ other_JJ countries_NNS of_IN the_DT Indo-Pacific_JJ region_NN ,_, Japan_NNP ,_, China_NNP ,_, Indo-_NNP nesia_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
The_DT credit_NN for_IN popularising_VBG such_PDT an_DT enterprise_NN should_MD go_VB to_TO the_DT Chinese_NNPS ,_, who_WP have_VBP been_VBN pioneers_NNS in_IN fresh_JJ water_NN fish_JJ culture_NN ._.
The_DT Chairman_NNP of_IN the_DT Sub-_NNP Committee_NNP on_IN fish_JJ culture_NN of_IN the_DT Indo-Pacific_NNP Fisheries_NNP Council_NNP ,_, F.A.O_NNP ._.
states_NNS (_( F.A.O./IPFC_NNP 1951_CD )_) that_IN fish_NN are_VBP reared_VBN simultaneously_RB with_IN paddy_NN in_IN over_IN 4,00,000_CD hectares*_NN of_IN paddy_JJ fields_NNS in_IN the_DT Indo-Pacific_JJ area_NN ._.
Malaya_NNP leads_VBZ in_IN this_DT with_IN 3,00,000_CD hectares_NNS of_IN paddy_JJ fields_NNS under_IN fish-culture_NN ._.
Indonesia_NNP is_VBZ second_JJ with_IN 62,000_CD hectares_NNS ,_, while_IN Japan_NNP has_VBZ 18,200_CD hectares_NNS ,_, Indo-China_NNP and_CC Ceylon_NNP have_VBP 15,000_CD hectares_NNS each_DT under_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN ._.
In_IN India_NNP several_JJ attempts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO popularise_VB the_DT practice_NN of_IN paddy-_JJ cum-fish_JJ culture_NN ._.
The_DT available_JJ literature_NN on_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN is_VBZ limited_VBN to_TO brief_VB reports_NNS and_CC notes_NNS ._.
Hora_NNP [_NN 1949_CD ]_NN states_NNS that_IN in_IN an_DT acre_NN along_IN with_IN a_DT paddy_JJ crop_NN ,_, a_DT fish_JJ crop_NN of_IN 100_CD to_TO 300_CD lb_NN ._.
could_MD be_VB raised_VBN ._.
In_IN China_NNP ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN shown_VBN that_IN paddy_JJ yield_NN increased_VBN by_IN 10_CD to_TO 15_CD per_IN cent_NN by_IN practising_VBG fish_JJ culture_NN in_IN rice_NN fields_NNS ._.
The_DT fish_NN to_TO an_DT extent_NN control_NN the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT stem_NN borer_NN and_CC also_RB the_DT propagation_NN of_IN mosquito_NN larvae_NN ._.
In_IN Dutch_NNP East_NNP Indies_NNP ,_, fish_JJ culture_NN in_IN paddy_NN fields_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN characterised_VBN as_IN the_DT 'highest_JJS form_NN of_IN pisciculture_NN ._. '_''
Experiments_NNS conducted_VBN by_IN the_DT Directorate_NNP of_IN Fisheries_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP during_IN 1945-46_JJ showed_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN paddy_JJ yield_NN of_IN 150_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN acre_NN ._.
The_DT F._NNP A._NNP O_NNP ._.
Rice_NNP Conference_NNP at_IN Baguio_NNP ,_, in_IN March_NNP 1948_CD ,_, recommended_VBD the_DT adoption_NN of_IN this_DT practice_NN in_IN all_DT suitable_JJ places_NNS ._.
Hora_NNP [_NN 1951_CD ]_NN while_IN commenting_VBG on_IN the_DT paper_NN by_IN Hofstede_NNP and_CC Ardiwinata_NNP [_NNP 1950_CD ]_NN on_IN the_DT compilation_NN of_IN data_NNS on_IN fish_JJ culture_NN in_IN irrigated_JJ rice_NN fields_NNS in_IN West_NNP Java_NNP draws_VBZ the_DT attention_NN of_IN the_DT public_NN on_IN the_DT importance_NN of_IN fish_JJ culture_NN in_IN paddy_JJ fields_NNS ._.
The_DT possibilities_NNS of_IN growing_VBG fish_JJ should_MD on_IN no_DT account_NN be_VB underestimated_VBN as_IN the_DT advantages_NNS derived_VBN are_VBP many_JJ ._.
Fish_JJ production_NN in_IN paddy-fields_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN classified_VBN into_IN four_CD categories_NNS :_: (_( a_DT )_) Catch_NN on_IN irrigated_JJ rice_NN fields_NNS which_WDT represents_VBZ a_DT wild_JJ crop_NN ._.
*_VB One_CD acre_NN =_VBZ 0.40468_CD hectare_NN 289_CD 7AR/53_CD 16_CD 290_CD PADDY-CUM-FISH_JJ CULTURE_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, (_( b_NN )_) Fish_JJ culture_NN as_IN a_DT secondary_JJ crop_NN ,_, which_WDT represents_VBZ the_DT raising_NN of_IN fish_NN as_IN an_DT alternate_NN crop_NN ._.
(_( c_NN )_) Fish_JJ culture_NN between_IN harvest_NN and_CC planting_NN in_IN fields_NNS where_WRB there_EX is_VBZ perennial_JJ irrigation_NN ,_, thus_RB using_VBG the_DT fields_NNS continuously_RB ._.
(_( d_NN )_) Mixed_NNP paddy_JJ cultivations_NNS and_CC fish_JJ culture_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT system_NN ,_, fish_NN is_VBZ reared_VBN as_IN a_DT catch_NN crop_NN during_IN longer_JJR or_CC shorter_JJR period_NN in_IN the_DT paddy_NN fields_NNS while_IN the_DT paddy_NN is_VBZ actually_RB growing_VBG ._.
Also_RB the_DT farmer_NN may_MD use_VB the_DT paddy_NN fields_NNS as_IN a_DT nursery_NN for_IN young_JJ fish_NN ._.
In_IN Indonesia_NNP ,_, there_EX is_VBZ an_DT extension_NN service_NN which_WDT gives_VBZ practical_JJ demonstration_NN on_IN the_DT utility_NN of_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN and_CC results_NNS of_IN these_DT experiments_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN the_DT paper_NN published_VBN by_IN Hofstede_NNP and_CC Ardiwinata_NNP ._.
According_VBG to_TO them_PRP ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB practicable_JJ to_TO have_VB fish_JJ culture_NN in_IN paddy_NN fields_NNS and_CC they_PRP recommend_VBP carp_NN as_IN an_DT ideal_JJ fish_NN for_IN such_JJ an_DT enterprise_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT tillering_VBG action_NN of_IN fish_JJ produces_NNS more_JJR stems_NNS ,_, the_DT fish_NN control_NN the_DT growth_NN of_IN weeds_NNS and_CC the_DT manurial_JJ value_NN of_IN fish_JJ excreta_NN will_MD result_VB in_IN an_DT increase_NN of_IN paddy_JJ yield_NN which_WDT is_VBZ shown_VBN to_TO be_VB 6.3_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
In_IN Mysore_NNP State_NNP the_DT first_JJ attempt_NN at_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN was_VBD made_VBN in_IN Nagar_NNP taluka_NN of_IN Shimoga_NNP district_NN in_IN the_DT paddy_JJ fields_NNS of_IN a_DT private_JJ land_NN owner_NN when_WRB a_DT few_JJ hundred_CD 1_CD in_IN ._.
size_NN fingerlings_NNS of_IN Ophicephalus_NNP striatus_NN were_VBD released_VBN into_IN a_DT paddy_JJ plot_NN ._.
Even_RB though_IN the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD not_RB completed_VBN due_JJ to_TO certain_JJ difficulties_NNS experienced_VBN by_IN the_DT landowner_NN on_IN the_DT field_NN ,_, his_PRP$ reactions_NNS to_TO this_DT novel_JJ venture_NN of_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN was_VBD expressed_VBN in_IN a_DT letter_NN to_TO the_DT Fisheries_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, wherein_VBD the_DT landowner_NN says_VBZ :_: ``_`` I_PRP am_VBP glad_JJ to_TO report_VB that_IN the_DT small_JJ fishes_NNS let_VBP out_RP in_IN one_CD of_IN my_PRP$ fields_NNS of_IN paddy_NN at_IN Nagar_NNP a_DT few_JJ months_NNS ago_RB are_VBP thriving_VBG well_RB and_CC attained_VBD a_DT size_NN of_IN about_IN 3_CD in_IN ._.
In_IN my_PRP$ opinion_NN the_DT scheme_NN of_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN can_MD be_VB made_VBN a_DT success_NN in_IN the_DT Malnad_NNP parts_NNS provided_VBD the_DT fishes_NNS are_VBP let_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT fields_NNS immediately_RB after_IN the_DT paddy_JJ seedlings_NNS are_VBP transplanted_VBN so_RB that_IN at_IN least_JJS a_DT period_NN of_IN four_CD months_NNS may_MD be_VB allowed_VBN for_IN them_PRP to_TO grow_VB ._.
I_PRP would_MD suggest_VB fishes_NNS of_IN bigger_JJR size_NN than_IN those_DT used_VBN at_IN Nagar_NNP should_MD be_VB used_VBN ._.
As_RB far_RB as_IN I_PRP could_MD see_VB only_RB two_CD difficulties_NNS are_VBP met_VBN with_IN ._.
When_WRB the_DT rains_NNS are_VBP heavy_JJ ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ almost_RB impossible_JJ in_IN the_DT Malnad_NNP parts_NNS to_TO avoid_VB the_DT flooding_NN of_IN fields_NNS with_IN the_DT result_NN that_IN the_DT fishes_NNS are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO escape_VB with_IN the_DT flowing_JJ water_NN ._.
Secondly_RB crabs_NNS which_WDT are_VBP in_IN abundance_NN in_IN the_DT paddy_NN fields_NNS bore_IN opening_VBG across_IN the_DT mud_NN bunds_VBZ surrounding_VBG the_DT fields_NNS and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ through_IN these_DT opening_NN made_VBN by_IN the_DT crabs_NN that_IN the_DT impounded_JJ fish_NN find_VBP an_DT exit_NN to_TO get_VB out_IN of_IN the_DT fields_NNS ._.
``_`` These_DT points_NNS raised_VBN by_IN the_DT cultivator_NN are_VBP noteworthy_JJ and_CC should_MD be_VB provided_VBN with_IN an_DT answer_NN ._.
In_IN Mysore_NNP ,_, the_DT Policy_NNP Committee_NNP for_IN Agriculture_NNP at_IN its_PRP$ sixteenth_JJ meeting_NN of_IN the_DT Mysore_NNP Economic_NNP Conference_NNP held_VBD on_IN 11_CD April_NNP ,_, 1949_CD recommended_VBD to_TO Govern-_NNP ment_NN a_DT Scheme_NN for_IN the_DT introduction_NN of_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN as_IN a_DT very_RB promising_JJ method_NN of_IN short_JJ term_NN food_NN production_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT meanwhile_NN the_DT Fisheries_NNPS Division_NNP of_IN the_DT Department_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Husbandry_NNP conducted_VBD two_CD pilot_NN experiments_NNS in_IN the_DT selec-_JJ ted_JJ paddy_NN plots_NNS at_IN the_DT Hesserghatta_NNP and_CC Visweswaraya_NNP Canal_NNP farms_NNS respectively_RB ._.

I_PRP (_( Conducted_VBN at_IN Hesserghatta_NNP Grass_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, from_IN 19_CD December_NNP ,_, 1949_CD to_TO 21_CD April_NNP ,_, 1951_CD )_) An_DT area_NN of_IN 1/4_CD acre_NN was_VBD selected_VBN for_IN the_DT experiment_NN on_IN paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN ._.

yards_NNS each_DT ._.

yards_NNS in_IN the_DT area_NN was_VBD selected_VBN for_IN fish_JJ culture_NN ,_, the_DT remaining_VBG plots_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN as_IN control_NN plots_NNS ._.

ft._NN and_CC 1½_CD feet_NNS deep_JJ was_VBD dug_VBN up_RP near_IN the_DT water_NN inlet_NN to_TO act_VB as_IN retreats_NNS for_IN the_DT fish_NN which_WDT were_VBD attracted_VBN to_TO the_DT water_NN flow_NN at_IN the_DT inlet_NN ._.

to_TO 6_CD in._NN ,_, thus_RB a_DT total_JJ volume_NN of_IN 507_CD cubic_JJ feet_NNS water_NN was_VBD always_RB maintained_VBN in_IN each_DT paddy_NN plot_NN ._.
No_DT special_JJ manure_NN was_VBD used_VBN in_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN the_DT paddy_JJ field_NN ._.

and_CC an_DT average_JJ weight_NN of_IN 0.87_CD gm_NN ._.
were_VBD released_VBN into_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT selected_VBN plots_NNS on_IN 19_CD December_NNP ,_, 1949_CD ._.

high_JJ and_CC 6_CD in_IN ._.
apart_RB at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN fish_JJ release_NN ._.

of_IN fish_JJ production_NN in_IN an_DT acre_NN of_IN paddy_NN ._.

At_IN Hesserghatta_NNP on_IN harvesting_NN ,_, 90_CD seers_NNS of_IN paddy_NN was_VBD collected_VBN in_IN the_DT paddy-cum-fish_JJ culture_NN lot_NN and_CC 84_CD seers_NNS from_IN the_DT control_NN lot_NN thus_RB recording_VBG an_DT increase_NN of_IN 7.2_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN paddy_JJ yield_NN in_IN the_DT plot_NN where_WRB fish_NN was_VBD also_RB reared_VBN ._.
Fish_JJ survival_NN Out_IN of_IN the_DT 1,020_CD fish_JJ fingerlings_NNS introduced_VBN ,_, only_RB 193_CD survived_VBD recording_VBG a_DT survival_JJ rate_NN of_IN 18.1_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT loss_NN of_IN 81.9_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT fish_NN ,_, besides_IN natural_JJ causes_NNS ,_, was_VBD also_RB due_JJ to_TO predation_NN and_CC escapement_NN ._.
EXPERIMENT_NNP No_NNP ._.
II_NNP (_( Conducted_VBN at_IN Visweswaraya_NNP Canal_NNP Farm_NNP from_IN 23_CD September_NNP ,_, 1951_CD to_TO 28_CD November_NNP ,_, 1951_CD )_) An_DT area_NN of_IN 726_CD sq_NN ._.
yards_NNS was_VBD selected_VBN ._.
This_DT was_VBD divided_VBN into_IN two_CD plots_NNS of_IN 363_CD sq_NN ._.
yards_NNS each_DT ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT plots_NNS was_VBD used_VBN for_IN fish_JJ culture_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT other_JJ one_NN was_VBD used_VBN as_IN a_DT control_NN lot_NN ._.
Bunds_NNS were_VBD raised_VBN to_TO 1½_CD ft._NN ,_, screens_NNS were_VBD provided_VBN to_TO the_DT water_NN inlet_NN and_CC outlet_NN and_CC a_DT small_JJ depression_NN was_VBD dug_VBN up_RP near_IN the_DT water_NN inlet_NN ._.
The_DT depth_NN of_IN water_NN in_IN the_DT plots_NNS was_VBD maintained_VBN between_IN 6_CD in_IN ._.
to_TO 9_CD in_IN ._.
The_DT plot_NN held_VBD a_DT total_JJ volume_NN of_IN 1,906_CD cubic_JJ feet_NNS of_IN water_NN ._.
The_DT water_NN temperature_NN ranged_VBD from_IN 23.3ºC_CD ._.
to_TO 24.4ºC_CD ._.
Special_JJ manure_NN mixture_NN of_IN 6_CD 2/3_CD maunds_NNS of_IN groundnut_NN cake_NN ,_, two_CD maunds_NNS of_IN super-_JJ phosphate_NN and_CC four_CD maunds_NNS of_IN ammonium_NN sulphate_NN per_IN acre_NN was_VBD used_VBN in_IN preparing_VBG the_DT paddy_JJ plots_NNS ._.
The_DT paddy_NN plant_NN used_VBN ,_, was_VBD the_DT special_JJ deep_JJ water_NN paddy_NN ._.
1,100_CD fingerlings_NNS of_IN Ophicephalus_NNP striatus_NN of_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN 1.95_CD in_IN ._.
and_CC of_IN an_DT average_JJ weight_NN of_IN 1.07_CD gm_NN ._.
were_VBD released_VBN into_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT selected_VBN paddy_NN plots_NNS on_IN 296_CD PADDY-CUM-FISH_JJ CULTURE_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ._.
XXIII_NN ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, 23_CD September_NNP 1951_CD ._.
The_DT paddy_JJ seedlings_NNS were_VBD 24_CD in_IN ._.
high_JJ and_CC 6_CD in_IN ._.
apart_RB at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN fish_JJ release_NN ._.
Daily_JJ record_NN of_IN water_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT paddy_JJ field_NN was_VBD kept_VBN ._.
The_DT water_NN temperature_NN ranged_VBD from_IN 23.3ºC_CD to_TO 24.4ºC_CD ._.
The_DT experiment_NN lasted_VBD 66_CD days_NNS ._.
At_IN the_DT conclusion_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN on_IN 28-11-_JJ 1951_CD ,_, 127_CD fish_NN were_VBD collected_VBN ._.
They_PRP measured_VBD on_IN an_DT average_JJ 5.24_CD in_IN ._.
and_CC weighed_VBD 28.3_CD gm_NN ._.
each_DT ._.
Due_JJ to_TO inaccessibility_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD not_RB possible_JJ to_TO take_VB monthly_JJ record-_JJ ings_NNS of_IN length_NN and_CC weight_NN of_IN the_DT fish_NN ._.
The_DT water_NN in_IN the_DT plot_NN was_VBD fertile_JJ and_CC teeming_VBG with_IN fish_JJ food_NN ;_: this_DT no_DT doubt_NN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO preliminary_JJ manuring_NN of_IN the_DT paddy_JJ field_NN ._.
Consequently_RB the_DT fish_NN recorded_VBD a_DT good_JJ rate_NN of_IN growth_NN showing_VBG an_DT increase_NN in_IN length_NN of_IN 3.29_CD in_IN ._.
and_CC a_DT gain_NN in_IN weight_NN of_IN 27.23_CD gm_NN ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN for_IN the_DT same_JJ species_NNS in_IN this_DT experiment_NN in_IN 66_CD days_NNS as_RB compared_VBN to_TO the_DT gain_NN in_IN length_NN of_IN 1.37_CD in_IN ._.
and_CC a_DT gain_NN in_IN weight_NN of_IN 8.98_CD gm_NN ._.
in_IN 122_CD days_NNS in_IN Experiment_NNP No_NNP ._.
I_PRP is_VBZ noteworthy_JJ ._.
Manuring_NN of_IN the_DT paddy_JJ plots_NNS prior_RB to_TO fish_VB release_NN is_VBZ very_RB beneficial_JJ for_IN fish_JJ growth_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ production_NN of_IN fish_JJ per_IN acre_NN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN as_IN computed_VBN was_VBD 114.2_CD lb_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT Visweswaraya_NNP Canal_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, experiment_NN of_IN paddy_JJ yield_NN in_IN the_DT fish_JJ culture_NN lot_NN was_VBD 147_CD seers_NNS while_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN lot_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD 130_CD seers_NNS which_WDT showed_VBD an_DT increase_NN of_IN 13_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN paddy_JJ yield_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN 1,100_CD fish_NN introduced_VBN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT survival_NN of_IN only_RB 11.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT fingerlings_NNS had_VBD grown_VBN to_TO such_VB a_DT size_NN that_IN they_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO jump_VB out_IN of_IN the_DT paddy-_JJ cum-fish_JJ culture_NN lot_NN into_IN the_DT adjoining_JJ fields_NNS during_IN night_NN time_NN ._.
Predation_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN crabs_NN and_CC water_NN snakes_NNS was_VBD also_RB observed_VBN ._.
*_NN SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
Culture_NN of_IN Ophicephalus_NNP striatus_NN in_IN paddy_JJ field_NN requires_VBZ better_JJR facilities_NNS like_IN raising_VBG the_DT height_NN of_IN the_DT bund_NN and_CC use_NN of_IN manure_NN in_IN preparing_VBG the_DT paddy_JJ plots_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO produce_VB 100_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN fish_NN in_IN an_DT acre_NN of_IN paddy_JJ field_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN increase_VB the_DT yield_NN of_IN paddy_NN by_IN 7_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 13_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT paddy_NN fields_NNS could_MD be_VB used_VBN as_IN nurseries_NNS in_IN the_DT culture_NN of_IN murrels_NNS ._.
ACKNOWLEDGMENT_IN The_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD started_VBN at_IN the_DT instance_NN of_IN Sir_NNP Datar_NNP Singh_NNP ,_, Additional_NNP Secretary_NNP ,_, Ministry_NNP of_IN Food_NNP and_CC Agriculture_NNP ,_, Government_NNP of_IN India_NNP ,_, during_IN his_PRP$ visit_NN to_TO Hessaraghatta_NNP grass_NN farm_NN ._.
*The_NN relatively_RB poor_JJ results_NNS obtained_VBN in_IN these_DT experiments_NNS can_MD be_VB ascribed_VBN to_TO the_DT defective_JJ selection_NN of_IN fish_NN for_IN culture_NN ._.
The_DT murrel_NN is_VBZ a_DT carnivorous_JJ fish_NN and_CC often_RB shows_VBZ cannabilistic_JJ tendencies_NNS ,_, if_IN live_JJ food_NN is_VBZ not_RB available_JJ in_IN its_PRP$ environment_NN ._.
The_DT paddy_JJ field_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT they_PRP were_VBD cultured_VBN ,_, at_IN least_JJS in_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN was_VBD ,_, of_IN the_DT desmid-type_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN faunal_JJ elements_NNS ,_, which_WDT from_IN the_DT food_NN of_IN murrel_NN ,_, were_VBD not_RB available_JJ in_IN adequate_JJ quantities_NNS in_IN the_DT area_NN and_CC the_DT stronger_JJR specimens_NNS may_MD have_VB devoured_VBN the_DT weaker_JJR ones_NNS ._.
Further_RB ,_, being_VBG an_DT airbreathing_VBG fish_NN ,_, the_DT murrel_NN can_MD travel_VB over_IN long_JJ distances_NNS on_IN wet_JJ land_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB quite_RB suited_VBN for_IN culture_NN in_IN paddy_NN fields_NNS having_VBG low_JJ embankments_NNS ._.
The_DT high_JJ rate_NN of_IN escapement_NN seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT main_JJ reason_NN for_IN low_JJ production_NN ._.
Instead_RB of_IN the_DT murrel_NN ,_, if_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT carps_NN had_VBD been_VBN employed_VBN for_IN the_DT experiments_NNS ,_, a_DT much_RB better_JJR yield_NN could_MD have_VB been_VBN obtained_VBN ._.
A_DT production_NN of_IN 150-300_JJ lb._NN ,_, estimated_VBN by_IN me_PRP in_IN 1949_CD ,_, is_VBZ under_IN natural_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC not_RB under_IN intensive_JJ fish_JJ culture_NN ._.
The_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT above_JJ experiments_NNS chiefly_NN lies_VBZ in_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN when_WRB fish_NN are_VBP cultured_VBN in_IN paddy_JJ fields_NNS ,_, there_EX is_VBZ an_DT appreciable_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT yield_NN of_IN the_DT paddy_NN ._.

R._NNP BHATTACHARYA_NNP (_( 1948-50_JJ )_) THE_FW paper_NN relates_VBZ to_TO the_DT investigations_NNS on_IN the_DT production_NN and_CC seasonal_JJ varia-_JJ tions_NNS of_IN food_NN suitable_NN for_IN major_JJ carps_NN in_IN the_DT fish_JJ ponds_NNS of_IN West_NNP Bengal_NNP ._.
The_DT investigation_NN is_VBZ directed_VBN to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT effect_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT ecological_JJ factors_NNS on_IN the_DT culture_NN of_IN major_JJ carps_NN ,_, Catla_NNP catla_NN ,_, Labeo_NNP rohita_NN and_CC Cirrhina_NNP mrigala_NN ._.
The_DT water_NN is_VBZ more_JJR alkaline_JJ (_( pH_JJ above_IN 8_CD )_) in_IN summer_NN ,_, but_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT fall_NN of_IN pH._NN ,_, and_CC in_IN concentrations_NNS ,_, of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN and_CC chlorides_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ._.
The_DT avail-_JJ ability_NN of_IN plankton_NN as_IN food_NN of_IN fish_NN is_VBZ meagre_VBN in_IN winter_JJ months_NNS and_CC high_JJ in_IN spring_NN and_CC summer_NN ._.
Microcystis_NN ,_, amongst_JJ phytoplankton_NN ,_, and_CC Ceriodaphnia_NNP sp_NN ._.
and_CC Cypris_NNP sp_NN ._.
amongst_JJ Zooplankton_NNP ,_, dominate_VBP the_DT plankton_NN in_IN summer_NN and_CC early_JJ part_NN of_IN rainy_NN season_NN ._.
Catla_NNP catla_NN feeds_VBZ only_RB on_IN plankton_NN throughout_IN its_PRP$ life_NN ,_, whereas_JJ Cirrhina_NNP mrigala_NN and_CC Labeo_NNP rohita_NNS are_VBP planktonic_JJ feeders_NNS in_IN the_DT fingerling_JJ stage_NN but_CC feed_NN mainly_RB on_IN decomposed_VBN vegetable_JJ matter_NN afterwards_NNS ._.
[_JJ B.N.G_NNP ._. ]_NN
Ecology_NN of_IN Mugil_NNP parsia_NN in_IN the_DT salt_NN water_NN bheries_NNS ._.
P._NNP S._NNP MUKHOPADHYAY_NNP (_( 1948-50_JJ )_) THE_FW present_JJ investigation_NN includes_VBZ the_DT studies_NNS on_IN life_NN history_NN ,_, bionomics_NNS and_CC ecology_NN of_IN Mugil_NNP parsia_NN with_IN special_JJ reference_NN to_TO the_DT conditions_NNS under_IN which_WDT this_DT fish_NN is_VBZ cultured_VBN in_IN salt_NN water_NN bheries_NNS in_IN the_DT southern_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Bengal_NNP ._.
Sea-_JJ sonal_JJ occurrence_NN of_IN phyto_NN and_CC Zooplankton_NNP ,_, availability_NN of_IN food_NN for_IN the_DT fish_NN at_IN different_JJ stages_NNS and_CC in_IN different_JJ seasons_NNS and_CC conditions_NNS of_IN maturity_NN are_VBP also_RB discussed_VBN ._.
The_DT bheries_NNS are_VBP rich_JJ in_IN plankton_NN ,_, Diatoms_NNP and_CC Myxophyceae_NNP ,_, constituting_VBG the_DT larger_JJR portion_NN of_IN phytoplankton_NN ,_, and_CC protozoans_NNS and_CC Crustaceans_NNPS that_IN of_IN Zoo-_NNP plankton_NN ._.
Phytoplankton_NNP is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN abundance_NN from_IN January_NNP to_TO September_NNP ,_, with_IN a_DT peak_NN in_IN March_NNP ,_, and_CC Zooplankton_NNP from_IN July_NNP to_TO January_NNP with_IN a_DT peak_NN in_IN Novem-_NNP ber_NN ._.
The_DT food_NN of_IN the_DT fry_NN of_IN Mugil_NNP parsia_NN consists_VBZ of_IN Diatoms_NNP ,_, Myxophyceae_NNP ,_, Chloro-_NNP phyceae_NN and_CC Crustacea_NNP while_IN fingerlings_NNS and_CC adults_NNS feed_VBP on_IN purely_RB vegetable_JJ mattter_NN comprising_NN of_IN Diatoms_NNP ,_, Myxophyceae_NNP and_CC Chlorophyceae_NNP ._.
The_DT fish_JJ feeds_NNS mainly_RB at_IN the_DT bottom_NN or_CC at_IN the_DT edges_NNS ,_, whereas_IN its_PRP$ fry_NN feeds_NNS at_IN the_DT surface_NN ,_, thus_RB indicating_VBG selective_JJ feeding_NN ._.
The_DT intensity_NN of_IN feeding_NN is_VBZ much_RB reduced_VBN during_IN September_NNP to_TO December_NNP ,_, when_WRB growth_NN is_VBZ also_RB retarded_VBN ._.
From_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN gonads_NNS and_CC from_IN the_DT appearance_NN of_IN fry_NN and_CC fingerlings_NNS ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN inferred_VBN that_IN the_DT breeding_NN season_NN extends_VBZ from_IN January_NNP to_TO June_NNP ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT availability_NN of_IN the_DT food_NN of_IN this_DT fish_NN in_IN freshwaters_NNS of_IN the_DT State_NNP ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN suggested_VBN that_IN Mugil_NNP parsia_NN can_MD be_VB successfully_RB cultivated_VBN in_IN these_DT waters_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN indicated_VBN that_IN ,_, if_IN stocked_VBN in_IN an_DT advanced_JJ stage_NN ,_, this_DT fish_NN can_MD be_VB grown_VBN along_IN with_IN prawns_NNS and_CC crabs_NNS and_CC also_RB with_IN carnivorous_JJ fishes_NNS ._.

299_CD 7_CD AR/53_NNP 18_CD 300_CD ABSTRACTS_NNP [_NNP Vol_NNP ,_, XXIII_NNP ,_, Part_NNP IV_NNP ,_, Diet_NNP protein_NN in_IN relation_NN to_TO disturbed_VB host-parasite_JJ balance_NN ._.

44_CD (_( 3_CD )_) ,_, 212-221_JJ THE_NNP author_NN has_VBZ reviewed_VBN the_DT literature_NN in_IN detail_NN and_CC has_VBZ described_VBN the_DT distur-_JJ bance_NN of_IN host-parasite_JJ balance_NN as_IN due_JJ to_TO certain_JJ factors_NNS ,_, protein_NNS intake_VBP of_IN the_DT host_NN being_VBG the_DT chief_NN amongst_VBZ them_PRP ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN in_IN certain_JJ infections_NNS in_IN which_WDT phases_NNS of_IN latency_NN exist_NN ,_, failure_NN of_IN host-parasite_JJ balance_NN may_MD follow_VB infection_NN with_IN a_DT different_JJ pathogen_NN ,_, tissue_NN trauma_NN ,_, physiological_JJ stress_NN or_CC protein_NN subnutrition_NN ._.
The_DT breakdown_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN protein_NN is_VBZ common_JJ to_TO all_PDT these_DT conditions_NNS which_WDT pre-_VBP sumably_RB includes_VBZ antibody_JJ gamma-globulin_NN ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN in_IN such_JJ circum-_JJ stances_NNS there_EX is_VBZ inhibition_NN of_IN resynthesis_NN of_IN gamma-globulin_NN ,_, as_IN antibody_NN ,_, owing_VBG to_TO the_DT insufficiencies_NNS of_IN dispensable_JJ amino-acids_NNS in_IN the_DT protein_NN reserve_NN or_CC of_IN indispen-_JJ sable_JJ amino-acids_NNS in_IN the_DT dietary_JJ intake_NN ,_, or_CC of_IN both_DT ._.
Lysine_NNP appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB of_IN special_JJ interest_NN in_IN this_DT connection_NN ,_, since_IN it_PRP is_VBZ quantitatively_RB the_DT most_RBS important_JJ indispensable_JJ amino-acid_JJ in_IN gamma-globulin_NN ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ also_RB suggested_VBN that_IN the_DT abnormal_JJ low-_JJ albumin_NN high-globulin_JJ pattern_NN of_IN plasma-protein_JJ response_NN in_IN infection_NN ,_, trauma_NN and_CC subnutrition_NN is_VBZ purposive_JJ ,_, in_IN that_DT ,_, since_IN in_IN all_PDT these_DT conditions_NNS there_EX is_VBZ increased_JJ danger_NN of_IN infection_NN (_( old_JJ or_CC new_JJ )_) overpowering_VBG the_DT existing_VBG antibody_NN defence_NN ,_, economy_NN in_IN dietary_JJ lysine_NN (_( of_IN which_WDT albumin_NN contains_VBZ about_RB twice_RB as_RB much_JJ as_IN globulin_NN )_) enables_VBZ a_DT greater_JJR amount_NN of_IN globulin_NN antibody_NN to_TO be_VB formed_VBN from_IN an_DT intake_NN which_WDT is_VBZ assumed_VBN to_TO remain_VB constant_JJ ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ not_RB suggested_VBN that_IN the_DT reasons_NNS for_IN the_DT failure_NN of_IN host-_JJ parasite_JJ balance_NN are_VBP necessarily_RB as_RB simple_JJ as_IN the_DT above_JJ hypothesis_NN might_MD seem_VB to_TO indicate_VB ,_, nor_CC that_IN the_DT part_NN played_VBN by_IN lysine_NN is_VBZ as_RB important_JJ as_IN might_MD apppear_VB ._.
[_JJ K.N.M_NNP ._. ]_NN
Sweet_NNP potato_NN root_NN meal_NN versus_IN yellow_JJ corn_NN meal_NN in_IN the_DT chick_NN 's_POS diet_NN ._.
M._NNP M._NNP ROSENBERG_NNP and_CC JAMES_NNP SEU_NNP (_( 1952_CD )_) ._.
World_NNP 's_POS Poult_NNP ._.
Sci_NNP ._.
J_NNP ._.
8_CD (_( 2_CD )_) ,_, 93-98_CD THE_NNP sweet_NN potato_NN utilised_VBN in_IN this_DT study_NN is_VBZ named_VBN Ono_NNP Lena_NNP ,_, a_DT Puerto_JJ Rican_JJ type_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
a_DT moist_NN ,_, high_JJ dextrin_NN tuber_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ recognised_VBN for_IN its_PRP$ carbohydrate_NN value_NN and_CC can_MD be_VB raised_VBN in_IN the_DT tropics_NNS ._.
Previous_JJ work_NN on_IN this_DT subject_NN had_VBD revealed_VBN that_IN the_DT starches_NNS in_IN raw_JJ sweet_JJ potato_NN ,_, among_IN others_NNS ,_, caused_VBD digestive_JJ disturbances_NNS when_WRB fed_VBN to_TO certain_JJ animals_NNS in_IN large_JJ quantity_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN cooking_VBG or_CC heating_NN of_IN the_DT tubers_NNS in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN water_NN ,_, dextrinised_VBD the_DT starches_NNS and_CC thereby_RB eliminated_VBD this_DT problem_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ study_NN the_DT authors_NNS have_VBP investigated_VBN and_CC procured_VBN data_NNS on_IN the_DT carbohydrate_NN value_NN of_IN sweet_JJ potato_JJ root_NN meal_NN ,_, processed_VBD or_CC otherwise_RB in_IN the_DT chick_NN 's_POS diet_NN ._.
Uncured_VBN ,_, uncooked_JJ dehydrated_VBD sweet_JJ potato_JJ root_NN meal_NN was_VBD prepared_VBN by_IN slicing_VBG newly_RB unearthed_VBN roots_NNS and_CC dehydrating_VBG the_DT chips_NNS at_IN 150ºF_CD ._.
When_WRB dry_NN ,_, the_DT chips_NNS were_VBD ground_NN and_CC screened_VBN and_CC stored_VBN in_IN four-ply_JJ paper_NN bags_NNS at_IN room_NN temperature_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN this_DT meal_NN was_VBD substituted_VBN on_IN a_DT pound_NN for_IN pound_NN basis_NN for_IN yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN in_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN rations_NNS fed_VBN for_IN 21_CD days_NNS to_TO straight-run_JJ ,_, day-old_JJ New_NNP Hampshire_NNP chicks_NNS housed_VBD in_IN battery_NN brooders_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ experiment_NN a_DT supply_NN of_IN fresh_JJ sweet_JJ potato_NN roots_NNS was_VBD cured_VBN or_CC cooked_VBN or_CC both_DT ._.
